{"code":1,"isDone":false,"toInsertArticleList":[{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"Canon EOS R6 mirrorless camera is designed for action and low-light shooting","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/canon/152768-canon-eos-r6-action-low-light","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"499\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152768-cameras-news-canon-eos-r6-image1-3bivl8nly7.jpg?v1\"> <p>Not content with launching just one major camera in one day, Canon has also added the EOS R6 to its line-up - which joins the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/canon/152765-canon-eos-r5-45mp-8k-video-mirrorless\" rel=\"\">even-higher-spec EOS R5</a>.</p><p>While the latter camera sells itself on ultra-high resolution and 8K video, the EOS R6 is a camera with different attentions. Yes, it's still part of the RF lens system. Yes, it's still got a full-frame sensor - but it's a 20-megapixel one, designed with action shooting in mind.</p><p>The R6's sensor is also capable of shooting in conditions as low as -6.5EV, which means it can autofocus is conditions like moonlight or even candle light. It is, on the basis of that, a consumer camera with no rival when it comes to low-light shooting, which is quite the accolade.</p><p>The R6 is certainly no slouch, then, thanks to the latest Dual Pixel CMOS AF II autofocus system - which is capable of automatically detecting faces, eyes, and even animals in order to track them in real time.</p><p>Canon described the R6 to Pocket-lint as the mirrorless embodiment of the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/canon/141439-canon-eos-6d-mark-ii-review-one-of-the-most-versatile-full-frame-dslr-cameras\" rel=\"\">EOS 6D II</a> (because of its full-frame sensor) and the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/canon/131682-canon-eos-7d-mark-ii-review-king-of-quality\" rel=\"\">EOS 7D II</a> (for its fast shooting capabilities). The shutter can actuate at 12 frames per second (20fps in electronic shutter mode), making light work of fast-moving subjects.</p><p>Although the R6 doesn't have the resolution to match the R5 when it comes to video capabilities (i.e. there's no 8K here), it can shoot 4K at 60fps (oversampling from a 5.1K frame).</p><p>Elsewhere there's a vari-angle touchscreen LCD, paired with a built-in 3.69m-dot electronic viewfinder (EVF) - ensuring versatile use whether you're shooting from the eye or the waist.</p><p>As the body is polycarbonate - not magnesium alloy as is typical - it's also ultra-light, plus it's weather-sealed too.</p><p>The Canon EOS R6 will be available from 27 August, priced £2,499.99 for the body, or £2,849.99 with the 24-105mm STM kit lens included in the box. That might be just enough to lure you away from a traditional DSLR.</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 09 Jul 2020 12:00:00 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152768-cameras-news-canon-eos-r6-image1-3bivl8nly7.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"0caf20aac38938597001131b2a6576ac","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn40@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-36-50-773_cfecf8c030f225c0.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":499,"sourceBytes":58393,"destBytes":38084,"author":"Mike Lowe","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152768-cameras-news-canon-eos-r6-image1-3bivl8nly7.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn40@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-36-50-773_cfecf8c030f225c0.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209016},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"Panasonic Lumix G100 vlogging camera tracks faces & isolates voices in audio first","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/panasonic/152607-panasonic-lumix-g100-mirrorless-vlogging-face-voice","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"499\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152607-cameras-news-panasonic-lumix-g100-image1-9r3djdpigx.jpg?v1\"> <p>As the vlogging world gathers momentum, traditional camera makers are setting their sights onto the portable video camera market. The Panasonic Lumix G100 is one such product - but a camera with many points of difference that help set it apart from its competition.</p><p>The G100 comes with OZO Audio by Nokia - it's the first time this technology has been used in a consumer camera - which can utilise the three on-board cameras to isolate audio. It's even clever enough to use face-detection tracking and isolate audio to that specific area - matching face to voice for the best possible quality without interference.</p><p>Principally the G100 is part of the Lumix G range, meaning it's an interchangeable lens mirrorless camera. You can switch out lenses as you wish, adjusting the camera's capabilities as a result. Primarily, however, we suspect most will use this small-scale package with the 12-32mm ultra-compact zoom lens - which comes as part of the kit package - for its wide-angle capabilities.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152607-cameras-news-panasonic-lumix-g100-image1-ldv9joghzs.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><p>While most G series cameras aren't huge by any means, the G100 is considerably smaller than its G series cousins. This isn't a replacement for anything that already exists in the range - it's Panasonic's answer to other small-sensor alternatives, such as the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/sony/152266-sony-zv-1-vlogging-camera-release-price-specs\" rel=\"\">Sony ZV-1</a> and <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/canon/148530-canon-powershot-g7-x-iii-review-3-camera-video\" rel=\"\">Canon PowerShot G7 X III</a>.&nbsp;</p><p>The Lumix G100 comes with a vari-angle screen which can be maneuvered to the side of the camera for self shooting. If you'd rather use a viewfinder then a high-resolution one in built-in - it offers 3,680k dots, which is more than many pro-grade digital cameras - which will be great for shooting when in bright sunlight.</p><p>Video quality is 4K at 30fps maximum (the frame crop is 1.47x though), while slow-mo options are also available. Vlog-L is included if you wish to grade content.</p><p>There's also built-in electronic image stabilisation (EIS) which combines with lens optical image stabilisation (OIS) to produce a 5-axis system that can negate the 'bounce' when walking and counter handshake that's often magnified when shooting one-handed.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152607-cameras-news-panasonic-lumix-g100-image1-08svjsqknm.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><p>Designed with the social media minded as its users, there's also a Frame Marker feature which permits vertical video or puts coloured borders on the screen to show you, say, the 5:4 ratio for Instagram. Then there's a dedicated Send Image button to push footage to a smart device via the Lumix Sync app with ease.</p><p>The Panasonic Lumix G100 will be available from the end of July 2020, priced £589 body-only, £679 with the 12-32mm kit lens. Order either before 31 August 2020 and you'll get a free DMW-SHGR1 tripod grip to use with the camera.</p><p>squirrel_widget_270682</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 24 Jun 2020 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152607-cameras-news-panasonic-lumix-g100-image1-9r3djdpigx.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"f116238be8d7950030ace3e86634911d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn39@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-36-51-977_e8f0be231e1e361f.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":499,"sourceBytes":58273,"destBytes":25916,"author":"Mike Lowe","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152607-cameras-news-panasonic-lumix-g100-image1-9r3djdpigx.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn39@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-36-51-977_e8f0be231e1e361f.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152607-cameras-news-panasonic-lumix-g100-image1-ldv9joghzs.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn48@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-20-184_f0bd3f782be0eccc.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152607-cameras-news-panasonic-lumix-g100-image1-08svjsqknm.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn100@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-37-18-429_0079cd0f1e7651cc.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209016},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"29 fantastic photographic firsts","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/141060-fantastic-photographic-firsts","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"499\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/141060-cameras-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image1-2inpsotauz.jpg?v1\"> <p>Photos serve an important purpose in life. They capture precious moments, funny moments, once in a lifetime moments and many more. With the rise of social media, we're snapping and sharing more photos than ever. According to a recent survey, more than 2.5 trillion photos were shared online in 2016 alone, more than 30 times the amount of photos we took in the 1990s.</p><p>Among the several trillion photos taken over the years, there have been many photo firsts and we've done our research to find the best of them. So join us as we take a trip down a visual memory lane of the photographic milestones of the past 190 years.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image2-sv0au46k2h.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"520\" /></p><h2>First photograph made in a camera</h2><p>The oldest surviving photograph is the View from the Window at Le Gras, taken in 1826 or 1827 by Nicéphore Niépce. It was taken on a camera obscura which projects the image being taken through a pinhole in a screen, where it is then shown as a reversed and inverted image.</p><p>The image on the original plate is quite hard to distinguish, but thanks to modern technology it's been manually enhanced to show buildings and the surrounding fields of the Le Gras estate. It's been voted as one of the 100 most important photographs in the world.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image3-8hrisd2zxv.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"537\" /></p><h2>First picture of a person</h2><p>Louis Daguerre was friends with Niépce, and after Niépce's death in 1833, Daguerre continued to experiment with various and eventually created the Daguerreotype process. He's also responsible for taking the first photo to feature people.</p><p>Taken in 1838 at the Boulevard du Temple, in Paris’ 3rd arrondissement, the long exposure means that that all the traffic in the street has vanished, but two men are clearly visible in the bottom left, who, thanks to one having his boots polished by the other, have remained static long enough to become visible on the negative.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image4-fuz5fq63jq.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"982\" /></p><h2>First photographic&nbsp;self-portrait&nbsp;</h2><p>Before we called them ‘selfies’ and we flitted around with smartphones, there was a breed a photographer such as American Robert Cornelius, who did things the hard way.</p><p>A man of infinite patience he is credited with creating the first ever photographic self-portrait in 1839, a feat that required him to sit motionless in front of his camera of a 15 minute exposure.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image5-s7pbddi69a.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"732\" /></p><h2>First photographic hoax</h2><p>The accolade of the first staged photograph goes to a one Hippolyte Bayard. Bayard was considered Daguerre's rival, as he came up with his own photography method called the direct positive process. Bayard wanted to be considered <em>the&nbsp;</em>pioneer of photography, but&nbsp;Daguerre beat him to it. As a reaction, Bayard took a photo of himself drowning in water, claiming he had killed himself, when in fact it was all staged.</p><p>He even wrote a full paragraph on the back of it, claiming \"The Government which has been only too generous to Monsieur Daguerre, has said it can do nothing for Monsieur Bayard, and the poor wretch has drowned himself.\"</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image6-mvrp7x9t4q.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"589\" /></p><h2>First real \"news\" photo</h2><p>Despite the name of the photographer who took this 1847 image being lost to the passage of time, this Daguerreotype image of a man being arrested in France by soldiers is widely regarded as the first photograph of a news event.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image7-y3vg7f8euv.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"882\" /></p><h2>First aerial photo</h2><p>The first aerial photo on record is a view of Boston in 1860 at a height of 2,000 feet. Back then photographer's didn't have drones, so this photo was taken from a hot air balloon. It's titled \"Boston, as the Eagle and Wild Goose See it\".</p><p>However, French photographer Nadar (real name Gaspard-Félix Tournachon) is credited as being the exponent of aerial photography in 1858, but unfortunately, none of his work has stood the test of time.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image8-egfb5x3vzf.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"1036\" /></p><h2>First photo of a U.S. President</h2><p>As is often the way with images from the early years of photography – just because an image is first doesn't mean it survives. So it is with the early pictures of the U.S. Presidents. On 8 March 1841, William Henry Harrison became the first sitting president to be photographed but sadly the image taken on the day of his inauguration speech has been lost.</p><p>It is, therefore, this&nbsp;1843 image of John Quincy Adams, the sixth President, that has become the oldest surviving image of a Commander in Chief, despite it being taken over a decade after he left the office.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image9-0reovmhuul.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"612\" /></p><h2>First durable&nbsp;colour&nbsp;photo&nbsp;</h2><p>Colour images started appearing in the late 1840s, but the techniques of the day were so laborious and the results so fragile, that it wasn’t until 1861 that the first durable colour image was produced.</p><p>The image, called Tartan Ribbon, was created by photographing the same subject three times, using red, green, and blue filters over the camera's lens. When the pictures were developed, they were printed onto glass sheets and then shone onto a wall via three different projectors – each fitted with a coloured lens that matched the filter used to take the original picture.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image10-f7lvaihym1.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><h2>First&nbsp;halftone photograph ever printed in a newspaper</h2><p>Halftone refers to the technique of producing an image using several small black dots of varying size and spacings. It's an optical illusion of sorts, as the human eye sees the dots as a gradient.</p><p>The first printing of a halftone photograph was in the 4 March 1880 issue of The Daily Graphic, an American newspaper. The image in question was \"A Scene in Shantytown, New York\".</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image11-qkrg5vewvi.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"294\" /></p><h2>First photo taken from an unmanned aerial vehicle</h2><p>Having narrowly survived falling 200 feet from a captive airship, American aerial photographer George R. Lawrence pioneered a safer technique for getting his 22kg cameras to elevated vantage points.</p><p>Through the use of kites, Lawrence was able to capture amazing images such as this one of the ruins of San Francisco following the 1906 Earthquake. The image sold like wildfire netting the photographer $15,000 – almost $400,000 by today’s standards.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image12-2hxi5qpvtd.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"729\" /></p><h2>First photo of an atomic bomb being detonated</h2><p>As is often the case throughout its history, photography has often been used to document the very best, and the very worst of mankind’s achievements.</p><p>On July 16th, 1945 the first ever atomic bomb was detonated at the Trinity Site in New Mexico. Of all the numerous images taken of the blast, Jack Aeby's is the only colour photo of the blast to have emerged well exposed enough to show the fireball in all its terrifying glory.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image13-1v9g4x2rqy.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"591\" /></p><h2>First photo of&nbsp;the Earth as seen from Space</h2><p>On October 24th, 1946 The White Sands Rocket, officially referred to as V-2 No.13 took the first ever photograph of the Earth from Space.</p><p>Captured using a DeVry 35mm camera the picture was taken from an altitude of 65 miles (104.6Km), 5 times higher than any other picture taken before.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image14-nlqodybdfn.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"964\" /></p><h2>First Playboy front cover</h2><p>Ever the showman, when Hugh Heffner launched Playboy magazine in December 1953 he knew he needed something big to woo his potential readers, and they didn’t come much bigger than Marilyn.</p><p>Thanks in part of Marilyn’s star power, along with there being very little direct competition for the startup magazine, Heffner quickly sold all 53,000 copies printed and the publishing icon was born.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image15-tzegjyqorh.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"796\" /></p><h2>First photo to win World Press Photo contest</h2><p>The World Press Photo of the Year is considered as one of the most prestigious press photography competitions in the world.</p><p>It was this image from 1955 of a rider falling off his motorcycle during the Motocross World Championship at the Volk Mølle course that won Danish photographer Mogens von Haven the inaugural title.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image16-wernp2hq6b.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"912\" /></p><h2>First digital image</h2><p>Russell A. Kirsch is credited as the man who produced the first digital image. While working at the National Bureau of Standards, Kirsch and his team developed a digital image scanner.</p><p>The first image scanned was of a photo of Kirsch's three-month-old son, captured at one bit per pixel. It's considered to be one of the 100 photographs that changed the world.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image17-6xokpzgqip.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"297\" /></p><h2>First photo of the Earth as seen from the Moon</h2><p>The first photo of the Earth, taken from the moon, was taken on 23 August 1966. The photo was taken by the unmanned Lunar Orbiter 1 spacecraft and transmitted to Earth, where it was received at a NASA tracking station near Robledo De Chavela near Madrid, Spain.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image18-kxcbqwnjs2.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"748\" /></p><h2>First colour photo of the Earth</h2><p>The first colour image taken of our planet was shot by Astronaut William Anders as part of the Apollo 8 mission in 1968. Anders used a highly modified Hasselblad 500 EL camera with an electric drive and 70mm colour film.</p><p>Life magazine has since regarded Earthrise as being \"the most influential environmental photograph ever taken.\"</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image19-jwrwfh2ikg.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"748\" /></p><h2>First full view of Earth</h2><p>Four years after the first colour image of the Earth was taken, the crew of Apollo 17 captured an image of the entire planet. The photo was taken on 7 December 1972 and is now known as the \"Blue Marble\".</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image20-vf3v4elwcf.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"371\" /></p><h2>First photo of another planet's surface</h2><p>In 1975, whilst on an unmanned mission to Venus,&nbsp;Soviet spacecraft Venera 9 captured these images of Venus' surface. They became the first photos to show us&nbsp;the surface of another planet in our solar system.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image21-tpq5vq0cie.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"595\" /></p><h2>First photo to be&nbsp;published to the Internet</h2><p>In July 1992 Tim Berners-Lee, inventor of the World Wide Web, turned to Silvio de Gennaro, his colleague at CERN, and asked if he had a couple of pictures that Berners-Lee could upload to the web to test the newly created support for the Gif file format.</p><p>De Gennaro happened to have to hand a series of pictures he had taken of the CERN parody tribute group Les Horrible Cernettes. Being a fan of the group, Berners-Lee decided they would make an ideal test image and selected this frame of the girls posing to upload.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image22-umsozgfvlo.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"561\" /></p><h2>First photo taken with a camera phone</h2><p>Having a camera on our phones is now considered essential, but there was such a time when you would have to use a separate, dedicated camera if you wanted to take photos, as having one on your phone seemed farfetched.</p><p>That all changed in 1997 when Philippe Kahn created the first camera phone, which was done by literally combining a digital camera and a mobile phone, and took the first photo of his newborn daughter. He then sent the the photo wirelessly to 2,000 people around the phone.&nbsp;</p><p><strong><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image23-vnht9ecyyg.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"975\" /></strong></p><h2>First photo to \"Break the Internet\"</h2><p>While it didn't literally \"break the Internet\", it did come under a lot of stress when Paper Magazine released naked photos of Kim Kardashian in the WInter 2014 edition.</p><p>The photos were shot by French fashion photographer Jean-Paul Goude, and Paper Magazine's website received 50 million hits in one day, which accounted for 1 per cent of all US internet traffic that day</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image24-o3ldq6ni0v.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"818\" /></p><h2>First photo to be uploaded to Instagram</h2><p>The very first photo to be uploaded to Instagram was this picture of a dog at a taco stand. It was taken by Instagram co-founder Kevin Systrom and uploaded on 16 July 2010.</p><p>Since its inception, Instagram has gone on to become the most used social site ever. As of April 2017, the service has 700 million active users and well over 1 billion photos have been uploaded.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image25-sjli6nsebd.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"421\" /></p><h2>First \"super-selfie\"</h2><p>One of the most famous selfies ever was taken at the Oscars 2014. Ellen DeGeneres got as many celebs as she could to get in the frame, including Jennifer Lawrence, Brad Pitt, Glenn Close, Julia Roberts and Kevin Spacey. It was Bradley Cooper that got to press the shutter button.</p><p>Since then, the photo has become the fastest retweeted image to date, amassing&nbsp;more than&nbsp;3.4 million retweets</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image26-woyvfhyttx.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"748\" /></p><h2>First photo of a potato to sell for over $1m</h2><p>No, we kid you not. In a world where photography has long vied to be treated equally to art, it's hardly surprising that photographs should start selling for crazy insane amount of cash.</p><p>There have been several stories over the last few year’s of individual photographs changing hands for vast sums of money but for sheer understated elegance you can’t go beyond a potato photographed by Kevin Absoch.</p><p>For the uninitiated, American photographer Abosch specialises in celebrity portraits and has developed a cult following. It was during dinner at the artist's Paris home in 2015, where a European businessman saw ‘Potato #345’ hanging on the wall and had to have it, regardless the cost, which was a cool million dollars.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image27-8qg0hjmdu6.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"1121\" /></p><h2>First photo to get over 10 million likes on Instagram</h2><p>With over 700 million users, it was only a matter of time before a photo uploaded to Instagram would get over 10 million likes. It happened in February 2017 when Beyonce uploaded a photo announcing that she and partner Jay-Z were expecting twins.</p><p>The image has now gained more than 11 million likes and over 500,000 comments.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image28-fiwr4wx3xs.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"224\" /></p><h2>First Gigapixel photo</h2><p>In 1998, underwater photographer Jim Hellemn started to photograph the Bloody Bay Wall off the Cayman Islands. Shooting for 10 days straight over 23 dives, Hellemn painstakingly captured a 20 ft by 68-foot area of the wall in 280 overlapping frames.</p><p>Post-processing of the shots took 6 months with Hallemn using a drum scanner to import each frame into a Mac G4 at 4000ppi. All 18GB of RAW data got combined to create a stunning 1.77 Gigapixel final image. When the project was completed in 1999, it was believed that Hallemn had made the largest image ever created outside of the scientific community.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image29-jllq9w41jg.jpg\" /></p><h2>First photo of the far side of the moon</h2><p>In January 2019,&nbsp;China's Chang'e 4 lunar probe made a soft touchdown on the far side of the moon. At that point, the probe snapped the first photo of that region. The image represented a number of different firsts as it was also the first time that area of the moon had been explored.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image30-6bknjq1h0w.jpg\" /></p><h2>The first photo of a Black Hole</h2><p>In April 2019, another historic feat was achieved with the help of an&nbsp;international network of radio telescopes called the <a href=\"https://eventhorizontelescope.org/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Event Horizon Telescope</a>. This system was used to capture the <a href=\"https://www.nasa.gov/mission_pages/chandra/news/black-hole-image-makes-history\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">first image of a Black Hole</a>.&nbsp;</p><p>Although perhaps not the most impressive photo (many would complain about it being \"blurry\") the image itself is actually incredible when you take a look at the facts surrounding it. The first of which is the fact that this Black Hole, known as M87, is located&nbsp;53 million light-years away from Earth. It's also a terrifying sight as it is&nbsp;6.5 billion times the mass of the Sun. It's huge, powerful and utterly dangerous. The effort that went into capturing this image is also impressive. You can find out more <a href=\"https://www.jpl.nasa.gov/edu/news/2019/4/19/how-scientists-captured-the-first-image-of-a-black-hole/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">about how they did it here</a>.&nbsp;</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 24 Apr 2020 18:13:00 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/141060-cameras-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image1-2inpsotauz.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"98bef4b7b6f971e92026c3df11a645d1","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn35@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-36-52-568_3c6f962728a9ae30.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":499,"sourceBytes":40595,"destBytes":27618,"author":"Max Langridge","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/141060-cameras-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image1-2inpsotauz.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn35@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-36-52-568_3c6f962728a9ae30.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image2-sv0au46k2h.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn63@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-36-55-375_3f194ffb4f52e062.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image3-8hrisd2zxv.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn61@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-25-981_ead4c3769ef318b7.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image4-fuz5fq63jq.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn66@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-37-21-225_ea9b6a6f897985fa.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image5-s7pbddi69a.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn42@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-21-709_ac5eccd6ce3d74a6.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image6-mvrp7x9t4q.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn65@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-37-09-043_238e35d68745d125.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image7-y3vg7f8euv.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn93@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-37-23-941_c49a14df18fb3b97.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image8-egfb5x3vzf.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn6@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-37-10-512_3ff7a4e9681af5f2.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image9-0reovmhuul.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn54@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-37-12-204_d3ff75a1f231bd99.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image10-f7lvaihym1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn19@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-14-666_d0ee99cda43ef5d8.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image11-qkrg5vewvi.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn34@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-37-18-939_8938fcd2066e4e0c.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image12-2hxi5qpvtd.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn72@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-37-18-577_493a87145c048210.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image13-1v9g4x2rqy.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn11@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-36-54-152_988f9ad47cbe07f9.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image14-nlqodybdfn.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn1@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-04-619_c572b4b7b332fad6.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image15-tzegjyqorh.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn52@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-37-06-816_49b6e768cc866874.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image16-wernp2hq6b.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn51@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-36-58-542_cec5ac29651300a6.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image17-6xokpzgqip.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cd ts/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image26-woyvfhyttx.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn52@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-36-58-945_626c31a94ec5321b.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image27-8qg0hjmdu6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn24@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-37-14-979_c149df9c91e89558.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-news-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image28-fiwr4wx3xs.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn100@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-16-783_ea32e0bcba6d0cfc.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image29-jllq9w41jg.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn70@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-37-02-478_19d4d6288ad07848.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141060-cameras-feature-29-fantastic-photographic-firsts-image30-6bknjq1h0w.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn59@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-37-26-308_cb050980a3eb5292.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209020},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 camera","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/dji/152636-dji-osmo-action-camera-discount-deal","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"498\" currently running on the DJI Osmo Action, meaning you can save up to 30 per cent depending on where you shop.</p><p>The price reduction has appeared in a number of retailers, meaning you can save a packet if you're in the market for an action camera, down to £229 in some cases, saving you £100.</p><p>Squirrel_widget_148833</p><p>Alternatively, you can get the DJI Osmo Action with an <strong>accessories pack</strong> <a href=\"https://www.amazon.co.uk/DJI-Osmo-Action-Charging-Combo/dp/B088L1CC81?tag=pocketlintc07-21\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">for just £239 direct from Amazon UK</a>.&nbsp;</p><p>The DJI Osmo Action is a natural rival to the GoPro, with a similar design and features. It's most notable for the big display on the front - so it's easy to film yourself - while the best feature is the RockSteady stabilisation that results in super smooth video.</p><p>You'll be able to shoot 4K at 60fps, perfect for smooth and detailed action, all with good battery life too. It will even shoot HDR footage.&nbsp;</p><p>It uses a large touchscreen on the back for the controls which are simple to use and it comes with waterproofing down to 11m, which will cater for most casual uses.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 22 Jun 2020 11:06:17 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152636-cameras-news-deal-save-up-to-30-on-the-dji-osmo-action-camera-image1-ovldkn04ca.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"19437ceb9e7c1597923ef6d019305e69","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn51@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-36-52-330_337efd822afb3e85.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":498,"sourceBytes":56430,"destBytes":20356,"author":"Chris Hall","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152636-cameras-news-deal-save-up-to-30-on-the-dji-osmo-action-camera-image1-ovldkn04ca.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn51@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-36-52-330_337efd822afb3e85.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209016},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"Samsung's 50MP GN1 camera sensor promises faster autofocus and better low-light snaps","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/samsung/152237-samsung-s-50mp-gn1-camera-sensor-promises-faster-autofocus-and-better-low-light-snaps","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"499\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152237-cameras-news-samsungs-50mp-gn1-camera-sensor-promises-faster-autofocus-and-better-low-light-snaps-image1-iuaglupeh6.jpg?v1\"> <p>Samsung has announced a new camera sensor for phones that potentially offers faster autofocus and better low-light photography.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/phones/news/samsung\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Samsung</a> Isocell GN1 is a 50-megapixel sensor with&nbsp;1.2μm-sized pixels - larger than usual. This, combined with Dual Pixel and Tetracell technology (for the first time in a single Samsung sensor), allows for more sensitive light capture and \"DSLR-style autofocus speeds\".</p><p>Tetracell technology effectively improves a pixel's ability to capture and process more light by binning four pixel signals into one. It therefore increases the pixel size to 2.4μm and enables much brighter 12.5-megapixel images - a quarter of the usual resolution but better low-light pics.</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/phones/news/147024-what-is-a-time-of-flight-camera-and-which-phones-have-it\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">What is a ToF camera? The Time-of-flight sensor explained</a></li> \n </ul><p>Dual Pixel technology utilises two photodiodes sitting side-by-side in a single pixel, with each able to receive light from different angles for phase detection. That means, when all pixels are deployed for focusing, it snaps into focus much more quickly that previous Samsung camera sensors.</p><p>As well as the two technologies, the GN1 comes with Smart-ISO technology for auto ISO selection, real-time HDR, and electronic image stabilisation.</p><p>It supports video recording in up to 8K 30fps.</p><p>The chip, which is seen as a direct rival to <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/phones/news/sony-mobile\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Sony</a>'s&nbsp;IMX689 alternative - found in the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/phones/reviews/oneplus/151750-oneplus-8-pro-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">OnePlus 8 Pro</a> and a few other recent handsets - will be going into mass production this month. We should see it in phones later this year.</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 19 May 2020 08:19:22 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152237-cameras-news-samsungs-50mp-gn1-camera-sensor-promises-faster-autofocus-and-better-low-light-snaps-image1-iuaglupeh6.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"e423a2366f48b75fb7cdd4dcc27bde82","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn95@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-36-52-565_ead7b2a606d4e410.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":499,"sourceBytes":66784,"destBytes":33218,"author":"Rik Henderson","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152237-cameras-news-samsungs-50mp-gn1-camera-sensor-promises-faster-autofocus-and-better-low-light-snaps-image1-iuaglupeh6.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn95@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-36-52-565_ead7b2a606d4e410.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209018},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"More old images from the American West: A window to another time","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/152026-more-images-from-the-american-west-are-a-window-to-another-time","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"472\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152026-cameras-feature-more-old-images-from-the-american-west-a-window-to-another-time-image1-ye0f2ym8qb.jpg?v1\"> <p>The American West, whether you call it the Wild West or not, is one of the most evocative settings and periods of history that we can think of. Whether that's because of countless movies down the years or more modern entries like Westworld and <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/games/reviews/rockstar/147087-red-dead-redemption-2-review\" rel=\"follow\">Red Dead Redemption 2</a>, it's a consistently interesting time.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/151936-photos-american-west\" rel=\"follow\">These old photos from the American West will make you yearn for a better time</a></li> \n </ul><p>Even better, it's a time that coincided with the first instances of photography, and that means that there are plenty of old photos out there showcasing the diversity of life back then.</p><p>We've gathered together another selection of some of the most interesting photographs we've found for your browsing pleasure.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152026-cameras-feature-more-images-from-the-american-west-are-a-window-to-another-time-image1-omqjs5jpwb.jpg\" /></p><h2>Hunting</h2><p>We all know that it was a more brutal time, when trophy hunting was more widely accepted than it is around the world now. This grizzly bear, though, is of particular note, and not just because of how impressively massive it is. It was actually shot by General Custer, who would later go down in infamy for his foolish military tactics.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152026-cameras-feature-more-images-from-the-american-west-are-a-window-to-another-time-image2-e27ifpzauw.jpg\" /></p><h2>Training dummies</h2><p>Before you get worried, as you'll see from the annotation on this photograph, the horses you see in it are alive and well, merely being trained in battlefield tactics. That said, given the guns being wielded on both sides, it's more than a little depressing to consider that horses were trained to act as cover like this.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/141060-fantastic-photographic-firsts\" rel=\"follow\">29 fantastic photographic firsts</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152026-cameras-feature-more-images-from-the-american-west-are-a-window-to-another-time-image3-cderbukvoi.jpg\" /></p><h2>Quite a view</h2><p>Turning away from that more brutal side of things, this view over the intersection between the Mississippi and Minnesota rivers is extremely romantic, not least because of the young woman surveying it to the left of the frame. In the background you can see some long buildings that are suggestive of barracks or other mass accommodation.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152026-cameras-feature-more-images-from-the-american-west-are-a-window-to-another-time-image4-yrk0tc7unj.jpg\" /></p><h2>Skating along</h2><p>This picture is from Montana, and shows a skating party taking advantage of frigid weather to enjoy an excursion - don't miss the big shaggy black dog the group on the left has brought with them. It's rare to see images with families and children in this setting.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152026-cameras-feature-more-images-from-the-american-west-are-a-window-to-another-time-image5-pxcuyh57db.jpg\" /></p><h2>Adverse conditions</h2><p>Cold weather generally didn't make for fun and games like the skating we saw before, though - for people on the move it meant treacherous conditions and hard riding, as this column shows. At least they're all wrapped up against the cold.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152026-cameras-feature-more-images-from-the-american-west-are-a-window-to-another-time-image6-xincqwgblj.jpg\" /></p><h2>Speakeasy</h2><p>A bar in the old West has something extraordinarily evocative to it. This is The Good Old Days canteen from Fort Keogh in Montana, pictured in the early 1890s, in case the mustaches on show didn't give you a hint.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/gadgets/news/140183-retro-gadgets-you-can-buy-that-will-remind-you-of-the-glory-days\" rel=\"follow\">Amazing retro gadgets you can buy that will remind you of the glory days</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152026-cameras-feature-more-images-from-the-american-west-are-a-window-to-another-time-image7-zo0jrmst51.jpg\" /></p><h2>Tools of the trade</h2><p>Blacksmiths might not be a particularly common brand of tradespeople now, but they were key links chains of infrastructure in the West, helping with all manner of tooling and repairs, from carriages to horseshoes.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152026-cameras-feature-more-images-from-the-american-west-are-a-window-to-another-time-image8-fm8kobonzw.jpg\" /></p><h2>A stained history</h2><p>Of course, one of many uncomfortable truths of this period of history is the treatment of indigenous people all around America. This image shows native Americans welcoming President Chester A. Arthur, a rare image of concord.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152026-cameras-feature-more-images-from-the-american-west-are-a-window-to-another-time-image9-684m0qutb9.jpg\" /></p><h2>All a-flutter</h2><p>As camera technology pushed ever forward, pictures were able to become less and less posed and formal. This image of a cavalry unit performing practice sabre manoeuvres is a perfect example, packed with motion and dust.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152026-cameras-feature-more-images-from-the-american-west-are-a-window-to-another-time-image100-7zzqcfuvji.jpg\" /></p><h2>Not much of a jail</h2><p>Of course, the West is also famous for its gangs and robbers, and its sheriffs and deputies - a lawless time that would slowly be reeled in. If you ended up on the wrong side of the law things could get pretty rough for you. Just consider this jail in Clifton, Arizona, carved out of the very cliff face. We wouldn't fancy spending much time in there.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/141224-the-most-famous-ghost-photographs-ever-taken\" rel=\"follow\">The most famous ghost photographs ever taken</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152026-cameras-feature-more-images-from-the-american-west-are-a-window-to-another-time-image111-tu47cahqqp.jpg\" /></p><h2>The force</h2><p>This photograph of Dodge City, Kansas' \"Peace Commissioners\" paints a real picture - the serious looks on their faces, the varied and eye-catching differences between their coats and hats. These were the law-keepers when there wasn't much law.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152026-cameras-feature-more-images-from-the-american-west-are-a-window-to-another-time-image122-dbsw8sfrpo.jpg\" /></p><h2>Rough justice</h2><p>Another form of justice is represented here by Judge Roy Bean, holding a court session of sorts as he judged horse thieves. As the sign for beer might have hinted, this building was both the courthouse and the saloon for locals, making it an interesting dual-purpose place.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152026-cameras-feature-more-images-from-the-american-west-are-a-window-to-another-time-image1-w5ixzvkssx.jpg\" /></p><h2>Toil</h2><p>While the cowboys and sheriffs might take the limelight, the reality is that most Americans in the West at the turn of the century faced a hard life of work and little play. These workers on a vineyard show that even if in rudimentary surroundings, industries were starting out.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/151839-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos\" rel=\"follow\">The shortlist for the 2020 Sony World Photography Awards is full of gobsmacking photos</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152026-cameras-feature-more-images-from-the-american-west-are-a-window-to-another-time-image1-vrp3utcloe.jpg\" /></p><h2>Rest</h2><p>You could probably rely on being able to relax after dark, though, as this party is doing at a ranch in Idaho, complete with characterful timber construction, furs and, of course, an astonishing collection of guns.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152026-cameras-feature-more-images-from-the-american-west-are-a-window-to-another-time-image1-v2q6lejzh0.jpg\" /></p><h2>Arable</h2><p>Depending on where you washed up, yours could be the only property for miles around, leading to isolated but stunningly beautiful scenes like this one, taken in Montana, with the mountains rising up in the background.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152026-cameras-feature-more-images-from-the-american-west-are-a-window-to-another-time-image1-jxmeqnhcpg.jpg\" /></p><h2>Backbreaking work</h2><p>This might look some sort of military endeavour, but it's actually an irrigation trench in the process of being dug in Arizona, largely by native American labour. This is a showcase of just how much physical labour was required.</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/148556-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs\" rel=\"follow\">33 incredibly interesting photos from history</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152026-cameras-feature-more-images-from-the-american-west-are-a-window-to-another-time-image1-jvysc1zhit.jpg\" /></p><h2>Family life</h2><p>Meanwhile, families continued to live and have children, as demonstrated by this group from Mormon Lake in Arizona (we can't be sure whether they themselves were Mormons - the place name, though amusing, might be unrelated).&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152026-cameras-feature-more-images-from-the-american-west-are-a-window-to-another-time-image1-hoktodlawu.jpg\" /></p><h2>Houseproud</h2><p>As anyone who's played Red Dead Redemption 2 through to the end knows, building a house at this time took, well, time. This group might quite have finished the house behind them, but they look might proud of it regardless, and fair enough.</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 30 Apr 2020 12:47:00 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"The best GoPro photos in the world, prepare to lose your breath","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/131203-best-gopro-pictures-and-photos-from-around-the-world","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"499\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/131203-cameras-feature-the-best-gopro-photos-in-the-world-prepare-to-lose-your-breath-image1-rgol1zihfy.jpg?v1\"> <p>From surfing and skydiving to animal close-ups and stunning scenery, this gallery has some breathtaking images that we only get to see thanks to the GoPro.</p><p>No longer are rare wildlife photos restricted to pros who spend years awaiting the perfect shot – now thousands of GoPros are scanning the world&nbsp;all at once, constantly. We're only ever going to get more amazing shots to wow us.</p><p>Thanks to the camera, and video stills, the internet is awash with stunning images from GoPros around the world. Finding them all is a bit of a job, so we've done it for you.</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/131203-best-gopro-pictures-and-photos-from-around-the-world\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">The best GoPro: Which GoPro should you buy today?</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/buyers-guides/137301-best-360-cameras-the-best-vr-and-360-video-cameras-no-matter-your-budget\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Best 360 cameras: The best VR and 360 cameras, no matter your budget</a></li> \n </ul><p>squirrel_widget_145781</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/131203-cameras-feature-the-best-gopro-photos-in-the-world-prepare-to-lose-your-breath-image2-fue4fdpm86.jpg\" /></p><h2>Formation selfie</h2><p>This image was snapped by&nbsp;Marcos Trotta who is part of the&nbsp;Brazilian Air Force and no doubt a magnificent pilot. The photo was taken at the end of a loop during a formation exercise and there's no denying the results are awesome. Not many of us could take such a cool selfie while going about our day job.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/131203-cameras-feature-the-best-gopro-photos-in-the-world-prepare-to-lose-your-breath-image3-cx8judwxdp.jpg\" /></p><h2>A still view of Lake Bled</h2><p>This incredibly calm view of Lake Bled, Slovenia, shows a 4 am sunrise over a peaceful lake with staggeringly still waters. An amazing image with breathtaking views captured with a GoPro Hero 4 Black.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/131203-cameras-feature-the-best-gopro-photos-in-the-world-prepare-to-lose-your-breath-image158-c7qfracjzo.jpg\" /></p><h2>Nighttime in paradise</h2><p>This fantastic nighttime shot shows an awesome view of paradise with the use of a GoPro Hero 7 Black. Taken in India, the image shows some awesome streaks of light in the sky created by the stars. GoPro has some hints on <a href=\"https://gopro.com/news/mastering-hero7-night-photo-mode?utm_campaign=later-linkinbio-gopro&amp;utm_content=later-1967261&amp;utm_medium=social&amp;utm_source=instagram\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">how to take awesome nighttime photos like this on its site</a>.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/131203-cameras-news-feature-the-best-gopro-photos-in-the-world-prepare-to-lose-your-breath-image14-zqoklpxmvr.jpg\" /></p><h2>Swimming with the locals</h2><p>This is what selfie sticks should be used for. This GoPro user has really set a high-bar for underwater photos with the local dolphins. A fantastic view of nature thanks to the compact action camera.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/131203-cameras-feature-the-best-gopro-photos-in-the-world-prepare-to-lose-your-breath-image7-tpaf3hxk4d.jpg\" /></p><h2>A wintery view</h2><p>A smashing wintery view of the world captured by&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/k_wicksy/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Kyle Wicks</a> with a GoPro Hero 7 Black. A colorful sunset scene with an ice-covered view of the landscape and a lone person in the midst of it all.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/131203-cameras-news-feature-the-best-gopro-photos-in-the-world-prepare-to-lose-your-breath-image15-hyvnloj1bq.jpg\" /></p><h2>Something with a little more bite</h2><p>On the opposite end of the underwater spectrum, this GoPro photo is slightly less chilled out. A massive shark shows off his razor-sharp teeth for all to enjoy - or at least cower in fear from. Hopefully, this GoPro user was safe inside a cage.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/131203-cameras-feature-the-best-gopro-photos-in-the-world-prepare-to-lose-your-breath-image4-2s7lvcfplb.jpg\" /></p><h2>Footprints in the sand</h2><p>Mitchell Pettigrew is an amateur photographer with an eye for landscape photography and an undeniable talent. He's capable of capturing some nifty views with his GoPro, as this simply awesome shot shows. His <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/shipwreckphotography/\" rel=\"follow\">Instagram feed</a> is also worth checking out.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/131203-cameras-news-feature-the-best-gopro-photos-in-the-world-prepare-to-lose-your-breath-image16-ymwd86pgma.jpg\" /></p><h2>Underwater paradise</h2><p>GoPro cameras certainly allow for an interesting range of underwater photographs. This one shows brilliantly blue waters and a casual swim with the local fishes.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/131203-cameras-news-feature-the-best-gopro-photos-in-the-world-prepare-to-lose-your-breath-image17-bomdq0hrl4.jpg\" /></p><h2>Fun with flippers</h2><p>Another snap we're jealous of. These waters look warm, peaceful and welcoming. We wish we were there too!</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/131203-cameras-news-feature-the-best-gopro-photos-in-the-world-prepare-to-lose-your-breath-image18-dtkbzdtb8q.jpg\" /></p><h2>Man's best friend</h2><p>Pooches enjoy a swim too or maybe a quick surf? The versatile action cam isn't just for underwater shots and high-octane sports but is brilliant at capturing photos of pets in the wild too.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/131203-cameras-feature-the-best-gopro-photos-in-the-world-prepare-to-lose-your-breath-image159-c68mzgub9s.jpg\" /></p><h2>A starry lighthouse</h2><p>This incredible photo was posted on Instagram along with some expert tips on achieving the same results with a GoPro Hero 7:</p><p>\"I've always wanted to photograph the stars, so I headed to the Fingal Head Lighthouse to try it out. During a&nbsp;#LongExposure, your&nbsp;#GoPro&nbsp;has to be very still, so I mounted it to the Shorty Mount. I set the GoPro to Night Photo Mode and used the following ProTune settings: Shutter Speed 30s, ISO 800, Sharpness Low, Auto WB.&nbsp;#ProTip: Toggle on RAW Format for maximum control over your image while editing.\"</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/131203-cameras-news-feature-the-best-gopro-photos-in-the-world-prepare-to-lose-your-breath-image19-49qha1xlkl.jpg\" /></p><h2>A cooling paddle for piggy</h2><p>This GoPro user had an unexpected visit in the form of a piggy looking for a cooling dip in the water. The crystal clear waters are certainly inviting, so we can't blame him. The result of the encounter makes for a fairly awesome photo too.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/131203-cameras-news-feature-the-best-gopro-photos-in-the-world-prepare-to-lose-your-breath-image20-7guc3fy4oi.jpg\" /></p><h2>Below the blue</h2><p>Now you're just showing off. This chap is up to some underwater shenanigans for sure. We love the submerged view of the clouds though. Another fantastic GoPro photo from inviting waters.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/131203-cameras-news-feature-the-best-gopro-photos-in-the-world-prepare-to-lose-your-breath-image21-06fzl5shol.jpg\" /></p><h2>Catching some waves</h2><p>This photo is certainly more the style we'd expect to see from GoPro users. An action shot from a surfer catching some waves.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/131203-cameras-feature-the-best-gopro-photos-in-the-world-prepare-to-lose-your-breath-image22-w93nhbqjrc.jpg\" /></p><h2>A cave with a view</h2><p>Another surfing shot, but this one is calm and colourful. These sorts of images show just how versatile the GoPro cameras can be. They're not just great for video, but for landscape and portrait shots too.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/131203-cameras-news-feature-the-best-gopro-photos-in-the-world-prepare-to-lose-your-breath-image23-anjczf0ybe.jpg\" /></p><h2>Up, up and away</h2><p>On the wing of a glider or light aircraft, the humble GoPro gives us a brilliant view of the world from high above the earth. This image shows us the beautiful surrounding sights as one GoPro user carries out some incredible aerobatic stunts.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/131203-cameras-news-feature-the-best-gopro-photos-in-the-world-prepare-to-lose-your-breath-image24-y38knu6hgr.jpg\" /></p><h2>Over the top</h2><p>Some pretty spectacular views over the mountain tops. More proof that a good camera mount can make for some incredible views captured with your favourite action cam.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/131203-cameras-news-feature-the-best-gopro-photos-in-the-world-prepare-to-lose-your-breath-image25-svxtpzk4so.jpg\" /></p><h2>A line in the sand&nbsp;</h2><p>The compact GoPro captures some fairly cool views of the surroundings too. A wide angle lens makes for some interesting views, especially when combined with the unusually shaped landscape.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/131203-cameras-news-feature-the-best-gopro-photos-in-the-world-prepare-to-lose-your-breath-image26-iabqosv37y.jpg\" /></p><h2>A rider's reflection&nbsp;</h2><p>Here a GoPro user takes a brilliant shot on the road ahead as seen through the reflection in their visor. GoPro cameras are a popular choice of bikers anyway, but we're particular fans of this snap.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/131203-cameras-news-feature-the-best-gopro-photos-in-the-world-prepare-to-lose-your-breath-image27-sogkruabon.jpg\" /></p><h2>Getting back to nature</h2><p>The GoPro is an amazing tool for outdoor photos, wherever you might be. This snap from the woods as the sun rises captures the beauty of nature perfectly.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/131203-cameras-news-feature-the-best-gopro-photos-in-the-world-prepare-to-lose-your-breath-image28-gqjvdyb2kx.jpg\" /></p><h2>Liquid lines</h2><p>A perfectly timed photo of a wave breaking with brilliant clarity. This image shows the amazing and surprising photographic powers of the GoPro. It's not just for video.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/131203-cameras-news-feature-the-best-gopro-photos-in-the-world-prepare-to-lose-your-breath-image29-vrlahypfwg.jpg\" /></p><h2>Way above the concrete jungle</h2><p>Another aeroplane wing shot shows a fantastic view above a city. This image shows how GoPro cameras can be put to good use to create some brilliant tricks with the light too. The result is a colourful photo which almost makes it look like the car is travelling at light speed.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/131203-cameras-news-feature-the-best-gopro-photos-in-the-world-prepare-to-lose-your-breath-image31-btwn3dwxkz.jpg\" /></p><h2>A skyline with a view</h2><p>It's not just aerial photos that the GoPro makes light work of. You'll often see these sorts of vertigo-inducing snaps from high above the rooftops.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/131203-cameras-news-feature-the-best-gopro-photos-in-the-world-prepare-to-lose-your-breath-image32-atx7pfgsvm.jpg\" /></p><h2>Painting with light</h2><p>Sparklers, fireworks and more can be combined with GoPro's clever camera settings to create works of art like this where shapes and patterns are created from light.
