delivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn67@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-37-19-070_9c068cb3aa8f6131.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/133911-drones-feature-best-drone-photos-ever-taken-image1-a5dbfy9sdy.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn35@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-37-07-215_a1ebaeef9dde74d8.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/133911-drones-feature-best-drone-photos-ever-taken-image1-batwjzhpwo.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn47@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-37-14-625_30a10e3fa3cc3f9e.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/133911-drones-feature-best-drone-photos-ever-taken-image1-h0bqzhatv6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn73@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-37-13-337_f06ab059b54d1969.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/133911-drones-feature-best-drone-photos-ever-taken-image1-thoszfsvuy.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn48@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-37-18-100_b42da23bec9b50b0.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/133911-drones-feature-best-drone-photos-ever-taken-image1-6sj2leaqay.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn22@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-37-05-420_242552c639a00773.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/133911-drones-feature-best-drone-photos-ever-taken-image1-ejnpiigfe4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn22@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-37-24-208_122066eb37d5d86f.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/133911-drones-feature-best-drone-photos-ever-taken-image1-phiabr0ojn.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn26@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-37-11-874_92e6e15f6abdc2ed.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/133911-drones-feature-best-drone-photos-ever-taken-image1-l6uz1ic2oe.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn76@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-36-58-166_e35cbcd7f65b358f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209022},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"27 amusing images of cartoon characters in Photoshopped into Renaissance paintings","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/adobe/149332-amusing-images-of-cartoon-characters-in-photoshopped-into-renaissance-paintings","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"498\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/149332-apps-feature-amusing-images-of-cartoon-characters-in-photoshopped-into-renaissance-paintings-image1-ifwspryqgq.jpg?v1\"> <p>We love the work of skilled Photoshoppers, reimagining photos or breathing new life into classic artworks.</p><p>We've discovered a brilliant <a href=\"https://www.designcrowd.com/community/?type=photoshop+design\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Photoshop competition at Design Crowd</a> where some talented individuals have blended together modern cartoons and classic Renaissance artwork.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul>\n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/adobe/149161-amusing-images-of-animals-photoshopped-into-renaissance-paintings\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">&nbsp;25 amusing images of animals Photoshopped into Renaissance paintings</a></li>\n </ul> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 12:22:00 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/149332-apps-feature-amusing-images-of-cartoon-characters-in-photoshopped-into-renaissance-paintings-image1-ifwspryqgq.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"0a8dfd40adbf2959838cbe96ddee8424","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn56@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-36-50-744_afebd683a204d8ac.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":498,"sourceBytes":97891,"destBytes":64830,"author":"Adrian Willings","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/149332-apps-feature-amusing-images-of-cartoon-characters-in-photoshopped-into-renaissance-paintings-image1-ifwspryqgq.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn56@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-36-50-744_afebd683a204d8ac.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209017},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"Sony ZV-1 review: Vlogging champ","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/sony/152309-sony-zv-1-review","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"498\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152309-cameras-review-sony-zv-1-hardware-image1-bceqvt7ml3.jpg?v1\"> <p>Sony has been working hard on its video chops over the past five years or so. Its high-end full-frame Alpha series is a firm favourite in the video-making community, while smaller cameras <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/sony/149119-sony-a6600-review\" rel=\"follow\">like the A6600</a> have sought to offer similar capabilities in a much more compact form.</p><p>With features like fast autofocus, advanced real-time face- and eye-tracking, you'd have thought that's where it ends. Apparently not. There's one specific breed of video-maker that Sony wants under its wings: vloggers.</p><p>Enter the Sony ZV-1. This powerful, very compact and functional camera offers all the tools you need - whether you're just starting at vlogging, or a seasoned pro who needs some extra tools.</p><h2>Design</h2>\n <ul> \n  <li>Dimensions: 105.4 x 60 x 44mm / Weight: 294g</li> \n  <li>3.5mm, Micro-USB, mini HDMI out/in</li> \n  <li>Flip-out rotating screen</li> \n </ul><p>Sony says it designed the ZV-1 from the ground up for vloggers. That means the appearance is quite different from the RX series, the latter designed predominantly for stills shooting. So the ZV-1 may be a very <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/sony/150349-sony-rx100-vii-review-m7\" rel=\"\">similar size to the RX100</a>, but it's certainly not the same.</p><p>The design is minimal, crafted from a subtly textured black plastic. Unlike the RX100, the ZV-1 has a rubber grip sticking out of the left side. It's quite narrow, but that's so there's enough of a gap between it and the lens to give you somewhere to put your thumb when shooting yourself front-on.</p><p></p><p>While the grip isn't large enough to get a proper grip on when shooting the other way around, it does help add a bit of 'stickiness' when holding the camera. We felt like we were less likely to lose grip or drop it.</p><p>That's not the only element of the camera's design that makes the ZV-1 more tuned to a vlogger's needs. Sony has put a proper flip-out touchscreen on this video-focused camera, which is so much better than any of the ones that flip over the top of the camera (like in the RX100 series).</p><p>Having the screen flip out to the side of the camera means it's at the same level as the lens and - more importantly - means it can never be blocked by any accessories you might want to mount to the top of the camera, on the hotshoe, or plugged into the ports on the opposite side.</p><p>The screen also acts as a sort-of power button. Flipping the screen out of its shut state automatically powers up the camera, ready for shooting. It's really useful, especially when you just want to open up the display and capture the shot, without having to search for the small on/off button on the top edge. That's a good thing, because with the included wind-killing deadcat in place, the on/off button is covered by the deadcat's fluff.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152309-cameras-review-sony-zv-1-hardware-image1-l3idlbkgqw.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"498\" /></p><p>The top itself is mostly flat. There are no protruding buttons or dials, but it still manages to squeeze in five functional buttons: on/off button, a mode button, a big movie button (with a bright red ring around it), the usual shutter button (with zoom dial surrounding it to control the lens), plus a dedicated button for switching background defocus on.</p><p>The inclusion of background defocus is yet another vlogger-targeted feature. Those who want to create a bokeh effect - that's the soft, melty background blur called by its proper name - while speaking to the camera can do so at the press of a button.</p><p>Battery and SD Card access is achieved by opening the door on the underside of the camera. It's not a great placement for anyone who likes to mount their camera to a tripod. We've often found access blocked in these instances, so we have to unmount the camera to get to the memory card. Still, this camera is designed to be used primarily handheld.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152309-cameras-review-sony-zv-1-hardware-image1-pmqyxdtvai.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"498\" /></p><p>For the pro user who wants to be able to capture audio from a dedicated microphone, Sony has included a 3.5mm port on the right, just above the Micro-USB port and mini HDMI, each of which is covered in its own individual plastic door.&nbsp;</p><p>Lastly - as if any further evidence that this is a vlogger's camera was required - there's no viewfinder. You just get the screen. The space normally taken up by a pop-up viewfinder in the RX100 has been replaced by a three capsule mic system and shoe mount - which is hidden by quite a large mesh grille.</p><h2>Processing, tracking and smart exposure</h2>\n <ul> \n  <li>Real-time eye and face tracking (with human and animal modes)</li> \n  <li>Instant bokeh and face smoothing modes</li> \n  <li>315 autofocus points</li> \n </ul><p>A lot of what makes Sony's cameras so appealing is the brains running the show. In the ZV-1 there's the Sony BIONZ X image signal processor. It's similar to the one you'll find inside the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/sony/143157-sony-a9-initial-review-phenomenal-speed-from-the-full-frame-mirrorless-master\" rel=\"\">top-end A9</a>, which means that all of the super fast, super smart auto-focusing and tracking you find higher up the Sony camera chain are present in the ZV-1.&nbsp;</p><p>The joy of the sensor is that you stick the camera in intelligent auto (iA) mode, or auto movie mode, and the brains of the camera will generally suss out what's going on in the scene pretty quickly and adjust settings to match. If that's you recording a vlog to camera, it'll automatically focus on your eye and then base the exposure of the entire frame on ensuring that your face is well lit and natural looking.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152309-cameras-review-screenshots-and-processing-image1-awha2oyrsz.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><p>Having tested this in a few different lighting situations, both indoors and outdoors, with bright backlighting and even with our face shaded by an over-hanging tree, the results are surprisingly good. It does seem to take a second or two to adjust and expose, but when we stood in shade that covered our face, it still managed to pull out the details and make our face clearly visible. Similarly, with bright light shining on our face, it adjusted to tone it down. You can see the before/after in the image above.</p><p>As you'd expect, in extreme contrasting conditions like this the background can end up looking bleached out and overexposed, but the priority for the vlog is seeing the person clearly, so that's what you get. Sony says this works regardless of skin colour and ethnicity.&nbsp;</p><p>You can - if you want - also enable skin smoothing modes, and adjust how much smoothing you want. If you want your skin looking all natural, with all of your pores and wrinkles on show, you can have that. Likewise, if you want to hide them for that smoother airbrushed look, you can do that too.&nbsp;</p><p>Another major feature is the instant background defocus mode. So how does this work? Watching the lens mechanism when you press the dedicated mode button, we could see the ZV-1 mechanically switching to a wider aperture. Checking image metadata from stills we took in the same scene, but having switched background defocus on and off, revealed as much to be true. The defocus setting has the aperture set to f/1.8 by default, then adjusts exposure time and ISO sensitivity accordingly.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152309-cameras-review-screenshots-and-processing-image1-6rpyd7ivh2.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><p>As for the auto-tracking and autofocusing, that's as fast and accurate an experience as it is on any of Sony's modern cameras. That's thanks largely down to the 1-inch sensor featuring both phase-detection points on its surface, use in conjunction with contrast-detection autofocus. We recorded our cats, then messed around with touching to focus on the screen, and the camera was quick to detect changes and lock in on the newly selected area.&nbsp;</p><p>For the mobile generation, those who share more videos on vertical-centric platforms like TikTok, Sony's latest camera automatically detects when it's shooting video in portrait mode and at stays in vertical mode once it's transferred onto a device for sharing.&nbsp;</p><p>Those who shoot product-based videos, or make-up tutorials, or other types of videos where you're often bringing products close to the lens to show it briefly and then move it away, there's also a product-specific mode you can switch it to.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152309-cameras-review-screenshots-and-processing-image1-ivnipcvmbd.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><p>When activated, you can hold your product - whether it be a lipstick, a Lego figure, a phone, or whatever - up to the camera, and it'll quickly focus on it, blurring you out in the background, then quickly switching back again to focus on your face when you remove the product from the frame. There is a little bit of focusing noise as the adjustment happens, but it's not especially loud, and if you're talking at the same time, it's not all that noticeable.&nbsp;</p><h2>Audio power</h2>\n <ul> \n  <li>Three capsule mic</li> \n  <li>Wind/noise reduction features</li> \n  <li>Included windshield/deadcat&nbsp;</li> \n  <li>3.5mm input</li> \n </ul><p>With video, the image is only one part of the story. Sony's additional effort in the ZV-1 was to include a built-in microphone system that's good enough to use on the fly without any additional mic equipment. And, for the most part, that effort has paid off.&nbsp;</p><p>Recording video and speaking to camera results in clear and loud audio. It wasn't the nasty, muffled type of sound you'd perhaps expect to get from a camera's own microphone. We tested it in a few different scenarios and found our voice was clear and pronounced and had enough natural timbre to it that it didn't sound flat and broken.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152309-cameras-review-sony-zv-1-hardware-image1-pca5izf3sn.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"498\" /></p><p>Of course, using a professional microphone will yield better results, and you can either use the 3.5mm input for that, or use a hotshoe adapter to connect up an XLR cable.</p><p>The ZV-1 also comes with a dedicated deadcat - a small fluffy 'wind-shield' - that attaches to the hotshoe and covers the mic grille. We tested this out on a particularly blustery day and while you could hear the wind it never resulted in any tearing sounds, regardless of how bad the wind got.&nbsp;</p><p>Now, there is also a wind reduction feature that you can enable within the camera's menus, but this is more of an ambient noise killer than a dedicated wind noise filter. It essentially switches off the two wide mic capsules, leaving only the central one picking up your voice. The difference is stark - it doesn't completely kill traffic or wind noise, but it does reduce it. The downside to this filter, however, is that it can make the sound seem quite flat.</p><h2>Video pro</h2>\n <ul> \n  <li>4K at 30fps/1080p at 60fps</li> \n  <li>Slow motion modes</li> \n  <li>Multiple picture profiles - ideal for colour grading</li> \n  <li>Proxy support</li> \n </ul><p>This isn't just a camera for people who want to pop a camera on a tripod and shoot a TikTok dance in vertical, full-automatic mode. Sony knows what video creators want, and so has included a bunch of features to try and keep those people happy too.&nbsp;</p><p>Sadly, one of those features isn't 4K video at 60 frames per second. The ZV-1 maxes out at 30fps at its full resolution setting, but it can shoot up to 60fps in 1080p.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152309-cameras-review-screenshots-and-processing-image1-ued4xmkjic.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><p>It's also pre-loaded with a bunch of preset picture profiles - which you can customise - that allow you to shoot with a variety of different S-log, cine and gamma profiles. So if you want to you can set it to a nice, flat, desaturated profile giving you the scope to colour grade it to your liking.</p><p>You can also enable proxies, which are supported by the likes of Adobe Premiere Pro and Final Cut Pro, enabling fast editing and rendering without losing detail in the final product.&nbsp;</p><p>You'll need to do a bit of digging into settings with the camera set to the manual video mode in order to choose one of these options. It took us a little while to figure a lot of those menus - as there's a lot in there.&nbsp;</p><p>One of the most useful settings to enable, we found, was adjusting the the focus speed. With the camera set to 'touch focus', then changing the focus speed to slow, it allowes for automatic slow pull focus effects. That's useful if you want to add a bit of extra motion to a frame where nothing is moving.</p><h2>It takes stills too</h2>\n <ul> \n  <li>20-megapixel 1-inch size CMOS sensor</li> \n  <li>24-70mm (equivalent) zoom lens</li> \n  <li>24fps burst mode</li> \n </ul><p>It may be a 'vlogger camera' but you can take pictures with the ZV-1 too - and the results aren't half bad.</p><p>It still uses that same eye-tracking, fast autofocusing tech too. Pointing at a pet with the animal tracking on locks quickly onto an eye and focuses. Even if that cat's eye is half-shut because the cat is inevitably asleep.&nbsp;</p><p>We found the results to be detailed, with good colour and dynamic range in good light. Sometimes they might come out a bit too contrasty in automatic mode, but there are enough opportunities to adjust settings, including switching off a lot of the automatic scene suggestions.</p><p>Perhaps the only thing that makes this less versatile as a stills camera is the zoom length. It only has a 3x optical zoom (a 24-70mm equivalent), which isn't anywhere near as versatile in that regard as the RX100 (which has an 8.5x, 24-200mm optic).&nbsp;</p><h2>A note on battery life</h2><p>Being a small camera means quite a small battery capacity. Sony claims the ZV-1 can get you up to 45 minutes of recording.</p><p>Having tested this at 4K video resolution, we find that rather ambitious. We didn't get close to 45 minutes capture in our own use, but then a lot of our time testing was spent digging through menus, playing with different settings, and testing different features - all of which eats into battery life.</p><p>Thankfully, it's one of those cameras that's convenient to keep topped up. You just need to plug it in with the Micro-USB cable, so plug it into a power supply at home when you're done or keep a battery pack with you when out and about.</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 26 May 2020 14:00:00 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152309-cameras-review-sony-zv-1-hardware-image1-bceqvt7ml3.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"ae78b3777ebb7aad47e5e1aa747771c6","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn41@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-36-51-791_db1e20d39b72ab38.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":498,"sourceBytes":55683,"destBytes":44020,"author":"Cam Bunton","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152309-cameras-review-sony-zv-1-hardware-image1-bceqvt7ml3.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn41@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-36-51-791_db1e20d39b72ab38.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152309-cameras-review-sony-zv-1-hardware-image1-l3idlbkgqw.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn11@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-37-25-904_544e63f564f67ec9.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152309-cameras-review-sony-zv-1-hardware-image1-pmqyxdtvai.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn54@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-25-403_627c4cfa6ad9685e.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152309-cameras-review-screenshots-and-processing-image1-awha2oyrsz.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn24@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-37-25-984_c52fd021ce07659e.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152309-cameras-review-screenshots-and-processing-image1-6rpyd7ivh2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn31@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-37-14-574_1252e97368f220c3.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152309-cameras-review-screenshots-and-processing-image1-ivnipcvmbd.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn78@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-37-05-111_fff14a6ff871559e.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152309-cameras-review-sony-zv-1-hardware-image1-pca5izf3sn.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn40@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-36-58-008_707f53363e7321ee.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152309-cameras-review-screenshots-and-processing-image1-ued4xmkjic.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn74@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-37-01-668_fa936af2de529cc8.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209018},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"Nikon Z5 and Z30 set to expand mirrorless camera line-up?","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/nikon/152465-nikon-z5-z30-rumoured-z9","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"499\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152465-cameras-news-nikon-z-image1-i85lqadui3.jpg?v1\"> <p>With the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/gadgets/news/151272-coronavirus-update-all-the-major-tech-conferences-canceled-so-far\" rel=\"\">passing of so many major shows in 2020</a> - there was no CP+ in Japan, for example - there's been a lack of exciting new camera releases. Especially from the big brands, such as Nikon. Rumour has it, however, that's about to change in the coming months.&nbsp;</p><p>With the company's focus now on its mirrorless line-up, the Z series, 2020 will see an expansion of focus with the purported release of two new cameras: the Z5 and Z30.</p><p>The Z5 will sit beneath <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/nikon/147435-nikon-z6-review-full-frame-mirrorless-camera\" rel=\"\">the Z6</a> (pictured), likely to hit a more appealing price point and bring slightly watered-down features to the full-frame model.</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/buyers-guides/nikon/145451-nikon-z7-z6-difference-comparison-specs\" rel=\"\">Nikon Z7 vs Nikon Z6: What's the difference?</a></li> \n </ul><p>At the other end of the scale is the Z30, destined to sit beneath <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/nikon/149696-nikon-z50-review\" rel=\"\">the Z50</a> - again bringing fewer features for a more accessible price point to the APS-C sensor line-up.</p><p>Perhaps the bigger rumour, however, is that in 2021 there's a plan for a new chart-topping model: the as-yet-unnamed '<a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/nikon/148392-nikon-z9-pro-features-spec\" rel=\"\">Z9</a>'. This has been a long time coming - as in the middle of 2019 <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/nikon/148392-nikon-z9-pro-features-spec\" rel=\"\">we wrote about the five features we'd like to see in such a camera</a>. Inevitably it looks as though it's been delayed.</p><p>It all seems very sensible to us if these rumours are true. The company needs to get that kit into the market to expand its range - especially with <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/canon/144836-canon-eos-m50-review-mirrorless\" rel=\"\">Canon already offering the M50</a> and <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/canon/151073-canon-eos-r5-8k-ibis-release\" rel=\"\">R5</a> (likely comparable to the Z30 and Z5).</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 08 Jun 2020 10:15:00 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152465-cameras-news-nikon-z-image1-i85lqadui3.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"87e9ac69a2422e0a4c30a871aa0eacd9","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn75@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-36-50-630_a4cc21fe887d38d8.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":499,"sourceBytes":76545,"destBytes":51200,"author":"Mike Lowe","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152465-cameras-news-nikon-z-image1-i85lqadui3.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn75@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-36-50-630_a4cc21fe887d38d8.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209017},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"How to take pictures of tonight's supermoon or worm moon","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/canon/143512-how-to-take-pictures-of-the-super-moon","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"499\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/143512-cameras-feature-how-to-take-pictures-of-the-‘super-blue-blood-moon’-image1-yis9hz50g2.jpg?v1\"> <p>Tonight sees a big lunar event called the \"super worm moon\" when the moon will look bigger and brighter in the night sky.&nbsp;</p><p>Landscape and travel photographer and Canon ambassador David Noton has put together his top tips for photographing supermoon events. The best thing about this particular celestial event is that you won't need any special gear - it'll be visible to the naked eye so you should be able to photograph it relatively easily.&nbsp;</p><p>It's believed that the worm moon/supermoon will be visible from 5.35pm after sunset as the moon rises in the east and will peak at around 5.48pm. It should be visible for much of the evening, though.&nbsp;</p><p>So what are David’s best super moon shooting tips?</p><h3>1. Be in-the-know</h3><p>The sun’s position in the sky at any given time of day varies massively with latitude and season. That is not the case with the moon as its passage through the heavens is governed by its complex elliptical orbit of the earth. That orbit results in monthly, rather than seasonal variations, as the moon moves through its lunar cycle.</p><p>The result is big differences in the timing of its appearance and its trajectory through the sky. Luckily, we no longer need to rely on weight tables to consult the&nbsp;behaviour of the moon, we can simply download an app on to our phone.</p><p>The&nbsp;Photographer’s Ephemer is&nbsp;is useful for giving moonrise and moonset times, bearings and phases; while the&nbsp;Photopills&nbsp;app gives comprehensive information on the position of the moon in our sky.</p><h3>2. Invest in a lens with optimal zoom</h3><p>One of the key challenges we’ll face is shooting the moon large in the frame so we can see every crater on the asteroid pockmarked surface.</p><p>It’s a task normally reserved for astronomers with super powerful telescopes, but if you’ve got a long telephoto lens on a full frame DSLR with around 600 mm of focal length, it can be done, depending on the composition.</p><h3>3. Use a tripod to capture the intimate details</h3><p>As you frame up your shot, one thing will become immediately apparent; lunar tracking is incredible challenging as the moon moves through the sky surprisingly quickly.&nbsp;As you’ll be using a long lens for this shoot, it’s important to invest in a sturdy tripod to help capture the best possible image.</p><p>Although it will be tempting to take the shot by hand, it’s important to remember that your subject is over 384,000km away from you and even with a high shutter speed, the slightest of movements will become exaggerated.</p><h3>4. Integrate the moon into your landscape</h3><p>Whilst images of the moon large in the frame can be beautifully detailed, they are essentially astronomical in their appeal. Personally, I’m far more drawn to using the lunar allure as an element in my landscapes, or using the moonlight as a light source.</p><p>The latter is difficult, as the amount of light the moon reflects is tiny, whilst the lunar surface is so bright by comparison. Up to now, night photography meant long, long exposures but with cameras now capable of astonishing low light performance, a whole new nocturnal world of opportunities has been opened to photographers.</p><h3>5. Master the shutter speed for your subject&nbsp;</h3><p>The most evocative and genuine use of the moon in landscape portraits results from situations when the light on the moon balances with the twilight in the surrounding sky. Such images have a subtle appeal, mood and believability.</p><p>By definition, any scene incorporating a medium or wide-angle view is going to render the moon as a tiny pin prick of light, but its presence will still be felt. Our eyes naturally gravitate to it, however insignificant it may seem. Of course, the issue of shutter speed is always there; too slow an exposure and all we’ll see is an unsightly lunar streak, even with a wide-angle lens.</p><p>On a clear night, mastering the shutter speed of your camera is integral to capturing the moon - exposing at 1/250 sec at f8 ISO 100 (depending on focal length) is what you’ll need to stop the motion from blurring.</p><p><strong>Liked this?</strong> <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/phones/news/120868-10-top-tips-for-better-smartphone-photography\" rel=\"\">Check out these tips for great low light photography</a></p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 09 Mar 2020 14:26:00 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/143512-cameras-feature-how-to-take-pictures-of-the-‘super-blue-blood-moon’-image1-yis9hz50g2.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"27b8d5c4fffd32581a908ce79247efac","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn68@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-36-52-428_716a1148aefcd1a7.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":499,"sourceBytes":70287,"destBytes":37038,"author":"Dan Grabham","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/143512-cameras-feature-how-to-take-pictures-of-the-‘super-blue-blood-moon’-image1-yis9hz50g2.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn68@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-36-52-428_716a1148aefcd1a7.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209021},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"GoPro Max review: Everything an action camera should be","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/gopro/151240-gopro-max-review","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"498\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/151240-cameras-review-gopro-max-review-everything-an-action-camera-should-be-image1-k1awmaxtzb.jpg?v1\"> <p>GoPro makes action cameras, that's what it's known for. In recent years it's <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/buyers-guides/134096-best-gopro-action-camera-gopro-models-compared\" rel=\"\">released some of its best Hero products</a>, with powerful features at sensible price points. But the company hasn't stuck with a linear product line-up, as the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/gopro/141310-gopro-fusion-review-the-360-degree-camera-you-ve-been-waiting-for\" rel=\"\">GoPro Fusion 360-degree camera</a> showed us back in 2018.</p><p>So what of the GoPro Max, the next step 360-degree camera which can capture spherical video? As we've found out: the Max is a different proposition to the Fusion in the way that it's used. Is it the ultimate kind of action camera?</p><h2>What is the GoPro Max?</h2>\n <ul>\n  <li>Dimensions: 64 x 69 x 25 mm</li>\n  <li>Built-in 16:9 touchscreen</li>\n  <li>Waterproof to 5m</li>\n  <li>Built-in mount</li>\n  <li>Included lens covers for underwater use</li>\n </ul><p>Take a look at its exterior and you might just see the Max as a miniature version of the GoPro Fusion. It has the two cameras, one on either side of the body, stuck in the right corner. The lenses are domed, as you'd expect from a 360 camera, and they ship with lens covers to keep them protected.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151240-cameras-review-gopro-max-review-everything-an-action-camera-should-be-image1-hmhsp9zovd.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"704\" height=\"469\" /></p><p>As an added bonus, the camera also comes with a soft microfibre bag to make it easy to carry around. This pouch also comes with additional lens covers designed specifically for shooting in the water. They snap easily onto the lenses, enabling a way to shoot underwater and above the water's surface simultaneously (with the clear dividing line between the two).</p><p>Just like the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/gopro/149442-gopro-hero8-black-review-action-camera\" rel=\"\">Hero 8</a>, the Max has a built-in flip out frame on the underside of the camera, so you don't need to attach any frames or additional accessories just to mount it. It'll easily screw onto any handle or mount from GoPro's range using the standard screw.</p><p>Another more important inclusion is the small touchscreen on the bottom of its front/back. It means you no longer have to shoot 360-degree video completely blind, meaning you get an easy way to control and frame your shooting. Which is massively important.</p><p>Joining the screen is the addition of an advanced microphone system, which GoPro has added to offer more professional quality audio, but also better ambient noise cancellation when you need it to focus on your voice.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151240-cameras-review-gopro-max-review-everything-an-action-camera-should-be-image1-ovlxwzlcpf.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"704\" height=\"469\" /></p><p>There's also the durable metal cover, which seals shut the battery and microSD slots, locking them behind a catch. It holds really well in daily use, and needs a good amount of force to release and gain access, so those worried about it being broken easily can rest easy. As can anyone concerned about water seeping in. The Max is waterproof up to five metres and the build makes that pretty clear.</p><h2>User friendly</h2>\n <ul>\n  <li>Easy touchscreen interface</li>\n  <li>Two physical buttons</li>\n </ul><p>One of the things we've grown to love about GoPro is the company's attempts to make using its cameras as simple as possible. That's meant reworking the user interface on the touchscreen, and developing new mobile-first apps that make it super-easy to edit on the go. These same strengths are evident in the GoPro Max.</p><p>Because this latest 360-degree camera has a touchscreen on it, actually seeing what you're filming is possible, whereas on the Fusion it was a case of pressing record and hoping things looked right.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151240-cameras-review-gopro-max-review-everything-an-action-camera-should-be-image1-ya4s2lboex.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"704\" height=\"469\" /></p><p>Just like the Hero 8 Black, there are easy interface elements on the Max's touchscreen. You can switch between Hero mode - where you shoot from one camera like a regular GoPro - and 360 mode by tapping a little camera icon in the bottom left corner. Then you can flip the view on the screen to switch between the cameras by tapping the icon in the bottom right.</p><p>Like Hero you can also adjust the field of view, depending on how wide-angle you want it, as well as quickly selecting what resolution and frame rate you'd like to use. It's really consumer friendly and not at all difficult to figure out. Even if you've never used a GoPro before, you'll quickly get used to the controls, even if they are a bit tiny and fiddly on that small touchscreen.</p><p>There are physical buttons on the camera too, which for the GoPro-experienced will seem immediately familiar. The power/mode button lets you quickly cycle through the shooting modes, while the bigger red button on the top starts and stops recording.</p><h2>The GoPro app</h2>\n <ul>\n  <li>Android/iPhone app</li>\n  <li>Easy keyframe selection</li>\n  <li>Accelerometer framing for easy viewing</li>\n </ul><p>It's safe to say using the Fusion was a learning curve. Initially, you had to install a desktop plugin and app for advanced editing programs like Premiere Pro. It eventually was made easier with an app, but with the Max it's been made easy right from the outset.</p><p>Once you shoot some 360 video, you simply launch the app and view the media. Press play and then move your phone to point within the frame you want to view. It takes very little effort.</p><p>Editing the footage, adding transitions, changing the view and angle is all done in a similarly easy way. And being mobile-focused, it's so much simpler than using a desktop editing suite. And that makes it far less time consuming.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151240-cameras-review-app-image1-grzeikjkqi.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"704\" height=\"325\" /></p><p>Once you have your footage downloaded to the phone, all you have to do is choose to edit it by adding keyframes. Play the video, move it around using your finger on the screen, pinch-to-zoom in or out to change the view, and add a keyframe by tapping the little icon at the bottom of the screen.</p><p>Once that's done, it'll automatically pan and zoom between the starting point and your keyframe. Then all you have to do is keep adding keyframes with the angle and view you want, then save and render on the phone. It's so easy it's almost ridiculous.</p><h2>Photos and video</h2>\n <ul>\n  <li>5.6k 360-degree footage at 30fps</li>\n  <li>16.6MP stills</li>\n  <li>2x slo-mo&nbsp;</li>\n  <li>PowerPan - single take panorama</li>\n  <li>Spherical audio</li>\n </ul><p>There's no doubt that when it comes to shooting with the Max, it's one of the most versatile action cameras GoPro has ever launched. That stems primarily from the fact that you can use it as either a 360-degree camera, or in 'Hero' mode, just use it like a GoPro and using one camera.&nbsp;</p><p></p><p>The downside of Hero mode, however, is that the resolution tops out at 1440p, and even then you're forced to use that in 4:3 ratio. If you want 16:9 video - which is much more typical for the format - then you can only get 1080p as a maximum resolution.&nbsp;</p><p>Short version: if what you want is the highest quality regular video footage, you're better off saving a little money and buying the Hero 8 Black instead. It has higher resolution video that generally looks better.&nbsp;</p><p>The process of shooting 360-degree video with the Max and what you can do with it afterwards is a lot of fun. One of the things we're most impressed with is the stabilisation: holding the camera handheld while we're running or walking sees the footage stay stable and smooth, with only a little smooth movement. With the feature enabled, it also keeps the horizon locked in place, ensuring you're almost looking at footage that's the right way around. It's a testament to GoPro's work on algorithms that process the movement and footage.&nbsp;</p><p>Once stitched together, the 360-video file comes in around 5.6K resolution, but when you edit into a video for a flat-screen, obviously it ends up being a much lower resolution, so it doesn't always seem that sharp.&nbsp;</p><p>If you shoot in nice bright daylight with blue skies, the footage - while a little rough resolution-wise - can look vivid and bright. In overcast conditions, or even in Hero mode shooting 1080p, it appears the camera can struggle to balance out the exposure, backlighting and shadows some of the time, leaving you either with a dark image or one that's a little too over-exposed and lacking in detail.&nbsp;It's not all that bad, but it could be better.&nbsp;</p><p>Another of the big advantages of this particular 360 camera is what it enables on the stills front. Of course, you can create 360-degree photos with tiny-planet spherical effect, but you can also create what GoPro calls a PowerPano (a panorama photo it snaps in one press of the shutter). Unlike using a smartphone, you just hold the camera still, and it'll create the Panorama using the two lenses.&nbsp;</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 12 Mar 2020 10:00:00 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/151240-cameras-review-gopro-max-review-everything-an-action-camera-should-be-image1-k1awmaxtzb.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"1e39bc5c99a8ff335422dae38117581c","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn35@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-36-51-914_b5b01e365de86e1d.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":498,"sourceBytes":39174,"destBytes":21212,"author":"Cam There's no built-in viewfinder, as reflects this models' entry position.</p><p>The X-A7 is available in dark silver or silver finishes, both of which look great. Lowe","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152834-cameras-news-fujifilm-x-a7-image1-ctqbac9fgi.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn27@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-36-52-204_148af9d59a960954.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209016},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"You can now use your Panasonic camera as a webcam","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/panasonic/152493-panasonic-cameras-can-now-be-used-as-webcams","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"499\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152493-cameras-news-you-can-now-use-your-panasonic-camera-as-a-webcam-image1-lgevm0vnny.jpg?v1\"> <p>With the world in lockdown, more people are relying on <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/buyers-guides/131512-video-calling-apps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">video conferencing apps</a> to keep in touch with friends and colleagues.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/151426-what-is-zoom-and-how-does-it-work-plus-tips-and-tricks\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Zoom</a>, <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/microsoft/139364-microsoft-teams-is-here-a-slack-like-app-that-s-part-of-office-365\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Microsoft Teams</a> and <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/google/140512-what-is-hangouts-meet-and-hangouts-chat-how-do-they-work-and-when-can-you-use-them\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Google Meet</a> are proving incredibly popular, but people are also discovering that their laptop webcams aren't cutting the mustard.&nbsp;</p><p>Sure, you can <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/gadgets/buyers-guides/150812-best-webcam-stream-and-video-chat\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">upgrade your webcam</a>, but there may well be a better way. You could potentially employ your camera instead.</p><p>This is already possible with an additional purchase of something like <a href=\"https://www.elgato.com/en/gaming/cam-link-4k\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Elgato's Cam Link</a> (a great <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/games/buyers-guides/151356-how-to-start-streaming-your-gaming-all-the-gear-you-need\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">bit of kit for streamers</a>) but now camera manufacturers are making it possible in other ways.&nbsp;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/canon\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Canon</a> recently released its <a href=\"https://www.usa.canon.com/internet/portal/us/home/support/self-help-center/eos-webcam-utility/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">EOS Webcam Utility</a> to allow people to use some of its DSLR, Mirrorless and PowerShot cameras as webcams. Now <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/panasonic\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Panasonic</a> is following suit.&nbsp;</p><p>Panasonic has released a free piece of software that allows you to use some Panasonic cameras for live streaming.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.panasonic.com/global/consumer/lumix/lumixtether.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Lumix Tether for Streaming (Beta)</a> is a free download for Windows that allows a \"Live View\" mode which can be used for streaming after the camera is connected to a PC with a USB cable.&nbsp;</p><p></p><p>There are a few provisos though. Firstly, it's worth keeping in mind that the software is in beta and still in development. Secondly, it only compatible with these Panasonic cameras:</p>\n <ul> \n  <li>DC-GH5</li> \n  <li>DC-G9</li> \n  <li>DC-GH5S</li> \n  <li>DC-S1</li> \n  <li>DC-S1R</li> \n  <li>DC-S1H</li> \n </ul><p>It's also only available for Windows at the moment, not macOS and you'll need to hit these requirements:</p>\n <ul> \n  <li>OS: Windows 10 (32bit/64bit)</li> \n  <li>CPU: Intel CPU of 1 GHz or higher</li> \n  <li>Display: 1024 x 768 pixels or more</li> \n  <li>RAM: 1GB or more (32bit),2GB or more (64bit)</li> \n  <li>HDD: Free space of 200 MB or more for installation</li> \n  <li>Interface: USB 3.0/3.1</li> \n </ul><p>If you tick all the right boxes though, the Lumix Tether software is certainly a great way to upgrade your visuals and improve your calls or live streaming endeavours!</p> +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152493-cameras-news-you-can-now-use-your-panasonic-camera-as-a-webcam-image1-lgevm0vnny.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"6eb24e165344dead4cc22d39b86f9f18","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn12@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-36-52-382_5805b6b612399a5d.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":499,"sourceBytes":67397,"destBytes":32788,"author":"Adrian Willings","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152493-cameras-news-you-can-now-use-your-panasonic-camera-as-a-webcam-image1-lgevm0vnny.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn12@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-36-52-382_5805b6b612399a5d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209017},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"DJI's Osmo Action camera is almost half off on Amazon right now","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/dji/152333-dji-s-osmo-action-camera-is-almost-half-off-on-amazon-right-now","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"499\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152333-cameras-news-djis-osmo-action-camera-is-almost-half-off-on-amazon-right-now-image1-fcjsjg8mv6.jpg?v1\"> <p>DJI’s 4K HDR action camera, the Osmo Action, usually costs between $400 to $500. <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/DJI-Digital-Displays-Waterproof-HDR-Video/dp/B07TWYHJQG/?tag=pocketlintc07-20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">But, right now, on Amazon (US), you can get it for half that.</a></p><p>It costs $288 and comes with a 128GB microSD card. You also get DJI’s Care Refresh service plan, which allows up to two replacement units in one year. Even if you disregard those extras, the last time DJI's action camera had this much of a price reduction was around Christmas. It has maintained its current pricing for months. And we suspect it won't go on sale again until later this year.</p><p>Keep in mind this is <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/dji\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">DJI's first action camera</a>. When the company first launched the device, many saw it as a little foolish to go after a market place that GoPro has championed - and one that's dwindling. But we didn't think that's the story.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152333-cameras-news-djis-osmo-action-camera-is-almost-half-off-on-amazon-right-now-image2-69yq5nvizm.jpg\" /></p><p><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/dji/148194-dji-osmo-action-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">In our review,</a> we noted DJI has a growing ecosystem of products, with drones and gimbals making up a big part of that. For those shooting outdoor action, this Osmo Action adds another weapon to that arsenal, and - for those with DJI drones and Osmos - it gives them another relatively inexpensive, portable camera to slot into that workflow.</p><p>It might not be selling billions, but for the DJI user who wants to stick in the ecosystem, it's a good extra camera that can enhance creativity.</p><p>SQUIRREL_148833</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 27 May 2020 04:00:56 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152333-cameras-news-djis-osmo-action-camera-is-almost-half-off-on-amazon-right-now-image1-fcjsjg8mv6.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"df820ab3bc09519e317f41846b211ecf","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn63@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-36-51-874_789116a588b52b17.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":499,"sourceBytes":44021,"destBytes":16862,"author":"Maggie Tillman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152333-cameras-news-djis-osmo-action-camera-is-almost-half-off-on-amazon-right-now-image1-fcjsjg8mv6.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn63@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-36-51-874_789116a588b52b17.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152333-cameras-news-djis-osmo-action-camera-is-almost-half-off-on-amazon-right-now-image2-69yq5nvizm.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn92@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-37-05-957_09d6547b93b9e98e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209017},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"How to buy the right printer for you","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/laptops/news/hp/99101-how-to-buy-a-printer","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"499\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/99101-laptops-news-how-to-buy-the-right-printer-for-you-image1-ckrpqvtsot.jpg?v1\"> <p>Printers aren't the sexiest of gadgets. We know this. But the fact remains that more and more people are choosing to print out their digital photos as well as using the things for letters, contracts and other documents.</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/smart-home/buyers-guides/151531-best-printers-documents-photos\" rel=\"follow\">Best cheap home printer: The best printers for documents and photos</a></li> \n </ul><p>So, if you want to know how to avoid the pricey ink trap and make sure you're getting the most beautiful snaps for your frames then read on.</p><h2>Rule 1: Work out how much you'll use it</h2><p>This is both the hardest thing to figure out and also the most important at the same time. In fact, if you get this bit sussed, you're pretty much home already. The trouble is that it's a hard thing to estimate because it's not worth paying attention to while you do it.</p><p>In fact, you're most likely only going find out the answer after it's too late and you've already made your purchase. So, as dull as it might sound, if you can have a good estimate at this now, it'll save you a fair bit of money and trouble in the long run.</p><h2>Rule 2: Cheaper printers have more expensive ink</h2><p>You might have paid a good price for the hardware in some sale or other but chances are that a cheap printer will cost you more in ink cartridges over time whereas replacements on a more expensive piece of kit will work out better as time goes on.</p><p>So, based on the calculation of how many pages you think you'll be printing each month, you'll have some idea of how often you'll get through cartridges. Lots of brands these days say on the packaging just how many sheets they'd expect you to get out of them.</p><p>Combine that with your printing frequency and you'll have some idea of how much you'd expect to pay in refills over each year. Factor in the initial cost of the machine and you'll see at what point it might be worth going for a higher spec printer.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><h2>Rule 3: Lasers are not necessarily the best</h2><p>Most home user probably would opt for an inkjet anyway but even if you really want to spend some cash or you're a small business trying to make the right choice, don't just presume that you'll get more for your money with a laser printer. The major advantage of them is that they're fast.</p><p>Many inkjets will beat laser models for startup time if you're just printing a page or two. On the other hand, if you're going to be calling for 20 sheets at a time, then a laser's probably the right call.<br> <br> Another issue is that lasers won't necessarily offer more accurate colours over all parts of the spectrum as a high-end inkjet might. So, if printing photos is the reason for your purchase then make sure to read the reviews carefully if you really are sold on the idea of these bigger, faster machines.</br></br></p><p>On the cartridge side, you won't have to shell out for a new one quite so often but you will be looking at a fair old wedge when you do. Quite a good compromise if you're unsure of which type to go for are often the prosumer type inkjet printers. They're generally quicker and more economic with the ink provided you use them on a regular basis. But they cost more initially.&nbsp;</p><h2>Rule 4: Use the right refills</h2><p>One option to make your ongoing printer use cheaper is to go for non-brand printer cartridge replacements or even have your empties filled back up again. By all means, give this a crack but get them from a reputable supplier rather than somebody selling a supply from an unknown source. Some non-brand replacements are reliable but many aren't.&nbsp;<br> <br> Another thing to keep your eyes out for are extra large cartridges and printer packs. It's just a question of a buying-in-bulk mentality. These deals will offer you a lower cost per page but obviously need you to spend more up front.&nbsp;</br></br></p><h2>Rule 5: Use the right paper</h2><p>There's a holy trinity of printing between the machine, the ink and the paper and if any one of them is out, there's a chance that you won't get good results. Fortunately, you don't have to be quite as specific with paper as you do with the ink.</p><p>Photo quality paper is the one to pay most attention to. If you are going to print your snaps, it's not really a place to scrimp. That said, they often come in grades equivalent to “good”, “better” and “best” so try a few and see which reaches the right price/quality point for you.</p><p>One piece of advice for all printing is to make sure that your paper is 80gsm thick or over – if you require your documents to have an aesthetic value, that is.</p><h2>Rule 6: A printer is a subscription</h2><p>Most dissatisfaction over printers is caused by the bill shock of the cartridges. The problem is that people just aren't in the right mindset when they buy them. You've got to see the purchase of a printer much like a mobile phone where there's an initial outlay to consider as well as an equal, if not more significant, running cost.</p><p>Pick the subscription model that suits you the best. Are you happy paying little and often or would you prefer to shell out in bursts? You might consider a cheaper printer more like a 12 month contract whereas a better model you'll need to keep for a longer period of time to really reap the economic benefits.</p><p>&nbsp;</p>\n <!--            @page { margin: 2cm }           P { margin-bottom: 0.21cm } --> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 06 Apr 2020 08:53:00 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/99101-laptops-news-how-to-buy-the-right-printer-for-you-image1-ckrpqvtsot.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"7fd77148066f7b7edd7d21f6e2353dd5","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn88@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-36-51-042_7e05fd06a856fa30.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":499,"sourceBytes":40816,"destBytes":22172,"author":"Dan there's something perfect about them when edited onto other animals, as in the case of this proud penguin, whose little wings are a lot more beautiful than normal.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152265-cameras-news-enter-another-world-with-these-dreamlike-photoshop-jobs-image8-5wiaarcmxc.jpg\" /></p><h2>Supermoon</h2><p>We're all used to the idea that every so often the moon will do something absolutely nuts, whether it's an eclipse, a red moon or a supermoon, but sadly most of us are unlikely to ever see one quite so enormous as this stunner, let alone catch a stag perfectly posed in front of it.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/tv/news/bbc/152153-emtpy-bbc-sets-gallery\" rel=\"follow\">These images of empty BBC sets are ideal Zoom and Skype backgrounds</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152265-cameras-news-enter-another-world-with-these-dreamlike-photoshop-jobs-image9-bpj3o8oxew.jpg\" /></p><h2>Dreamscape</h2><p>We love the ripples spreading out from around this swan in the sky, a sort of dream-pond that makes it feel like the manifestation of an ancient god or something, while the hot air balloon adds a human touch.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152265-cameras-news-enter-another-world-with-these-dreamlike-photoshop-jobs-image100-0em4zxp8nj.jpg\" /></p><h2>Diving utopia</h2><p>We're sure that any experienced divers would be absolutely thrilled to discover a reef or ecosystem as interesting as this one so close to the surface, and indeed so close to land - it sure would be convenient!</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/147200-astounding-underwater-photos\" rel=\"follow\">Stunning underwater photos that will take your breath away</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152265-cameras-news-enter-another-world-with-these-dreamlike-photoshop-jobs-image111-rstx5gk7ha.jpg\" /></p><h2>Melting away</h2><p>Old buildings can sometimes feel like, unless they're taken care of with great attention, they could melt away like a candle, so to speak, after having burned so brightly in their heyday.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152265-cameras-news-enter-another-world-with-these-dreamlike-photoshop-jobs-image122-to93gbh0hw.jpg\" /></p><h2>Quite the jogging route</h2><p>If you thought one hot air balloon looked scenic, check out this composition with loads of the things. It makes us absolutely yearn for the days when we can pick our own running routes with total freedom again, even if they're unlikely to match this beachside spot.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/instagram/144672-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house\" rel=\"follow\">How to be an Instagram travel sensation without leaving the house</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152265-cameras-news-enter-another-world-with-these-dreamlike-photoshop-jobs-image133-aqurgrh68k.jpg\" /></p><h2>Perfect timing?</h2><p>This is the sort of shot that might once have passed for real, before people got wise. It's one thing to nail the conditions and lighting for this moody bridge shot, but quite another to also get a passing bird in focus and looking right at the camera.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152265-cameras-news-enter-another-world-with-these-dreamlike-photoshop-jobs-image144-gorvdsyawm.jpg\" /></p><h2>Space aquarium</h2><p>Jellyfish return, for possibly the most magic-realist image in this collection, with the man's head-torch illuminating an impossible scene of skybound water creatures frolicking beneath the stars.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/152215-photos-from-old-west-american\" rel=\"follow\">A lawless time of discovery: Early photos from the Old West</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152265-cameras-news-enter-another-world-with-these-dreamlike-photoshop-jobs-image155-jjkw934xgx.jpg\" /></p><h2>When I see an elephant butterfly</h2><p>If you think we're not proud of that Dumbo pun, you're dead wrong, but either way we love this image of an elephant in their home turf, but with one key, and very eye-catching detail changed.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152265-cameras-news-enter-another-world-with-these-dreamlike-photoshop-jobs-image166-duqfvy4tut.jpg\" /></p><h2>Giraffe graffiti</h2><p>We love this image of another African mammal changed in an immediately obvious way, not least because it reminds us of how we used to colour in these gentle giants when we were kids - with every crayon colour we could lay our grubby mitts on.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/148556-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs\" rel=\"follow\">33 incredibly interesting photos from history</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152265-cameras-news-enter-another-world-with-these-dreamlike-photoshop-jobs-image177-dn1jbehapx.jpg\" /></p><h2>The giant peach</h2><p>This image has an obvious inspiration from a certain Roald Dahl story, if you're asking us, and it shares that author's love of whimsy and far-fetched situations. Frankly, it even looks quite attractive.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152265-cameras-news-enter-another-world-with-these-dreamlike-photoshop-jobs-image188-kvxmz8sxij.jpg\" /></p><h2>Too good to be true</h2><p>Another day, another giraffe, although this one's much closer to looking normal. In fact, it's the animal's surroundings that have had a touch-up of the more subtle variety, lending the picture a colour palette that would sadly be unlikely in real life.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/parenting/news/lego/151241-classic-lego-sets-of-all-time\" rel=\"follow\">Classic Lego sets: Do you remember these all time greats?</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152265-cameras-news-enter-another-world-with-these-dreamlike-photoshop-jobs-image199-tgyowrope0.jpg\" /></p><h2>Leaves like a cloud</h2><p>Another lovely scene is offered up by this shot of a dry landscape at sunset, and you might not even notice what's odd about it at first glance, until you pay more attention to that tree's cloudy foliage.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152265-cameras-news-enter-another-world-with-these-dreamlike-photoshop-jobs-image20-oditkyhw9w.jpg\" /></p><h2>Foreboding</h2><p>This dust twister and desery combo is more than a little off-putting, though it doesn't seem to be stopping the 4x4 approaching it - more than enough evidence to make us suspect that the twister has been added in entirely, as has the storm in the background.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li class=\"align-left\"><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/phones/news/120303-mobile-phone-40-year-anniversary\" rel=\"follow\">The most iconic mobile phones in history</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152265-cameras-news-enter-another-world-with-these-dreamlike-photoshop-jobs-image21-rq6um1nqos.jpg\" /></p><h2>Wet wings</h2><p>Our penultimate photo brings the last outing for butterfly wings, this time replacing the tailfin of this huge whale, and we are serious fans of the contrast between the royal blue of the ocean and the bright orange of those wings.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152265-cameras-news-enter-another-world-with-these-dreamlike-photoshop-jobs-image22-bcolpgru2y.jpg\" /></p><h2>Diving in</h2><p>Last but not least, we're so on board with the vibe of this final image. Its subject, that little turtle, seems to be diving, flying through the air towards that lovely blue sea - truly joyful.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/sony/151522-jaw-dropping-photos-sony-world-photography-awards\" rel=\"follow\">These stunning award-winning pro photos will blow you away</a></li> \n
