derx1/cdn89@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-37-01-022_8db627e2c08b89f5.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147200-cameras-feature-stunning-underwater-photos-that-will-take-your-breath-away-image13-mvhtiuqzw8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn36@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-36-54-244_c82052ebdeca3c20.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147200-cameras-feature-14-astounding-underwater-photos-image1-70otgbrzfk.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn17@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-37-05-550_daa44b4ab1e7f522.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147200-cameras-feature-stunning-underwater-photos-that-will-take-your-breath-away-image14-ru5aazfu8g.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn83@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-37-14-942_d418e57019d064f1.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147200-cameras-feature-stunning-underwater-photos-that-will-take-your-breath-away-image6-hfyjpsrykc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn1@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-37-21-428_40577bee2c651e4e.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147200-cameras-feature-stunning-underwater-photos-that-will-take-your-breath-away-image9-qbemfov05q.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn42@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-37-11-575_b6340ec679ac0960.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147200-cameras-feature-stunning-underwater-photos-that-will-take-your-breath-away-image4-ivbjitgjy2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn56@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-37-01-190_dc329cc7bb88555b.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147200-cameras-feature-stunning-underwater-photos-that-will-take-your-breath-away-image12-z4ezldg1mr.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn93@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-10-874_a4f3a08dc668517a.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147200-cameras-feature-stunning-underwater-photos-that-will-take-your-breath-away-image15-ng9u387pak.j 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"Living in the Old West: Photos from the early days of the United States","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/152449-photographs-american-old-west-gallery","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"518\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152449-cameras-news-living-in-the-old-west-photographs-from-the-birth-of-the-united-states-image1-ljr5mns7zd.jpg?v1\"> <p>The US National Archive is a genuine treasure trove of amazing imagery from times gone by, a huge set of documentation that acts as a testament to how things used to be, in all different walks of life.</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/instagram/149858-this-incredible-photographer-creates-new-worlds-with-arts-and-crafts\" rel=\"follow\">This incredible photographer creates new worlds with arts and crafts</a></li> \n </ul><p>Its images from the Old West are some of its most impactful, showcasing how the modern nation was born, and both upending and validating our preconceived notions of what life looked like on the frontier and in towns and cities.</p><p>We've been trawling through its list of photographs for weeks now, gathering together some of the most interesting and arresting shots, like those below.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152449-cameras-news-living-in-the-old-west-photographs-from-the-birth-of-the-united-states-image2-seo8kj4q5v.jpg\">&nbsp;</img></p><h2>A spot for lunch</h2><p>There's nothing like heading out for a picnic in the shade of what is a frankly enormous cactus - the sort of cactus you remember from Looney Tunes. These guests of the garrison at Fort Thomas in Arizona look like they're having a delightful day, despite the guns everywhere.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152449-cameras-news-living-in-the-old-west-photographs-from-the-birth-of-the-united-states-image3-slsk4um6jq.jpg\" /></p><h2>Rudimentary</h2><p>It might not be easy to make out at first, but these men are actually gathered for the solemn occasion of a game of poker - it looks like they've got plenty of work to do, but there's never really a bad time to sit down for a few hands, right?</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/instagram/144672-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house\" rel=\"follow\">How to be an Instagram travel sensation without leaving the house</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152449-cameras-news-living-in-the-old-west-photographs-from-the-birth-of-the-united-states-image4-3zvixli0rn.jpg\" /></p><h2>Hillside views</h2><p>This is another image where it might not be immediately obvious what's actually going on - it's recreation, again, although with a side of skillful practise, as these men work on some target practise with their firearms.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152449-cameras-news-living-in-the-old-west-photographs-from-the-birth-of-the-united-states-image5-tmcvkbjhib.jpg\" /></p><h2>Water, water everywhere</h2><p>This photo shows that getting water circulating around a new town was hardly a simple matter (not that we'd assume it would be). The water tower being erected here in Oklahoma would be a key part of the initial infrastructure for the area.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152449-cameras-news-living-in-the-old-west-photographs-from-the-birth-of-the-united-states-image6-iquomw24pm.jpg\" /></p><h2>Hustle and bustle</h2><p>It's amazing to us that this photograph was taken in the same year as the last, 1893 - it demonstrates just how far ahead some territories could be based on immigration and growth. This bustling cotton market is a far cry from the badlands it once occupied.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/games/news/149572-then-vs-now-video-games-through-the-decades\" rel=\"follow\">Then vs now: Video games through the decades</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152449-cameras-news-living-in-the-old-west-photographs-from-the-birth-of-the-united-states-image7-isprz7gf1s.jpg\" /></p><h2>Someone's got to build it</h2><p>Of course, those towns don't just pop up out of nowhere - they had to be built, and before the days of industrial tools and automation that meant hard work and an absolutely huge bucket of elbow grease.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152449-cameras-news-living-in-the-old-west-photographs-from-the-birth-of-the-united-states-image8-ywvsju591a.jpg\" /></p><h2>Family life</h2><p>This photograph showcases another side to the American West - the family life, in a house that's clearly recently built, and to be fair is nice and chunky, giving plenty of space. The photo's a little underexposed, giving one side of the house that menacing dark look, which we think increases the image's impact.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/141224-the-most-famous-ghost-photographs-ever-taken\" rel=\"follow\">The most famous ghost photographs ever taken</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152449-cameras-news-living-in-the-old-west-photographs-from-the-birth-of-the-united-states-image9-kijwg6oruw.jpg\" /></p><h2>Business goes on</h2><p>A key part of the growth of these towns is, of course, the arrival of business and commerce, and in the early days many businesses would have to cater to multiple diverse needs. If you had a supply of wood, for example, you might set up shop selling both furniture and coffins, as this shop has.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152449-cameras-news-living-in-the-old-west-photographs-from-the-birth-of-the-united-states-image100-xoh2rkfbqn.jpg\" /></p><h2>A sight for sore eyes</h2><p>Where people settle, food follows, and people will almost always be interested in spending their disposable income on some food they don't have to prepare themselves. It might be a little strong to call this a restaurant, but the English Kitchen certainly looks like an early one.</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/152226-politicians-re-imagined-in-famous-portrait-paintings\" rel=\"follow\">Modern politicians fantastically re-imagined in famous portrait paintings</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152449-cameras-news-living-in-the-old-west-photographs-from-the-birth-of-the-united-states-image111-qfunjcxsrg.jpg\" /></p><h2>I am the law</h2><p>You couldn't necessarily rely on having a huge list of lawyers to choose from if you wanted some legal work done back then, but you'd hopefully be able to find help from the likes of J. W. Craig and others who ironed out disputes over land in particular.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152449-cameras-news-living-in-the-old-west-photographs-from-the-birth-of-the-united-states-image122-mev4qbsxp9.jpg\" /></p><h2>Cosy</h2><p>Another delightful picture of a place that must have been treasured by many, The Bijou saloon would indeed look like a jewel if you were particularly thirsty for a drink - although we're amused to see how tiny it is given how many people are stood outside it!</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/147588-amazing-images-of-our-moon\" rel=\"follow\">Amazing images of our moon in all shapes and sizes</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152449-cameras-news-living-in-the-old-west-photographs-from-the-birth-of-the-united-states-image133-ajtkk8ddui.jpg\" /></p><h2>Photo day</h2><p>Another great group shot, this is a reminder that growing up in the West still meant going to school, unless you were really rural - this shot of a class full of kids is a great one that echoes down to the similar class photographs still being taken all over the world today.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152449-cameras-news-living-in-the-old-west-photographs-from-the-birth-of-the-united-states-image144-xwizsacmpd.jpg\" /></p><h2>Airs and graces</h2><p>This is about as fancy a building as we've seen in the Archive from this period, photographed in around 1897 or 1898, and it's no surprise to learn that it's the home of an early university, which would want to house its students in something a little more sophisticated.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/140473-best-internet-optical-illusions-you-won-t-believe-your-eyes\" rel=\"follow\">The very best internet optical illusions around: You won't believe your eyes</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152449-cameras-news-living-in-the-old-west-photographs-from-the-birth-of-the-united-states-image155-96nxpus2li.jpg\" /></p><h2>Quite a clan</h2><p>This image shows another type of educational institution - a local church's sunday school in Oklahoma, which explains why everyone's dressed up quite so fancy. It's a diverse group and shows the sort of communities that would spring up and centre around faith.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152449-cameras-news-living-in-the-old-west-photographs-from-the-birth-of-the-united-states-image166-vi19zfgpyh.jpg\" /></p><h2>Vice</h2><p>Faith couldn't repel all vices, though, and gambling was an early arrival in the United States, becoming a staple for movies about the West, too. This table's playing Faro, which isn't quite so popular anymore, but still feels characteristic of the feel of a saloon.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/151711-best-zoom-backgrounds-fun-virtual-backgrounds-for-zoom-meetings\" rel=\"follow\">Best Zoom backgrounds: Fun virtual backgrounds for Zoom meetings</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152449-cameras-news-living-in-the-old-west-photographs-from-the-birth-of-the-united-states-image177-ywacn0nqut.jpg\" /></p><h2>Beachside</h2><p>How's that for an imposing location? We can't help but feel that building such a huge structure quite so close to ocean is asking for trouble, but it doesn't half look picturesque. This was taken near San Francisco in 1902, and we're really fond of the choice to have the family outing in the foreground to lend a sense of scale.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152449-cameras-news-living-in-the-old-west-photographs-from-the-birth-of-the-united-states-image188-voftlkmc2r.jpg\" /></p><h2>Patience personified</h2><p>This cow looks like it's fairly used to having to cart around the youngsters on its back, but that doesn't make it any less impressive. They look like they're having a whale of a time, and it's a lovely image of a happy time.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/instagram/148290-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-pixel-art\" rel=\"follow\">Fantastic street artist transforms the world with incredible pixel art</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152449-cameras-news-living-in-the-old-west-photographs-from-the-birth-of-the-united-states-image199-2k1tbxwxgj.jpg\" /></p><h2>Rustic</h2><p>This church is a great reminder that not all buildings at this time were something you could call impressive - it's got a character to it, for sure, but also looks more than a little rustic. The scorching heat of the New Mexico day is almost palpable, too.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152449-cameras-news-living-in-the-old-west-photographs-from-the-birth-of-the-united-states-image20-jf1tklhzbc.jpg\" /></p><h2>The high street</h2><p>In many small towns across the country, this is what a high street looked like a for a very long time - some shops with porches, many without, and huge lettering on signs to let you know where to head to pick up your supplies.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152449-cameras-news-living-in-the-old-west-photographs-from-the-birth-of-the-united-states-image21-jtvfpxnozk.jpg\" /></p><h2>Shamrock Saloon</h2><p>We've seen plenty of images of saloons in this collection, and our final image is another, showcasing the Shamrock Saloon, which looks to also be advertising itself as a restaurant if you were feeling brave. It's just a shame for the owner that his face is shadowed out of the image!&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/152215-photos-from-old-west-american\" rel=\"follow\">A lawless time of discovery: Early photos from the Old West</a></li> \n </ul> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 05 Jun 2020 13:45:00 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"The shortlist for the 2020 Sony World Photography Awards is full of gobsmacking photos","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/151839-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"499\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image1-p1mhdnh4qy.jpg?v1\"> <p>Sony's annual photography awards are always a superb excuse to drink in some absolutely unbelievable photographs, spanning all sorts of categories and subject matters, and the 2020 shortlist is no exception to that rule.</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/sony/151442-stunning-photos-from-the-national-sony-world-photography-awards-2020\" rel=\"follow\">57 stunning photos from the National Sony World Photography Awards 2020</a></li> \n </ul><p>That list of contenders was recently unveiled for the Open category of the awards, which is the section that's open to all comers and entrants. The winners won't be unveiled until early June, but until then we've got plenty of time to enjoy browsing the amazing selection of photos.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image1-un5afekgbi.jpg\" /></p><h2>Clean lines</h2><p>There's something hugely satisfying about the lines of colour and texture in this wintery photograph, with the various strata of the building drawing the eye differently, while the two shuttered windows actually look much like a pair of heavy-lidded eyes themselves.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image2-1fysgvnhbq.jpg\">&nbsp;</img></p><h2>Divided</h2><p>The division between metropolis and green space is rarely as clear and obvious as in this aerial picture taken in Guangzhou, China. The clustered, crowded buildings are mirrored by the overgrowth of the trees and plants, with that clear dividing road between the two.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image3-9ci30qjd6n.jpg\" /></p><h2>Bridge to nowhere&nbsp;</h2><p>This cove in Newfoundland has countless fishing baskets waiting to be used on a pier, piled up in their multitudes. The prominence of timber in the construction of the pier makes this photo have an almost historical feeling to it.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/sony/151522-jaw-dropping-photos-sony-world-photography-awards\" rel=\"follow\">These stunning award-winning pro photos will blow you away</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image4-auu4xokhm2.jpg\" /></p><h2>Painterly</h2><p>It's almost inconceivable to us that this is a photograph, not a painting, so gorgeous and smooth is the imagery. There's no overbearing sharpness or clarity here, just superb colour and a wonderfully chosen point of view.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image5-flgbcv3njj.jpg\" /></p><h2>Land to sea&nbsp;</h2><p>This Icelandic vista has a mind-blowing range of colours and textures to take in, as water runs out to sea over various types of rock and silt, taking on peculiar and memorable tones as it does so. The ripples on the surface of the water in the middle of the frame are extremely pleasing, too.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image6-yy6vm8eket.jpg\" /></p><h2>Timeless</h2><p>This rower's pose, fashion and hairstyle all combine to make her seem somehow out of time - it's credible that this photo could have been taken in any of the last multiple decades, we'd argue. It's a superb portrait capturing her taking a breath as she works.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image7-9c245berfh.png\" /></p><h2>Eerie</h2><p>This looks like a nice, simple exploration of light and darkness until you look more closely through the car's windows and see that there's far more to interpret. What are those otherworldly lights? What's going on inside the car? All these are up to your imagination.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/141628-48-insanely-neat-photos-of-cables-that-belong-in-a-modern-art-gallery\" rel=\"follow\">58 insanely neat photos of cables that belong in a modern art gallery</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image8-fiukhlonmi.jpg\" /></p><h2>Silhouettes</h2><p>The historical techniques used to take this photo shine through in the soft, monochromatic look of it. The contrast between the far cow, viewed from the side, and its closer friend looking directly into the lens, is nice, while the seascape in the distance is enigmatic.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image9-kimotqph7e.jpg\" /></p><h2>Jubilation</h2><p>This action shot from the&nbsp;Palkhi Festival in Pandharpur, India, is bustling with energy and happiness, the sole drummer rising above the crowd to steal your focus while the foregrounded clapping hands frame the entire shot.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image100-ryk8zb0mji.jpg\" /></p><h2>Swirl</h2><p>The setting sun provides gorgeous lighting for this motion-capturing shot of a boat being piloted with a bit of fun in mind, and the endlessly random ripples and eddies it leaves in its wake are eye-catching.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image111-nyteok6v3g.jpg\" /></p><h2>Ablaze with colour</h2><p>The day of the dead is a well-known festival, but its costumes and pageantry don't get any less entertaining to observe, as this extraordinarily colourful costume demonstrates. The look she's serving the camera with could scare anyone.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/148556-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs\" rel=\"follow\">33 incredibly interesting photos from history</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image122-hbz6davp1k.jpg\" /></p><h2>Taking the plunge</h2><p>There's nothing quite like the pure joy of a dog enjoying playtime, and this shot also shows off the sheer chaos that groups of pooches can foster. There's a lot going on, but the core of the image is that dog frozen mid-dive as it jumps back into the pool, clearly for neither the first nor the last time.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image133-jpazevrcxd.jpg\" /></p><h2>Boom</h2><p>Planned demolitions make for satisfying viewing in video form, provided everything goes right, but this amazing frame shows that they can be just as awesome in photographic form. The setting sun is the perfect ingredient to tie it all together with great colour.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image144-wzb4exrp3q.jpg\" /></p><h2>Contrast</h2><p>It took us absolutely ages to work out what on earth was happening here, but once you clock that the blurred orange sheen in the top of the frame is falling snow, things start to make more sense in terms of perspective.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/apple/116023-apple-fans-better-dressed-80s\" rel=\"follow\">Apple's $10K sneakers were only the half of it, these 80s clothes were quite magnificent</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image155-bkgjhwnec4.jpg\" /></p><h2>Sanctified</h2><p>This image is a stunning evocation of the quiet resonance of places of worship, helped by the clean quality of its morning light and the total lack of people in the frame. It looks like a truly calm space in which to think.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image166-kwlxuppz1o.jpg\" /></p><h2>Ominous</h2><p>This mind-bending sculpture is very real - it's called&nbsp;38° Parallelo by Mauro Staccioli, and the black and white photography here makes it stand out all the more from the natural landscape in which it's set.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image177-wmsrbusb51.jpg\" /></p><h2>Crashing wave</h2><p>Those of us in the UK know this sort of image all too well from annual storms battering our coastlines, but this is a particularly artistic version, with the cracks in the sea wall catching the eye once you look away from the wave itself.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image188-8fcteqjrsy.jpg\" /></p><h2>Luminous</h2><p>If you know much about fish you might be confused by what's poking out of this little guy's mouth. Sadly for him, it's a tongue-eating parasite, so not exactly the happy-go-lucky photo you might have first taken this for.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/drones/news/133911-best-drone-photos-ever-stunning-images-taken-from-up-high\" rel=\"follow\">Best drone photos ever: Stunning images taken from the sky</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image199-xtokozkaw8.jpg\" /></p><h2>Seeing right through you</h2><p>Staying with the ocean, this negative image of a bizarre octopus was taken at night, but looks for all the world like a still from a laboratory environment. It's completely weird in a really captivating way.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image20-7glvicpilv.jpg\" /></p><h2>Midair dogfight</h2><p>Seagulls can be mighty possessive of any potential food, as we know all too well from trying to eat chips at the seaside, but the way these three are fighting over an utterly helpless starfish is amazing. The timing required to get this shot beggars belief.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image21-b86abhlmjf.jpg\" /></p><h2>Still and serene</h2><p>With this photo, meanwhile, it must have been more about patience, waiting for a lack of disturbance to be able to capture the totally still landscape and these stunning&nbsp;dancing mangrove trees in Indonesia.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image22-drfciog5bh.jpg\" /></p><h2>Red</h2><p>This Brazilian dancer's hair, hat and skin tone combine wonderfully to make a delicate palette for this image, while the way her hair blocks her face creates a shield of anonymity.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/adobe/148866-hilarious-images-of-celebrities-photoshopped-into-renaissance-paintings\" rel=\"follow\">Amusing images of celebrities Photoshopped into Renaissance paintings</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image23-afiqcub5p8.jpg\" /></p><h2>Fantasy forest</h2><p>This looks for all the world like a shot straight out of Tolkien's Fangorn Forest, not a lane in Tenerife, but the latter is the reality of the situation. That mist is perfect for evoking memories of countless fantasy novels.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image24-urjax3ehgy.jpg\" /></p><h2>Redder</h2><p>This frame is simply saturated in subtly different shades of red, a portrait of a&nbsp;Theyyam ritual in India. The costume is elaborate, delicate and hugely complex.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image25-82r9p37rxm.jpg\" /></p><h2>Parenting</h2><p>Not all portraits of parenthood require humans, and the bond between this baby Orangutan and its mother is clear to see at a glance. The amusing grimace on mum's face is a picture of perseverance, meanwhile.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image26-gkmd2ixis3.jpg\" /></p><h2>Historically new</h2><p>We love this portrait of a young man in South Africa, his oversized jacket seeming to say a lot about the expectations he's been saddled with, while the arid landscape behind him is chastening, too.</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/adobe/140252-30-famous-photoshopped-and-doctored-images-from-across-the-ages\" rel=\"follow\">Famous Photoshopped and doctored images from across the ages</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image27-e6vv5kjq0k.jpg\" /></p><h2>The void</h2><p>We find this image almost menacing, as a result of that yawning black void creeping down from the top of the frame as these men blithely take selfies and take photos on their phones.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image28-yjeomw0kry.jpg\" /></p><h2>Negative landscape</h2><p>This photo captures an Alpine landscape using infrared technology to present a colourscape unlike anything any human eye would normally see, and leaving you with the impression of an almost alien landscape.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image29-2akjzx8fol.jpg\" /></p><h2>Groom with a view</h2><p>Another beautiful shot of parenting in action, this mutual grooming by a young cheetah and its mother showcases the duality of big cats - terrifying hunters one moment, and adorable oversized fluffballs the next.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image30-mzocg6wohn.jpg\" /></p><h2>Silent witnesses</h2><p>This shot of Extinction Rebellion protestors on the London Underground feels like an impactful statement on modern times - not least because of the fact that they're being quietly ignored by most of the commuters in the shot.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/tv/news/142867-photoshop-fails-go-to-the-movies-the-worst-film-posters-of-all-time\" rel=\"follow\">Photoshop fails go to the movies: The worst film posters of all time</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image31-lqe9bdy3vw.jpg\" /></p><h2>Absolute squad</h2><p>This huge gang of rare&nbsp;cownose rays, on the Ningaloo Reef off Australia, produces an amazing image where the group almost appear to be moving as one seething ball of ray.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image32-yqjcudpnqx.jpg\" /></p><h2>Flat earth</h2><p>We love this jaw-dropping photograph for how it draws your eye to the horizon, where you're confronted with the immediate rise of that range of mountains at the back of the frame. It's an amazing landscape, that's for sure.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image33-hearsp3xgm.jpg\" /></p><h2>Frozen wave</h2><p>This ice cave is so smooth and shiny that it almost looks like a riptide wave that's been frozen in time. The two hikers leaving it give you valuable context on just how massive it is, too.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image34-6qxbprekru.jpg\" /></p><h2>Smiling in the rain</h2><p>There's nothing like a rainy day at a festival to showcase human spirit - conditions that should breed misery bounce off people having the time of their lives, like these girls capturing the moment with a selfie.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/smart-home/news/151431-home-desks-from-heaven-and-hell-check-out-these-diy-work-from-home-solutions\" rel=\"follow\">Home desks from heaven and hell: Check out these DIY work-from-home solutions</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image35-gonz8cu16d.jpg\" /></p><h2>Poise</h2><p>The look this girl is giving the camera just screams power, while the amazing outfit she's wearing is nearly limitlessly interesting to look at. Her hair is stunningly made up, while lens-flare style bubbles on the frame are a great, odd touch.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image36-rajgxcxv34.jpg\" /></p><h2>Unstill life</h2><p>This still life looks like it must have taken ages to organise, if the cat's body language is anything to go by. It's offbeat and coy, that banana taped to the wall a possible reference to the great modern art story of 2019.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image37-aqtyechdv9.jpg\" /></p><h2>Gradient</h2><p>This mountainous landscape, photographed from above, reveals an amazing range of colours emanating from the river carving out a valley in the middle of the frame.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image38-pmts0pwelx.jpg\" /></p><h2>Reflecting on it</h2><p>We're entranced by the beauty of this shot, from the gentle slope and that still iceberg to the slightly rippling reflections of them both. It's got a strong environmental message to hit home with, as well.</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/parenting/news/lego/151409-best-lego-sets-based-on-games-mario-halo-call-of-duty-and-more\" rel=\"follow\">Best-ever Lego sets based on games: Mario, Halo, Call of Duty and more</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image39-wtn1jdmeha.jpg\" /></p><h2>Colourful</h2><p>This unbelievable display is created by some&nbsp;17,300 students in North Korea, moving as one, just as the regime directs them. It's an astonishing site, beautifully captured, while the fact they're creating a rainbow feels grimly ironic.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image40-2gpmslvfon.jpg\" /></p><h2>Fighting the good fight</h2><p>Firefighting often feels like pushing back against a powerful inanimate beast, but the blackness of this photograph also makes the fight look more hopeless than it is. The gushing black smoke and blackened rooftop are opressive.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image41-lgrypenuze.jpg\" /></p><h2>Silicon valley</h2><p>You could be forgiven for thinking this was a picture of a microchip or some other piece of technology, but it's actually the side of a building, artfully shot to remove its context and look like something it isn't.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image42-k15ivbfzba.jpg\" /></p><h2>Clear light</h2><p>This study of light and colour has a variety of enticing textures and shades to give up, with that strong shaft of light beaming through its centre at an angle.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/gadgets/news/148387-the-best-tanks-and-armoured-fighting-vehicles-of-all-time\" rel=\"follow\">Some of the best tanks and armoured vehicles of all time</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image43-aydvepehs1.jpg\" /></p><h2>Waterways</h2><p>This is an image that appears beautiful until you piece together that it's not a natural phenomenon. It's actually from a salt mine, showing the impact that human shave on huge landscapes.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image44-rex9rlchyu.jpg\" /></p><h2>City 17</h2><p>The brutalism of this shot, and the architecture it captures, are both memorable. You might assume it's somewhere more totalitarian or industrialised than the ancient city of Athens, where it was actually shot.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image45-mf9kzzaxnc.jpg\" /></p><h2>All the pretty horses</h2><p>This beautiful shot is perfectly framed with three horses each owning their slice of the photograph, while the colour of the sky and mountains at the top are almost improbably gorgeous.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151839-cameras-news-the-shortlist-for-the-2020-sony-world-photography-awards-is-full-of-gobsmacking-photos-image46-o9v6jdcylb.jpg\" /></p><h2>Paradise on earth</h2><p>We end with a slice of paradise, an aerial shot of Exuma which makes us yearn for a proper holiday. International Space Station is&nbsp;in regular orbit around the Earth. Not only serving as a home to&nbsp;astronauts and cosmonauts but also functioning as&nbsp;a unique science laboratory.&nbsp;</p><p>Circling the Earth at roughly 250 miles up, travelling at 17,500 mph and orbiting the planet every 90 minutes, the space stations bares witness to some pretty incredible views. Simple: to make full-frame photography more affordable for those wanting that bigger sensor experience. Not that the £1,719/€1,999 asking price is <em>small</em>, per se, it's just under that critical two grand mark with a lens included. In the USA the body-only price is $1,399.</p><p>So what do you get for your money? The Z5 is designed to sit beneath the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/nikon/145453-nikon-z7-review-specs-price\" rel=\"\">Z7</a> a <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/nikon/147435-nikon-z6-review-full-frame-mirrorless-camera\" rel=\"\">Z6 models</a>, bringing a 24.3-megapixel full-frame sensor to the line-up (which is almost the same resolution as that in the Z6).</p><p>Also launching is the Nikkor Z 24-50mm f/4-6.3 lens, which claims to be the \"shortest and lightest full-frame mirrorless zoom lens\" on the market. That's another play of the Z5: to bring a more compact form factor compared to similar cameras.</p><p>The Z5 isn't just about stills, as it's gifted with 4K video capture too. There's dual card slots (SD, UHS-II) to capture files, which will be especially handy for large video files.</p><p>Here's a quick summary of other big selling points about the Nikon Z5:</p>\n <ul> \n  <li>Built-in 3,690k-dot viewfinder (EVF) &amp; tilt-angle LCD touchscreen</li> \n  <li>5-axis Vibration Reduction (VR) stabilisation system</li> \n  <li>Dust &amp; moisture sealed magnesium alloy body</li> \n  <li>273-point Hybrid AF autofocus system</li> \n  <li>Eye-Detection AF locks onto eyes</li> \n  <li>Animal-Detection AF for pets</li> \n  <li>Wi-Fi &amp; Bluetooth</li> \n </ul><p>Sounds like a treat. The camera will go on sale \"late summer\" 2020 - which is probably another way of saying September. Still <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/nikon/152465-nikon-z5-z30-rumoured-z9\" rel=\"\">no word on the also rumoured Z30 model</a> though, so expect more on that later down the line.</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 21 Jul 2020 08:28:11 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/153046-cameras-news-nikon-z5-image1-j0aiykqhzd.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"25a3864f4be69319c7e2fd595517e653","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn74@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-36-51-241_de6de79c65132385.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":499,"sourceBytes":52754,"destBytes":31782,"author":"Mike Lowe","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/153046-cameras-news-nikon-z5-image1-j0aiykqhzd.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn74@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-36-51-241_de6de79c65132385.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209024},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"Canon EOS R5 launch event: How to watch the \"Reimagine\" livestream and what to expect","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/canon/152818-how-to-watch-new-canon-camera-launch-event-online","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"498\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152818-cameras-news-canon-eos-r5-launch-event-how-to-watch-the-reimagine-livestream-and-what-to-expect-image2-1xlh9dqo0w.jpg?v1\"> <p>Canon will host an online camera launch event on Thursday 9 July and, somewhat uniquely, you can watch live.</p><p>Alll you need to do is sign up for details closer the time.</p><p>Here we explain how, along with what you can expect - spoiler alert: the company has teased an EOS R5 mirrorless camera in recent times.</p><h2>When is the Canon Reimagine online launch event?</h2><p><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/canon\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Canon</a> will broadcast its online event (in English only) on Thursday 9 July 2020, starting at 2pm CEST. Here are the times in your region:</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><strong>UK:</strong> 1pm BST</li> \n  <li><strong>Central Europe:</strong> 2pm CEST</li> \n  <li><strong>East coast US:</strong> 8am EDT</li> \n  <li><strong>West coast US:</strong> 5am PDT</li> \n </ul><p>A separate Q&amp;A session (also in English only) will take place later on the same day. It starts at the following times:</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><strong>UK:</strong> 6pm BST</li> \n  <li><strong>Central Europe:</strong> 7pm CEST</li> \n  <li><strong>East coast US:</strong> 1pm EDT</li> \n  <li><strong>West coast US:</strong> 10am PDT</li> \n </ul><h2>How to watch the Canon launch event</h2><p>It looks as if Canon will host its event on its own site, but we also expect it to be available on YouTube (and likely here on Pocket-lint) as the <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/user/CanonEurope\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Canon Europe YouTube channel</a> sports a banner advertising it.</p><p>The best bet is to register your email address on the <a href=\"https://www.canon.co.uk/pro/events/reimagine-live-event/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">dedicated event page</a> to find out more details when they are available.</p><h2>What to expect during Canon Reimagine</h2><p>Canon will likely unveil its EOS R5 mirrorless camera.</p><p>Previous reports revealed that it will be stabilisation.</p><p>The company also <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/canon/151870-canon-eos-r5-8k-30fps-spec-revealed\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">teased a few key video (H.265)&nbsp;</li> \n  <li>4:2:2 10-bit in Canon Log or 4:2:2 10-bit HDR PQ output via HDMI at 4K 59.94fps</li> \n  <li>5-axis optical image stabilisation - enabling Lens IS &amp; camera IBIS to be breath-taking space can be.&nbsp;</p><p>Just be prepared to feel a little insignificant.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/144794-amazing-images-from-the-international-space-station\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Breath-taking images from the International Space Station</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/142413-50-incredible-images-of-space-like-you-ve-never-seen-before\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Incredible images of space like you've never seen before</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image2-oypxrcqijo.jpg\" /></p><h2>The tangled remnants of a supernova</h2><p>At the end of 2018, the&nbsp;Hubble Space Telescope captured this image of a tangled web&nbsp;SNR 0454-67.2. The image shows the&nbsp;remnants of a supernova - a tangled mess in space caused by the end of a massive star in the region. The resulting explosion apparently sent a great swathe of material out into surrounding space.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image3-mwibtwhq5l.jpg\" /></p><h2>Galactic goulash</h2><p>An image created using data from NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory reveals the cosmic outcome of mixing two galaxies together over millions of years. This area of space is located&nbsp;140 million light years from Earth where two galaxies have collided and caused some interesting phenomena.&nbsp;</p><p>Regions of this area of space seemingly show stars forming at an unusually rapid rate. The various colours show emissions of hot gas in the area which is believed to represent the formation of new stars.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image4-yxcm6fshbd.jpg\" /></p><h2>Giant Red Spider Nebula</h2><p>In 2017, Hubble captured this image of the&nbsp;Red Spider Nebula which plays host to&nbsp;one of the hottest stars known to man. This star generates large stellar winds which can be seen reaching out as far as&nbsp;62.4 billion miles.</p><p>These stellar waves are caused by supersonic shocks, that occur when the gas in the area is compressed, heated and then rapidly expands. The result is magnificent&nbsp;waves of radiation that can be easily seen in this fantastic image.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image5-rxasyw5cgx.jpg\" /></p><h2>The Pillars of Creation</h2><p>This image captured by the Hubble Space Telescope shows a vision of the Eagle Nebula - a cluster of stars in&nbsp;the&nbsp;constellation Serpens. This view is unbelievably over 6,500 light years&nbsp;from Earth and shows a number of star-forming&nbsp;gas and dust&nbsp;regions stretching off into pillar-like formations.&nbsp;</p><p>This nebula was originally discovered by Swiss&nbsp;astronomer&nbsp;Jean-Philippe Loys de Chéseaux in&nbsp;1745 but is perhaps most well-known thanks to this image from the&nbsp;Hubble Space Telescope.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image6-3e24feyhf9.jpg\" /></p><h2>The bubble nebula</h2><p>The Bubble Nebula is located 8,000 light-years away from Earth and was originally discovered by&nbsp;German-born British&nbsp;astronomer&nbsp;Frederick William Herschel in 1787. The bubble is actually the result of winds from a nearby star and it is the heat from the star that causes it to glow.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image7-k0dlo5p6go.jpg\" /></p><h2>Antennae Galaxies reloaded</h2><p>The Antennae Galaxies have been photographed by the Hubble Space Telescope several times over the last few decades. This image is the most recent and the most impressive. The galaxies shown in this image are locked in a constant battle - clashing with each other for several hundred million years.</p><p>This space battle is&nbsp;so violent that stars have been ripped from both galaxies and&nbsp;form a streaming arc which bridges the two. Signs of this cosmic chaos can be seen in the various colours surrounding the galaxies.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image8-ikweuzux0r.jpg\" /></p><h2>The Horsehead Nebula</h2><p>This image shows part of the&nbsp;constellation of Orion. It was captured during the Hubble Space Telescope's 23rd year in use. The magnificent view shows incredible waves of&nbsp;dust and gas creating what looks like a&nbsp;giant space seahorse.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image9-6jtq8hso5z.jpg\" /></p><h2>Hubble mosaic of the majestic Sombrero Galaxy</h2><p>The&nbsp;Sombrero Galaxy is thought to be&nbsp;one of the universe's most beautiful and&nbsp;photogenic galaxies. It's also named due to its likeness to the famous Mexican hat.&nbsp;</p><p>A brilliant and brightly lit galaxy with a&nbsp;bulbous core<strong>&nbsp;</strong>surrounded by masses of gas. The galaxy&nbsp;is so bright it can be easily seen&nbsp;through small telescopes from Earth but is just beyond the limit of the naked eye.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image10-ojxrnlqest.jpg\" /></p><h2>Most detailed image of the Crab Nebula</h2><p>This incredible image from the Hubble Space Telescope shows one of the most detailed views of the Crab Nebula ever seen. The image is actually stitched together from 24 individual images captured by the telescope and we think you'll agree, the results are spectacular.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image11-xivml08osw.jpg\" /></p><h2>The Lagoon Nebula</h2><p>At an incredible 55 light-years wide and 20 light-years tall, the Lagoon Nebula is as impressive as it is beautiful. This Nebula is 4,000 light-years away from Earth and was originally discovered in 1654. Since then, it has been&nbsp;photographed and analysed by&nbsp;astronomers all over the world.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image12-0debjhkqud.jpg\" /></p><h2>The Orion Nebula</h2><p>This brilliantly colourful view of the Orion Nebula shows a section of the Nebula where&nbsp;thousands of stars are forming. Incredibly, over&nbsp;3,000 stars of differing sizes appear in the region captured by this single image.&nbsp;The Orion Nebula is 1,500 light-years from Earth and is the closest star-forming region to our planet. Like other photos on this list, this image is actually made up from&nbsp;520 different photos captured by the Hubble Space Telescope.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image13-u58ncrfpib.jpg\" /></p><h2>Cosmic dust bunnies</h2><p>This image shows&nbsp;dust lanes and star clusters of this giant galaxy. These so-called dust bunnies are thought to be evidence that this mass is actually the result of the merging to two separate galaxies.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image14-qbtb5rvktz.jpg\" /></p><h2>Mystic Mountain</h2><p>This incredible image looks more like fantasy than reality, but the brilliantly colourful view speaks of friction and cosmic chaos. A spiralling pillar of gas and dust can be seen being engulfed by the brilliant light of nearby stars.&nbsp;</p><p>This view is of a&nbsp;stellar nursery known as the&nbsp;Carina Nebula which is a mere&nbsp;7,500 light-years away from Earth. Radiation and cosmic winds from nearby new-born stars are what cause the pillar-like formations that can be seen here. Jets of gas, swirls and wisps of dust and more can be seen as new stars are born and grow.&nbsp;</p><p>The colours are caused by the glow of the different gases - with oxygen in blue,&nbsp;hydrogen and nitrogen in green and sulphur in red. An astounding view, we're sure you'll agree.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image15-kupti27qjs.jpg\" /></p><h2>Star birth in the extreme</h2><p>This incredible view of the Carina Nebula shows an amazing inferno and area of activity where new stars are being born.&nbsp; Scorching ultraviolet radiation and outflowing winds from stars within this area of space create the colourful cosmic painting before your eyes. Again, these colours represent the different gases flowing within the regions -&nbsp;sulfur,&nbsp;hydrogen and oxygen swirling wonderfully as nature creates new cosmic life.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image16-kadviborh0.jpg\" /></p><h2>The Ring Nebula</h2><p>From our perspective on Earth,&nbsp;Messier 57 (also known as \"The Ring Nebula\") has an elliptical shape with a rough, shaggy edge. The Hubble Space Telescope shows a slightly different view though - one likened more to a distorted doughnut. This view is&nbsp;formed by gases being expelled from a giant red star that's in the process of evolving into a white dwarf.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image17-heydcvrajp.jpg\" /></p><h2>Centaurus A</h2><p>Who knew space dust could be so astounding? This image of Centaurus A was taken with&nbsp;Hubble's most advanced instrument, the Wide Field Camera 3. It shows incredible&nbsp;never-before-seen&nbsp;detail of the dusty parts of the galaxy.&nbsp;</p><p>Centaurus A&nbsp;is one of the closest&nbsp;radio galaxies&nbsp;to&nbsp;Earth giving off luminous radio emissions thanks to&nbsp;electromagnetic radiation in the region. These radio emissions make the areas easier to observe and study. The centre of&nbsp;Centaurus A&nbsp;contains a&nbsp;supermassive black hole which emits&nbsp;X-ray&nbsp;and&nbsp;radio&nbsp;wavelengths from the area.&nbsp;</p><p>It is thought that Centaurus A was once a large elliptical galaxy that collided with a smaller galaxy in the region and merged to create the view we see now.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image18-sxih8wgkrq.jpg\" /></p><h2>The Veil Nebula</h2><p>This image from the Hubble Space Telescope shows a small area of the Veil Nebula, also known as the&nbsp;Witch's Broom Nebula. This view shows heated and ionized gas and cosmic dust of the region. It is also the aftermath of a supernova that exploded in the region somewhere between&nbsp;3,000 to 6,000 BC.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image19-zrdnuhxotk.jpg\" /></p><h2>The Carina Nebula</h2><p>Yet another image of the&nbsp;Carina Nebula shows the beauty of the gas and dust pillar in the region. This pillar is an astounding&nbsp;three light-years-long and can be seen bathed in the glowing light of massive nearby stars.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image20-xo80paynfp.jpg\" /></p><h2>A galactic crash</h2><p>This image shows a&nbsp;scattered and warped region of space - the result of a clash between two galaxies. Powerful cosmic forces carve out the shapes now seen here in a galaxy known simply as NGC 4490.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image21-techjbedig.jpg\" /></p><h2>Globular cluster 47 Tucanae</h2><p>47 Tucanae is, after Omega Centauri, the brightest globular cluster in the night sky. As you can see from this image&nbsp;47 Tucanae hosts&nbsp;tens of thousands of stars.</p><p>Scientists examining the area have noted how dying white dwarf stars have migrated from the central region to the very outskirts. A process that was known to happen, but had not seen before in great detail until the study of this area began in earnest.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image22-kzza94o7en.jpg\" /></p><h2>The whirling disc of NGC 4526</h2><p>This beautiful view of galaxy NGC 4526 seems to show a peaceful galaxy glowing brilliantly in the depths of space. This serene view shows a galaxy that has&nbsp;hosted two known supernova explosions in the last few decades alone. It also has a&nbsp;supermassive black hole at its core with an incredible mass of&nbsp;450 million Suns.</p><p>A&nbsp;rapidly rotating disc of gas spectacularly reaches out from the&nbsp;galaxy's&nbsp;heart and spans seven per cent of its entire radius. This disc spins at a staggering&nbsp;250,000 metres per second. As remarkable as it is beautiful.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image23-ublfqn4xia.jpg\" /></p><h2>Crab on LCD</h2><p>The Crab Nebula shown in bright and beautiful neon colours. This fantastic image was created&nbsp;by combining data from different telescopes capturing the entire electromagnetic spectrum, from radio waves to X-rays. This Nebula is sited&nbsp;6,500 light-years from Earth and is the result of a supernova explosion observed by&nbsp;astronomers in 1054.&nbsp;</p><p>At the centre of the Crab Nebula sits a super-dense neutron star, known as a pulsar. This pulsar spins once every&nbsp;33 milliseconds and as it spins it shoots out beams of&nbsp;radio waves and incredible visible light shows.&nbsp;Fast-moving winds from the pulsar fly off energising gas and dust in the nearby area.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image24-5a197ukegn.jpg\" /></p><h2>Auroras on Jupiter</h2><p>This stunning view shows incredible light shows happening in Jupiter's atmosphere. These&nbsp;auroras are the result of&nbsp;high-energy particles entering&nbsp;planet's atmosphere. These particles then collide with atoms of gas and create a visible reaction which has also been observed by <a href=\"https://www.nasa.gov/feature/goddard/2016/hubble-captures-vivid-auroras-in-jupiter-s-atmosphere\" rel=\"follow\">NASA's Juno Spacecraft</a>.&nbsp;</p><p>This article represents a slim sample of the many images captured by the Hubble Space Telescope and the wonder of the vast space that surrounds our planet.&nbsp;</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 24 Apr 2020 08:49:00 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image1-bq4fawt8ek.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"0b845580d20509bfe9af19a6e79f1f43","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn11@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-36-50-801_18d900b293bb1b0d.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":498,"sourceBytes":95877,"destBytes":63280,"author":"Adrian
