derx6/cdn92@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-36-58-324_3691e329606b1815.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image15-kupti27qjs.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn68@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-36-56-599_44d5f6935164ac96.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image16-kadviborh0.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn10@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-37-13-673_7dce6355b2a7e3ff.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image17-heydcvrajp.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn45@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-37-24-787_54077cf944472c9a.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image18-sxih8wgkrq.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn88@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-37-06-921_2ae83959c8152219.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image19-zrdnuhxotk.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn26@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-37-08-960_f3955b7ef086618f.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image20-xo80paynfp.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn4@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-36-56-539_c48d7493cd6bb4e4.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image21-techjbedig.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn4@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-37-06-830_3e34534d60ee78fe.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image22-kzza94o7en.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn86@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-37-25-036_b51902825e7b8151.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image23-ublfqn4xia.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn81@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-22-906_9d65cc8fb60553b4.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/145151-cameras-feature-astounding-images-from-the-depths-of-the-universe-courtesy-of-the-hubble-space-telescope-image24-5a197ukegn.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn69@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-37-03-713_178960500133f299.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209020},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"Fujifilm X-T200 review: All-round improvement","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/fujifilm/152068-fujifilm-x-t200-review","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"499\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152068-cameras-review-fujifilm-x-t200-review-image1-xp51wv9xlz.jpg?v1\"> <p>When we <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/fujifilm/145312-fuji-xt100-review-camera-mirrorless\" rel=\"\">reviewed the Fujifilm X-T100</a> back in 2018 we were a bit flummoxed about how it was supposed to sit within this high-end camera series. Two years on and its follow-up, the X-T200, has arrived. Featuring an updated design and new feature set, can it convince us where its predecessor could not?</p><p>We've long been fans of Fujifilm's mirrorless cameras, because the X series is all about doing things differently. Whether that's the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/fujifilm/151739-fuji-x100v-review-fujifilm\" rel=\"\">unique viewfinder of the X100V</a>, or the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/fujifilm/151202-fujifilm-x-t4-review\" rel=\"\">impressive sensor technology in the X-T4</a>. Except the X-T200 doesn't leverage any of that, largely because it doesn't use the X-Trans CMOS sensor design of the rest of the X-T mirrorless range.</p><p>The Fujifilm X-T200 is therefore the company's unabashed entry-level push in the interchangeable lens market. It's the camera that wants you to ditch your smartphone. But does it all add up?</p><h2>Design &amp; Lens Mount</h2>\n <ul>\n  <li>Fujifilm X mount (for XF lenses)</li>\n  <li>Built-in electronic viewfinder (0.39in, 2,360k-dot OLED)</li>\n  <li>Vari-angle mounted screen, with touch controls (3.5in, 2,760k-dot LCD)</li>\n </ul><p>While many camera makers release incremental updates of a series, Fujifilm has re-thought things a little more for the X-T200. It's redesigned, thus about 80g lighter than its predecessor (just 370g for the body), the intent being to appeal to those who baulk at the idea of carrying a big and heavy camera around.</p><p><img src=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/fujifilm/assets/images/152068-cameras-review-fujifilm-x-t200-review-image6-0jeog9zy2v.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1067\" /></p><p>That's why it comes equipped with a retracting power-zoom lens, too, rather than depending on the pricier and more advanced lens options in the range. These XF lenses do still fit the camera, of course, if you wish to buy any for your collection - that's always part of the appeal and point of an interchangeable camera.</p><p>The retro looks are appealing, but the X-T200 avoids the mass of labelled dials that the more traditional models in the series feature. Instead there's a mode dial with manual controls, plus a bunch of scene modes. It makes sense, in that we get it, but it doesn't make sense, in that it feels like the outlier in the X-T series.</p><p>Elsewhere the X-T200 comes fully featured on the screen and viewfinder front. The fact is has the latter built-in will be as much an appealing element as it may be a deterrent for some others; it's a good finder, though, with ample resolution and helpful for when sunlight is too bright.</p><p><img src=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/fujifilm/assets/images/152068-cameras-review-fujifilm-x-t200-review-image100-m2visiwjcd.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"498\" /></p><p>The 3.5-inch rear touchscreen is now bracket mounted, so it can open through 180-degrees or rotated between 90-to-180-degrees. That's useful for overhead shooting, waist-level work, or rotating the camera between portrait and landscape when in such scenarios.</p><h2>Performance</h2>\n <ul>\n  <li>Autofocus with 117 selectable areas</li>\n  <li>Face Detection &amp; Eye Detection AF</li>\n  <li>Adjustable AF point size</li>\n  <li>Up to 8fps burst</li>\n </ul><p>Let's explain the X-T100's smattering of dials: there's a Film Simulator to one side; a mode dial, and twin top dials (this pair change their function depending on selected mode) to the other side.</p><p>When clicking between Film types using the top dial, there's a neat effect where the camera shows you the live image, a line drawn down the middle, to compare current selection (Provia) and whatever else you're looking to use (Velvia - vivid, Astia - soft, Classic Chrome, Pro Neg - Hi/Std, Monochrome (with Yellow/Red/Green filter options), and Sepia. It's a nice touch - even if the frame-rate slows somewhat due to the processing asks.</p><p><img src=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/fujifilm/assets/images/152068-cameras-review-fujifilm-x-t200-review-image5-wjmveawzpk.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><p>The pre-set scene modes on the main mode dial seem like a compact camera feature that's trying to creep into a more serious camera, but the inclusion of Night (for completeness: there's also Sport, Landscape, Portrait) shows the camera is able to push settings beyond their normal restrictions, which can be really handy.</p><p>That's one of the things about the X-T200: the included power-zoom lens has its limitations given its limited maximum aperture. By default you might find it will mean a very limited shutter speed is selected, which may not be appropriate for the scene. That said, the optical stabilisation (OIS) system is rather impressive: we've been able to shoot at 1/15th second without much bother, which is something you won't get away with on your phone.</p><p>Elsewhere the X-T200 improves upon the autofocus system of its predecessor. With a total of 117 areas to select from, incuding area size adjustment, it's possible to select one, an area/group, and move the focus area around using the touchscreen or rear lever (a physical control that lacked on its predecessor).</p><p><img src=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/fujifilm/assets/images/152068-cameras-review-fujifilm-x-t200-review-image2-wcxqgdt5ov.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><p>The autofocus system is adept, as it's utilising an improved on-sensor system, but some of the implementation isn't perfect. For example: when the cameras sometimes throws back \"AF!\" in a red box when it's unable to focus, it isn't over-ridden with a half press of the shutter button, as you would expect. Which isn't intuitive for a camera of this type.&nbsp;</p><p>However, the inclusion of Face/Eye detection (including left/right eye priority) is really useful for portraits and group scenes. This used to be the reserve of higher-end cameras only.</p><h2>Image Quality</h2>\n <ul>\n  <li>'New' 24.2 million pixel sensor, APS-C size</li>\n  <li>Standard primary colour filter (not X-Trans CMOS)</li>\n  <li>Video capture: 4K at 30fps, Full HD (1080p) at 60fps</li>\n </ul><p>The X-T200 also includes a brand new sensor. Yes, it's the same 24.2-megapixels of resolution as the outgoing X-T100's, but it's been engineered differently, has phase-detection autofocus points on the sensor itself - hence that improved focus ability compared to the last model - and a processor that's three-and-a-half times quicker than its predecessor too.</p><p>That additional speed means burst shooting to eight frames per second (8fps) at full resolution, while 4K video is also possible to 30fps. That's knocking on the door of much more expensive cameras in both departments.</p><p>What you really want to know about is what the pictures are like. As the X-T200 does things differently to its X-series family - there's no X-Trans CMOS sensor, it's a 'normal' sensor and colour array here - it's something of a departure in process.</p><p>But that doesn't mean the pictures are poor. Indeed, it's quite the opposite. Which is a major reason to consider buying the X-T200 in the first place.</p><p><img src=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/fujifilm/assets/images/152068-cameras-review-fujifilm-x-t200-review-image-samples-image1-yossbkvzzg.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1067\" /></p><p>The thing that really stands-out from a camera with a large sensor such as this is two fold: one, how good image quality can be in low-light conditions; two, how standout the blurred background effect is, giving much more pro-looking results.</p><p>Despite the power zoom lens' limited aperture, we've been shooting indoors and the camera has handled limited light really well by pushing the ISO sensitivity up. Even at ISO 3200 when shooting trinkets inside the home (we're locked down, okay?) the lack of image noise is impressive.</p><p>At the lower end of ISO sensitivity the quality is even more striking. Having shot buildings and flowers, the clarity provided by this sensor and lens combination is great. Better still, Fujifilm makes even better lenses that could give you yet more creative control and impressive results.</p><p><img src=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/fujifilm/assets/images/152068-cameras-review-fujifilm-x-t200-review-image-samples-image1-xset6houk9.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><p>It might not have the hallmark X-Trans CMOS sensor in tow, but even without it the X-T200's images speak for themselves in terms of quality.</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 14 Aug 2020 09:00:00 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152068-cameras-review-fujifilm-x-t200-review-image1-xp51wv9xlz.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"feb269dcf14cd2a69a9067b7a1b93d5b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn39@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-36-52-522_5aa4eeb01289a147.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":499,"sourceBytes":65710,"destBytes":48246,"author":"Mike Lowe","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152068-cameras-review-fujifilm-x-t200-review-image1-xp51wv9xlz.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn39@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-36-52-522_5aa4eeb01289a147.webp","https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/fujifilm/assets/images/152068-cameras-review-fujifilm-x-t200-review-image6-0jeog9zy2v.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn0@2020_1/404.jpg","https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/fujifilm/assets/images/152068-cameras-review-fujifilm-x-t200-review-image100-m2visiwjcd.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn0@2020_1/404.jpg","https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/fujifilm/assets/images/152068-cameras-review-fujifilm-x-t200-review-image5-wjmveawzpk.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn0@2020_1/404.jpg","https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/fujifilm/assets/images/152068-cameras-review-fujifilm-x-t200-review-image2-wcxqgdt5ov.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn0@2020_1/404.jpg","https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/fujifilm/assets/images/152068-cameras-review-fujifilm-x-t200-review-image-samples-image1-yossbkvzzg.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn0@2020_1/404.jpg","https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/fujifilm/assets/images/152068-cameras-review-fujifilm-x-t200-review-image-samples-image1-xset6houk9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn0@2020_1/404.jpg"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209016},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"Canon EOS R5 will shoot cinema-grade 8K at 30fps, 4K to 120fps","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/canon/151870-canon-eos-r5-8k-30fps-spec-revealed","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"498\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/151870-cameras-news-canon-eos-r5-image1-wbncy3asmb.jpg?v1\"> <p>We already knew <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/canon/151073-canon-eos-r5-8k-ibis-release\" rel=\"\">a new Canon EOS R camera was coming, the R5</a>, but now Canon has released yet more minutae details about just what this full-frame system camera can do.</p><p>And it's all about video capture prowess <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/canon/149820-pro-canon-eos-r-stabilisation-confirmed-rumour\" rel=\"\">with image stabilisation</a>. Capable of capturing 8K raw footage up to 30fps in-camera, this is the kind of system that will be used in high-end productions. It shows that Canon is, in part, crossing over what it offers to the pro market - there's overlap here in what you'll find in the company's EOS C range, for example.</p><p>So what about the finer details of what the R5's video will do? Here's a summary:</p>\n <ul> \n  <li>8K 4:2:2 10-bit in Canon Log (H.265) or 4:2:2 10-bit HDR PQ (H.265)</li> \n  <li>4K up to 120fps 4:2:2 10-bit in Canon Log (H.265) or 4:2:2 10-bit HDR PQ (H.265)&nbsp;</li> \n  <li>4:2:2 10-bit in Canon Log or 4:2:2 10-bit HDR PQ output via HDMI at 4K 59.94fps</li> \n  <li>5-axis optical image stabilisation - enabling Lens IS &amp; camera IBIS to be combined</li> \n  <li>Dual card slots: 1x CFexpress, 1x SD (UHS-II)</li> \n </ul><p>&nbsp;</p><p>All video modes will be compatible with the company's Dual Pixel CMOS AF for autofocus. There's also animal AF to recognise dogs, cats and birds, in addition to face detection.</p><p>All in all, given its 12fps stills shooting capability, this is starting to sound like the higher-end EOS R camera that Canon has been hinting about since the inception of the product line.</p><p>&nbsp;</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 20 Apr 2020 17:00:00 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/151870-cameras-news-canon-eos-r5-image1-wbncy3asmb.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"83d3379c5177ad9a108fcdbccf71515b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn83@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-36-51-285_002c87d3c6dc54fe.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":498,"sourceBytes":99123,"destBytes":53946,"author":"Mike Lowe","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/151870-cameras-news-canon-eos-r5-image1-wbncy3asmb.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn83@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-36-51-285_002c87d3c6dc54fe.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209020},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"12 of the best images of time travellers from throughout history","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/147505-photographic-proof-of-time-traveller","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"498\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/147505-cameras-feature-photographic-proof-of-time-travellers-or-just-hoax-and-coincidence-image1-qg6mzfd4w9.jpg?v1\"> <p>Every now and then an image appears online which people claim shows a time traveller somewhere they shouldn't be. But are they just cases of people letting their imaginations run wild?</p><p>We've rounded up some of the best and most interesting images of time travellers throughout history. Some turned out to be plain fakes or cases of mistaken identities, but others are certainly intriguing.&nbsp;</p><p>Which have you seen before?</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147505-cameras-feature-photographic-proof-of-time-travellers-or-just-hoax-and-coincidence-image2-ctawh1ozip.jpg\" /></p><h2 class=\"nolinks2\">The time travelling hipster&nbsp;</h2><p>This photo was snapped in 1941 at the re-opening ceremony for the South Fork Bridge in British Columbia.</p><p>If you look carefully, on the right-hand side you can see an unusually dressed man in what appears to be modern clothing, sporting sunglasses at a time when most were wearing hats and smart jackets.</p><p>Many argue this is a time traveller, while others have countered that he's simply a man with a fashion sense ahead of his time and that it's <a href=\"https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/time-traveling-hipster/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">a false claim</a>. Either way,&nbsp;it's still a wildly popular photo and a great one too in our mind.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147505-cameras-feature-photographic-proof-of-time-travellers-or-just-hoax-and-coincidence-image3-xtwgepprty.jpg\" /></p><h2>World Cup celebrations</h2><p>This photo comes from the 1962 World Cup and shows the celebrations as the Brazilian team lifts the trophy.&nbsp;</p><p>If you look closely though, you'll see in the bottom centre of the image what looks like someone with a mobile phone snapping a photo of the event.</p><p>Could this be a time traveller as well? Bit odd to think someone in the future might have a flip phone, but then they have been making a comeback recently and we know <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/phones/news/146826-best-foldable-smartphones\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">folding phones are about to be big too</a>.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147505-cameras-feature-photographic-proof-of-time-travellers-or-just-hoax-and-coincidence-image4-2lwzvqqsnf.jpg\" /></p><h2>The time travelling sun seeker</h2><p>This <a href=\"https://twitter.com/StuartHumphryes/status/1046532116794748942/photo/1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">image from 1943</a> apparently shows British factory workers escaping to the seaside for a break during the midst of wartime. The clothes and beachwear of most people certainly fit the era, but in the centre of a frame appears to be a man dressed like Mr Bean checking his mobile phone.&nbsp;</p><p>Or maybe it's a time travel device? Likely a bit of a stretch or a case of overactive internet imagination, but we still enjoy the thought. Maybe there are no public beaches in the future?</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147505-cameras-feature-photographic-proof-of-time-travellers-or-just-hoax-and-coincidence-image5-gfbqwd1sao.jpg\" /></p><h2>Mohawk time traveller</h2><p>This image from 1905 appears to show the usual happenings of the time - including workers and a banana boat delivering its goods.</p><p>However, if you look near the edge of the boat you can spy a man in a white shirt with what appears to be a Mohawk style haircut. A very unusual haircut for the time and possible proof of a time traveller? Who can say?&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147505-cameras-feature-photographic-proof-of-time-travellers-or-just-hoax-and-coincidence-image6-blefrxujty.jpg\" /></p><h2>Film extra</h2><p>Film footage captured during the recording of Charlie Chaplin's 1928 silent film \"The Circus\" appears to show a lady dressed all in black, wearing a hat and walking around the set talking on her mobile phone.&nbsp;</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TiIrpEMbQ2M\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">footage is a little iffy</a> as is the idea that anyone could be talking on a mobile device in the 1920s, but it's certainly got some suggesting it might be proof time travellers are among us.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147505-cameras-feature-photographic-proof-of-time-travellers-or-just-hoax-and-coincidence-image7-uoldrkvoet.jpg\" /></p><h2>The ancient astronaut sculpture</h2><p>In Salamanca, Spain, there's a cathedral with multiple sculptures carved into its sides. One such sculpture appears to show the likeness of a modern day (or perhaps futuristic) astronaut.&nbsp;</p><p>Considering the cathedral's construction dates back to 1513, people have taken this as proof that time travellers made their way back to that time. However, the truth is the astronaut is merely a modern addition to the artwork carried out by&nbsp;Jerónimo García de Quiñones during <a href=\"https://www.theepochtimes.com/ancient-aliens-mysteries-of-the-salamanca-cathedral-astronaut-carving-revealed_1081104.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">renovations in 1992</a>.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147505-cameras-feature-photographic-proof-of-time-travellers-or-just-hoax-and-coincidence-image8-lkspzivaf1.jpg\" /></p><h2>Time travelling celebrities</h2><p>There's an interesting trend of people who <a href=\"https://www.boredpanda.com/time-travel-celebrities-historical-doppelgangers/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">closely resemble folks from a bygone era</a>. This could just be a spooky coincidence, but maybe it's proof that time travel is possible?</p><p>Perhaps these celebrities are living a double life in another century? Here,&nbsp;Marxist-Leninist Revolutionary Leader Mahir Cayan who was born in 1946 and died in 1972 is shown to bear a striking resemblance to TV star Jimmy Fallon. Is Jimmy Fallon living a double life as a revolutionary communist? Seems hilariously unlikely.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147505-cameras-feature-photographic-proof-of-time-travellers-or-just-hoax-and-coincidence-image9-xqdz85sskp.jpg\" /></p><h2>A man and his mobile phone</h2><p>Some claim that this oil painting by&nbsp;Pieter de Hooch, that was lovingly crafted in 1670 appears to show a young man holding his mobile phone. In an age where such a thing would probably have seen him burnt at the stake, this one is hard to believe.&nbsp;</p><p>A <a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Young_woman_with_a_letter_and_a_messenger_in_an_interior\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">description of the image</a> also suggests the young man is a messenger and that's a letter in his hand, not a phone, but it's still nice to let your imagination run wild once in a while. We've often wondered what it would be like to be able to travel back to simpler times to see what life was like for ourselves.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147505-cameras-feature-photographic-proof-of-time-travellers-or-just-hoax-and-coincidence-image10-qkccmjjtnm.jpg\" /></p><h2>The Adidas trainers mummy</h2><p>A couple of years ago, an ancient mummy was unearthed by archaeologists digging in Mongolia. At the time, it was suggested the funky looking footwear she was wearing bore a striking resemblance to Adidas trainers. More evidence of a time traveller visiting ancient times? Investigation of the body dated it around 1,100 years old. That's one heck of a blast through the past.&nbsp;</p><p>However, further unearthing showed the woman was more likely to have been a&nbsp;Turkic seamstress which might explain the fresh kicks. She was found with an&nbsp;ancient clutch bag, a mirror, a comb, a knife and more. But no mobile phone.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147505-cameras-feature-photographic-proof-of-time-travellers-or-just-hoax-and-coincidence-image11-s9bdx1rvin.jpg\" /></p><h2>The time surfer</h2><p>Another image of an out-of-place individual that people have latched on to as proof that time travel is a reality. This image dates back over 100 years and shows some smartly dressed Canadians sitting on the side of a hill.</p><p>On the left-hand side though, sits a young man in what appears to be a t-shirt and shorts with ruffled hair. He was quickly referred to as the surfing time traveller due to how unusual his attire is. Others have suggested people in the photo appear shocked by his appearance, even pointing out the woman on the right who seems to be gesturing in his direction. Again, a bit of a stretch as would a time traveller really go through time dressed like that?&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147505-cameras-feature-photographic-proof-of-time-travellers-or-just-hoax-and-coincidence-image12-9kgj8vrn3f.jpg\" /></p><h2>A visitor to wartime&nbsp;Reykjavík</h2><p>This photograph apparently shows a scene from downtown Reykjavík in 1943. In the heart of wartime, soldiers and sailors can be seen everywhere in the streets among civilians. The man circled though, appears to be on a mobile phone.</p><p>We've really got a theme going with these smartphone using time travellers. Who is he calling? And how? And if he is a time traveller, why is he not in Berlin trying to assassinate Hitler?</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147505-cameras-feature-photographic-proof-of-time-travellers-or-just-hoax-and-coincidence-image13-5fcvqa1tw3.jpg\" /></p><h2>The dabbing WWII soldier</h2><p>There's an apparent theme to these time traveller photos that not only includes smartphone users, but also people visiting the second world war. In this image, a young soldier is seen <a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dab_(dance)\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">dabbing</a>, a dance move that became popular around 2014, but certainly wasn't known in wartime.&nbsp;</p><p>Of course, it turns out this photo isn't an image of a time traveller, but rather just an image of some actors from 2017's blockbuster Dunkirk. The fact that most of the soldiers are smiling should also be a bit of a giveaway with this one.&nbsp;</p><p>This concludes our list of famous images of time travellers. Which do you prefer? And if you had the power to travel through time, where would you go and would you take your phone with you?</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 01 Apr 2020 08:19:00 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/147505-cameras-feature-photographic-proof-of-time-travellers-or-just-hoax-and-coincidence-image1-qg6mzfd4w9.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"92e741b840425499e91a7c21c6e9f500","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn71@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-36-51-217_9ad7389ea16c2452.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":498,"sourceBytes":119232,"destBytes":86718,"author":"Adrian Willings","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/147505-cameras-feature-photographic-proof-of-time-travellers-or-just-hoax-and-coincidence-image1-qg6mzfd4w9.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn71@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-36-51-217_9ad7389ea16c2452.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147505-cameras-feature-photographic-proof-of-time-travellers-or-just-hoax-and-coincidence-image2-ctawh1ozip.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn57@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-24-541_6176979856bcfc32.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147505-cameras-feature-photographic-proof-of-time-travellers-or-just-hoax-and-coincidence-image3-xtwgepprty.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn33@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-05-517_2fa6ea36f70e51dc.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147505-cameras-feature-photographic-proof-of-time-travellers-or-just-hoax-and-coincidence-image4-2lwzvqqsnf.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn48@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-37-26-216_e8224ca77f2bff1c.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147505-cameras-feature-photographic-proof-of-time-travellers-or-just-hoax-and-coincidence-image5-gfbqwd1sao.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn8@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-06-759_0b3427c7458c32cf.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147505-cameras-feature-photographic-proof-of-time-travellers-or-just-hoax-and-coincidence-image6-blefrxujty.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn30@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-37-13-727_4f59280e5405b8c3.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147505-cameras-feature-photographic-proof-of-time-travellers-or-just-hoax-and-coincidence-image7-uoldrkvoet.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn100@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-17-828_d337b832b7b88aa9.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147505-cameras-feature-photographic-proof-of-time-travellers-or-just-hoax-and-coincidence-image8-lkspzivaf1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn51@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-37-26-078_85d5aabf6c8b1d36.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147505-cameras-feature-photographic-proof-of-time-travellers-or-just-hoax-and-coincidence-image9-xqdz85sskp.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn34@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-36-57-511_3343b1b1417134a9.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147505-cameras-feature-photographic-proof-of-time-travellers-or-just-hoax-and-coincidence-image10-qkccmjjtnm.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn4@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-37-02-746_48a02ea28446bda8.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147505-cameras-feature-photographic-proof-of-time-travellers-or-just-hoax-and-coincidence-image11-s9bdx1rvin.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn75@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-37-06-683_23f5d3b4b68e200a.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147505-cameras-feature-photographic-proof-of-time-travellers-or-just-hoax-and-coincidence-image12-9kgj8vrn3f.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn90@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-37-22-090_e5096b3ad0a3ea6a.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/147505-cameras-feature-photographic-proof-of-time-travellers-or-just-hoax-and-coincidence-image13-5fcvqa1tw3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn70@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-37-23-779_753dc74c1608bf98.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209021},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"Amazing landscapes: Stunning Ansel Adams photographs in all their glory","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/152619-ansel-adams-nature-photographs-national-parks","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"587\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image1-up76bu5w02.jpg?v1\"> <p>Go to many national parks in the US, stunning natural reserves where wildlife is left relatively to itself, and where stunning scenery lies around almost every corner and twist, and you'll be likely to find some similar things.</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/152215-photos-from-old-west-american\" rel=\"follow\">A lawless time of discovery: Early photos from the Old West</a></li> \n </ul><p>There are old-school wooden lodges, camping grounds and trails to follow, and, oftentimes, whether posted up on message boards by trails, framed in lodge dining rooms or on postcards in the visitor centre's shop, you're likely to see photos by Ansel Adams. The legendary photographer travelled to many parks, taking photographs that are famous for their scale and beauty.</p><p>The US National Archives house many of his photographs, from a variety of national parks, and we've gathered some stunning highlights right here for your viewing pleasure.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image2-m4nuwnliqj.jpg\" /></p><h2>Reflective</h2><p>This shot of Acoma Pueblo, in New Mexico, nearly radiates heat, the white-out blanch of the low buildings reflecting the sun's glare. That pool of still water in the foreground creates a mirror for the world which palely shows the building again, and we love the light palette of the photo overall.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image3-3c5dsyw8rv.jpg\" /></p><h2>Going to church</h2><p>From another angle, this structure in Acoma Pueblo makes the settlement look more impressive and structured, with that church in the back left of the frame actually looking borderline grand, with its two towers, even despite a lack of ornamentation.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/instagram/144672-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house\" rel=\"follow\">How to be an Instagram travel sensation without leaving the house</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image4-79nhzg3pjw.jpg\" /></p><h2>Rough exterior</h2><p>From another angle, though, you can see the dilapidation striking in the background, with mortar falling away to show crumbling bricks below. It's a reminder of how structures from the West weren't necessarily built to last into the mid-20th Century.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image5-qkpyywcflj.jpg\" /></p><h2>Damn, that's big</h2><p>Later in his career, in 1941, Adams took a set of pictures of the Boulder Dam, otherwise known as the Hoover Dam, a huge structure on the Colorado River, and we think they make interesting viewing for how Adams applies a landscape photographer's eye to a huge manmade construction like this.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/phones/news/120303-mobile-phone-40-year-anniversary\" rel=\"follow\">The most iconic mobile phones in history</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image6-yzr05sjb94.jpg\" /></p><h2>Power</h2><p>Adams might be associated with landscape and natural photography, but he was living through a time of rapid technological change and the spread of industrial processes, and this photo of a power unit at the Hoover Dam shows he didn't just ignore this - it's a beguiling lattice of wires and coils.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image7-gmuqgfzp9d.jpg\" /></p><h2>A new landscape</h2><p>Meanwhile, power lines were spreading over the landscapes he would have photographed, as so many hikers know nowadays. Still, this photograph shows that with his expertise and camera skills he could perfectly expose a photo to make the power lines an equal and interesting part of the composition.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image8-lsdw1njlcn.jpg\" /></p><h2>A sliding scale</h2><p>This portrait shot of the dam gives a great sense for how huge it was (and remains) - standing on top of it can be a vertigo-inducing experience even in modern times, so must have been even more impactful back in the 40s when this shot was taken.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/152226-politicians-re-imagined-in-famous-portrait-paintings\" rel=\"follow\">Modern politicians fantastically re-imagined in famous portrait paintings</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image9-51ztuagmen.jpg\" /></p><h2>Lean out</h2><p>Here, again, Adams shows his eye by using the power line in the foreground to draw your eye back to the dam and then beyond it, to the rolling mountains and hills on the horizon, each fainter than the last as you head into the distance.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image100-ek1swodvmd.jpg\" /></p><h2>Trademark</h2><p>This image is textbook Adams, its dark, moody exposure creating a stunning tableau and the banded rock of this Arizona canyon lit up to differing degrees by the sun peeking through clouds. It's a superb piece that's up there with his most famous images in terms of quality.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/instagram/148290-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-pixel-art\" rel=\"follow\">Fantastic street artist transforms the world with incredible pixel art</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image111-fsoagz8bjy.jpg\" /></p><h2>Death Valley</h2><p>Death Valley national park is one of those locations that is clearly named to dissuade people from visiting, but visit we do nonetheless, and its apparently arid climes actually hide some crazy beauty. We're not sure what the blurred light elements are in the bottom of this shot, but they lend the photo an ethereal, magical feel.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image122-cbpnzzt3fg.jpg\" /></p><h2>The burn</h2><p>Forest fires can be terrifying, but they're also a natural part of regeneration (to a certain extent). This is the aftermath of such a fire in Glacier National Park, Montana, and shot in portrait orientation Adams gives it a massive sense of scale. Just try counting how many burnt trees are in this one shot.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/instagram/148765-the-finest-surreal-photographers\" rel=\"follow\">The finest surreal photographers and image manipulators of Instagram</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image133-zogwd4tjme.jpg\" /></p><h2>Misty mountains</h2><p>This shot shows how Adams had a true eye for the sky, able to see clouds forming and flowing and capture them at just the right moment. This pair of mountains has a cloud passing through them that looks straight out of Lord of the Rings.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image144-ebgxm8kgzn.jpg\" /></p><h2>Serenity</h2><p>There's nothing like a placid lake to make for a calming picture, and this photograph is a beautiful example. You can almost hear the natural silence that surrounds Adams as he takes this shot, with the many different hills and mountains all sloping down to the one lake.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image155-cualopmtmd.jpg\" /></p><h2>Postcard view</h2><p>This looks like a still from an animated movie or a painting, so perfect is the framing and so varied are the profiles of the mountains on show, while that single tree's silhouette at the bottom provides a lovely touch, and the cloud in the middle is just how you'd imagine one in your head.</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/152265-dreamlike-photoshop-images-gallery\" rel=\"follow\">Enter another world with these amazingly dreamlike photo edits</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image166-uje0boigfp.jpg\" /></p><h2>The sky's the limit</h2><p>Again, here Adams shows his unique talent by pretty much making the sky the real star of the show - the limitless variation of the cloud cover, their colour and depth all making for an amazing tableau. Of course, it doesn't hurt to have an amazing mountain below it all.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image177-yp4nul2mds.jpg\" /></p><h2>The elements</h2><p>Here we get a great three-piece image in vertical, with the lake in the foreground rising up to a sudden, barren mountain, which in turn points up into the sky, beckoning the viewer that way. You can tell that the sun is once again peeking through on the scene, too, so beautiful is the light.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/152281-retro-tech-pictures-gallery\" rel=\"follow\">These superb pictures of retro tech will show you how far we've come</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image188-xbowdpccba.jpg\" /></p><h2>Close-up</h2><p>Adams might have been often preoccupied with the huge end of the scale, but he clearly also had an eye for detail, and you can see why this patch of lichen took his fancy, spreading out on a sheer rock face. Its texture is just as compelling and unique as the clouds photographed elsewhere.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image199-f7zs36nrcw.jpg\" /></p><h2>Perfection</h2><p>Have you ever seen a more perfect leaf than this one? It's another great showcase of Adams' patience and eye, finding a pristine leaf to shoot in amongst the riot of options that any forest or undergrowth offers.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/instagram/149858-this-incredible-photographer-creates-new-worlds-with-arts-and-crafts\" rel=\"follow\">This incredible photographer creates new worlds with arts and crafts</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image20-1yabnvkafp.jpg\" /></p><h2>A lovely fern</h2><p>Another textbook example of a plant looking like how you'd imagine it in your head, this five-point fern is exposed beautifully, with a little more light than Adams sometimes used, to make for a dazzling image.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image21-z0ok98xdcm.jpg\" /></p><h2>Grand is the word</h2><p>If you're talking about depth, though, the layers and layers of rock faces and cliffs in this shot are jaw-dropping. It's from Grand Canyon National Park, an area that people might not realise covers much more than just the Grand Canyon itself, allowing for amazing vistas like this one.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/gadgets/news/148708-the-best-battleships-and-warships-of-all-time\" rel=\"follow\">The best battleships and warships of all time</a></li> \n </ul> +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image1-up76bu5w02.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"4775c666bb85dfab15fee553c680bf94","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn83@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-36-50-655_659f87a396b78aa8.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":587,"sourceBytes":91937,"destBytes":57180,"author":"Max /s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image8-lsdw1njlcn.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn49@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-37-01-448_3398c1b8428bc039.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image9-51ztuagmen.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn44@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-36-58-086_0a8080216b154a91.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image100-ek1swodvmd.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn88@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-36-58-449_b355df3aea21e48a.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image111-fsoagz8bjy.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn9@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-04-982_ed0e2a84dd2f6562.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image122-cbpnzzt3fg.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn79@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-37-25-736_f9895a3272c70cb7.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image133-zogwd4tjme.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn18@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-37-09-425_1aeeb76a63543f7e.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image144-ebgxm8kgzn.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn69@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-09-112_f59d63791a4453db.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image155-cualopmtmd.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn53@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-37-07-392_375a2c8a5f1b5a23.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image166-uje0boigfp.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn9@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-37-21-273_9207cec480b7616a.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image177-yp4nul2mds.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn8@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-36-53-972_f9c11f06a5e31058.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image188-xbowdpccba.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn48@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-36-59-681_2f02335a2216e59b.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image199-f7zs36nrcw.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn5@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-37-22-577_fe735f2094ff39cf.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image20-1yabnvkafp.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn99@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-37-15-952_2046769bb0015d03.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152619-cameras-news-these-stunning-ansel-adams-photographs-show-the-great-outdoors-in-all-its-glory-image21-z0ok98xdcm.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn54@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-37-08-922_2f5517e8199b90f3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209017},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"Best DSLR cameras 2020: The best interchangeable lens cameras available to buy today","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/buyers-guides/122777-best-dslr-cameras-full-frame-and-interchangeable-lens-cameras-to-buy","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"447\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/122777-cameras-news-buyer-s-guide-best-dslr-cameras-2020-the-best-interchangeable-lens-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image1-ipnxrntdrf.jpg?v1\"> <p>This is where we round-up the best DSLR cameras available to buy today.</p><p>DSLR cameras - which stands for digital single lens reflex - have removable lenses so that different optics can be attached in order to give a different view onto the world. This potential variety allows you to start small and build-up to the more varied, sharper and desirable featured lenses as you go along.</p><p>We'll guide you through the hottest cameras available - using only models that we've handled - to save you time when it comes to working out what the best options are.</p><p>Whether you're new to DSLRs, looking to upgrade, know plenty about cameras already, or are considering a more pro option, we've broken down our list of great DSLR cameras into sub-headed categories to make things easier to digest.</p><p>Don't confuse them with the newer breed of mirrorless cameras (sometimes called compact system cameras)&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/buyers-guides/124653-best-mirrorless-cameras-budget-to-high-end-mirrorless-lens-cameras-to-buy\" rel=\"\">which we have covered in a separate feature</a>.</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/deals/146122-best-camera-deals\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\"><strong>Best cheap camera deals</strong></a></li> \n </ul><h2>A quick lesson in lenses</h2><h3>Lens mount</h3><p>First thing's first: cameras don't work in a one-size-fits-all way. Brands like to keep their own heritage and, as such, each manufacturer has its own lens mount.</p><p>For Canon it's EF-mount (including EF-S), for Nikon it's F-mount, for Pentax it's K-mount, and Sony has A-mount. There are some additions and exceptions, but those are the current main four.&nbsp;Don't fall into the trap by buying the wrong lenses just because the brand names match up.</p><h3>Sensor size</h3><p>Second to the equation is sensor size. Entry and mid-level cameras typically have what's called an APS-C size sensor. Some pro-spec cameras have full-frame sensors that, because they're physically larger, need specific (typically pricier and more advanced) lenses that are capable of covering these larger dimensions. Typically these sensor types aren't interchangeable across the lens range: you're either using APS-C or you're using full-frame.</p><h3>Focal length</h3><p>There are plenty of things to consider with lenses and this all depends on the type of photography you are planning on doing. If it's all about portraits you'll want something around the 50mm or 75mm mark. If you are trying to snap that lion on the Savannah and don't want to get eaten then you'll want something with a long zoom, say, closer to 300mm or greater.</p><h2>Best entry-level DSLR</h2><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/143700-cameras-review-hands-on-canon-eos-2000d-review-image1-xploy5pbva.jpg\" width=\"1920\" height=\"1280\" /></p><h3>Canon EOS 2000D / Rebel T7</h3><p>squirrel_widget_143700</p><p>The replacement for the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/canon/137661-canon-eos-1300d-review-entry-level-ace\" rel=\"\">EOS 1300D</a> is a safe bet and typically a few quid cheaper than its <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/nikon/145545-nikon-d3500-is-a-24-2-megapixel-dslr-that-won-t-break-the-bank\" rel=\"\">Nikon D3500</a> competitor. Between the two there's not a huge difference in performance, price, or resulting image quality, though, so your choice may be based on price or brand perception alone.</p><p>If you want to use the Canon's rear LCD screen to compose pictures then you might as well forget about it here, as this is a to-the-eye and through-the-viewfinder optimised camera - if screen-based shooting is your absolute must then <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/buyers-guides/124653-best-mirrorless-cameras-budget-to-high-end-mirrorless-lens-cameras-to-buy\" rel=\"\">look to a mirrorless camera instead</a>.</p><p><strong>Read our preview:&nbsp;</strong><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/canon/143700-canon-eos-2000d-initial-review-asserting-dslr-s-entry-level-place-in-a-smartphone-world\" rel=\"\">Canon 2000D review</a></p><p>&nbsp;</p><h2>Best small-scale DSLR</h2><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141437-cameras-hands-on-canon-eos-200d-image2-fzduw2xpri.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1280\" height=\"854\" /></p><h3>Canon EOS 200D / SL2</h3><p>squirrel_widget_141437</p><p>The Canon EOS 200D (or SL2 for our American friends) sits in a world of its own, as the update to the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/canon/120751-canon-eos-100d-review\" rel=\"\">small-scale 100D (SL1)</a>. It's as small as DSLR cameras come - and that in itself is the single biggest reason for buying it.</p><p>This is the DSLR to take up less bag space while delivering quality akin to the EOS 80D model (listed below) thanks to the 24-megapixel sensor on board.</p><p><strong>Read our preview: </strong><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/canon/141437-canon-eos-200d-review-the-perfect-mini-dslr-for-beginners\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Canon EOS 200D</a></p><p>&nbsp;</p><h2>Best mid-level DSLR</h2><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/122777-cameras-news-buyer-s-guide-best-dslr-cameras-2017-the-best-interchangeable-lens-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image5-NwyRb4Mxd2.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1280\" height=\"855\" /></p><h3>Canon EOS 80D</h3><p>squirrel_widget_136751</p><p>If you're looking for an all-rounder when it comes to both still images and movie capture then the 80D is one of the best pure DSLRs to cater for such a varied and successful feature set. It's not brand new either (but is still very current), so the price has settled down over recent years.</p><p>Where the 80D really excels is with its autofocus system. The Dual Pixel AF system - which uses on-sensor phase-detection via live view and a different phase-detection system through the viewfinder - comprises 45 autofocus points and is super-fast whether you're looking through the viewfinder or using the rear screen to compose your shots.</p><p>Elsewhere the 80D ups the viewfinder ante with a what-you-see-is-what-you-get 100 per cent field-of-view - something cheaper DSLR cameras often lack (like the 2000D and SL2 listed above), and that the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/canon/123223-canon-eos-70d-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">earlier 70D</a> couldn't muster - while its 3.2-inch, tilt-angle touchscreen remains one of its strong points, especially in a competitive world against compact system cameras.</p><p>However, the Nikon D7500 (below) now offers much of the 80D's equivalent plus 4K video capture too.</p><p><strong>Read our&nbsp;full review: </strong><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/canon/136751-canon-eos-80d-review-the-mid-range-master\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Canon EOS 80D review</a></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141646-cameras-review-nikon-d7500-image1-qzjvwty2z5.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1066\" /></p><h3>Nikon D7500</h3><p>squirrel_widget_141646</p><p>Nikon arrives a little late to ruin the Canon 80D's party, but it's a formidable camera with great all-round features.</p><p>With a new tilt-angle screen for this level in the company's series, its touch-sensitive controls make it versatile - whether using viewfinder or screen for composition. However, the live view screen-based focus just isn't quite as snappy as the Canon equivalent. Still, it comes with 4K movie capture, which the Canon does not.</p><p>Just like the Canon equivalent, it's Nikon's autofocus system that really sells the D7500. The second-generation Multi-CAM 3500 delivers 51 AF points that are super quick to acquire subject focus - even in the dark thanks to operability down to -3EV - but that is the same system as found in <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/nikon/133473-nikon-d7200-review-enhancing-the-enthusiast-dslr\" rel=\"\">the earlier D7200 model</a>, which might make that older, more affordable model all the more tempting.</p><p><strong>Read our&nbsp;full review: </strong><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/nikon/141646-nikon-d7500-review-better-than-the-canon-80d\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Nikon D7500 review</a></p><p>&nbsp;</p><h2>Best entry-level full-frame DSLR</h2><p class=\"align-left\">Sensors the same size as traditional 35mm film negatives are called \"full-frame\". This large sensor size produces a pronounced depth of field, while the sensor's \"pixels\" are typically larger for a cleaner signal and, therefore, usually superior image quality compared to APS-C sensors (this can be resolution dependent though).</p><p class=\"align-left\"><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/122777-cameras-news-buyer-s-guide-best-dslr-cameras-2017-the-best-interchangeable-lens-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image7-EADqvaZ3YJ.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1280\" height=\"960\" /></p><h3>Nikon D610</h3><p>squirrel_widget_125841</p><p>The words \"entry-level\" and \"full-frame\" tend not to go hand in hand. Given that close to £2,000 needs to be spent for that full-frame experience - and that's before considering lens costs - you need to be sure that you're ready to dip into the larger-sensor world.</p><p>The D610 replaces the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/nikon/72964-nikon-d600-full-frame-fx-dslr-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">earlier D600</a> and, frankly, doesn't change much. If you scour the internet you will find a series of complaints about some Nikon D600 owners experiencing issues with oil on the camera's sensor. It's not an issue we had, but the arrival of the D610, with only a modest bump in features, suggests that it's a solution to brush any issues of its predecessor under the carpet. It does have a new shutter mechanism after all.</p><p>If you want some more resolution then go with the 45-megapixel D850 (further below) instead. If you're looking for greater versatility then the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/nikon/131160-nikon-d750-review-tilt-angle-tricks\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">tilt-angle screen of the Nikon D750 might suit better.</a></p><p><strong>Read our&nbsp;full review: </strong><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/nikon/125841-nikon-d610-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Nikon D610 review</a></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141439-cameras-review-canon-eos-6d-mark-2-image1-5br8zc2imn.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"561\" /></p><h3>Canon EOS 6D Mark II</h3><p>squirrel_widget_73072</p><p>Ok, so there's quite a big jump in price point here, as the 6D Mark II is a more recent addition than some listed here. But it's also perhaps the most versatile full-frame camera you can buy. It's got a great sensor. It's got a vari-angle touchscreen with excellent live-view autofocus for on-screen composition. It's got an autofocus system way better than its 6D predecessor. And it's far cheaper than the 5D MkIV (below). Sure, you can get a Nikon D610 for about half the price, but you might feel years behind.</p><p>The Canon's not quite perfect, though. The live view, while fast, isn't as pinpoint perfect when it comes to focus as an equivalent mirrorless camera. Then there's the viewfinder's 98 per cent field-of-view (the outermost two per cent isn't visible in the finder, but is captured), which for a near-£2k camera seems like a bit of a kick in the sides.</p><p>Nonetheless, if you've been thinking about buying a full-frame DSLR but have been waiting for some of the more modern technologies – touchscreen control, a vari-angle screen, Wi-Fi sharing and so on – then the 6D Mark II does a grand job.</p><p><strong>Read our&nbsp;full review: </strong><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/canon/141439-canon-eos-6d-mark-ii-review-one-of-the-most-versatile-full-frame-dslr-cameras\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Canon EOS 6D Mark II review</a></p><p>&nbsp;</p><h2>Best pro-spec all-rounder (APS-C sensor)</h2><p>When full-frame 35mm film was settled upon back in the day, it later spawned a smaller format that came to be known as APS-C. By having this half-frame sensor the image produced gives the impression of a greater zoom lens. That's why you'll see some lens' focal lengths described as \"35mm equivalent\". APS-c is now the most common sensor size, and arguably the most versatile.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/122777-cameras-news-buyer-s-guide-best-dslr-cameras-2017-the-best-interchangeable-lens-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image8-GqabgVuUL6.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><h3>Nikon D500</h3><p>squirrel_widget_136438</p><p>The <em>is-it-isn't-it?</em> replacement for the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/nikon/71347-nikon-d300s-dslr-camera-review\" rel=\"\">Nikon D300S</a>, the Nikon D500 is one of the most interesting and important DSLR cameras that we've handled. It embodies much of the top-spec ultra-pro <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/nikon/136437-nikon-d5-review-olympic-effort-from-pro-dslr\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Nikon D5</a> in a smaller format. It's the \"D5 mini\" if you will.</p><p>Which translates into a whole heap of good things. The 21-megapixel sensor is backed up with the speedy Expeed 5 processing engine and can capture shots up to an extended sensitivity of ISO 1,640,000. Yup, that's six figures.</p><p>It's so good we think it steps above the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/canon/131682-canon-eos-7d-mark-ii-review-king-of-quality\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Canon EOS 7D Mark II</a>, while the range of Nikon DX optics will see it as the more practical solution compared to the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/pentax/136763-pentax-k-1-review-full-frame-underdog-can-teach-the-competition-some-new-tricks\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Pentax K-1</a> for many - even if the Pentax has some standout features like its variable LCD screen.</p><p>In short, the Nikon D500 is certainly a contender for the best APS-C camera made to date. There are only some small gaps in its capabilities - such as unnecessary extended \"Hi\" ISO settings, and slight hunting in the live view autofocus - but otherwise its awesome autofocus system and all-round capabilities are second to none.</p><p><strong>Read our&nbsp;full review: </strong><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/nikon/136438-nikon-d500-review-the-best-aps-c-dslr-ever-made\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Nikon D500 review</a></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/122777-cameras-news-buyer-s-guide-best-dslr-cameras-2017-the-best-interchangeable-lens-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image9-z3beXQqWMP.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1068\" /></p><h3>Canon EOS 7D Mark II</h3><p>Until we'd seen the Nikon D500 (above) we'd yet to use an APS-C sensor DSLR camera that impressed us more than the Canon EOS 7D Mark II. Despite Nikon's new entry, this Canon is still a strong contender.</p><p>It features a 65-point all-cross-type autofocus system, new shutter mechanism (to 200,000 cycles), faster burst mode to 10 frames per second (up from 8fps in the original 7D), and 20.2-megapixel sensor. You can see the similarities between this and the D500, right?</p><p>There are some feature absences that we would like to have seen on board - such as a tilt-angle screen, touch-sensitive operation, Wi-Fi integration and 4K video capture - but these omissions aren't necessarily a total deal-breaker, even if it does make us lean towards the D500 that much more.</p><p><strong>Read our&nbsp;full review: </strong><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/canon/131682-canon-eos-7d-mark-ii-review-king-of-quality\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Canon 7D MkII review</a></p><p>&nbsp;</p><h2>Best high-resolution DSLR</h2><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142266-cameras-review-nikon-d850-review-image1-weuczlglvp.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"498\" /></p><h3>Nikon D850</h3><p>squirrel_widget_148591</p><p>Nikon did what we thought was utter madness when it announced the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/nikon/72773-nikon-d800-full-frame-36-megapixel-slr-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">36-megapixel D800</a> in 2012. But after using it extensively we found its super-high resolution full-frame sensor was an utter marvel. Two years after that <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/nikon/129959-nikon-d810-review\" rel=\"\">came the D810</a>, at the same resolution. The D850, however, pushes things yet further with its 45-megapixel sensor.</p><p>But the D850 is so far ahead, it could well be the best DSLR ever. In the right hands and with good quality glass, this camera is capable of producing crisp and highly detailed images. The dynamic range is almost unreal, too.</p><p>Little changes to the D850's body compared to its predecessor's also transform the user experience. Illuminated buttons, silent shutter mode, deeper grip and class-leading battery life all add up to something quite special.</p><p>Its only shortcoming is the live view autofocus speed isn't as capable as Canon's equivalent. And the Canon 5DS (below) crams in yet more resolution, if that's what you're really seeking.</p><p><strong>Read our full review:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/nikon/142266-nikon-d850-review-the-best-dslr-ever\" rel=\"\">Nikon D850 review</a></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/135439-cameras-review-canon-eos-5ds-review-image1-uslold3qhz.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><h3>Canon EOS 5DS</h3><p>squirrel_widget_135439</p><p>If it's resolution you want, nothing in the DSLR world crams more pixels onto a sensor than Canon (<a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/sony/148688-sony-a7r-iv-61mp-full-frame-specs\" rel=\"\">there's the 61MP Sony, but it's not technically a DSLR</a>). The 5DS has 50 million of them, making this a DSLR that can rival the medium format market.</p><p>And it's really rather brilliant. Shoot with this camera and you'll need to be extra tight with shutter speed control to avoid blur, which is why some of the 5DS's high-flying features - such as the 61-point autofocus system - almost seem mis-matched if you're the kind of user who expects to pick this camera up and snap away as if it's the same as the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/canon/138577-canon-eos-5d-mark-iv-review-the-30-megapixel-monster\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">5D Mark IV</a>.</p><p>Even so, when paired with the right lenses and selecting sufficient shutter speeds the Canon holds up well against the Nikon D850. Plus it has better on-screen live view autofocus, should you be shooting in that format.</p><p><strong>Read our&nbsp;full review: </strong><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/canon/135439-canon-eos-5ds-review-resolution-revelation\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Canon EOS 5DS review</a></p><p>&nbsp;</p><h2>Best DSLR for movie capture</h2><p>A contended category as, right now, mirrorless cameras are the more obvious choice for video-based work. Cameras such as the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/panasonic/143125-panasonic-lumix-gh5s-initial-review-the-4k-cinema-pro\" rel=\"\">Panasonic Lumix G5S</a> being a prime example of how far things can be pushed.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/139724-cameras-review-sony-alpha-a99-ii-review-image2-mfnzrks9th.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><h3>Sony Alpha A99 Mark II</h3><p>squirrel_widget_139724</p><p>Ok, so it's not technically a DSLR, it's actually an SLT (single lens translucent) camera, but that technology makes for exceptional fast and quiet autofocus that's perfect for video.</p><p>And the A99 II is really built for video. Sure, it's great with stills too - <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/sony/143157-sony-a9-initial-review-phenomenal-speed-from-the-full-frame-mirrorless-master\" rel=\"\">although the mirrorless A9 might appeal yet more</a> - but when you want to shoot moving images it's approaching unbeatable.</p><p>There's a silent control wheel to the front of the camera for live adjustment during recording, while the full-frame sensor is spot on for blurred-background effects and creating those pro-looking 1080p/4K shots.</p><p>All this can be witnessed in real time on the rear LCD screen without any cost to autofocus ability which, because of the SLT design, is just as fast as when using the camera through its electronic viewfinder - and that's also possible when capturing video.</p><p>It doesn't come cheap, though, which is its one major drawback. And many more DSLR cameras are now beginning to offer 4K capture - so it's arguable if this particular Sony can stay on top for long.</p><p><strong>Read our&nbsp;full review: </strong><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/sony/139724-sony-alpha-a99-ii-review-proving-that-translucent-can-triumph\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Sony Alpha A99 II review</a></p><p>&nbsp;</p><h2>Best enthusiast full-frame DSLR</h2><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/122777-cameras-news-buyer-s-guide-best-dslr-cameras-2017-the-best-interchangeable-lens-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image13-bWFReBcn9T.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"960\" height=\"638\" /></p><h3>Canon EOS 5D Mark IV</h3><p>squirrel_widget_138577</p><p>You already know your stuff. You want to take the full-frame sensor plunge or perhaps upgrade from an earlier model but don't have the cash for a crazy-fast pro-spec camera. Yet you still want just enough power in a feature set that's rounded enough to cover sports, portraits, landscapes - the works. Say hello to the 5D Mark IV.</p><p>The 5D IV is a deft balance between resolution, image quality, autofocus ability and control, seeing it stand head and shoulders above its predecessor and, right now, much of the competition too. With Nikon's current absence in this market, perhaps only the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/sony/139724-sony-alpha-a99-ii-review-proving-that-translucent-can-triumph\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Sony A99 II</a> or <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/sony/143157-sony-a9-initial-review-phenomenal-speed-from-the-full-frame-mirrorless-master\" rel=\"\">pricier A9</a> will be an alternative option - but probably not if you're already invested in Canon optics. And there's not a mirrorless model to compete at this level just yet, even if <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/panasonic/142737-panasonic-lumix-g9-review-the-finest-mirrorless-camera-that-money-can-buy\" rel=\"\">Panasonic is knocking on the door with its G9</a>.</p><p>Now the latest 5D is not cheap by any means - an end-of-line <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/canon/72817-canon-5d-markiii-digital-slr-camera-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Mark III</a> might do you justice instead - but it's got every base covered and that 30-megapixel sensor is not only awesome in good light, it aces low-light conditions too.</p><p><strong>Read our&nbsp;full review:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/canon/138577-canon-eos-5d-mark-iv-review-the-30-megapixel-monster\" rel=\"\">Canon EOS 5D Mk IV review</a></p><p>&nbsp;</p><h2>Best professional DSLR (full-frame sensor)</h2><p>The choices at this level are more or less two-fold if you're considering full-frame: Canon 1D X Mark II or Nikon D5 (further below).</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/970x/assets/images/122777-cameras-news-buyer-s-guide-best-dslr-cameras-2017-the-best-interchangeable-lens-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image14-ENpFsWBa7I.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"960\" height=\"639\" /></p><h3>Canon EOS 1D X Mark II</h3><p>squirrel_widget_136560</p><p>It's Canon that succeeds in the speed stakes, delivering 14fps burst shooting that can't be touched by the competition - the Nikon D5 can only manage that pace with the mirror locked (otherwise it's 12fps). Controversially you could look to the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/sony/143157-sony-a9-initial-review-phenomenal-speed-from-the-full-frame-mirrorless-master\" rel=\"\">Sony A9 instead as an option - which can muster 20fps</a> - despite that being a full-frame mirrorless competitor.</p><p>The 1D X II's battery life seems to last forever and, importantly, its 20.2-megapixel full-frame sensor is just about perfect for all manner of jobs. An updated autofocus system - <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/canon/136560-canon-eos-1d-x-mark-ii-review-the-fast-and-the-furious-part-ii\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">and there's not enough space here to explain its full complexities (take a look at our full review)</a> - hits home with 61 ultra-sensitive AF points and works a treat too.</p><p>Some other full-frame models outperform in the resolution stakes, it's questionable as to whether Canon has lost its \"movie king\" hat (the Mark II questionably replaces the 1D C too), and the Nikon D5 shouts a lot with its new 153-point autofocus system and low-light capabilities.</p><p>With all that said, having used the camera over a number of days we were struggling to try and find fault. When it comes to creative professional tools the 1D X Mark II is not just a worthy successor to the original, it's an astounding high-speed DSLR in its own right.</p><p><strong>Read our&nbsp;full review:</strong>&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/canon/136560-canon-eos-1d-x-mark-ii-review-the-fast-and-the-furious-part-ii\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Canon EOS 1D X II review</a></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/122777-cameras-news-buyer-s-guide-best-dslr-cameras-2017-the-best-interchangeable-lens-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image15-6iZ5XM1PDj.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><h3>Nikon D5</h3><p>squirrel_widget_136437</p><p>Ok, so Nikon can't quite match the 1D X II in the speed stakes (or buffer capacity from our tests), but it's got more than enough pop for most pros.</p><p>Where it really excels is with its nuanced 153-point autofocus system, which is super-fast whether shooting stills or tracking moving subjects. We tested out the camera's continuous autofocus (AF-C) mode with 3D, 153- and 72-point arrangements and it's lightning fast, even in dim conditions.</p><p>The D5 also has the upper hand when it comes to low-light and high ISO performance. Sure, the 3-million-odd ISO sensitivity is numbers for numbers' sake, but its six-figure sensitivities are genuinely excellent.</p><p>For the average consumer this is the Ferrari of cameras: out of reach in both price and realistic use (and not as fast as the Lambo; i.e. Canon). For the pros out there it's a priceless tool.</p><p><strong>Read our&nbsp;full review: </strong><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/nikon/136437-nikon-d5-review-olympic-effort-from-pro-dslr\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Nikon D5 review</a></p>
