+0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/122777-cameras-news-buyer-s-guide-best-dslr-cameras-2020-the-best-interchangeable-lens-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image1-ipnxrntdrf.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"df7dc69028b2263b40d167aec88a0b49","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn64@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-36-52-559_c781d8fad6498459.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":447,"sourceBytes":78277,"destBytes":50010,"author":"Mike Lowe","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/122777-cameras-news-buyer-s-guide-best-dslr-cameras-2020-the-best-interchangeable-lens-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image1-ipnxrntdrf.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn64@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-36-52-559_c781d8fad6498459.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/143700-cameras-review-hands-on-canon-eos-2000d-review-image1-xploy5pbva.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn52@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-37-27-225_7f81761ea30379f8.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141437-cameras-hands-on-canon-eos-200d-image2-fzduw2xpri.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn25@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-37-02-964_58b2321dd94969f1.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/122777-cameras-news-buyer-s-guide-best-dslr-cameras-2017-the-best-interchangeable-lens-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image5-NwyRb4Mxd2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn6@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-37-00-936_65256c1c93e949dc.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141646-cameras-review-nikon-d7500-image1-qzjvwty2z5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn4@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-36-59-212_4f1f217feb72c188.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/122777-cameras-news-buyer-s-guide-best-dslr-cameras-2017-the-best-interchangeable-lens-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image7-EADqvaZ3YJ.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn96@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-36-59-189_1139c25d9edd99fa.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141439-cameras-review-canon-eos-6d-mark-2-image1-5br8zc2imn.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn75@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-37-02-494_a7b859868a61e7bb.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/122777-cameras-news-buyer-s-guide-best-dslr-cameras-2017-the-best-interchangeable-lens-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image8-GqabgVuUL6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn21@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-37-02-945_19bdc0de6912a1fa.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/122777-cameras-news-buyer-s-guide-best-dslr-cameras-2017-the-best-interchangeable-lens-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image9-z3beXQqWMP.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn28@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-37-07-113_a95d6b74ec09efef.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142266-cameras-review-nikon-d850-review-image1-weuczlglvp.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn78@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-37-08-428_963699f2e833b834.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/135439-cameras-review-canon-eos-5ds-review-image1-uslold3qhz.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn27@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-37-18-707_73d08180b1581974.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/139724-cameras-review-sony-alpha-a99-ii-review-image2-mfnzrks9th.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn30@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-36-53-908_45cf2cf211d3540a.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/122777-cameras-news-buyer-s-guide-best-dslr-cameras-2017-the-best-interchangeable-lens-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image13-bWFReBcn9T.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn68@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-37-26-242_d2fdf3731d3c94bb.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/970x/assets/images/122777-cameras-news-buyer-s-guide-best-dslr-cameras-2017-the-best-interchangeable-lens-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image14-ENpFsWBa7I.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn35@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-37-16-288_d5f71be16cbdbfc8.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/122777-cameras-news-buyer-s-guide-best-dslr-cameras-2017-the-best-interchangeable-lens-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image15-6iZ5XM1PDj.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn67@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-36-57-390_3f56d22abf22e72c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209022},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"What should you consider when buying an action camera?","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/150556-what-should-you-consider-when-buying-an-action-camera","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"499\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/150556-cameras-news-what-should-you-consider-when-buying-an-action-camera-image1-p3eqjprx4l.jpg?v1\"> <p>From holiday snaps to your baby’s first steps, your smartphone camera has you covered for everyday moments in life. But when it comes to breathtaking action and adventure, a smartphone camera just can’t keep up — enter the modern-day action camera.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinaffid=326657&amp;awinmid=7327&amp;platform=dl&amp;p=https://www.dji.com/osmo-action\" rel=\"follow\">Action cameras</a> offer you an entirely new way to film your adventures, featuring durable designs, waterproof casings, and state-of-the-art imaging capabilities.</p><p>If you’re in the market for an action camera, hold on tight and launch yourself into a world of adventure with this article. We will discuss the action camera features you should consider and reveal some of the best options on the market in 2020.&nbsp;</p><h2>Durability: Whatever the weather</h2><p>Durability is one of the most important features to consider, as it will determine how well your action camera can keep up in any given shooting environment. The best action cameras on the market can withstand extreme temperatures, dirt, a dive into the ocean, or even being dropped. Waterproofing is a good feature to look out for if you wish to dive deeper for more content. DJI, GoPro, Sony, and other companies offer action cameras that are waterproof, shockproof, and resistant to extreme environments.</p><h2>Stabilisation: Hollywood shots</h2><p>Stabilisation has become a huge factor to consider when choosing an action camera. Whether your skiing down a mountain, running along a track, mountain biking, or recording other dynamic shots, stabilized video makes a world of difference to your footage. Most modern-day cameras come equipped with their own internal stabilization, letting you focus more on the action rather than worrying about the shot. When it comes to action camera stabilization systems, key contenders re DJI’s RockSteady, which made its debut with Osmo Action, and GoPro’s HyperSmooth, which was introduced with the GoPro Hero 7. We recommend checking out the stabilization availability of different action cameras for different resolution combinations.&nbsp;</p><h2>Videos: 4K and beyond</h2><p>The main function of an action camera is to capture dynamic, high-quality videos in any environment. Most action cameras in 2020 can now shoot both HD and 4K videos, which means you should pay attention to things like HDR support, 60fps frame rates, slow motion, and integrated shooting modes. A great example of this is Osmo Action, which features HDR video, 240fps slow-motion mode at either 1080p or 720p, and timelapses in 1080p, 2.7K, and 4K.</p><h2>Images: Simple shooting</h2><p>In addition to videos, an action camera should be able to take exceptional still images. A larger lens captures more light, which improves your images and video quality. Look for action cameras that offer intelligent image processing. The Sony RX0 II has one of the largest camera sensors of any action camera and offers a range of image control and dynamic range modes.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><h2>Lens: Wide-angle views</h2><p>Action cameras are known for their point-of-view lenses, which use a very wide-angle view to capture yourself and all of your surroundings in one frame. Most action cameras on the market can produce a wide-angle shot that is perfect for capturing all the action in one shot.</p><h2>Screens: Perfect selfie shots</h2><p>An action camera screen monitor is an important feature to consider when you are purchasing your equipment. A screen helps you see what the action camera is recording, review your footage, and change settings easily. The DJI Osmo Action triumphs in this category, featuring a 2.25-inch touchscreen on the back and a vivid 1.4-inch selfie screen at the front.&nbsp;</p><h2>Voice control: Focus on the action</h2><p>Every second counts when you are undertaking extreme sports activities. Voice control is a fantastic feature that lets you control your action camera while focusing on the moment at hand. This clever feature gives you control over recording, taking a photo, turning the device on and off, and more.</p><h2>Others to consider</h2><p>There are lots of other action camera features you should consider. Wi-Fi or Bluetooth connectivity makes it easier to transfer your images and videos to your phone or laptop. No matter how impressive the hardware is, software stability should always be considered when purchasing your action camera. A dedicated app lets you edit your footage, download files, change the camera settings, and more. Battery life is also an essential thing to consider; most modern action cameras can record for over an hour on a fully charged battery.</p><h2>Some action cameras to consider...</h2><p>Now that we’ve gone through some important action camera features, it’s time to check out some of the best action cameras in 2020. Here are five of our favourites!</p><h3>DJI Osmo Action</h3><p>To kick off our list of recommended action cameras, we will start with an action camera that has changed the game. The <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinaffid=326657&amp;awinmid=7327&amp;platform=dl&amp;p=https://www.dji.com/osmo-action\" rel=\"follow\">DJI Osmo Action</a> was released in May 2019, opening up a world of creativity for professionals and adventure seekers alike. DJI debuted its first action camera with some stand-out features that make it a unique addition to the action camera market.</p><p>Osmo Action has two screens: the back screen delivers a hyper-responsive display while the innovative front screen lets you capture selfies and frame action shots effortlessly. This action camera also comes with DJI’s own electronic image stabilization (EIS), which they have coined as “RockSteady.” The EIS technology works in conjunction with high-performance algorithms to record cinematic action shots.&nbsp;</p><p>In addition to 4K/60fps video at 100 Mbps, Osmo Action also features 4K HDR video, improving the dynamic range of your footage and giving you more vibrant details. This action camera also comes jam-packed with creative shooting modes that support 8x slow motion, timelapses, hyperlapses, and continuous shooting.&nbsp;</p><p>Osmo Action is as rugged as it is sophisticated, and is waterproof to depths of up to 11 meters without any external casing. This durable action camera features voice commands and is supported by a lineup of accessories, which round off an entry that easily earned its place on our list of top action cameras.</p><h3>GoPro Hero 8</h3><p>Next on our list is GoPro’s new successor to the Hero 7 Black — introducing the GoPro Hero 8 Black. Built on the success from previous models, this new model features a slimmer design, a foldable built-in mount, a better microphone, and updated EIS stabilization.</p><p>GoPro introduced HyperSmooth 2.0 with the Hero 8 Black, offering stabilization functionality across all resolutions and frame rates. Included with this update are three modes of stabilization that crop the frame at different levels to counter camera shakes. HyperSmooth 2.0 can also be applied to slow-motion footage shot at 120fps and 240fps.&nbsp;</p><p>In addition to these updates, a narrow lens perspective lets you shoot close-up footage, 2.7K and 4K video modes now support bitrates up to 100 Mbps, and social media live streams can be broadcasted at 1080p.&nbsp;</p><p>The Hero 8 Black also comes with built-in foldable hinges that allow it to be attached to other accessories like a tripod. This convenient feature removes the need for an additional frame mount for accessories and gives you easier access to the battery and memory card.</p><h3>Insta 360 One X</h3><p>This innovative action camera brings some impressive features to the market. The Insta360 One X offers sharp footage at 5.7K 30fps, 4K 50fps, and 3K 100fps. An HDR mode ensures your footage maintains excellent details in different types of lighting conditions. The Insta360 One X also features its own form of electronic stabilization, named FlowState, which provides stability for all of your action shots.</p><p>When it comes to exciting features, Insta360 One X brings heaps of action to the table. Snap the action camera into the Drifter accessory to create stunning slow-motion shots with ingenious angles. The accessory features an aerodynamic body and a shock-resistant frame, letting your creativity take flight. Another useful accessory is the invisible selfie stick that produces great selfies without appearing in the footage itself.&nbsp;</p><p>Insta360 One X also impresses with various shooting modes. TimeShift gives you control over your perspective by using slow motion and stabilized hyperlapses. These features are all combined with the One X app for simple, cinematic editing.</p><h3>Garmin VIRB XE</h3><p>The next action camera on our list is built for extreme adventures. The Garmin VIRB XE is a compact, waterproof action camera with plenty of impressive features. This action camera shoots high-definition footage at 1080p 60fps and 12MP photos up to 30fps. You can also capture photos while simultaneously recording videos. The VIRB XE is engineered to withstand harsh environments, and it is waterproof up to 50 meters without an external case.&nbsp;</p><p>G-Metrix is a clever feature that contains information on GPS, G-force, orientation, and more performance data. Users can playback their footage with overlays of speed, acceleration, and more. For fast-paced action shots, the VIRB XE contains motion sensors that detect camera movements and EIS stabilization that keep your shots smooth.&nbsp;</p><p>With built-in WiFi, VIRB XE can be connected to a smartphone or tablet for live video control, editing, and playback. This rugged action camera also comes with Bluetooth-enabled HD audio to ensure you can obtain the best audio possible. VIRB XE also comes with impressive remote-controlled accessories and features a user-friendly design that makes it a great addition to the action camera market.&nbsp;</p><h3>Sony RX0&nbsp;</h3><p>No action camera list in 2020 would be complete without the Sony RX0. Promising boundless creative inspiration, the RX0 combines excellent imaging performance with durability. This action camera is waterproof down to 10 meters and shockproof up to 2.0 meters.&nbsp;</p><p>Packing an Exmor RS CMOS sensor and BIONZ X image processor, RX0 offers excellent imaging capabilities. One great feature of this product is the ability to shoot super slow-motion video at 1000fps. From golf swings to football tackles, you can capture slow-motion sports footage like never before. RX0 also contains an anti-distortion shutter up to 1/32000 seconds that gives you crystal clear shots of fast-moving subjects. Users can take photos up to 16fps, and Picture Profile/S-Log2 offers more professional video options.&nbsp;</p><p>Along with all these great features, the RX0 is supported by a lineup of accessories that accommodate a variety of shooting options. The Sony RX0 is a robust action camera with impressive imaging features that easily place it in our top action camera list.</p><h2>Summary</h2><p>Inspiring infinite creative possibilities, action cameras provide content creators with cutting-edge technology and versatile applications. Whether you are skiing down a mountain or bungee jumping, the best action camera is the one you feel most comfortable using. So, before you hit the slopes and chase the next adrenaline fix, be sure to check out the options available for you on the market. In no time, you will be creating inspirational content to be proud of!</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 26 Feb 2020 10:03:00 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/150556-cameras-news-what-should-you-consider-when-buying-an-action-camera-image1-p3eqjprx4l.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"5116628d898c6edc0a4ff99a584696c5","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn88@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-36-50-751_339ea5ea9d5c9b25.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":499,"sourceBytes":44021,"destBytes":16862,"author":"Pocket-lint Promotion","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/150556-cameras-news-what-should-you-consider-when-buying-an-action-camera-image1-p3eqjprx4l.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn88@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-36-50-751_339ea5ea9d5c9b25.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209022},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"The best GoPro 2020: Which GoPro should you buy today?","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/buyers-guides/134096-best-gopro-action-camera-gopro-models-compared","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"499\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/134096-cameras-buyer-s-guide-best-gopro-which-gopro-should-you-choose-image1-ijl1kx0rok.jpg?v1\"> <p>GoPro is pretty much the preeminent name in the action camera world, and has been on top of the game for years now. It's constantly releasing new models to keep up with technological developments and user expectations.&nbsp;</p><p>While there's more competition now, GoPro still has arguably the best all-round ecosystem of action cameras. That said, there are absolutely loads of models to choose from. This begs the question: which GoPro should you buy?&nbsp;</p><h2>What GoPro offers</h2><p>GoPro's entire lineup has gone through something of a streamlining process and complete refresh over the past couple of years. Whereas prior years saw various models, including a budget, tiny Session, the company now only offers versions of the flagship Hero series and the 360-degree Max.&nbsp;</p><p>In 2018, it moved around its product line quite a bit to achieve this streamlining, and further slimmed it down in 2019 with the launch of <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/gopro/149442-gopro-hero8-black-review-action-camera\" rel=\"follow\">the Hero 8</a> and Max. Now it has the Hero 7 Silver, Hero 7 Black, Hero 8 Black and the GoPro Max.&nbsp;</p><p>That makes four cameras in total but between them you should easily be able to find something that works for you on your budget. What's more, you can still quite easily find some of the previous flagship cameras at much lower prices than they were at launch.&nbsp;</p><p>GoPro also offers an array of accessories, from small handheld mounts that act as tripods, and floating cases, to the powered, stabilising Karma Grip gimbal system. It also has a great, easy to use mobile and desktop apps for editing. As an ecosystem goes, it's pretty unbeatable.&nbsp;</p><h2>Our pick of the best action cameras from GoPro</h2><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/134096-cameras-buyer-s-guide-best-gopro-which-gopro-should-you-choose-image16-8ledprqct0.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><h2>GoPro Hero 8 Black</h2><p>squirrel_widget_168058</p><p>GoPro didn't just enhance the action camera's capabilities when it launched the Hero 8 Black, it also brought with it a new, more practical design. It's slightly bigger and heavier than its predecessor, but that extra size and weight means there's now space for built-in mounting arms, and that means no more additional clip-on frame. It'll mount to anything all by itself.&nbsp;</p><p>As you'd expect, it's waterproof and can shoot up to 4K resolution, with a huge number of frame rates and resolutions available depending on what kind of footage you're wanting to shoot. The big news in video performance is the enhancement of the company's HyperSmooth stabilisation algorithms. It's called HyperSmooth 2.0 and is available across all resolutions and frame rates, so it doesn't matter what you shoot, it'll be buttery smooth.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li>4K Wide - 60, 30, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>4K SuperView - 30, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>4K Linear - 60, 30, 24fps</li> \n  <li>4K (4:3) Wide - 30, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>2.7K Wide - 120, 60, 30, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>2.7K&nbsp;SuperView - 60, 30, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>2.7K Linear -&nbsp;60, 30, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>2.7K Narrow -&nbsp;60, 30, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>2.7K (4:3) Wide -&nbsp;60, 30, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>2.7K (4:3) Linear -&nbsp;60, 30, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>2.7K (4:3) Narrow -&nbsp;60, 30, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>1440p Wide -&nbsp;120, 60, 30, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>1440p Linear -&nbsp;60, 30, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>1440p Narrow -&nbsp;60, 30, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>1080p Wide - 240, 120, 60, 30, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>1080p SuperView + Linear - 120, 60, 30, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>1080p Narrow - 60, 30, 24 fps</li> \n </ul><p>One of the biggest enhancements to the Hero 8 Black is down to the redesigned exterior and port layout: mods. GoPro has introduced three new mod add-ons that enable a more professional vlogging experience. Simply: you can now connect a shotgun microphone, LED light and display mod so that you can light yourself in darker environments, get better audio recording and see yourself when shooting to camera.&nbsp;</p><p>It's for sure the most accomplished standard GoPro action camera to date. Check out more in our review below.&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Read the full review:&nbsp;</strong><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/gopro/149442-gopro-hero8-black-review-action-camera\" rel=\"follow\">GoPro Hero 8 Black review</a></p><h2><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/134096-cameras-buyer-s-guide-best-gopro-which-gopro-should-you-choose-image1-7dnnj6xelb.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></h2><h2>GoPro Max</h2><p>squirrel_widget_168074</p><p>GoPro doesn't want you to think of the Max as a reboot of the Fusion, but in a lot of ways it is. Likewise, in a lot of ways it isn't. It's a 360-degree camera, that's true, but its more than that and GoPro has completely changed the way you edit video from it.&nbsp;</p><p>You can shoot using either of the two 180-degree cameras on its own, and it features even better stabilisation than the Hero8. As well as using the HyperSmooth technology of the more standard camera, it uses its ultra wide lenses to automatically level the horizons, so not only does it make all your footage smooth, it's also always level.&nbsp;</p><p>It has a better mic than the Hero8 too, in fact, offering similar performance to the shotgun mic mod that you can buy for the Hero8. It has six mics in total, offering that 360-degree audio.&nbsp;</p><p>Of course, you can shoot in 360 too, using both cameras, and then you simply use the GoPro mobile app to reframe any of the footage you capture in a way that's much more user friendly than the method offered by the Fusion. You can also use a TimeWarp feature that lets you speed up and slow down footage while panning around the 360-degree footage.&nbsp;</p><p>Like the Hero, it has built-in mounting arms, so you'll never need a case for it to mount it to any of your handles. What's more, it's only $100 more than the single-camera device.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/134096-cameras-buyer-s-guide-best-gopro-which-gopro-should-you-choose-image14-cdhlexh5vl.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><h3>GoPro Hero 7 Black</h3><p>squirrel_widget_145781</p>\n <ul> \n  <li>4K video at 60fps</li> \n  <li>1080p at 240fps</li> \n  <li>HDR Photos</li> \n  <li>HyperSmooth + HyperLapse</li> \n  <li>10m waterproofing</li> \n </ul><p>It might have been launched in 2018, but the Hero 7 Black still offers a lot, and is even better value than ever now that its retail price has been reduced.&nbsp;</p><p>Stuck on the front is a camera capable of shooting HDR still photos, as well as 4K video up to 60 frames per second and 1080p footage up to 240fps for awesome slow-motion. It's also equipped with some very advanced digital stabilisation, which acts like a 3-axis gimbal to smooth out shakes and vibrations. It's called HyperSmooth and almost completely gets rid of bumps and shakes in the footage.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>As well as all that, general image quality is much more natural and better quality too, compared to its predecessor. All this is thanks to the new custom, upgraded GP1 processor, which has enabled these improvements in hardware that's largely the same as the previous model. It offers the following resolutions and FOVs:</p>\n <ul> \n  <li>4K Wide - 60, 50, 30, 25, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>4K SuperView - 30, 25, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>4K (4:3) Wide - 30, 25, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>2.7K Wide - 120, 100, 60, 50, 30, 25, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>2.7K&nbsp;SuperView + Linear - 60, 50, 30, 25, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>2.7K (4:3)&nbsp;Wide + Linear - 60, 50, 30, 25, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>1440p Wide + Linear - 60, 50, 30, 25, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>1080p Wide - 240, 200, 120, 100, 60, 50, 30, 25, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>1080p SuperView + Linear - 120, 100, 60, 50, 30, 25, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>720p Wide + Linear - 60, 50 fps</li> \n </ul><p>It's waterproof up to 10 metres, fits all the same accessories and mounts as the Hero 5. It also has the same 1220mAh battery.</p><p>What's particularly interesting here is that it was the first GoPro with the built-in ability to analyse telemetry, audio and facial recognition clues and better choose the bits where action is happening. That means when it comes to creating a QuikStory, the camera should be better at choosing the important parts than previous cameras.&nbsp;</p><p>You can control Hero 7 using the buttons or touchscreen as normal, or use voice commands to get your camera to take photos, shoot video, just by telling it to.&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Read the full review:&nbsp;</strong><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/gopro/145781-gopro-hero-7-black-review-specs-video-stabilisation-4k\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">GoPro Hero 7 Black review</a></p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/134096-cameras-buyer-s-guide-best-gopro-which-gopro-should-you-choose-image15-2u6exsgwhu.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><h3>GoPro Hero 7 White</h3><p>squirrel_widget_148418</p>\n <ul> \n  <li>1440p video at 60fps</li> \n  <li>10MP stills</li> \n </ul><p>If you want a capable action camera without the expense, there's the GoPro Hero 7 White. It's discontinued currently, but even at launch it was half the price of its highest-spec sibling. It was launched in 2018, effectively taking the features from the 6-month-old Hero, and putting it in a new design.&nbsp;</p><p>It doesn't have 4K video recording, but it has many of the same features as the old Hero 5 Black. For instance, you get voice control, QuikStories, video stabilisation and waterproofing up to 10 metres. It even has the 3-mic noise reduction system. And, unlike the Session cameras it's replacing, it does have a screen, so you can see what you're filming and interact with the controls using its touch sensitivity. It lacks the small monochrome screen on the front, and the battery isn't removable though.&nbsp;</p><p>If you can live without the 4K resolution video, the 60fps 1080p capture from the stabilised Hero should be more than enough to capture your best outdoor exploits. Here are&nbsp;all the resolutions, frame-rates and FOVs available:&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li>1440p Wide - 60fps</li> \n  <li>1080p Wide - 60fps</li> \n  <li>15/1 burst rate 10MP stills</li> \n </ul><p>It's a much simpler offering from GoPro and one which should prove very easy to use for those thinking about trying out a GoPro camera if you can still find one.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/970x/assets/images/134096-cameras-news-buyer-s-guide-best-gopro-which-gopro-should-you-chooseimage11-u6et0bsbx1.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"427\" /></p><h3>GoPro Hero 5 Session</h3><p>squirrel_widget_148420</p>\n <ul> \n  <li>4K video up to 30fps</li> \n  <li>10m waterproofing</li> \n  <li>Tiny, portable design</li> \n </ul><p>The Session range is the ultra-portable set of cameras that's been discontinued, but they still make great options if you can find one. They cut down a little on features, but are surprisingly capable of producing great footage, despite their small size. The top of the range Session is the Hero5 Session, which launched alongside the Hero5 in 2016.&nbsp;</p><p>Like the Hero5, it's compatible with QuikStories and connects to the GoPro mobile app. It's waterproof to 10 metres, is Wi-Fi and Bluetooth equipped, and can shoot in all the modes you've become accustomed to: Photo, Burst Mode, Night Photo, Video, Looping, Time Lapse Photo, Time Lapse Video and Night Lapse Photo.</p><p>Video is stabilised, and wind noise is actively reduced using two mics on the exterior. You can even make use of the ProTune feature for more manual photo and video control. Here's a full list of available resolutions and FOVs.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li>4K Wide - 30, 25, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>2.7K Medium - 48, 30, 25, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>2.7K SuperView, Wide + Linear - 30, 25, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>2.7K (4:3) Wide - 30, 25 fps</li> \n  <li>1440p Wide - 60, 50, 48, 30, 25, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>1080p Wide -90, 60, 50, 48, 30, 25, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>1080p Superview + Linear - 60, 50, 48, 30, 25, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>1080p Medium + Narrow - 48, 30, 25, 24 fps</li> \n  <li>960p Wide - 100, 60, 50, 30, 25 fps</li> \n  <li>720p Wide - 120, 60, 50, 30, 25 fps</li> \n  <li>720p SuperView + Medium - 60, 50, 30, 25 fps</li> \n </ul><p>As well as all these features, you can make use of GoPro's Voice Control to take photos, shoot video or time lapses. As small cameras go, it's pretty advanced, and matches the Hero5 Black in almost every way. It's just cheaper and smaller and missing the touchscreen.&nbsp;</p><h3>Which GoPro should you buy?</h3><p>If you want the best of the best, the Hero 8 Black is the easiest recommendation. It doesn't just film 4K resolution at 60fps, it's waterproof, can do 240fps slow-mo at 1080p resolution, and has really impressive digital stabilisation during shooting. Overall image quality is great too.&nbsp;</p><p>With that said, the GoPro Max also makes a solid case for itself by not only offering high-end Hero performance, but also more advanced stabilisation and horizon levelling, plus 360-degree capture.&nbsp;</p><p>If you want high end recording abilities in as small a package as possible, the Hero 5 Session is a really great option, even if it is discontinued. It's compact, waterproof and can shoot at pretty much the same levels as the Hero 5 Black, and doesn't cost the earth.&nbsp;</p><p>Ultimately it comes down to weighing up what's important to you in an action camera. To read up more on GoPro and its products - including the Fusion - be sure to check out our <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/gopro\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">GoPro Hub</a>.&nbsp;</p> 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"Fantastic street artist transforms the world with incredible pixel art","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/instagram/148290-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-pixel-art","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"498\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/148290-cameras-feature-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-incredible-pixel-art-image1-5u83lidea7.jpg?v1\"> <p><a href=\"https://www.pappasparlor.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Johan Karlgren</a> is an incredible street artist with an eye for creating new views of the world with awesome pieces of pixel art.</p><p>This brilliant&nbsp;Swedish artist is essentially using the world as his canvas. Decorating the streets, coastlines and landscapes with handcrafted wonders.</p><p>He uses a mix of beads and ingenious imagination to craft incredible little pixel style visions of some of our favourite cartoon, gaming and TV characters from over the last few decades.</p><p>We've collated a gallery of our faves for you to enjoy, but be sure to <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/pappasparlor/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">check out his Instagram account</a> and follow him for more.</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/instagram/149858-this-incredible-photographer-creates-new-worlds-with-arts-and-crafts\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">This incredible photographer creates new worlds with arts and crafts</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/instagram/148290-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-pixel-art\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Fantastic street artist transforms the world with incredible pixel art</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148290-cameras-feature-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-incredible-pixel-art-image2-yvriug8b0d.jpg\" /></p><h2>Everywhere's a golf course</h2><p>The great thing about this tiny little pixel creations is a simple change of perspective and the smallest area of the world can seem enormous. This shot is a perfect example of that as a small strip of grass is turned into a personal golf course.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148290-cameras-feature-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-incredible-pixel-art-image1-jdlqy3i9bx.jpg\" /></p><h2>Zombies!</h2><p>Just when you thought things couldn't possibly get any worse, along comes a bunch of zombies. Though to be fair, at least you could just squash these chaps under foot.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148290-cameras-feature-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-incredible-pixel-art-image3-9sfwmhapv0.jpg\" /></p><h2>Sonic catching some waves</h2><p>Even Sonic the Hedgehog needs some downtime. Of course, our nifty little blue friend never slows down though. This shot shows him catching some waves in the middle of the urban jungle.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148290-cameras-feature-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-incredible-pixel-art-image4-q1zgz2jerp.jpg\" /></p><h2>Luigi in danger</h2><p>Luigi looks fairly cheerful considering he's plummeting off the side of the road into the waters below. Totalled automobile will be the least of his problems.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148290-cameras-feature-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-incredible-pixel-art-image5-kw5ectob3f.jpg\" /></p><h2>Guybrush Threepwood fishing</h2><p>Guybrush Threepwood is not above a good adventure. The star of the classic Monkey Island series of video games (that originally started in the 1990s) is seen here engaging in a casual spot of fishing. Why not? Adventuring is pretty exhausting and everyone needs a break now and then.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148290-cameras-feature-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-incredible-pixel-art-image6-zopiwgxo1j.jpg\" /></p><h2>Nevermind Mario</h2><p>What awesome pixelated display of classic video game characters would be complete without Mario?&nbsp;</p><p>Johan Karlgren, aka&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/pappasparlor/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Pappas Pärlor</a>, went even further with this one though, by using Mario to recreate the iconic cover of Nirvana's 1991 album Nevermind. The old plumber taking the place of the naked baby and the dollar bill being swapped for a mushroom.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148290-cameras-feature-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-incredible-pixel-art-image7-fz3cwvdbap.jpg\" /></p><h2>Cookie monster</h2><p>Some of this art almost creates itself. A blue overflow drain by the side of the road, quickly and easily transformed into the cookie monster with the addition of some wild eyes, a cookie and a single munching arm.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148290-cameras-feature-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-incredible-pixel-art-image8-otywec8jxi.jpg\" /></p><h2>Grumpy Cat</h2><p>Alas, the most famous feline to ever grace the web,&nbsp;Tardar Sauce (aka Grumpy Cat) passed away in May 2019. This pixel art recreation of her may well be a fitting tribute to the much loved pussy.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148290-cameras-feature-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-incredible-pixel-art-image9-qw8zoawfvx.jpg\" /></p><h2>Mario Kart in real life</h2><p>We all enjoy a spot of Mario Kart. Imagine if you could race on real beaches and turn the entire world into your race track. How much fun could you have? These chaps are certainly having a blast.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148290-cameras-feature-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-incredible-pixel-art-image10-ztv12tfowy.jpg\" /></p><h2>Mo tavernless</h2><p>Simpson's bartender Mo is rarely the happiest of chappies, but being without his tavern and forced to sell his wares on the street, he looks even more put out. We love the reimaging of Duff beer in pixel form though, bound to quench the thirst.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148290-cameras-feature-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-incredible-pixel-art-image11-izu13gzomp.jpg\" /></p><h2>Homer meme</h2><p>It's great to see the classic Simpson's meme recreated in wonderful pixel art - Homer Simpson backing carefully through a hedge to avoid the neighbours.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148290-cameras-feature-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-incredible-pixel-art-image12-a0y9efnt7g.jpg\" /></p><h2>Hulk smash</h2><p>Hulk smash! Even a tiny, tiny version of the green-skinned Marvel superhero packs a serious punch. We always enjoy seeing artists using <a href=\"https://www.cbsnews.com/news/jim-bachor-pothole-mosaics-street-art-that-fills-a-need/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">potholes to create artwork</a>. There are plenty of different ways these individuals create something cool out of an urban menace. This one might be one of our favourites.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148290-cameras-feature-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-incredible-pixel-art-image13-dxufuh08p3.jpg\" /></p><h2>OutRun</h2><p>Arcade-style racing game OutRun came out back in the hazy days of 1986, but it's still an iconic legend and sports visual that are instantly recognisable.&nbsp;Pappas Pärlor used his skills to create an awesome homage to the gaming classic <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/BvolWvVhB23/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">with a video</a> that makes it look like he's racing against the Ferrari in real life.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148290-cameras-feature-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-incredible-pixel-art-image14-zip7lynxgp.jpg\" /></p><h2>Sensei Splinter</h2><p>Mentor and trainer of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Sensei Splinter looks pretty impressive in this close up snap of him above ground guarding the entrance to his lair. It does look like he's casually dropped a cigarette butt though, we don't approve of smoking or littering.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148290-cameras-feature-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-incredible-pixel-art-image15-bki5r8ghc3.jpg\" /></p><h2>Robocop</h2><p>It seems like everyone is selfie obsessed these days. This spot of artwork does make us wonder what it might look like if Robocop was real and had his own Instagram account though.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148290-cameras-feature-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-incredible-pixel-art-image16-nzqxxqkopc.jpg\" /></p><h2>A different kind of ring</h2><p>It seems that Sonic's compulsive need to collect golden rings isn't limited to virtual ones he can catch as he runs through a gaming level. Crisps and ring-shaped cereal is also fair game.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148290-cameras-feature-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-incredible-pixel-art-image17-ohgjgcbimh.jpg\" /></p><h2>Finish him</h2><p>Mortal Kombat fighting legends Subzero and Skorpion have taken to numerous locations on the mean streets to battle it out and see who will be the victor. Who will be the first to pull off their finishing move?&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148290-cameras-feature-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-incredible-pixel-art-image18-2sro8cmjx6.jpg\" /></p><h2>Never eat yellow snow</h2><p>No Yoshi! Bad&nbsp;dinosaur! Don't eat yellow snow! Everyone knows you shouldn't eat yellow snow.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148290-cameras-feature-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-incredible-pixel-art-image19-ep4ykijprz.jpg\" /></p><h2>Ninja turtles surveying their surroundings</h2><p>While Sensei Splinter might be standing guard on the harsh streets, the Ninja Turtles are busy looking for the nearest place to grab a slice of pizza. Guessing by the looks on their faces, we're not sure they've found the right spot.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148290-cameras-feature-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-incredible-pixel-art-image20-7mq48l9msa.jpg\" /></p><h2>Vader's day a the beach</h2><p>Photos from Darth Vader's holiday snaps show that even one of the greatest screen villains of our time enjoys a little time by the shore. We'd love to know why he felt the need to take his lightsabre with him though.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148290-cameras-feature-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-incredible-pixel-art-image21-9brxumbgy0.jpg\" /></p><h2>Shark puddle</h2><p>Another pothole, another classic piece of artwork. This small section of the urban landscape has been transformed into a much more dangerous place to be. Jaws strikes again, only this time from the ankle-nipping shallows.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148290-cameras-feature-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-incredible-pixel-art-image22-36jafpdm2y.jpg\" /></p><h2>Spiderman just hanging out</h2><p>Spiderman,&nbsp;Spiderman, does whatever a spider can. Does he hang from some stairs? Yes does because he's&nbsp;Spiderman. A little light and a brilliant location shows off a wonderful vision of Spiderman like we've never seen before.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148290-cameras-feature-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-incredible-pixel-art-image23-nqax6ygwai.jpg\" /></p><h2>Genie in a bottle</h2><p>A bottle of beer might not be your classic haunt for a genie, but it is an interesting one. This vision of Aladdin's Genie brings back wonderful memories of the humour and acting talent of Robin Williams.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148290-cameras-feature-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-incredible-pixel-art-image24-dq8kmgjcry.jpg\" /></p><h2>Who ya' gonna call?</h2><p>Slimer is on the loose and the Ghostbusters gang have rocked up to sort him out and clearance the ghostly menace from the streets before he brings any harm to the local motorists.&nbsp;</p><p>We love the attention to detail&nbsp;Pappas Pärlor puts into his work. Little touches including the colours of the ghost traps and even&nbsp;Egon Spengler's spectacles make an appearance.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148290-cameras-feature-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-incredible-pixel-art-image25-12hkyxseci.jpg\" /></p><h2>Duck hunt dog</h2><p>That pesky dog! Cheeky rascal that he was. Popping up to tease us when we were busy blasting ducks in Nintendo classic Duck Hunt. We thoroughly enjoyed seeing him reimagined for VR in <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/ar-vr/reviews/143202-duck-season-review-let-s-game-like-it-s-1989\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Duck Season</a>&nbsp;and we equally love seeing him recreated in pixel art too.&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 18 taken","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/141531-29-of-the-most-famous-alien-and-monster-photographs-ever-taken","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"532\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image1-zfk8c3uxvr.jpg?v1\"> <p>Since the dawn of time, the human race has seen mystery and intrigue around every corner. Mysterious events have been put down to the supernatural, the paranormal and even the extra-terrestrial.</p><p>One things for sure, there have been a lot of unexplained mysteries over the centuries and with modern technology giving people greater access to photography and previously unexplored parts of the galaxy, there are bound to be plenty more cropping up.</p><p>We've tracked down some of the most famous alien and monster photographs ever taken to show just how weird and wonderful the world can be.</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/141224-the-most-famous-ghost-photographs-ever-taken\" rel=\"follow\">The most famous ghost photographs ever taken</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/134235-the-best-astronomy-photographs-that-are-out-of-this-world\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">21 of the best astronomy photographs that are out of this world</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image2-lh39diqkwc.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1190\" /></p><h2>The Loch Ness Monster (565 AD)</h2><p>Nessie is the fabled creature that famously inhabits Loch Ness in Scotland. This monster might well be the oldest of the unexplained mysteries on our list as the earliest reports of sightings date back to 565 AD.</p><p>Since that time, plenty of people have claimed to see the monster of the Loch but there have also been many false sightings, hoaxes and misidentifications that have included everything from trees to natural gases.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image3-gw85pldi4m.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1600\" /></p><h2>An ancient visitor from outer space? (15th Century)</h2><p>This painting by Domenico Ghirlandaio of \"the Madonna with Saint Giovannino\" dates back to the 15<sup>th</sup> Century and seemingly shows an Unidentified Flying Object (UFO) hovering in the background.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>It might be a bit of a stretch, but some have theorised that it's not a mistake in the painting or a cloud in the sky because if you look carefully, you can see a man standing below staring up at the object.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image4-dhkv85snfx.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1200\" /></p><h2>The Tunguska event (1908)</h2><p>In June 1908, a massive explosion happened near the Stony Tunguska River in Russia. The explosion flattened 770 square miles of forest, toppling around 80 million trees and yet somehow resulted in no loss of human life.</p><p>It has been theorised that the Tunguska event, as it has been designated, was caused by an air bursting meteoroid but no one really knows for sure. There was no impact crater, so the conjecture is simply that it broke up in the atmosphere somewhere between three and six miles above the Earth's surface. The explosion is calculated to have been 1,000 times greater than that of the atomic bomb dropped on Hiroshima, Japan.</p><p>The Tunguska event has since lead to much discussion about <a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asteroid_impact_avoidance\" rel=\"\">asteroid impact avoidance</a>, a growing fear of <a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Extinction_event\" rel=\"\">extinction-level events</a> and has helped to spawn a multitude of science fiction films.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image5-z1lay604fx.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"2130\" /></p><h2>Ectoplasm séances (1912)</h2><p>During the 19<sup>th</sup> and 20th Centuries, spiritualism took a grip on society with many people believing that mediums could help communicate with the dead. Fraudsters took to manipulating their audiences with a variety of tricks and illusions aimed at duping them out of their hard-earned cash.</p><p>Strong favourites at the time came in the ability to produce convincing ectoplasm, apparitions and manifestations that couldn't easily be explained by the average person. In this photo, Marthe Béraud apparently conjures an inexplicable light between her hands and ectoplasm above her head. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image6-ytx0ainrvc.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1215\" /></p><h2>The Hinterkaifeck massacre (1922)</h2><p>In the depths of Bavaria, Germany, in 1922 a horrific massacre took place where six people including women and children were murdered with a farming implement. There were several things that turned this tragic event into an unexplained mystery and a crime that was never solved.</p><p>A suspect was never found, despite over 100 people being questioned. There were several rumours about the farmstead being haunted and the attacks also happened shortly after the arrival of a new maid (who was also killed).</p><p>Each of the victims was apparently lured to the barn where they were killed one by one. The events were even more sinister when evidence was unveiled that suggested the murder(s) stayed in the house for several days after committing the crime before disappearing. Decades later, a multitude of investigations have been carried out with no further results.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image7-fk3wqb8jbx.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1138\" /></p><h2>The time travelling hipster (1941)</h2><p>There are a fair few stories and legends of time travellers throughout history. The most popular so far has proven to be this image from 1941 taken at the re-opening of the South Fork Bridge, British Columbia.</p><p>The picture apparently shows a man in modern clothing and wearing sunglasses in an era when most people were sporting suits. Though there have been many <a href=\"http://www.snopes.com/photos/supernatural/hipster.asp\" rel=\"\">arguments and explanations</a> which counter the theory it's still wildly popular on the internet.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image8-trcpcb6kjk.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1293\" /></p><h2>The Battle of Los Angeles (1942)</h2><p>Shortly after the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbour, in the early hours of the morning 25 February 1942, an unidentified aircraft was spotted in the skies above Los Angeles. Fearing another attack, military forces fired over 1,400 anti-aircraft shells into the sky and apparently hit nothing.</p><p>Photographs from the event appeared to show a flying saucer-like object hanging in the sky and caught in the military searchlights. Of course, the Government denied the sighting and put it down to weather balloons.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image9-x8rfv3deyq.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"900\" /></p><h2>SS Ourang Medan (1947)</h2><p>This legend from the high seas comes from June 1947 when two American ships received a distress call from the SS Ourgan Medan. Sent in Morse code, the message read \"S.O.S. from Ourang Medan * * * we float. All officers including the Captain, dead in chartroom and on the bridge. Probably whole crew dead * * *.\"</p><p>The American ships went to offer aid but when they boarded the SS Ourgan Medan they found the crew were all dead, sprawled on their backs, mouths agape with no visible signs of injury. A fire then broke out on the distressed ship forcing the rescuers to abandon it before it exploded and sunk taking all evidence with it. What happened to the ship and crew remains a mystery.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image10-qucjhb57sl.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"515\" /></p><h2>The McMinnville UFO photographs (1950)</h2><p>In May 1950, a series of photographs were taken by Paul Trent at his farm near McMinniville, Oregon in the United States. These images appeared to show a metallic disk-shaped object moving slowly in the skies above the farm.</p><p>The event was witnessed by Paul Trent and his wife Evelyn. Despite many arguments that the <a href=\"https://www.debunker.com/trent.html\" rel=\"\">photographs were fake</a>, the two witnesses maintained their statements that images were genuine right until their deaths in the late 1990's.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image11-ot05aflnqx.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1050\" /></p><h2>The great alien reconnaissance (1952)</h2><p>In 1952 multiple air traffic controllers from several airports and air force bases near Washington D.C. reported seeing unidentified blips on their radar screens. When questioning local pilots, the controllers were told that a number of \"bright lights\" had been seen in the sky nearby.</p><p>The next weekend, it happened again, this time with a dozen blips appearing on the radar screens. Fighter jets were scrambled to intercept but were unable to match the speed of the unidentified flying objects. These sightings were added to list being investigated by the Government under <a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_Blue_Book\" rel=\"\">Project Blue Book</a> but nothing further was revealed.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image12-wmzvg1szfy.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1265\" /></p><h2>The Dyatlov Pass incident (1959)</h2><p>In 1959, in the depths of the Ural Mountains of Russia, an experienced group of trekkers died under mysterious circumstances which were never adequately explained. Investigators discovered that the victims had cut a hole through their tent and run away from something while wearing minimal clothing despite the temperatures being around -30 degrees Centigrade.</p><p>A number of the victims died from hypothermia but some had inexplicable fatal injuries including a fractured skull, major chest fractures and one victim had brain damage despite no visible injury to their skull. Another of the victims was found with major injuries as well as missing tongue, eyes and lips. Several theories have been offered as to what caused the hikers to run and what eventually killed them, but none have been conclusive and their deaths remain a mystery.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image13-2xdx7oypgc.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1066\" /></p><h2>The Babushka Lady (1963)</h2><p>In 1963, President John F. Kennedy was assassinated while riding in his motorcade in Dallas, Texas. Many conspiracy theories and wild claims have centred around the events of that day. Perhaps the least known of which relates to this woman nicknamed \"the Babushka lady\" (thanks to&nbsp;the headscarf she can be seen wearing in photographs).</p><p>Based on images taken from that day, the woman can be seen pointing a camera at the President's car at an angle that would have captured essential footage. Despite this, the woman apparently never came forward and the images from her camera have never been seen.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image14-xz0repqhds.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"2354\" /></p><h2>The Solway Firth Spaceman (1964)</h2><p>While on a day trip to Burgh Marsh in Cumbria, England, Jim Templeton took several photographs of his daughter, one of which, when developed appeared to show a man in <a href=\"https://drdavidclarke.co.uk/secret-files/the-solway-spaceman-photograph/\" rel=\"\">a white space suit standing behind her</a>. Jim swears there was no one else in the shot, but critics claim the photo is likely to be his wife overexposed in the background.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image15-lqg1s7uhny.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"2248\" /></p><h2>The Hook Island sea monster (1964)</h2><p>While on a boat trip with his family in the summer of 1964, Robert Le Serrec saw a creature in the Australian waters that appeared monster like in size. Described as being around 80 feet in length, with serpent-like features and eyes on top of its head, the creature quickly became known as the Hook Island monster.</p><p>Many <a href=\"https://blogs.scientificamerican.com/tetrapod-zoology/the-amazing-hook-island-sea-monster-photos-revisited/\" rel=\"\">theories have debunked the photograph</a> as being either fake or staged, but the myth lives on.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image16-2qqhsyr1vn.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1891\" /></p><h2>Bigfoot (1967)</h2><p>Bigfoot is a legend that dates back as far as 1867 with several people reporting seeing giant, \"wild men\" wandering the forests and mountains of the Pacific Northwest parts of the United States and Canada.</p><p>In 1967, filmmakers Roger Patterson&nbsp;and Robert&nbsp;Gimlin&nbsp;captured the most famous and well-known footage of Bigfoot in existence. Its authenticity has been in much dispute in the decades that followed, but there's certainly something compelling about it.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image17-caw3d82sqx.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1974\" /></p><h2>The Falcon Lake Incident (1967)</h2><p>Another year, another story about a UFO sighting. This time from Manitoba, Canada, where Stefan Michalak apparently saw an unidentified alien craft land nearby when he was out prospecting for gold and silver.</p><p>Stefan approached the craft and apparently heard human-like voices muffled by the engines. He went close enough to poke his head inside the craft and saw \"a maze of lights\" within. He was then startled when the craft took off and injured by a beam of heat that shot from the ship. The heat set fire to his clothes and severely burnt his chest. Doctors and authorities could not explain his injuries and this added credence to his story which he repeated in interviews until his death in 1999.&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image18-ur2mquzjox.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1607\" /></p><h2>NASA Lunar Pyramid (1972)</h2><p>In 1972, Apollo 17's mission to the moon came back with several photographs from near Geophone Rock. This photo was marked by NASA as \"blank\" but when enhanced appears to show what looks like a pyramid on the moon.</p><p>This later led to many conspiracy theories that NASA was hiding what was really up there.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image19-jrsn6o4quc.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1129\" /></p><h2>The face of Mars (1976)</h2><p>Another NASA related mystery, this time centres around Mars and comes thanks to another photo snapped from outer space. Here, the Viking 1 spacecraft captured photos of Mars' surface that appeared to show a face looking back at the spaceship from the ground.</p><p>More recent photographs with higher resolution lenses have given a clearer picture of the area and now NASA has concluded it may just be a Mesa. This hasn't stopped popular opinion concluding it's a sign of life on Mars.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image20-idjmr7a83u.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"900\" /></p><h2>The Phoenix Lights (1997)</h2><p>The Phoenix Lights event was probably the biggest known report of UFO sightings in history. On a single day in March 1997, thousands of people reported seeing lights above them in the skies over a 300-mile range through the American Southwest.</p><p>Witnesses claimed to have seen a huge V-shaped UFO passing overhead and making no sound as it moved. No reasonable explanation was offered as to the cause of the sightings and further reports of the UFOs came again in 2007 and 2008.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image21-iqenpxyhoc.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1775\" /></p><h2>The Black Knight satellite (1998)</h2><p>There is a myth among UFO conspiracy theorists and enthusiasts that an alien satellite exists and has been in Earth's orbit for around 13,000 years.</p><p>The so-called \"Black Knight\" satellite theory is based on a series of different stories around items of unknown origin orbiting our planet and extra-terrestrial radio signals being picked up on Earth. NASA and other space organisations claim the sightings and photographs are more likely to be space debris or remains of our satellites.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image22-pkpfrubh23.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"2720\" /></p><h2>The Myakka Skunk Ape (2000)</h2><p>The Myakka Skunk Ape is by most accounts a distant relation Bigfoots. This large ape-like creature has been spotted many times over the years with the earliest sightings dating back to the 1960's but more recently it has also been caught multiple times on video.</p><p>The Skunk Ape mostly inhabits regions of Florida and got its name due to the stink that often accompanies its sightings. Sceptics of the sightings say that it's far more likely to be misidentification of other wildlife including local black bears. Much like the footage of Bigfoot, recordings and photographs of the Skunk Ape are often shaky, low-quality or taken from an extreme distance.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image23-5dwb27q3dr.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1100\" /></p><h2>Juvenile Bigfoot (2007)</h2><p>In September 2007, Rick Jacobs placed a motion sensing camera in a tree along the game trails of Pennsylvania. This camera later captured multiple images which appear to show some bears being chased off by an ape-like creature which resembled a juvenile Bigfoot. &nbsp;</p><p>Several witnesses have claimed to see Juvenile Bigfoot over the years, describing them as walking on four legs (unlike Bigfoot who is usually seen on two legs) which have led to them being dismissed as fake or likely to be another animal misidentified.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image24-nkrzmpucob.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1071\" /></p><h2>The&nbsp;Hessdalen lights&nbsp;(2007)</h2><p>Over the valleys of Hessdalen in central Norway, a series of unexplained lights regularly appear through the day and night. Sometimes the lights appear for over an hour, sometimes they're there for just a few seconds. They're a regular occurrence and have had many UFO theorists claiming the lights to be of extra-terrestrial origin.</p><p>Scientists, however, have attributed the lights to a chemical and electrical reaction caused by the different metals and minerals in the local hillside reacting with the environment. Though it's not quite as exciting, it's certainly pretty.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image25-yklprow2rd.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1088\" /></p><h2>The Raystown Ray (2007)</h2><p>Another body of water said to contain an aquatic monster is the Raystown Lake in Huntingdon, Pennsylvania. Here, a creature not too dissimilar to the Loch Ness Monster has been spotted and photographed many times over the years.</p><p>Much like Nessie, there's not much proof beyond photographs taken from a distance that prove or disprove the existence of the creature, but it's certainly a popular local legend.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image26-mgdsxvbvgc.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1200\" /></p><h2>The Hubble Pyramid (2008)</h2><p>From around 1999, the Hubble telescope was pointed at the moon and captured a number of images. One of these photographs, never officially released by NASA, appears to show a pyramid on the surface.</p><p>This is the second sighting of a pyramid-like object on the moon, the first being captured during Apollo 17's mission, but neither has been accurately explained or had its authenticity confirmed by the authorities. Thus, the mystery of the moon pyramids continues.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image27-yrtlviscpd.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"900\" /></p><h2>The Baltic Sea anomaly (2011)</h2><p>In 2011, a Swedish diving team discovered a mysterious formation on the bottom of the Baltic Sea. Sonar imagery appeared to show a strange disc-like object 60 meters in diameter with many unusual characteristics that include a long runway running up it, a stairway at the side and a light soot covering.&nbsp;</p><p>Explanations for the object have included everything from a crashed UFO to a naturally occurring geological formation. It has even been likened to the Millennium Falcon from Star Wars. Not much else is known about the object, though it is purported that it could be as much as 140,000 years old.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image28-tpdelnigcr.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1198\" /></p><h2>The death of Elisa Lam (2013)</h2><p>In 2013, Elisa Lam was staying at the Hotel Cecil in Los Angeles. She went missing during her stay and was later discovered in the water tank on the hotel's roof. There were several unusual facts about the case which made it mysterious, including a video released by the LAPD of her getting into a lift, pressing multiple buttons and apparently trying to hide from someone.</p><p>Access to the hotel roof was blocked at the time of her death and both toxicology and coroner reports showed no visible trauma or reason for her passing. Though her death was officially labelled as \"accidental drowning\" there have been many other theories that include her being victim to a serial killer.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image29-l8ykojd4qq.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"845\" /></p><h2>The Portuguese Chupacabra (2016)</h2><p>The legend of the <a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chupacabra\" rel=\"\">Chupacabra</a> finds it roots in the Americas, where a creature is said to wander the lands attacking and killing livestock and drinking the blood from their remains. Reports of Chupacabra have since come from all over the world and in 2016 a video was captured in the Portuguese desert.</p><p>The video appears to show a man-like beast walking through the desert and then disappearing behind a bush. Much like all the videos of Bigfoot, the footage is long-distance and low quality, so we'll leave it up to you to judge its validity.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image30-bx8lubysdg.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1600\" /></p><h2>Unexplained Mars object (2017)</h2><p>There are a few images of Mars which have raised questions about whether there was once life on Mars or indeed whether there still is.</p><p>In 2017, the Mars Curiosity Rover <a href=\"https://mars.nasa.gov/mer/gallery/all/1/p/348/1P159077009EFF40DPP2594L7M1.HTML\" rel=\"\">captured an image</a> which appears to show an unidentified object on the surface of Mars. Doubters have suggested it's merely debris from the Mars Rover itself, but the conspiracy theorists take this image as proof of the existence of extra-terrestrial life.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image1-73rfnahwui.jpg\" /></p><h2>The hospital demon</h2><p>This blurry scene apparently came from a camera feed over a hospital bed. It's a bit hard to see, but seems to show a small demonic like creature walking across the bed. Creepy.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 30 Apr 2020 16:00:00 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/141531-cameras-feature-unexplained-mysteries-and-paranormal-events-image1-zfk8c3uxvr.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"80bb4149fdd2c3cd930fc84cac6d168b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn55@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-36-51-973_d4f6e8ad1f471fbd.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":532,"sourceBytes":87944,"destBytes":56738,"author":"Adrian
