7-14-408_dbb0cd66cb2c1ab3.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image44-ge5m4iauct.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn34@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-37-04-706_cf2220c4878c10f5.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image43-tbrchd0ode.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn65@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-37-08-283_75ade4b3788b681b.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image42-tvdbayr0do.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn89@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-05-222_10d950bb34cdebc0.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image41-raxscz1yhp.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn36@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-37-18-218_4a619aaccc0e89fd.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image40-5oujvyenr0.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn22@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-37-08-012_dd4c28b73499159b.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image39-7tw6fn5mzj.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn87@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-36-54-005_a3db6c553d548497.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image38-bco5aqiqeu.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn78@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-37-10-531_b0fafc4678db3180.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image37-swlvdct3pz.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn60@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-27-092_84230c657999db48.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image36-jmuhii5bvk.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn85@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-37-23-747_c703a828e678995b.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image35-31xzywfwju.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn20@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-36-56-370_c1890d0b490fe0f7.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image34-woqtqp1azh.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn39@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-36-53-986_5e0917c7359cd35f.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image33-3zezud7jkt.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn64@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-36-59-801_8fe96ce31c5db167.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image32-lcaoj17iqj.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn20@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-37-16-186_eddf77d8ca54430c.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image31-wa1fi6trt3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn71@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-37-25-829_dab7315e69e00ab5.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image30-sb2na86mqt.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn65@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-01-444_e1b1c6c7aeed83df.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image29-lva8fezw2i.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn10@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-37-24-130_f180e8bc043ddc29.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image28-qv3sbgkho9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn75@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-37-18-339_03c289e0202b5fb8.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image27-lr69anv5qh.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn23@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-37-07-065_7256305da790fc08.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image26-m1abofwtsh.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn68@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-37-16-612_8a2dd3bd8674b689.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image25-s8bxt4zt0d.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn21@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-12-877_2ce15ab7b95ffc46.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image24-hujarsmkfq.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn30@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-37-09-481_13bda7fa56d8014a.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image23-gptlsztjwm.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn91@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-36-59-262_f16f556a875048f3.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image22-8qahutmcbr.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn67@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-17-373_f1c87a4b4e744c89.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image21-htm4x3bld7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn81@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-37-11-685_a3f7c0806ee365b6.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image20-vblf6dxl5p.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn50@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-10-447_5b3640ef2da5bc06.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image19-ohelekl1xg.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn6@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-37-03-654_1d89cd83e9bfd6e8.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image18-7kiruax5zy.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn28@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-36-56-318_d143283660098fd7.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image17-vjconfpzmt.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn57@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-37-08-924_29791e767ced1796.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image16-6inyvsz0qz.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn44@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-36-58-923_7d5f3c68d7e43c79.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image15-eb0bdqykim.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn13@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-01-943_dc0f8cf44aad3103.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image14-rmr53owkin.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn39@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-36-59-556_705707859910f881.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image13-sxuultffcl.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn88@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-37-26-587_ace7fdb756de7eeb.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image12-4cufuy0op5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn92@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-36-56-750_357e1394c72ec711.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image11-kpshzut8om.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn5@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-12-784_2f5dbf9db0c90e96.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image10-jyaddp5lvj.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn38@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-37-13-818_761595abd4af4bc7.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image9-halsokchd1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn27@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-37-26-314_59977fb9e0f35b38.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image8-ds0irfs4vd.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn27@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-37-26-861_e2cba728e1d10323.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image7-ggj8diywo4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn71@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-19-102_3c6af0bbeafe4c72.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image6-xtnr7mcpwh.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn31@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-37-18-798_c67e810f6889b028.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image5-8y51oxziia.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn71@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-36-59-166_e4e8fed918d7688a.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image2-jga0ix1egm.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn19@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-37-17-080_3c52e0e0aa260e3d.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image2-ancphpq9hs.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn48@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-36-55-135_cfe554342944e79d.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/142413-apps-feature-art-and-science-collide-the-best-in-modern-space-art-image1-npimsu74fx.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn62@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-37-04-103_247bd4ae82b23a6c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209020},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"Best compact cameras 2020: The best point-and-shoot-cameras available to buy today","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/buyers-guides/120768-best-point-and-shoot-compact-cameras-to-buy-today","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"427\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/120768-cameras-news-buyer-s-guide-best-compact-cameras-2020-the-best-point-and-shoot-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image1-ghbuqiaxmk.jpg?v1\"> <p>There are lots of things to think about when choosing a new compact camera – what do you want to use the camera for? Perhaps you want a versatile, all-rounder for a vacation or travelling. Maybe you want a camera with a bonkers-long zoom?</p><p>Here at Pocket-lint we've been cutting through the abundance of compact camera releases over recent years, including the creme de la creme of last year's models and earlier, as relevant.</p><p>We've broken down our list of great compacts into sub-headed categories to make things easier to digest. You name it, we've got you covered.&nbsp;So without further ado let's guide you through the top compact cameras to save you time when it comes to buying one from your local shop or online.</p><h2>Best do-it-all compact</h2><p class=\"align-center\"><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/120768-cameras-buyer-s-guide-best-compact-cameras-2019-the-best-point-and-shoot-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image1-fgxltmfatb.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><h3>Panasonic Lumix TZ90 / SZ70</h3><p>squirrel_widget_140940</p><p>Panasonic's TZ-series has long been a favourite and the Lumix TZ90 (SZ70 in the USA) is one of its top-end do-it-all compacts (although it has been replaced by the altogether similar TZ95). It even has a built-in electronic viewfinder to the rear, which is helpful to see an image direct to the eye when sunlight makes the rear screen tough to see.</p><p>The TZ90's premier feature is its 30x optical zoom lens, which encompasses wide-angle (24mm equivalent) for those group shots, or can zoom right in (to a 720mm equivalent) to make far-away subjects appear large in the frame. There are more advanced cameras in this TZ series (the TZ200 springs to mind) but they tackle different feature sets.</p><p>With decent autofocus, excellent image stabilisation, a tilt-angle LCD screen for selfies, and a whole roster of other top features, the TZ90's aspirations make it the one-stop shop for all things. The only downside, really, is limitations to low-light image quality and.&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Read our full review:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/panasonic/140940-panasonic-lumix-tz90-review-the-ultimate-travel-camera\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Panasonic Lumix TZ90 review</a></p><h2>Pocket power</h2><p>When it comes to something small and pocketable, but where image quality needs to be a step above a conventional small-sensor compact or smartphone, there are various models to choose from. Such cameras tend to have shorter zoom lenses in order to retain best sharpness and clarity, while offering more advanced optical features such as wider maximum aperture for better low-light shooting or creating that pro-looking, soft-focus background effect.&nbsp;</p><p class=\"align-center\"><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/120768-cameras-buyer-s-guide-best-compact-cameras-2019-the-best-point-and-shoot-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image2-f8qowtmtlh.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><h3>Canon PowerShot G7 X II</h3><p>squirrel_widget_137555</p><p>The big sell of the G7 X Mark II is its larger-than-typical sensor. It's called a 1-inch sensor (note: not a physical measurement), meaning larger on-sensor pixels that can better digest light for clearer image results.</p><p>Although the G7 X II doesn't opt for the smaller scale of the Sony RX100 series (further below) and there's no viewfinder, there's still a lot to enjoy about Canon's revamped take on the 1-inch market. Plus the price is within reach rather than super-high like Sony's advanced offerings.</p><p>This G-X series camera outshines the slender <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/canon/135492-canon-powershot-g9-x-review-touching-the-void\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">G9 X</a>, is more pocketable than the earlier <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/canon/135491-canon-powershot-g5-x-review-chunky-but-comprehensive-compact\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">G5 X</a> and others in the range, without compromising on the performance front.</p><p><strong>Read our full review:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/canon/137555-canon-powershot-g7-x-mark-ii-review-nip-and-tuck-triumphs\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Canon PowerShot G7 X II review</a>&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/120768-cameras-buyer-s-guide-best-compact-cameras-2019-the-best-point-and-shoot-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image3-hwhmusnucv.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><h3>Panasonic Lumix LX15 / LX10</h3><p>squirrel_widget_138718</p><p>The Panasonic Lumix LX15 is high-end, but comes minus the highest-end price point. It's a significant chunk of cash less than the Sony RX100 (further below), and competitive against the Canon G7 X Mark II (above) too.</p><p>Crucially the LX15 comes with a best-in-class lens: a 24-72mm f/1.4-2.8 equivalent, which will help to open up creative possibilities. That wide aperture at the wide-angle setting means plenty more ability when it comes to low-light conditions.</p><p>There's even an aperture control ring, a nod to the earlier LX7 model from years gone by, to simplify controlling the camera. Add a touchscreen, great autofocus abilities and a stack of other top-end features, including 4K video capture, and there's almost nothing we don't like about the LX15... except its odd name (we'd have opted for LX10, as it is called in the USA).&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Read our full review:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/panasonic/138718-panasonic-lumix-lx10-lx15-review-the-best-high-end-compact-camera-money-can-buy\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Panasonic Lumix LX15 review</a></p><h2>Superzoom without the scale</h2><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/120768-cameras-buyer-s-guide-best-compact-cameras-2019-the-best-point-and-shoot-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image4-xdkoaz03zn.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><h3>Panasonic Lumix TZ100 / ZS100</h3><p>squirrel_widget_136159</p><p>Now here's an odd one out, as you can probably tell from looking at the TZ100's small scale (or ZS100 in the USA). Superzoom, you say? Well it kind of is, kind of isn't. This pocketable camera combines a large 1-inch sensor, similar to that of the FZ2000 (further down the page), but condenses the lens to a 10x optical zoom with a more limited aperture range, in a body that's more akin to the TZ90 (further up the page).</p><p>Now while that combination doesn't mean it's a stand-out camera for shooting almost everything under the sun, if you're after top quality and a decent zoom range then there's not really anything else on the market just yet that can match it – except, that is for the TZ200 and it's 15x optical zoom lens!&nbsp;– so long as you have expectations in check with what the lens can achieve due to its aperture limitations.</p><p><strong>Read our full review: </strong><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/panasonic/136159-panasonic-lumix-tz100-review-imaging-liberation-meet-lens-limitation\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Panasonic Lumix TZ100 review</a></p><h2>Best advanced / enthusiast compact camera</h2><p>Here's where compacts step up a gear. Whether it's all the bells and whistles in the form of hands-on controls, a built-in viewfinder, or a large sensor for optimum quality, there are all kinds of advanced compacts to suit different tastes and purposes. But these typically bigger wedges of camera are not only larger, they tend to demand a more considerable asking price too.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/120768-cameras-buyer-s-guide-best-compact-cameras-2019-the-best-point-and-shoot-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image5-f0xgpvs1gy.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><h3>Sony Cyber-shot RX100 V</h3><p>squirrel_widget_139172</p><p><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/sony/135882-sony-cyber-shot-rx100-iv-review-still-the-compact-to-beat\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The Sony RX100 series</a> has gone from strength to strength and in its Mk5 format it's a camera that, at this size, pretty much has it all.</p><p>It's small scale enough to be pocketable, yet has a premium build, a pop-out built-in electronic viewfinder and stacks of features&nbsp;– not to mention great image quality and 4K movie capture from its 1-inch sensor and 24-70mm f/1.8-2.8 equivalent lens.</p><p>If pocketable is priority then this is one of the best options out there. It's a tour de force. And can be found for pretty reasonable prices lately too.</p><p><strong>Read our full review:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/sony/139172-sony-rx100-v-review-impressive-but-resting-on-its-laurels\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Sony Cyber-shot RX100 V review</a></p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/120768-cameras-buyer-s-guide-best-compact-cameras-2019-the-best-point-and-shoot-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image6-vnapzmqgzg.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1067\" /></p><h3>Sony Cyber-shot RX100 VI</h3><p>squirrel_widget_145815</p><p>We've left the Mk5 model (above) in this mix as it's quite a different beast to the RX100 Mk6. This newer model breaks the mold for the series by extending the lens yet further for greater versatility.</p><p>You'll need deep pockets though – and not on account of its size, simply because its £1,150 asking price is mega. It's a great camera that's worth it for the right buyer. Although there's now a Mk7 model available too, the VII, which brings the series even more up to date.</p><p><strong>Read our full review:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/sony/145815-sony-rx100-vi-review-compact-camera-m6\" rel=\"\">Sony Cyber-shot RX100 VI review</a></p><p class=\"align-left\"><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/120768-cameras-buyer-s-guide-best-compact-cameras-2019-the-best-point-and-shoot-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image7-4fcnmowk92.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><h3>Panasonic Lumix LX100 MkII</h3><p>squirrel_widget_145441</p><p>The original Panasonic LX100 was like the company's LX15 (further above) on steroids. It was the first compact camera to feature a large Micro Four Thirds sensor – the same size you will find in top-of-the-line interchangeable lens models&nbsp;– for exceptional image quality. That's a bigger sensor than the Sony RX100 series (also above), delivering equal or better quality overall, more similar to a <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/buyers-guides/124653-best-mirrorless-cameras-budget-to-high-end-mirrorless-lens-cameras-to-buy\" rel=\"\">mirrorless system camera</a>.</p><p>The second-generation model here isn't massively different to the first, meaning it maintains those physical retro dials, giving that chunky metal body plenty of personality. There's an autofocus system that will see off a whole range of compact camera competitors, a fast 24-75mm f/1.7-2.8 equivalent lens, and brilliant electronic viewfinder. Although there's no tilt-angle screen, which we think is a shame, it does offer the power of touch control.</p><p><strong>Read our full review:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/panasonic/145441-panasonic-lumix-lx100-mark-2-review-camera\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Panasonic Lumix LX100 M2 review</a></p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/120768-cameras-buyer-s-guide-best-compact-cameras-2019-the-best-point-and-shoot-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image8-jfg8vm61cb.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"498\" /></p><h3>Canon PowerShot G1 X Mark III</h3><p>squirrel_widget_142548</p><p>Canon's answer to the Panasonic LX100 (above). The G1 X Mark III crams in an APS-C sensor – which is the same size as you'll find in the company's DSLR cameras – for the utmost in image quality.</p><p>In one sense, we love the G1 X III. Considering the sensor is that big, the camera itself is small&nbsp;– far smaller than the Mark II model (which had a smaller sensor!). It's hugely capable when it comes to image quality.</p><p>But there's a caveat: the 24-72mm f/2.8-5.6 equivalent lens quickly drops down the aperture range, so you'll often be shooting at higher sensitivities when using a little bit of zoom. Sometimes that can counter some of the quality that can be extracted from this otherwise great camera. Plus the autofocus, while decent, isn't as advanced as the Sony RX100 series.</p><p><strong>Read our full review:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/canon/142548-canon-powershot-g1-x-mark-iii-review-can-this-compact-truly-replace-a-dslr\" rel=\"\">Canon G1 X Mk3 review</a></p><h2>Best superzoom</h2><p>When normal compacts just aren't enough and you want to zoom in on those far-away subjects to make them appear large in the frame, a superzoom&nbsp;– sometimes called bridge camera&nbsp;– is just the ticket. Safari, bird spotting and so forth are well matched to a superzoom camera.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/120768-cameras-buyer-s-guide-best-compact-cameras-2019-the-best-point-and-shoot-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image9-akwbglygda.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><h3>Panasonic Lumix FZ330</h3><p>squirrel_widget_134561</p><p>Typically as a zoom lens extends the amount of light it lets in drops, which potentially means image quality can suffer in low-light conditions. Not so with the Panasonic Lumix FZ330: its wide-angle 24mm lens extends all the way through to a 600mm equivalent, all the while maintaining a maximum f/2.8 aperture. And that's been managed without significant impact to the model's relatively trim scale.</p><p>This f/2.8 aperture means more light can enter, which is ideal for faster exposures to capture action or to avoid using those less desirable higher ISO sensitivities.</p><p>As <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/panasonic/72947-panasonic-lumix-dmc-fz200-superzoom-camera-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the replacement for 2012's FZ200</a>, the FZ330 adds a touchscreen and ups the ante in the viewfinder resolution stakes too. It's still dependent on a 1/2.3in sensor size, however, so don't expect complete and utter miracles in the image quality department – for that you'll want a larger yet sensor, as found in something like the FZ2000 (see below).</p><p><strong>Read our full review:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/panasonic/134561-panasonic-lumix-fz330-superzoom-gets-even-more-serious-hands-on\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Panasonic Lumix FZ330 review</a></p><h2>Best premium superzoom</h2><p>If you want that little extra from image quality, while achieving significant zoom, then you'll need to fork out some extra cash for a larger sensor model. The current range is a fight between Panasonic with its FZ1000 and FZ2000 models and Sony with its RX10 Mark III and Mark IV.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/120768-cameras-buyer-s-guide-best-compact-cameras-2019-the-best-point-and-shoot-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image10-u8fzwloc0t.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"501\" /></p><h3>Sony RX10 III</h3><p>squirrel_widget_138844</p><p>The earlier <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/sony/136120-sony-cyber-shot-rx10-ii-review-one-serious-superzoom\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">RX10 II</a> was by no means a disappointing camera, but the RX10 III takes its only real flaw – its lack of zoom reach – and tosses it out the window, thanks to its 24-600mm f/2.8-4.0 equivalent optic.</p><p>The result is a bridge camera with a 1-inch sensor that offers a stunning level of flexibility and versatility all from the one lens. If you're ok with the body's big scale, anyway.</p><p>Many bridge cameras feel like jacks of all trades, masters of none, but Sony has produced one that truly masters most areas of stills and video photography.</p><p>There's also an RX10 IV, which enhances autofocus capability, if you want to stretch even further and spend a little more cash.</p><p><strong>Read our full review:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/sony/138844-sony-rx10-iii-review-a-camera-for-all-seasons\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Sony Cyber-shot RX10 Mark III review</a>&nbsp;</p><h2>The camcorder-beater</h2><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/120768-cameras-buyer-s-guide-best-compact-cameras-2019-the-best-point-and-shoot-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image11-ltkhju1dom.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><h3>Panasonic Lumix FZ2000</h3><p>squirrel_widget_138720</p><p>The FZ2000 is certainly a big and pricey superzoom, but its premium position is justified for the right kind of user. And with its significant push towards video features, including 4K capture and an abundance of high-end features, that will be for both photographers and videographers alike.</p><p>When a normal superzoom won't cut it, the FZ2000's has two things that stand out: enhanced image quality from its 1-inch sensor and an internally focusing lens, which means the optic doesn't physically move throughout its 24-480mm equivalent range.</p><p>If you've been looking for a do-it-all body and aren't fearful of a DSLR scale, then as a stills camera there's plenty on offer in the FZ2000. If video is more your thing then we think the FZ2000's considerable capabilities paints a red cross on the door of the enthusiast camcorder market too.</p><p><strong>Read our full review:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/panasonic/138720-panasonic-lumix-fz2000-review-premium-superzoom-premier-league\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Panasonic Lumix FZ2000 review</a>&nbsp;</p><h2>Best fixed-lens compact cameras</h2><p>When money is no barrier and quality is everything, there's a camera for that. DSLR sensor sizes in compact bodies and, typically, a fixed lens (no zoom) that's matched up to its respective sensor for best possible image quality. Here's where the compact goes pro - and these special specimens don't just match DSLR quality, they often better it.</p><p class=\"align-left\"><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/120768-cameras-buyer-s-guide-best-compact-cameras-2019-the-best-point-and-shoot-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image12-hu9sjbhaty.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><h3>Fujifilm X100F</h3><p>squirrel_widget_140051</p><p>Fujifilm has stormed the high-end compact market with the X-range, and the X100F keeps the bar high, upping the resolution and design compared to the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/fujifilm/131959-fujifilm-x100t-review-naughty-but-niche\" rel=\"\">previous X100T model.</a></p><p>The X100F isn't going to be suitable for a huge audience as there's no zoom and its retro aesthetic is a specialist thing in itself – but that, in some regard, is all part of what makes this high-end compact so appealing.</p><p>It's not the model to pick if you're into close-up macro shooting by any means, as wide apertures render soft images in such situations, but what really sells the X100F is the unique-to-Fuji hybrid optical and electronic viewfinder. And now that comes with a fantastic \"electronic rangefinder\" option for even more accurate manual focus.</p><p>That may all sound bonkers, but it's not: think of a wider-than-100-per-cent optical viewfinder with all the bells and whistles of an electronic overlay and that's what the X100T delivers. You can see beyond the frame's edges to help capture the shot at that decisive moment.</p><p>Image quality from the fixed 23mm f/2.0 lens – that's a 35mm equivalent when paired with the APS-C sensor – is so crisp from f/4.0 and below, in part thanks to Fujifilm's own special colour array design and the fact there's no low-pass filter to bypass light diffusion for heightened sharpness. It's perfect for those candid street photography snaps.</p><p><strong>Read our full review:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/fujifilm/140051-fujifilm-x100f-review-fixed-lens-finery\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Fujifilm X100F review</a>&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/120768-cameras-buyer-s-guide-best-compact-cameras-2019-the-best-point-and-shoot-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image13-xkqysu7khf.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><h3>Fujifilm X70</h3><p>As much as we've got a lot of love for the X100 series, the smaller-scale Fujifilm X70 actually pips it in terms of preference for us. This 28mm (equivalent) fixed lens compact is like a more pocketable, wider-angle, slightly more consumer focused aid to the X100T.&nbsp;</p><p>Although we'd like a more detailed and faster autofocus system, and are in two minds about the lack of viewfinder, the X70 is otherwise a champion addition to the X-series. It's really all about the image quality, which is why we suspect X100T fans and, to some degree, newcomers will be rushing out to buy this wide-angle wonder.</p><p>If you're looking for something more flexible then the Panasonic LX100 (further up the page) is probably the route to go down, not that both models are distinctly comparable.</p><p><strong>Read our full review: </strong><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/fujifilm/136161-fujifilm-x70-review-wide-angle-wonder\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Fujifilm X70 review</a></p><h2>Best full-frame compact camera</h2><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/120768-cameras-buyer-s-guide-best-compact-cameras-2019-the-best-point-and-shoot-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image14-yzgpsklv3r.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><h3>Leica Q / Q2</h3><p>squirrel_widget_134816</p><p><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/sony/73057-sony-cyber-shot-rx1-full-frame-compact-camera-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Originally it was the Sony RX1 which held this spot</a>, as the original fixed-lens full-frame compact camera. Ok, so <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/leica/134816-leica-q-review-the-best-fixed-lens-full-frame-compact-ever-made\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the Leica Q</a> isn't particularly \"compact\" and its £2,900 price tag certainly isn't small (if you can find one – they're sold out almost everywhere), but its 28mm f/1.7 lens is so out-of-this-world that it has to take the crown.</p><p>It's not a compact for everyone, of course, with that price tag indicating so. But its huge full-frame sensor, which is the same size as found in pro-spec DSLR cameras, is paired with a lens so sharp that its results are incredible. Nope, there's no zoom, but in-camera 35/50mm crop modes go some way to help.</p><p>There's a built-in electronic viewfinder (a 3.86m-dot LCOS one, no less) which is wonderfully high resolution, but it ought to activate a little quicker for street work. Add surprisingly speedy autofocus with touchscreen control and&nbsp; this is every bit the Leica for a new generation.</p><p>Sure, it's not a mass market product, as is the case with any fixed-lens camera. But whether you're a staunch Leica fan, or simply a photography fan, the Q is that rare Leica that will transcend users old and new. There's also a follow-up Q2 model, which we're yet to review.</p><p><strong>Read our full review: </strong><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/leica/134816-leica-q-review-the-best-fixed-lens-full-frame-compact-ever-made\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Leica Q review</a></p> /24/23-36-56-933_6244fbf19271f575.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/120768-cameras-buyer-s-guide-best-compact-cameras-2019-the-best-point-and-shoot-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image7-4fcnmowk92.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn13@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-37-04-519_b0e5d426442552bb.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/120768-cameras-buyer-s-guide-best-compact-cameras-2019-the-best-point-and-shoot-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image8-jfg8vm61cb.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn24@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-36-53-973_47933904d67fb4f8.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/120768-cameras-buyer-s-guide-best-compact-cameras-2019-the-best-point-and-shoot-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image9-akwbglygda.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn21@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-37-22-325_411e338f090eec2a.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/120768-cameras-buyer-s-guide-best-compact-cameras-2019-the-best-point-and-shoot-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image10-u8fzwloc0t.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn82@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-37-05-127_c7900549265f6da2.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/120768-cameras-buyer-s-guide-best-compact-cameras-2019-the-best-point-and-shoot-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image11-ltkhju1dom.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn37@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-37-25-172_5bda2729f6bce312.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/120768-cameras-buyer-s-guide-best-compact-cameras-2019-the-best-point-and-shoot-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image12-hu9sjbhaty.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn54@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-37-05-630_2a955718ddd0ecf7.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/120768-cameras-buyer-s-guide-best-compact-cameras-2019-the-best-point-and-shoot-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image13-xkqysu7khf.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn58@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-03-191_970be502bf023211.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/120768-cameras-buyer-s-guide-best-compact-cameras-2019-the-best-point-and-shoot-cameras-available-to-buy-today-image14-yzgpsklv3r.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn44@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-37-26-112_7727451a1b979878.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209019},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"Fujifilm X100V review: The fixed-lens champion","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/fujifilm/151739-fuji-x100v-review-fujifilm","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"499\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/151739-cameras-review-fujifilm-x100v-review-image1-m6ezeivnuw.jpg?v1\"> <p>For years Fujifilm has been making the finest fixed-lens cameras in its X100 series. These street photography cameras are certainly specialist - given the retro styling, unusual viewfinder, and lack of zoom - but there's nothing else that can compete in this class.</p><p>Back in February 2020, around two-and-a-half years after the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/fujifilm/140051-fujifilm-x100f-review-fixed-lens-finery\" rel=\"\">release of the X100F</a>, Fujifilm revealed an eagerly-awaited update: the X100V. So what's new for this fixed-lens camera that might attract you to buy one?</p><h2>Is the X100V's design new?</h2>\n <ul> \n  <li>Adds 4K video</li> \n  <li>New ergonomic grip</li> \n  <li>New lens construction</li> \n  <li>Adds touchscreen controls</li> \n  <li>Adds vari-angle bracket for screen</li> \n  <li>Adds weather-sealing (requires adapter ring &amp; filter, sold separately)</li> \n  <li>26.1-megapixel X-Trans CMOS IV sensor (new generation ups resolution from 24MP)</li> \n </ul><p>While Fujifilm hasn't gone back to the drawing board for the X100V - in that it looks much the same as the X100F - there are some nips and tucks. According to the original press release, the grip has been redesigned. But having now handled the camera, we can't find any noticeable difference with it. No biggie, though, as the subtle curve of this grip works just fine for a camera that doesn't have a massive lens on the front.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151739-cameras-review-fujifilm-x100v-review-image1-umz2ji7zpr.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><p>A much bigger change is that the LCD screen can now flip out away from the body, up to 90-degrees vertically, or about 30-degrees facing downward. This has been implemented really nicely, without excessive bulk, just a little nub to the side of the screen to aid in pulling it away from the camera body. Or leave it in a fixed position, as the choice is yours.</p><p>There's also the prospect of weather-sealing. You'll need to attach the AR-X100 adapter ring and PRF-49 protection filter to achieve that resistance, none of which comes in the box. We think Fujifilm should have gone all-out in making the X100V sealed straight out of the box really. Although such sealing won't be an essential for everyone.</p><h2>Anything missing?</h2>\n <ul> \n  <li>Lens is still a bit noisy</li> \n  <li>Close-focus sharpness limitations</li> \n  <li>No exposure compensation dial lock</li> \n </ul><p>Front-on and the X100V looks identical to earlier X100F. Some changes in moving controls have taken place around the back to accommodate the bracket-mounted screen, but in general you're getting the same fairly large scale compact and all the goodness that brings.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151739-cameras-review-fujifilm-x100v-review-image1-ea50oj8q21.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"498\" /></p><p>We looked back over our X100F review from 2017 and it's clear that the X100V takes many minor complaints we had back then and solves them. For example: that bracket-mounted screen now includes touch control, bringing this camera into the modern world of hands-on operation. There's also 4K video, should that be your thing.</p><p>It's only really with the exposure compensation dial where nothing has changed. It still can't be locked into position, which sees ours spin into the wrong position from time to time. Not the end of the world, but it'd be great to see this solved.</p><h2>How does the X100V handle?</h2>\n <ul> \n  <li>23mm Fujinon single focal length lens (equates to 35mm), f/2.0-f/16 aperture with ring control</li> \n  <li>Hybrid optical/electronic rangefinder-style viewfinder unique to this camera series</li> \n  <li>35mm (equivalent) focal length; 50/70mm (equivalent) crop options available</li> \n  <li>425-point autofocus system</li> \n </ul><p>At first glance you might think the X100V's lens is identical to its predecessors. In many regards it is: the focal length, a 35mm equivalent, is the very same. So is the f/2.0 maximum aperture and manual control ring. The difference lies in the construction: although the eight elements arranged in two groups remains the same, two of those elements are now aspherical (in the X100F it was just one molded ASPH element).</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151739-cameras-review-fujifilm-x100v-review-image1-srjo861nsp.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"498\" /></p><p>Why is this useful? Aspherical lenses are a more oval shape and help to deliver a 'flatter' image appearance because the lens doesn't bulge in a spherical way. This will, for example, make for more natural portraits from a relatively wide-angle lens. The new lens is also said to be capable of resolving higher resolution, delivering lower distortion, and focusing closer to subjects - all things that we've wanted from this series in the past. Yay.</p><p>However, the close-focus distance of the X100V is the very same as the X100F, at up to 10cm from lens. And if you're shooting with a wide open aperture then you still won't be able to resolve crisp detail in such close-up shots. There's nothing to stop you shooting at f/2.0 but close-to-lens subjects won't be sharp, even if they're within the focal plane, <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/fujifilm/151739-fuji-x100v-review-fujifilm\" rel=\"follow\">delivering a milky 'halo' as a result</a>. The camera doesn't warn of this - it's just something you have to learn as you go.</p><p>Still, as high-end compact cameras go, we love the X100V. It's a camera like no other - in looks and operation - and we've always had such a soft spot for this camera series. Drop the aperture for f/4.0 and you'll squeeze a lot more sharpness potential out of it. Coupled with the large sensor size that still enables shallow depth of field control no problems.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151739-cameras-review-fujifilm-x100v-review-image1-fesbgtplqi.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"498\" /></p><p>The autofocus system also offers a huge spread of focus points throughout the screen's breath, and with the ability to adjust their size they function in a fairly pinpoint fashion. Of the 425 autofocus points, there's a 117-point option, while combination of phase-detection and contrast-detection systems makes for good performance. The more sensitive points are outlined as distinct, larger squares so you know what's what.</p><p>However, the lens is quite noisy when shifting focus. The mechanical sounds are reminiscent of a miniature printer seeking out its ink.</p><p>The addition of optional touch control is really handy, especially with the screen tilted outward for waist-level work. You may not go using the screen that much though. It's the viewfinder that really sells the X100V. It's always been the pinnacle of this camera series: offering a wider-than-100-per-cent optical view, so you can predict what's coming into the frame, thanks to a digital border outlining the edges of the shot you're about to capture. Just make sure you're keeping a keen eye on that digital white outline - as that's where the picture magic happens.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151739-cameras-review-fujifilm-x100v-review-image1-8g7qxisz5g.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><p>When adjusting to the 50/70mm crop options, that digital border moves - you'll see it get smaller within the view, to represent the new capture area. Parallax adjustment is also catered for in this situation, which means the frame edge will move accordingly if you've focused on a closer subject (necessary given the different placement of the viewfinder window and through-the-lens alignment to the sensor) to accurately focus on what you intend.</p><p>A flick of the X100V's finder switch - which is positioned towards the front - opens up an in-camera rangefinder-style preview window to the bottom right corner, which can be used to view the whole frame, or 2.5x or 6.5x magnification, to see exactly what you're doing. Flick the finder switch the other way and the whole viewfinder goes fully electronic - which can be handy, as it means zero parallax error (everything is operating through-the-lens) - but we far prefer the more fluid vision of the optical viewfinder with its electronic overlay. It's a thing of beauty.</p><h2>What's the X100V's image quality like?</h2>\n <ul> \n  <li>26.1-megapixel X-Trans CMOS IV sensor</li> \n  <li>ISO 160 - 12,800 (80 - 51,200 ext.)</li> \n  <li>4-stop ND filter built-in</li> \n </ul><p>The X100V doesn't lavish the image sensor with lots more resolution compared to its predecessor. The bump from 24- to 26-megapixels is all you're getting for this generational jump. But that's a sensible approach: overloading the sensor with too many 'pixels' would mean they would be smaller and less able of gathering light.</p><p>As it stands the X100V can deliver exceptional quality, but it's situationally dependent. As we've pointed out prior, a lens and sensor combination such as this can't handle close-up focus with a wide open aperture. Even if you're shooting 30cm from the lens you won't want to shoot wide open at f/2.0 - we'd suggest stopping down at least once stop to deliver the best possible crispness.&nbsp;</p><p>The sensor has an wide-ranging sensitivity, although it begins at ISO 160, which isn't necessarily the best pairing with such a wide aperture lens. Thankfully there's an extended ISO setting, but more usefully - in order to maintain the dynamic range of the image data - is the built-in neutral density (ND) filter, which can step in for up to four stops.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151739-cameras-review-fujifilm-x100v-review-photos-image1-3pojwjo6v8.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><p>We've found the lower sensitivities to deliver crisp and colourful images, although when pushing into four-figure numbers the precision detail isn't quite as present (a number of ISO 2500 examples show this). Not that you'll capture lots of image noise within a frame thanks to the large sensor and processing abilities. The lens really is great, assuming the subject is just far enough away.</p><p>Another potential perk with the X100V is the leaf shutter within the lens. This opens in an outward-from-centre motion, rather than upward focal-plane motion, which means much higher flash sync speeds are possible. It's great for catching flash-lit subjects while causing the background to not receive the same degree of lighting and, therefore, provide a darker appearance - like the subject is highlighted beyond it, even in outdoor scenes.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151739-cameras-review-fujifilm-x100v-review-photos-image1-fgbxpi4nbq.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><p>During times of lockdown it's rather hard to test a camera, but on our evening exercise sessions we've been stopping to quickly shoot market stalls, flowers and such like - all hands-off - to get a greater understanding of how the new lens fares. We must say that distortion is very low, so in terms of setting up those perfectly straight-line shots the X100V is ideal. Sharpness dwindles only a little towards the edges, which is very impressive.</p><p>Overall, this is a specialist camera designed for a particular and meticulous way of working. If that suits you down to the ground then, well, prepare to be blown away with the overall quality that you'll be able to get - and the process of getting there.</p> src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image1-oyzsp4buna.jpg?v1\"> <p>There's a certain breed of IT worker who has a deep fetish for all things neat and tidy.</p><p>The result is a server room with hundreds of cables neatly organised, cable-tied and manipulated into perfect angles. Not only is the outcome aesthetically pleasing, it's also technically practical.&nbsp;</p><p>We've collected some of the best images of these masterfully neat cables for you to enjoy. Perhaps some inspiration while you're stuck indoors with nothing better to do?</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image2-s5mdouitey.jpg\" /></p><h2>Retro gaming setup</h2><p>Perhaps the neatest gaming setup you've ever seen. This image not only features some next level cable management, it also includes all manner of retro gaming machines. Don't believe us? Just take a look at the shelf above the TV.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image3-2aznyuoxgo.jpg\" /></p><h2>Subtle gaming setup</h2><p>This neat gamer went entirely the other way with their cable management. Going as far as installing not one, but two gaming machines on the back of their TV and keeping all the cables nice and neat and out of sight. Seems like a great way to sneak a new device into the house without your other half noticing as well.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image4-4lqippw67m.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1065\" /></p><h2>National Energy Technology Laboratory</h2><p>This cable porn comes from the National Energy Technology Laboratory, part of the U.S. Department of Energy. It's good to see that even Government bodies take cable management seriously.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image5-ew35s4cgk1.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1068\" /></p><h2>Barcelona Super Computer</h2><p>This super-computer is a superb work of art, you can tell this setup means serious business.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image6-acdu40plxh.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"2133\" /></p><h2>Pathtrack install</h2><p>This copper colour wiring seems to give the impression of metal pipework and electrical/data wiring coming together in perfect unison.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image7-ylt8wsahzk.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"977\" /></p><h2>Micro wiring</h2><p>This neat wiring could easily be present in your phone or tablet. Tiny attention to detail ensuring the best results from our digital world.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image8-idom05ezpt.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1067\" /></p><h2>Tiny circuit board wiring</h2><p>This tiny circuit board wiring shows that cable management is a fine art, even at the tiniest level.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image9-hrk2jpldgb.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1200\" /></p><h2>Braided cables from CERN</h2><p>It's no surprise that CERN, the European Organization for Nuclear Research, needs some serious cabling to keep their research running.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image10-pszkoeye5x.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"635\" height=\"849\" /></p><h2>Purple paradise</h2><p>Thick batches of purple cable neatly line the walls of this rack. Even the internet can't be calmed by simple neat cabling and zip ties.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image15-w48dhbljtf.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"2844\" /></p><h2>Up to the heavens</h2><p>This is some seriously impressive wiring, wiring that even God would be proud of. A tubular mass of wires take all the data up through the ceiling to where it's needed.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image16-lh7zeuqmnq.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1459\" /></p><h2>Stairwell pipe-chase</h2><p>This overhead pipework is pleasantly neat and easy on the eye. We wonder how many people take the time to stop and look up when walking down these twisting corridors.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image17-wtd2l9myci.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"2133\" /></p><h2>Purple rainbows</h2><p>These neat and arching cables clearly took hours of meticulous work to put together. You have to admire the handiwork and the dedication to cable perfection.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image18-rg2x5ahns4.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1196\" /></p><h2>German efficiency</h2><p>This cabling and pipework dates back to the 1930's and hails from Germany. It's no surprise to see the Germans being as efficient with their pipework as they are with everything else. Everything in its place and a place for everything.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image19-svcruipkx2.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"2133\" /></p><h2>Curvaceous cabling</h2><p>You have to admire this curvaceous cabling, magnificent lines and a high attention to detail.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image20-47bgyuqjcd.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"2843\" /></p><h2>Baby Rack</h2><p>It might be tiny compared to some of the other racks we've seen, but the cabling here is still impressive.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image21-ndqj5o4x02.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"2133\" /></p><h2>Insane cable management</h2><p>Another neat snap of perfectionist level cable management. Again, this one had Redditors arguing about whether there were enough cable ties being used or too many.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image22-vyopbdz6ue.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"2845\" /></p><h2>The internet</h2><p>This photo is simply labelled \"the internet\" but despite the neatness, we're not too sure there are enough cables here to hold the whole internet.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image23-zxz3m7efk9.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"899\" /></p><h2>All the colours of the internet</h2><p>Wonderful domestic wiring captured in a simple photo of a number of ethernet cables neatly arranged on their journey from the home broadband router.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image24-zvslwuypdm.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"2133\" /></p><h2>Video routing needs neat cabling too</h2><p>Even video streaming and routing needs neat cabling. This Redditor is understandably impressed with their work and with good cause too.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image25-71ykq3argr.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1058\" /></p><h2>Cable management is an art</h2><p>Seeing this cable management, Redditor Bitwaba commented \"Cable management is an art, but if to maintain it you have to be an artist, then you're making it more complicated than it should be.\" This single comment sums up almost all the photos in this article.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image26-zhp37amkqh.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"2155\" /></p><h2>A rainbow of cables</h2><p>This Redditor attempted to create a rainbow out of their cabling and the outcome is as neat as it is colourful.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image27-1smgvdewrk.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"900\" /></p><h2>Small but neat</h2><p>This wiring is from a self-built PC and shows the dedication to cable management and neatness these enthusiasts have when building their own machines.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image28-rynxzfqak7.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"910\" /></p><h2>Google's TensorFlow Cloud Service</h2><p>A photo from behind the scenes at the inner workings of Google's mammoth machine. This wiring is part of the machinery used for machine learning, so you can imagine the data that passes through these wires.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image29-pxgkrs0w6h.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"2846\" /></p><h2>Mean green cable machine</h2><p>We're green with envy. This insanely neat cabling is a joy to behold.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image30-fsaoxs7oht.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"2142\" /></p><h2>Mellow yellow</h2><p>Bright yellow cabling curls and curves in satisfying ways, taking data off to where it's needed most.</p><p><img pleasure</h2><p>Neat and tidy cables don't just belong in the workplace, here a piece of ethernet cabling has been turned into a work of art rather than just an eye-sore.</p><p><img you</h2><p>To the keen eye, this cabling boasts both Velcro ties and zip ties to keep the cables neat and tidy and drive the cable porn enthusiasts insane.</p><p><img wiring racks help keep these neat cables out of view at this datacenter which you could argue is a shame, but it's certainly neat and practical.</p><p><img cable</h2><p>This multi-core power cabling shows that even power cables can be neatly organised.</p><p><img snap of a mobile broadcasting van captured at the London Marathon. Exposed wiring and innards no doubt help with air flow and cooling during the hot days.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image36-fpvtdqlx0r.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1600\" /></p><h2>Top down cabling</h2><p>Neat cabling with curves flows down like a waterfall of data. Magnificent and intricate.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image37-cpxqst6ky9.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"2133\" /></p><h2>Pipework to be proud of</h2><p>Neatness isn't just for cabling. The organisation of this pipework is as admirable as it is beautiful.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image38-yqa5seaml0.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"2829\" /></p><h2>Digital TV wiring</h2><p>This is what it looks like when someone with a high attention to detail wires an apartment building for digital television signals all originating from a single dish.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image39-gyjqfh7mpw.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"904\" /></p><h2>The Cat5-o'-9-Tails</h2><p>A bored network admin has turned some CAT5 cable into a cat o' nine tails. This photo gives a whole new meaning to the term \"cable porn\".</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image40-nlvutpinr2.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"2829\" /></p><h2>Purple cable porn</h2><p>This magnificent purple cabling is likely co-axial cables neatly arranged on the inside of a mobile broadcasting truck. A magnificent feat of cabling and tremendous use of cable ties.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image41-35p2qcxmfn.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"2133\" /></p><h2>Cable or candy?</h2><p>This colourful wiring could just as easily be mistaken for candy cane.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image42-tzrj8ruqwd.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"2133\" /></p><h2>Contrived conduits</h2><p>This beautiful pipework made its way onto Reddit under /r/conduitporn/ and shows that it's not just wiring that people get obsessive about.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image43-iptqhpivn3.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"2844\" /></p><h2>Electric meter neatness</h2><p>This is a transformer rated electric meter for a 2000 Amp service. A neat piece of work by the installer on a powerful bit of kit.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image44-zlapt7ifbq.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"942\" /></p><h2>Cables as art</h2><p>This one looks more like a work of art than a photo of technology it's just that neat and tidy. There's no denying the symmetry is pleasing to the eye.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image45-0xbg7u6j2c.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1066\" /></p><h2>The seriously neat server room</h2><p>Photographer Alejandro Cynowicz says he hates cables, but their company takes the matter of neat cabling extremely seriously.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image46-eyptqzhrlf.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"1001\" /></p><h2>The neat green machine</h2><p>This sort of cabling gets the wiring nerds arguing about what a nightmare it would be if a single cable needed replacing.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image47-rh9pgkl82w.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"2133\" /></p><h2>Colourful completion</h2><p>You can almost feel the satisfaction of a job well done when looking at this photo taken at the end of a completed cabling mission. Neat and tidy and everything in its correct place.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image48-l2i65v9beu.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"2142\" /></p><h2>Mapped out cable art</h2><p>This work of cable art looks like someone tried to map out the London underground using power cables and wall tacks.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image49-hycsp2luqm.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"997\" /></p><h2>Neat and colourful</h2><p>When airflow is important, there's even more value to neat wiring than just being easy on the eye.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image50-grkiustgz5.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1404\" /></p><h2>More mellow yellow&nbsp;</h2><p>There seems to be a theme with these cable enthusiasts with a passion for yellow cables.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image51-aif9exnoyq.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1070\" /></p><h2>Barcelona Super Computer</h2><p>Super-computing in Barcelona is serious business.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image52-xwoqadujcs.jpg\" /></p><h2>Before and after</h2><p>Many of these images feature some seriously neat cabling, but you rarely get to see any insight into the level of effort that goes into these photos. Well, now you can as this Redditor has shown off what the cable mess looked like originally before they \"fixed\" it. This fine craftsmanship took six hours of human effort to complete.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image53-9akhg1zffy.jpg\" /></p><h2>PC gamers do it best</h2><p>As PC gamers and <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/laptops/news/144012-how-to-build-and-upgrade-your-own-gaming-pc\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">builders ourselves</a>, we can always appreciate a bit of neat cable management when it comes to a gaming PC build. This Redditor is clearly a master of sleeved cables and zip ties. It's stunning.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image54-1la7duqeod.jpg\" /></p><h2>A musical instrument</h2><p>Where most of these tidy cable images involve great swathes of cables being neatly tied and bundled together, this one went the other way. This image comes from Facebook's offices and shows a cable setup that looks like it could be played like a musical instrument.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image55-belexiqsgq.jpg\" /></p><h2>The Cloud</h2><p>Is this what the cloud really looks like? A magnificent view of cable heaven.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image56-gdgp9at6qn.jpg\" /></p><h2>TV production levels of awesome</h2><p>This incredibly beautiful cable view shows a mass of cables being used at a&nbsp;large TV production facility. A total of 576 ports filled with all the necessary neat cables.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image1-8wyp0dqhbw.jpg\" /></p><h2>Service loops</h2><p>Some might argue that this is unnecessary and some of it could have been done out of sight, but we have to admire the craftsmanship of these service loops. Wonderfully neat and organised cables separated and controlled in the most magnificent of ways.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image1-cdfozufupy.jpg\" /></p><h2>Four days of work</h2><p>This impressive mass of cables apparently took Reddit user T---Ham four days to put together this neatly. He said there were at least&nbsp;378 cables in this setup and his hands were raw by the end, but oh boy was it worth it.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image1-sdcghkf71m.jpg\" /></p><h2>Attention to detail</h2><p>From massively neat and satisfying cable constructions down to tiny works of art like this. Cable management beauty is everywhere. This photo shows the results of a fine piece of working hardware modding a PlayStation 2.
