x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image38-yqa5seaml0.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn62@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-37-00-479_e893967c3792f82a.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image39-gyjqfh7mpw.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn3@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-36-56-791_31e894d6584651f9.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image40-nlvutpinr2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn1@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-37-00-955_32020dd59e47e9b7.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image41-35p2qcxmfn.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn65@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-37-05-755_d3594579d7c9d170.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image42-tzrj8ruqwd.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn52@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-36-55-405_55b3963e337fa06b.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image43-iptqhpivn3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn73@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-37-03-270_9bee0b737c2e59d0.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image44-zlapt7ifbq.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn20@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-36-53-982_005e552074408b21.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image45-0xbg7u6j2c.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn87@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-37-25-867_d828345096cbeed3.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image46-eyptqzhrlf.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn28@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-37-17-068_de47354bd8630746.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image47-rh9pgkl82w.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn74@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-37-05-160_02996a752f1385f4.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image48-l2i65v9beu.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn18@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-11-038_14e5d7c438f42eb9.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image49-hycsp2luqm.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn10@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-37-26-570_aebce06e26f25bf7.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image50-grkiustgz5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn97@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-37-04-372_39c6fc715105780c.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image51-aif9exnoyq.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn4@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-37-15-161_29e93582f0efbc1a.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image52-xwoqadujcs.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn8@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-37-15-257_1c7bb1287d5cc904.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image53-9akhg1zffy.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn84@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-36-53-987_15c8dfad2e7bd02e.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image54-1la7duqeod.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn72@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-36-54-177_71b29c62018d240c.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image55-belexiqsgq.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn91@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-37-26-550_c462f0582a0460c3.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image56-gdgp9at6qn.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn25@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-37-05-516_57f90ac469e2ec9e.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image1-8wyp0dqhbw.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn66@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-37-07-427_626390bda7eb3e4f.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image1-cdfozufupy.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn20@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-37-26-103_e3bdfb0b6527c1e2.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/141628-cameras-feature-ocd-cable-porn-image1-sdcghkf71m.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn45@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-37-00-566_24aa568e8cdd55f3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209021},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"Eve Cam goes on sale, the first indoor camera for HomeKit Secure Video","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/smart-home/news/150661-eve-cam-is-first-indoor-security-camera-made-for-apple-homekit-secure-video","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"499\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/150661-smart-home-news-eve-cam-is-first-indoor-security-camera-made-for-apple-homekit-secure-video-image1-jrms4yod2p.jpg?v1\"> <p>Originally announced at the start of the year, Eve Systems has put its Eve Cam on sale at last and it'll ship on June 23.&nbsp;</p><p>The $150/150 Euro <a href=\"https://www.evehome.com/en/eve-cam\" rel=\"\">Eve Cam</a> is the first indoor security camera made for Apple's <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/smart-home/news/apple/129922-apple-homekit-and-home-app-what-are-they-and-how-do-they-work\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">HomeKit</a> Secure Video system.</p><p>Apple HomeKit Secure Video means that activity captured by the camera is analysed by your home hub - an Apple TV, for example - and then either discarded if it's just a pet going about its daily business or recorded and stored for free in iCloud if it's a person. You can also choose to store everything if you wish.&nbsp;</p><p>The footage is stored for up to 10 days and doesn't count towards your iCloud storage space. Notifications will pop up on your iPhone to tell you that events have occurred.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/smart-home/buyers-guides/133631-best-smart-plugs-intelligent-outlet-plugs-for-your-smarthome\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Best smart plugs: Google, Alexa and Apple HomeKit control</a></li> \n </ul><p>Keep a close eye on your home around the clock. Receive rich notifications on your iPhone immediately when something is up in your home – and protect the privacy of your personal space in the process.&nbsp;</p><p>The camera itself is a compact Full HD camera with a 150-degree ultrawide field of view. It's capable in day or night, with infrared night vision kicking in when the lights are off, and an integrated microphone and speaker means you can communicate with whoever is in the room - to surprise intruders, for example, or tell the kids their dinner is ready.</p><p>It comes with a magnetic camera base and can be installed on a shelf or wall.</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/smart-home/buyers-guides/131155-best-indoor-smart-home-cameras-see-inside-your-home-anytime\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Best indoor security cameras: See inside your home anytime</a></li> \n </ul><p>The&nbsp;Eve Water Guard has also recently gone on sale&nbsp;- a HomeKit-enabled leak detector for your home.</p><p>squirrel_widget_261982</p><p>&nbsp;</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 03 Jun 2020 14:40:00 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/150661-smart-home-news-eve-cam-is-first-indoor-security-camera-made-for-apple-homekit-secure-video-image1-jrms4yod2p.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"7d80d914bf49447df13f65f44dbcb7c7","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn15@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-36-51-454_b3dd5a8221d236a3.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":499,"sourceBytes":53975,"destBytes":21782,"author":"Rik Henderson","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/150661-smart-home-news-eve-cam-is-first-indoor-security-camera-made-for-apple-homekit-secure-video-image1-jrms4yod2p.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn15@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-36-51-454_b3dd5a8221d236a3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209017},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"Fujifilm X-T4 mirrorless camera can crank out 15 frames per second","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/fujifilm/151222-fujifilm-x-t4-15fps-official","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"498\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/151222-cameras-news-fujifilm-x-t4-mirrorless-camera-image1-c9qmufopt4.jpg?v1\"> <p>Fujifilm's X-T series has just raised the bar with the release of the fourth-gen model, the X-T4. So what's new in this forthcoming mirrorless camera?</p><p>First thing's first: the X-T4 features the same sensor and processor <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/fujifilm/145646-fuji-xt3-review-fujifilm\" rel=\"\">as the earlier X-T3</a> - that's a 26-megapixel X-Trans CMOS IV, if you're wondering - meaning the image quality potential between the two cameras is one and the same.</p><p>Where the X-T4 steps things up is in a few main areas.</p><p>First, it's got a new in-body stabilisation system, said to support for up to 6.5 stops, paired with a new shutter system that's capable of shooting up to 15 frames per second (15fps).</p><p>Second, there's a new battery system. The cells are far more capacious than the outgoing model, which means they're longer-lasting, but also larger as a result - therefore the X-T4 is about 10 per cent bigger and heavier than the X-T3.</p><p>Third up, the video mode - or movie mode, if you prefer - has its own dedicated switch to activate. This takes the camera into movie-only functionality, with a dedicated silent menu if you need to change settings. Plus the Full HD (1080p) mode can now shoot at 240fps for one eigth slow-mo (the 4K mode remains at 60fps, if you want Ultra-HD instead).</p><p>That's the X-T4 in summary. If you want to know more about the camera then <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/fujifilm/151202-fujifilm-x-t4-review\" rel=\"\">take a look at our full hands-on preview of the camera</a>, which we saw ahead of its official unveil.</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><strong>READ: <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/fujifilm/151202-fujifilm-x-t4-review\" rel=\"\">Fuji X-T4 review</a></strong></li> \n </ul><p>squirrel_widget_188716</p><p>&nbsp;</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 26 Feb 2020 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/151222-cameras-news-fujifilm-x-t4-mirrorless-camera-image1-c9qmufopt4.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"0c1a5784ea470ce259ee7b3148ceb8b7","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn27@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-36-51-148_1fe667a16b72b5ff.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":498,"sourceBytes":64725,"destBytes":29634,"author":"Mike Lowe","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/151222-cameras-news-fujifilm-x-t4-mirrorless-camera-image1-c9qmufopt4.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn27@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-36-51-148_1fe667a16b72b5ff.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209022},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"Fujifilm X-T4 initial review: Mirrorless boss brings bolder feature set","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/fujifilm/151202-fujifilm-x-t4-review","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"499\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/151202-cameras-review-hands-on-fujifilm-x-t4-review-image1-ni1tzg6q09.jpg?v1\"> <p>The long-standing Fujifilm X-T series has in the past set the benchmark for being the mirrorless camera to beat all others. Indeed, <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/fujifilm/145646-fuji-xt3-review-fujifilm\" rel=\"\">the X-T3 won Best Camera</a> in the <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/gadgets/news/139556-pocket-lint-gadget-awards-winners\" rel=\"\">2019 Pocket-lint Awards</a>.</p><p>Now there's a new kid in town: the Fujifilm X-T4. But does this latest camera add enough extra to warrant its purchase? We got to play with a pre-production camera ahead of its official announcement, so here's what you can expect.</p><h2>X-T4 vs X-T3: What's new?</h2>\n <ul> \n  <li>X-T4 adds: \n   <ul> \n    <li>New in-body stabilisation unit (IBIS)</li> \n    <li>New shutter unit (15fps mechanical)</li> \n    <li>Dedicated movie mode</li> \n    <li>New battery system</li> \n   </ul> </li> \n </ul><p>At a glance the X-T4 looks a lot like its X-T3 younger brother. But there are some clear differences. The newer camera is a little larger and heavier, on account of a new battery system that's designed to last longer.</p><p>Some weight has been shed elsewhere, to avoid it getting altogether too heavy, by introducing a newer, smaller in-body stabilisation system, which is said to be capable up to 6.5 stops (up from the 5 stops of the X-H1, where in-body was first introduced by Fujifilm).</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151202-cameras-review-hands-on-fujifilm-x-t4-review-image1-9itqfl3dkb.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><p>In tandem with the stabilisation system is a new shutter mechanism, capable of up to 15 frames per second (15fps) burst shooting. It's also tested to 300,000 shutter cycles, doubling the durability over the X-T3.</p><p>Other little tweaks should make a big difference for movie users: a dedicated movie mode, with its own Q Menu on-screen settings (useful for silent adjustment), and even a removable SD card door, should you be shooting from a rig. The rear LCD screen is also a little higher in resolution than before (1.62m-dot compared to 1.04m-dot).</p><p>Elsewhere the specification is built around the same core as the X-T3: this means the X-T4 has the same sensor and processor combination, same on-sensor autofocus capabilities (albeit with some algorithm tweaks to improve tracking and face/eye-detection). So if you're looking for higher resolution or advances iin quality in that area, then the two cameras don't differ.</p><h2>How does the X-T4 perform?</h2>\n <ul> \n  <li>New magnesium alloy body footprint: 134.6mm x 92.8mm x 63.8mm / 607g</li> \n  <li>3-inch tri-adjustable LCD touchscreen, 1.62m-dot resolution</li> \n  <li>0.5-inch, 3.69m-dot OLED electronic viewfinder</li> \n  <li>Improved autofocus algorithm</li> \n  <li>425 selectable AF areas</li> \n </ul><p>The X-T4 is made primarily from magnesium alloy, which gives it a robust feeling in the hand. It's also weather-resistant, so paired with a suitable lens you needn't worry about splashes and rain.</p><p>The X-T4 is larger than the X-T3 given its new battery system, but that extra little bit of bulk and 10 per cent weight increase is worth it on account of longevity. The new battery is 2,200mAh in capacity, which is a big increase over the 1,260mAh of the X-T3's cell. Fujifilm says you can expect over 500 shots per charge as a result.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151202-cameras-review-hands-on-fujifilm-x-t4-review-image1-efv7ek5itm.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><p>There's also a new vertical grip, which can house two additional batteries, and comes with a dedicated switch to flick between normal, boost and economy performance modes. The X-T3 grip won't fit onto the X-T4 due to the new battery system and different camera footprint.</p><p>Recharging takes place via USB-C, much like an Android phone, but you'll need to use a 15W charger at the wall for the fastest possible recharge times. It'll take about three hours to recharge the one cell, which isn't especially quick, but use a low power USB port and it'll take three or four times longer than that!</p><p>The X-T4 has the now staple rear LCD and OLED viewfinder setup. The vari-angle touchscreen is easy to use, benefits from that added resolution, while the X-T4's OLED finder is the exact same as found in the X-T3. That means it's got all the resolution you'll need, complete with a high refresh-rate, deep contrast, and a massive 0.75x equivalent magnification size - which makes for a formidable finder scale to this eye.</p><p>If you're familiar with the X-T3's autofocus - which we found did a great job at the Goodwood Revival motor show - then it's much the same with the X-T4. The camera uses a massive 2.16-million phase-detection pixels embedded across its sensor's surface, designed to cover the full width from edge to edge. That means you can focus anywhere in the field of view, as far vertically or horizontally as you wish, and still acquire the same focus ability as you would in the centre.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151202-cameras-review-hands-on-fujifilm-x-t4-review-image1-ebiogrmdu3.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><p>The autofocus system is pared down to 425 areas maximum, which can be further reduced to simplify operation as you wish. The AF point can be adjusted between a variety of point sizes, too, by using the rear thumbwheel. There's still no Panasonic-style Pinpoint mode, however, which we always miss when using other brands' mirrorless cameras.</p><p>Fujifilm claims the X-T4 has tweaked the tracking and face/eye-detection for the better, but we've not been able to shoot in suitable scenarios as yet to discern any major difference.</p><p>With a decent lens on the front and the X-T4 is a formidable shooting machine (yes, we know, it's pictured here with a basic 18-55mm kit lens, but Fujifilm offers plenty of better glass). From its 15fps burst, to the various custom settings (much like you'll find in a pro DSLR, in a scenario-appropriate format), mirrorless system cameras don't really get any better than this.</p><h2>What's the X-T4's image quality like?</h2>\n <ul> \n  <li>26-megapixel X-Trans CMOS 4 sensor</li> \n  <li>ISO 160-12,800 (80-51,200 ext)</li> \n  <li>New: Eterna Beach Bypass filter</li> \n </ul><p>Just like the X-T3, the X-T4 features Fujifilm's fourth-generation X-Trans CMOS sensor. This sensor is backside illuminated, with the copper wiring placement beneath the photo diodes in the sensor, in order to create a cleaner signal path.</p><p>That all worked a treat in the X-T3 and it's much the same here: image quality is exemplary. Although, as we always say, a lot of that comes down to the lens on the front of the camera. And Fujifilm's range of optics means there's something for more or less every situation. The 18-55mm we've used for this preview is fine, but not the hottest ticket, we've found the 40-150mm f/2.8 and 50mm f/2.0 to impress us much more - especially those wider aperture lenses.</p><p>We've shot with the X-T4 in and around Fujifilm's House of Photography in central London, where there's a variety of light sources and situations. That's given a broad scope to test out the baseline ISO 160 sensitivity, right through to the higher ISO 12,800 setting when shooting a vase of flowers in the dim-lit (off public limits) basement at the property.</p><p>Low-light will show some grain, of course, but it's not overwhelming by any measure and even the four-figure ISO settings are really clean looking. But daylight is where things really shine, those lower settings giving real clarity.</p><p>We've always praised Fujifilm for its image quality prowess, a trend that the X-T4 continues. No, it's not more resolute or more advanced than the X-T3, which some will see as a downer, but as that camera was already accomplished you're really looking to buy this newer model for its better battery, faster burst rate and improved image stabilisation (although it's a marginal improvement in that regard).</p><h2>The X-T4's new video capabilities</h2>\n <ul> \n  <li>Dedicated movie mode, via physical switch dial</li> \n  <li>Dedicated Q Menu with silent mode selection</li> \n  <li>4K 60fps maximum, 1080p 240fps slow-mo</li> \n  <li>Can fix crop to 1.29x for all modes</li> \n </ul><p>The X-T4 has also clearly been engineered with the videographer in mind. Not only on account of the better battery and removable SD card door, but also the dedicated movie mode, which is activated via a physical switch beneath the shutter speed dial atop the camera.</p><p>Moving this switch over to 'Movie' means you get a dedicated Q Menu, which is accessible during shooting and means silent adjustment of modes is possible using the touchscreen. The physical dials will also work, but if you want to avoid the physical motion and clicking sounds then this is one way around it.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151202-cameras-review-hands-on-fujifilm-x-t4-review-image1-gbmzkaqcsz.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"499\" /></p><p>The frame-rate possibility has also increased, with Full HD (1080p) now available at up to 240fps. Some would call that slow-motion to one eighth the speed of a normal 30fps capture. The X-T4 is also 4K capable, offering 60fps in this Ultra-HD mode (just like the X-T3).</p><p>All this adds up to a much more accomplished and movie-focused device, in an attempt to outsmart the Panasonic and Sony options on the market.</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 26 Feb 2020 05:00:00 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/151202-cameras-review-hands-on-fujifilm-x-t4-review-image1-ni1tzg6q09.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"512eb209106a4e441241785e97fa22d5","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn20@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-36-51-097_2e3848b8f1ea659b.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":499,"sourceBytes":79106,"destBytes":43508,"author":"Mike before","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/147538-staggering-images-of-mars","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"498\" planet, but there's a lot more to Mars than just rocks and red dust. NASA's images show plenty of hidden beauty and intrigue.</p><p>We've been combing the archive to pick a selection of the best and most interesting images NASA has compiled.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul>\n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/gadgets/news/google/147416-a-visual-exploration-of-space-with-nasa-and-google\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">An amazing glimpse of decades of space exploration with NASA</a></li>\n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/144794-amazing-images-from-the-international-space-station\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Breath-taking images from the International Space Station</a></li>\n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/142413-50-incredible-images-of-space-like-you-ve-never-seen-before\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Incredible images of space like you've never seen before</a></li>\n </ul> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 13 Aug 2020 12:02:00 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/147538-cameras-feature-staggering-images-of-mars-like-youve-never-seen-before-image1-ubnktz64li.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"70cf317578680d7d7d1a698c29b66c11","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn59@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-36-52-883_391176e11edbf24d.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":498,"sourceBytes":108714,"destBytes":73352,"author":"Adrian Willings","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/147538-cameras-feature-staggering-images-of-mars-like-youve-never-seen-before-image1-ubnktz64li.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn59@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-36-52-883_391176e11edbf24d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209023},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"Pentax's 2020 flagship to feature huge viewfinder - but when will it launch?","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/pentax/152207-pentax-dslr-2020-k-series-aps-c-viewfinder","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"498\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152207-cameras-news-pentax-2020-aps-c-image1-a02qx3pdtl.jpg?v1\"> <p>Pentax, the Japanese camera company which is now owned by Ricoh, is continuing its mission to launch new DSLR cameras. For 2020 that will be an as-yet-unnamed APS-C sensor model, which has been explored in a little more depth in <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=0001&amp;v=vXd47-xBXSU&amp;feature=emb_logo\" rel=\"\">a company YouTube video</a>. </p><p>The big reveal is this new K-series camera - which we could assume to be a \"K80\" - has an all-new viewfinder that presents a massive image to the eye.</p><p>Optical viewfinders use magnitication, which is typically 0.9x (for APS-C models anyway); the new Pentax model will have 1.05x magnification - delivering an image size that's larger than any equivalent competitor for a camera of this type.</p><p>Pentax says the finder uses special glass to minimise refraction, to deliver a distortion free and clear image - right to the edges. The finder also protrudes 3mm from the rear of the camera, to help avoid nose contact with the LCD screen - a screen which auto-dims when the finder is in use to avoid being a distraction.</p><p>The new DSLR will also offer a new battery grip designed for both portrait and landscape orientation use.</p><p>So when can we expect the new Pentax K-series? The company says it's still on course for the end of 2020, with assurances from factory managers and suppliers. Seeing as the camera was first teased at the end of 2019, it looks like being a long road to get there.</p><p>&nbsp;</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 15 May 2020 09:30:00 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152207-cameras-news-pentax-2020-aps-c-image1-a02qx3pdtl.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"0bec36f9f1c924bd1ff29f4d38cfc6c9","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn8@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-36-52-591_15c4e4d3b3941e25.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":498,"sourceBytes":27001,"destBytes":12734,"author":"Mike Lowe","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152207-cameras-news-pentax-2020-aps-c-image1-a02qx3pdtl.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn8@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-36-52-591_15c4e4d3b3941e25.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209018},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"These old photos from the American West will make you yearn for a better time","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/151936-photos-american-west","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"562\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/151936-homepage-feature-these-old-photos-from-the-american-west-will-make-you-yearn-for-a-better-time-image1-iotmkbtxyw.jpg?v1\"> <p>There's nothing like a dose of nostalgia in the morning. Ancient photographs, from the very earliest days of the technology's use, can often act as portals into times we find hard to properly imagine.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/146499-incredible-images-from-the-wildlife-photographer-of-the-year-competition\" rel=\"follow\">Incredible images from the Wildlife Photographer of the Year competition</a></li> \n </ul><p>We all know stories and movies about the old West, America's semi-lawless lands of prospecting and exploration, but it's fair to say that these works of fiction can only do so much to paint a picture of what life was like. Luckily, there are hordes of photos out there, showing the idiosyncrasies of real life back then.&nbsp;</p><p>We've gathered some of our favourites right here for your browsing pleasure - enjoy!</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151936-homepage-feature-these-old-photos-from-the-american-west-will-make-you-yearn-for-a-better-time-image1-avsltjacu5.jpg\" /></p><h2>Journalism in the West</h2><p>This photograph shows the staff of a Utah journal called the Daily Reporter at their office, a tent in an encampment. It shows just how rugged the conditions for many were when settlements were being established, but also how people got on with their lives nonetheless.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151936-homepage-feature-these-old-photos-from-the-american-west-will-make-you-yearn-for-a-better-time-image2-mkxtpcs7ug.jpg\" /></p><h2>A real character</h2><p>We love this photo for a number of reasons, not the least of which is the cheeky grin on Fred Loring's face - this is him showing off his mule, named \"Evil Merodach\", which for our money has to be in the running for greatest pet name ever. Just two days later, Loring would be killed by Apaches - it was that sort of time.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151936-homepage-feature-these-old-photos-from-the-american-west-will-make-you-yearn-for-a-better-time-image3-u5iw31eixp.jpg\" /></p><h2>Distant threat</h2><p>This image shows a correspondent from the San Francisco Bulletin taking notes on the battlefield, and we like the contrast between his studious air and the armed wariness of the soldiers to the left of him.</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/148556-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs\" rel=\"follow\">33 incredibly interesting photos from history</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151936-homepage-feature-these-old-photos-from-the-american-west-will-make-you-yearn-for-a-better-time-image4-bgescqltvr.jpg\" /></p><h2>A nice place to stop</h2><p>This member of an expedition takes a break to sketch by a dried-out canyon bed, before a stunning cliffside. The parasol he's sitting under gives the scene a lovely sense of calm.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151936-homepage-feature-these-old-photos-from-the-american-west-will-make-you-yearn-for-a-better-time-image5-bylphpz5cu.jpg\" /></p><h2>Wooded seclusion</h2><p>This image actually shows a photographer in action - John K Hillers is inspecting one of his negatives while camping on a geological surveying trip.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151936-homepage-feature-these-old-photos-from-the-american-west-will-make-you-yearn-for-a-better-time-image1-jmk9bp2yuu.jpg\" /></p><h2>Natural Beauty</h2><p>This photograph shows a natural vista in what is now Idaho, and it really is stunning - it might take you a little while to even notice the human figures checking it out for themselves in the foreground.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/141701-history-in-colour-amazing-artists-add-colour-to-our-past\" rel=\"follow\">History in colour: Amazing artists add colour to our past</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151936-homepage-feature-these-old-photos-from-the-american-west-will-make-you-yearn-for-a-better-time-image1-tx7pbfjb2r.jpg\" /></p><h2>Parched</h2><p>This desert scene might look extremely remote, although it's actually in the Carson Desert, Nevada. Still, the heat shouldn't be underestimated. The photo shows the ambulance wagon that doubled as a portable blackroom for photographer Timothy O'Sullivan.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151936-homepage-feature-these-old-photos-from-the-american-west-will-make-you-yearn-for-a-better-time-image1-ca0soqfhrj.jpg\" /></p><h2>Lunchtime</h2><p>This photo shows one of many geological surveys on a break for lunch as they travelled the land, and the ragtag nature of the bunch looks like something straight out of an adventure novel.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151936-homepage-feature-these-old-photos-from-the-american-west-will-make-you-yearn-for-a-better-time-image1-ofe0pnmjrv.jpg\" /></p><h2>Riverside</h2><p>This is what you'd call a proper convoy, with dozens of horses and riders walking along the edge of this river near Yellowstone, an apparently typical portrayal of how people travelled.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151936-homepage-feature-these-old-photos-from-the-american-west-will-make-you-yearn-for-a-better-time-image1-jrg4qtj7fw.jpg\" /></p><h2>Changing times</h2><p>This images shows directors from the Union Pacific Railroad company on the 100th meridian, far west of Omaha, before a ride to celebrate the railway's opening. It's a great portrait of how times were moving quickly as technology advanced.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/adobe/140252-30-famous-photoshopped-and-doctored-images-from-across-the-ages\" rel=\"follow\">Famous Photoshopped and doctored images from across the ages</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151936-homepage-feature-these-old-photos-from-the-american-west-will-make-you-yearn-for-a-better-time-image1-dt9n2tcpxr.jpg\" /></p><h2>For contrast</h2><p>Meanwhile, elsewhere travel was still entirely rudimentary, relying on ramshackle bridges and infrastructure like this one, pictured at Beaver Head River five years after the last image.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151936-homepage-feature-these-old-photos-from-the-american-west-will-make-you-yearn-for-a-better-time-image1-hdbk5c1pto.jpg\" /></p><h2>Moving people</h2><p>Even with the coming of the railway, most big groups moved in the traditional way, as evidenced by this column of cavalry and weapons under General George's Custer's command. And, yes, he is indeed&nbsp;<em>that&nbsp;</em>Custer.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151936-homepage-feature-these-old-photos-from-the-american-west-will-make-you-yearn-for-a-better-time-image1-y2mga9wrse.jpg\" /></p><h2>Means of travel</h2><p>This riverboat, pictured in 1878, is the Rosebud, which travelled up and down the Missouri river, taking people with it.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151936-homepage-feature-these-old-photos-from-the-american-west-will-make-you-yearn-for-a-better-time-image1-ut7tfdlyyi.jpg\" /></p><h2>An old-school coach</h2><p>This stagecoach is an example of the sort used by express delivery companies in this time period - complete with the armed guards riding atop the carriage.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/gadgets/news/148672-best-product-flops-from-history\" rel=\"follow\">Best product flops and missteps from history: How many of these blunders do you remember?</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151936-homepage-feature-these-old-photos-from-the-american-west-will-make-you-yearn-for-a-better-time-image1-lfeygrsnwq.jpg\" /></p><h2>Challenging terrain</h2><p>While the trains and boats were speeding up supply links all over the US, some places still need proper rugged explorers to chart them - such as this expedition up the now-famous Pike's Peak, which looks a lot like hard work to us.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151936-homepage-feature-these-old-photos-from-the-american-west-will-make-you-yearn-for-a-better-time-image1-qayya1xeob.jpg\" /></p><h2>Laying tracks</h2><p>If you're talking about hard work, though, we're not sure anything beats actually laying railroad tracks in the sweltering heat of Arizona, as these workers are toiling away at.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151936-homepage-feature-these-old-photos-from-the-american-west-will-make-you-yearn-for-a-better-time-image1-jzc327upwq.jpg\" /></p><h2>Some assembly required</h2><p>When you see a stagecoach, through modern eyes, it's easy to forget that they didn't just pop out of some factory ready-made for most people. This deconstructed version reminds us that they needed maintenance and, often, assembly.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151936-homepage-feature-these-old-photos-from-the-american-west-will-make-you-yearn-for-a-better-time-image1-na1qpfbxld.jpg\" /></p><h2>Traversal</h2><p>When it comes to covering challenging areas, slippery rocks under high sun isn't too nice either, as this party is discovering in Utah in 1909, some time later than most of the photos we've shown so far.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/phones/news/apple/135231-the-apple-iphone-is-10-years-old-look-how-much-the-iphone-has-changed\" rel=\"follow\">Apple iPhone history: Look how much the iPhone has changed</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151936-homepage-feature-these-old-photos-from-the-american-west-will-make-you-yearn-for-a-better-time-image1-nm4vt9x0tb.jpg\" /></p><h2>Charting a course</h2><p>Another image that shows just how difficult it could be moving around the country, this trail on the Pike's Peak road in Colorado in 1911 shows that even into the 20th Century it was still a proper challenge.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151936-homepage-feature-these-old-photos-from-the-american-west-will-make-you-yearn-for-a-better-time-image1-3zcmbhtsy1.jpg\" /></p><h2>A new world</h2><p>Never mind that elsewhere in the country people were no longer relying on horses and carriages - the automobile had arrived in America, as shown by this image from 1912. Road signage, sadly, wasn't up to scratch for some time.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151936-homepage-feature-these-old-photos-from-the-american-west-will-make-you-yearn-for-a-better-time-image1-2ogihhrwsx.jpg\" /></p><h2>People change</h2><p>This image shows a test drive of the new route between Denver and Salt Lake, to see how stable and drivable it was - one of the cars is from the Denver Motor Club, showing how quickly motor cars gained fans in America.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151936-homepage-feature-these-old-photos-from-the-american-west-will-make-you-yearn-for-a-better-time-image1-dyytr9nb1p.jpg\" /></p><h2>The old lingers on</h2><p>Our final image for this collection contrasts the time period that we end in, having started in the era of horses and carriages - here, a car waits to let a carriage pass on the road, illustrating how much has changed.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/adobe/148866-hilarious-images-of-celebrities-photoshopped-into-renaissance-paintings\" good, high-tech camera here at Pocket-lint - the more features, tech and smarts that can be squeezed into a unit, the better. That said, we also have a lot of time for the occasional dose of simplicity.</p><p>Instant cameras have been around forever, and have enjoyed a massive revival over the last decade or so, as people start to value the immediate physical artefacts they spit out, compared to the near-countless photos you can take on a phone or camera in the course of a couple of minutes.</p>\n <ul>\n  <li><a Freeman-Mills","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/151832-cameras-buyer-s-guide-the-best-instant-cameras-for-2020-capture-the-moment-in-physical-form-image1-gl4t7rqmqc.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn44@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-36-52-284_f13c1b6e5d78663d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209023},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"These stunning award-winning pro photos will blow you away","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/sony/151522-jaw-dropping-photos-sony-world-photography-awards","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"499\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-wcbeskjhbp.jpg?v1\"> <p>There are photos, and there are photos. We've all taken some holiday snaps at a particularly enviable location, or in a rather picturesque spot, and checked out the images later, thinking that professional photography might not be out of reach after all.</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/buyers-guides/122777-best-dslr-cameras-full-frame-and-interchangeable-lens-cameras-to-buy\" rel=\"follow\">Best DSLR cameras: The best interchangeable lens cameras available to buy today</a></li> \n </ul><p>Well, maybe think twice about that - the images you're about to browse are from the shortlist of Professional shots from Sony's 2020 World Photography Awards, and to say they're stunning would be an understatement.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/buyers-guides/120768-best-point-and-shoot-compact-cameras-to-buy-today\" rel=\"follow\">Best compact cameras: The best point-and-shoot-cameras available to buy today</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-tbiiugvqka.jpg\" /></p><h2>Angles</h2><p>This image is all about the clean lines and stunning, bright colours. It's like something out of a child's imagination, but is actually just the result of people wanting a splash of colour in their lives.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-9qk5gy3oum.jpg\" /></p><h2>Isolation</h2><p>Here, again, you get a splash of colour, this time in an otherwise white-out landscape. This tiny home looks like it might be encrusted in place, but in theory could be picked up like a trailer and driven away. The yellow of the main cabin is a beautiful contrast to the freezing outdoors.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-qnewt0ahot.jpg\" /></p><h2>Construction</h2><p>It's amazing seeing monumental structures in the process of being constructed, and there's something completely otherworldly about seeing these giant elephant heads in India, robbed of their context, with a worker casually holding one in place.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/sony/151442-stunning-photos-from-the-national-sony-world-photography-awards-2020\" rel=\"follow\">Check out these entries from the National category of the 2020 Sony World Photography Awards</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-kgrne5hypz.jpg\" /></p><h2>Tuckered out</h2><p>Part of the story of any sport is the exhaustion afterward, whether you've won or lost. We love the way this wrestler has so clearly sat down utterly knackered, and the fact that his expression gives nothing away at all about how his own bout went.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-naqttuh0za.jpg\" /></p><h2>Growth</h2><p>This image has something magic realist about it, and certainly seems to be sending a message about the value of reading and book-learning. The mushrooms growing from this tome seem to evoke wizards and witches, but maybe that's just us.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-g5vi3sw4hx.jpg\" /></p><h2>A matter of scale</h2><p>This photograph is an interesting contrast in scales, with the architecturally complex model on the floor drawing the eye. The table above it is more beguiling, especially when you realise that it's an inch off the ground.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-nsvbeoowhx.jpg\" /></p><h2>Shorn</h2><p>We all know the aftermath of a home haircut means sweeping - lots of sweeping. This photo takes that scene and turns it into a lovely meditation on texture, not to mention an ode to a classic-looking chair.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/parenting/news/lego/151241-classic-lego-sets-of-all-time\" rel=\"follow\">Classic Lego sets: Do you remember these all time greats?</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-2oyua0jt9z.jpg\" /></p><h2>Mocked up</h2><p>The models used by trainee doctors to practice their medicine are creepy at the best of times. The colour grading and orientation of this photo makes this scene seem almost like something out of a picture book, or constructed from toys.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-fdsrw8ei9w.jpg\" /></p><h2>Uncanny valley</h2><p>If you thought the last model was creepy, try this one on for size. It's a robot called&nbsp;Alter on display in a robotics museum in Tokyo, and as far as we're concerned, it's terrifying.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-zxxsijk1fd.jpg\" /></p><h2>Still life</h2><p>This still life has beautiful colour to showcase in its tablecloth, while the subject, the tuber cassava, is lovingly focused upon and lit to show the wonderful variety of its knobbly crusted skin.</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/adobe/141493-amazing-photoshop-artists-with-skills-that-will-blow-your-mind\" rel=\"follow\">Amazing Photoshop artists with skills that will blow your mind</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-le6u7d5nek.jpg\" /></p><h2>Micro</h2><p>Bugs under a microscope - it's not our idea of fun, but the images you can get out of the process are undeniably striking. This black-and-white monstrosity is tiny, but photographed like this, could be a giant space beast for all you know.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-pmcubin4hv.jpg\" /></p><h2>Big air</h2><p>This kid is shredding it - proving that scooters can get huge air just like skateboards, and making us worry for his safety at the same time. The perspective is brave, and the expression on his face is priceless.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-rwsrkizhnn.jpg\" /></p><h2>Portrait</h2><p>This portrait is of Chantal, a woman from the Democratic Republic of Congo, and the victim of sexual violence perpetrated by soldiers. As part of photographer Denis Rouvre's Unsung Heroes project she talked about her experience. This photo is a raw reminder of the importance photography can carry as an act of witnessing.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-32ryugetfh.jpg\" /></p><h2>A retro look</h2><p>We love the look and feel of this photo - you couldn't tell what decade it was from if you tried. It's a railroad worker in Ukraine, and we're fond of how proud she is of that uniform, paired with those spectacular curtains for a beautiful colour palette.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/adobe/140252-30-famous-photoshopped-and-doctored-images-from-across-the-ages\" rel=\"follow\">Famous Photoshopped and doctored images from across the ages</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-7ue6wlxnrj.jpg\" /></p><h2>Captured at work</h2><p>This might be our favourite portrait in this whole collection, a goldfish seller captured on his bike about to drive away. The lighting is sumptuous, while just taking in all the fish on his stand would keep us occupied for some time.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-dxztxkrquw.jpg\" /></p><h2>Precious</h2><p>Pangolins are trafficked in sad numbers, and remain extremely endangered. They're stunning creatures, and extremely beautiful to observe, as this photo demonstrates, picking out the details and outline of each of it scales with lovely skill.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-462c8qdwcz.jpg\" /></p><h2>Texture</h2><p>You might be hard-pressed to guess what this photograph is actually of - we certainly were stumped. It's actually a butterfly's wings under a lot of degrees of magnification.</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/adobe/145762-bonkers-new-animals-imagined-with-the-power-of-photoshop\" rel=\"follow\">Bonkers new animals imagined with the power of Photoshop</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-kutzdl8eca.jpg\" /></p><h2>Chilly</h2><p>Bears might be more used to the freezing cold than us, but we have to say we still feel pretty sorry for this chilly-looking customer. The frost in his beard is really detailed, while the black and white gives the whole picture a melancholic air.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-dnwsve28c5.jpg\" /></p><h2>Colour grading</h2><p>The grey of these trees is in wonderful contrast to their orange leaves, while the fallen foliage on the water's surface give this a really eerie vibe. It's like something out of True Detective, with the bayou beckoning.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-ldkm8gpszn.jpg\" /></p><h2>Man's mark</h2><p>There's nothing like a remote road to remind you of the extent to which we have remodelled the world's landscapes to suit our ends. This winding road with its endless switchbacks is a textbook example.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-3xu2iyszgz.jpg\" /></p><h2>Clinical</h2><p>Similarly, anytime you forget that we're growing plants, flowers and foodstuffs in almost insane quantities at a time, check out an image like this to remind you that many \"farms\" don't look like much like their name anymore.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/adobe/143402-proof-that-photoshop-makes-everything-better\" rel=\"follow\">Proof that Photoshop makes everything better</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-gektyucjip.jpg\" /></p><h2>Symmetry</h2><p>Returning to calmer themes, this beautiful sea gate and two lanterns is shrouded all around by mist to create a scene that wouldn't look out of place in a Miyazaki film. It's a lovely, blanched photograph.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-47holqfjem.jpg\" /></p><h2>A family business</h2><p>It might not look like your own domestic bliss, but this photo of family harmony is delightful. The Bolivian family here have swapped to agriculture because the climate crisis was making their old craft of fishing harder and harder.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-w42ouaizgv.jpg\" /></p><h2>Hellscape</h2><p>And here's the climate crisis represented more forcefully - a natural gas flaring site in Nigeria spews flames into the sky, above a landscape that was once vibrant and full of life, and now looks like somewhere to be avoided at all costs.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-sa8kepldwg.jpg\" /></p><h2>Pilgrimage</h2><p>Again, the industrial background to this image is impossible to escape. We love the bizarre symbolism of this lone wanderer, decked out in gold, making what looks like a pilgrimage toward a promised land that doesn't hold much allure.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/adobe/140252-30-famous-photoshopped-and-doctored-images-from-across-the-ages\" rel=\"follow\">Famous Photoshopped and doctored images from across the ages</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-nysxhbw1fk.jpg\" /></p><h2>Hell on earth</h2><p>If the fossil fuels burning don't evoke the climate crisis, this terrifying image of a true conflagration should. Needless to say, it's from Australia's bushfire crisis, and the lone fire truck puts the scale of destruction into proper context.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-dno3amwhqb.jpg\" /></p><h2>Bleached</h2><p>A more peaceful scene, if still somewhat unsettling, is provided by this photograph of&nbsp;Pardis, near Tehran. The blanched-out colours make for a landscape that almost looks unreal.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-uhz9tibhcp.jpg\" /></p><h2>True pink</h2><p>You don't often see the colour pink in nature, but this superb aerial image of the&nbsp;Lemurian salt lake, Ukraine, shows that where it does arise, it's simply stunning. The addition of a single person gives you a sense of scale and points out the colours all the more vividly.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-0f5ra7xs8v.jpg\" /></p><h2>Athleticism</h2><p>We love how communal this image is, with these wrestlers training against the sand's resistance as a group, all striving for the same goal of excellence and victory. You can see how single-minded each is at the moment captured.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151522-cameras-feature-these-jaw-dropping-photos-from-the-sony-world-photography-awards-will-blow-you-away-image1-3dihu4edxj.jpg\" /></p><h2>True romance</h2><p>We end on a true high note with this photograph of an Iraqi couple taking a boat trip having just been married. The bride picks her way up the rocky beach carefully, her beautiful dress clear and obvious as a beacon, while the groom carefully gets on the boat in the background. One lovely little further detail - in the background, a lone swimmer interrupts the lake's surface.&nbsp;</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 27 Mar 2020 12:00:00 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"New SD Express cards to increase speeds up to 4Gb/s, ideal for 8K video","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/152262-new-sd-express-cards-to-increase-speeds-up-to-4gb-s-ideal-for-8k-video","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"499\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152262-cameras-news-new-sd-express-cards-to-increase-speeds-up-to-4gbs-ideal-for-8k-video-image1-rum8fvetfh.jpg?v1\"> <p>The SD Association has announced a new standard for memory cards that will result in new <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/gadgets/news/149685-best-sd-cards-memory\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">SD cards</a> with transfer speeds up to 4Gb/s - four times faster than previously possible.</p><p>Full-size SD Express cards can soon employ the latest SD 8.0 specification and use faster PCIe and NVMe architectures. They will be a much better fit for the demands of 8K video recording, RAW continuous burst mode in professional still cameras, and all other speed hungry applications.</p><p>Gaming systems can also benefit, claims the Association.</p><p>\"By dramatically increasing the speeds for SD Express we’re giving device manufacturers and system developers more storage choices,\" said the SDA's president, Hiroyuki Sakamoto.</p><p>\"SD 8.0 may open even more opportunities for extra high performance solutions using removable memory cards.\"</p><p>The new, faster SD Express cards will appear across the SDHC, SDXC and SDUC ranges. Like current Express cards, they will sport an additional \"EX\" added to their on card specifications markers.</p><p>It is likely to be some time before the new spec appears on cards you can purchase, and they'll likely to be extremely expensive when first released, but if you are a pro photographer or videographer, the investment could be very much worth it.</p>
