07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"Amazon Blink Mini is a compact indoor camera with two-way audio","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/smart-home/news/amazon/151715-amazon-blink-mini-is-a-compact-indoor-camera-with-two-way-audio","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"499\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/151715-smart-home-news-amazon-blink-mini-is-a-compact-indoor-camera-with-two-way-audio-image1-eugjv6irkg.jpg?v1\"> <p>Amazon has updated its lineup of <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/smart-home/news/amazon\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Blink home security cameras</a> to include a compact indoor camera.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07X6C9RMF/?tag=pocketlintc07-20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Called the Blink Mini</a>, it is available for preorder through Amazon for $35. If you get two of them, you can save $5, bringing the total to $65. There's also a cloud storage service for it that costs $3 per month (or $30 a year) after the free trial.</p><p>Blink Mini records 1080p resolution and has two-way audio, which allows you to communicate with whoever it sees using the Blink app. Other features include motion detection and night vision via infrared light. It is a&nbsp;wired camera, too, so there's no need to switch out the batteries. It can also pair to Alexa devices such as the Echo Show to display a live feed from the camera's view.</p><p>As for that cloud video storage plan, Blink is offering a free trial of Blink Plus until the end of 2020. After that, it costs $3 per month. Previously, Blink didn't charge to store clips in the cloud. The&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/stores/page/FBD8F381-8A53-4429-9BE2-5E71CAB97194?ingress=0&amp;visitId=44bf3497-b492-4f25-a3b5-0f686d2b725f&amp;channel=homeallproducts&amp;liveVideoDataUrl=https%3A%2F%2Famazonlive-portal.amazon.com%2Fv2&amp;tag=pocketlintc07-20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Blink XT2</a> even still seems to offer free cloud storage for video for a year.&nbsp;</p><p>squirrel_widget_230092</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151715-smart-home-news-amazon-blink-mini-is-a-compact-indoor-camera-with-two-way-audio-image2-epejlr7hi1.jpg\" /></p><p>Amazon plans to fully launch Blink Mini in the coming weeks.&nbsp;Amazon will also launch the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/dp/B084RQ6MHJ/?tag=pocketlintc07-20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">$35 Blink Sync Module 2</a>&nbsp;later this year, so you can record and locally save clips. Simply plug a USB drive into it, and you can store video from up to 10 different Blink Mini cameras.</p><p>You can then watch all your Blink Mini footage from the USB drive itself (when plugged into a PC) or from the Blink Home Monitor.&nbsp;</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 02 Apr 2020 22:22:37 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/151715-smart-home-news-amazon-blink-mini-is-a-compact-indoor-camera-with-two-way-audio-image1-eugjv6irkg.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"826c3b8c0c2dbdcd38f914b1579f9e82","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn87@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-36-52-232_65857731b27c88cb.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":499,"sourceBytes":40076,"destBytes":14326,"author":"Maggie Tillman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/151715-smart-home-news-amazon-blink-mini-is-a-compact-indoor-camera-with-two-way-audio-image1-eugjv6irkg.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn87@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-36-52-232_65857731b27c88cb.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151715-smart-home-news-amazon-blink-mini-is-a-compact-indoor-camera-with-two-way-audio-image2-epejlr7hi1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn57@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-13-308_8150032f0df18f25.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209020},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"33 incredibly interesting photos from history","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/148556-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"498\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image1-anxrwueqpv.jpg?v1\"> <p>Ever since the camera was invented it's been a wonderful tool for documenting not just our daily lives, but the history of mankind, from our greatest moments to the worst atrocities.&nbsp;</p><p>We've collected some of the most interesting images of all time, taken throughout the decades and showing all sorts of visions of mankind throughout the ages.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image2-n9yqibapn6.jpg\" /></p><h2>Operation Dominic nuclear tests</h2><p>This is a shot taken during <a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Dominic\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Operation Dominic</a> - a series of 31 different nuclear weapons tests carried out by the US during the height of the Cold War. This photo was taken on 11 May 1962 and shows the detonation of Swordfish. This particular test involved anti-submarine missiles and&nbsp;W44 nuclear depth charges designed to deal a blow to Soviet submarines.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image3-dxlh16jdwi.jpg\" /></p><h2>Wilbur Wright flies around the Statue of Liberty</h2><p>Wilbur Wright, one of the brothers made famous for the invention of the aeroplane, caused another sensation with this flight around the Statue of Liberty in 1909.</p><p>He had been asked to get involved in special&nbsp;exhibition flights that were being put on in order to celebrate 300 years of New York City. The flight took place on 29 September 1909 and lasted no more than five minutes, but caused quite a stir with onlookers and the press.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image4-qxdre0qwnc.jpg\" /></p><h2>High-wheeling down the steps of the Capitol building</h2><p>The American Star Bicycle was a high-wheeler designed with a small front wheel to prevent it from tipping forward. It was originally built in 1880 and this iconic image shows Will Roberston, a member of the Washington Bicycle Club riding it down the steps of the United States Capitol building.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>Photographic proof that even back then people were daredevils on bicycles.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image5-rg46wjcxou.jpg\" /></p><h2>RMS Queen Mary full of troops</h2><p>During the second world war, the retired British ocean liner, the RMS Queen Mary, was used to ferry soldiers from the States to the United Kingdom to fight for the war effort. Here, the massive ship is seen on 20 June 1945 bringing thousands of US troops home. The decks are certainly crowded.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image6-5zokx1yqo0.jpg\" /></p><h2>Lady Liberty under construction</h2><p>The history of the Statue of Liberty is <a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Statue_of_Liberty#Construction\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">certainly an interesting one</a>. You've no doubt seen plenty of photos of Lady Liberty over the years, but have you ever seen those taken during her construction?&nbsp;</p><p>Before it was fully built, parts of the statue were constructed in France before shipping to New York. In 1878, the head was shown off at the&nbsp;World's Fair in Paris.&nbsp; Several years later, in 1885, crates containing the main parts of the statue were shipped via&nbsp;French steamer into New York and construction began in earnest. The rest is history.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image7-wd3u0ab2xn.jpg\" /></p><h2>Apple clothing</h2><p>Apple has been known for creating some interesting, inspiring and impressive designs over the years. There have been <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/gadgets/news/146883-apple-s-greatest-hits-best-ever-apple-gear\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">plenty of highlights</a> and <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/gadgets/news/apple/105026-five-worst-apple-tech-failures\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">plenty of flops too</a>.</p><p>Once upon a time, in the 1980s, the tech brand also had some <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/apple/116023-apple-fans-better-dressed-80s\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">pretty special clothing</a> on offer to superfans. We'll certainly mark this one down in the history books.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image8-qua7skfdzw.jpg\" /></p><h2>End of Prohibition</h2><p>Prohibition ended in the States in 1933, in Cleveland Ohio, the people began celebrating almost immediately. Men were seen dispensing beer from a truck with customers able to call&nbsp;Henderson 8030 for more.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image9-oekywlpgd7.jpg\" /></p><h2>FA-18 going transonic</h2><p>This spectacular view is a vision of what happens when a high-speed jet goes transonic. It's known as a vapour cone and is, in essence, a cloud of condensed water which has formed around the plane as it passes through moist air at high-speed. This F-18 was photographed with a perfect cloud as it pushed into transonic flight. This happens at the point where parts of the aeroplane are supersonic while others remain subsonic. Shock waves and water condensation create a magnificent view of mankind's high-speed travel achievements.</p><p>The first supersonic flight happened in October 1947 when a&nbsp;Bell X-1s reach&nbsp;Mach 1.06 (700 miles per hour), but this image is a brilliant homage to how far that technology has come since.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/gadgets/news/148109-the-most-interesting-and-important-aircraft-of-all-time\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">The most interesting and important aeroplanes of all time</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image10-rbv1564lhx.jpg\" /></p><h2>The Bowden Spacelander</h2><p>The Bowden Spacelander was seen as a marvel of post-war design. It was originally created by British designer, <a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benjamin_Bowden\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Benjamin Bowden</a> in 1946 and though many were in awe at the time, it wouldn't go into production until over a decade later, by which time people weren't as enthused. Only 500 were made, making it one of the weirdest and rarest bicycles ever made.&nbsp;</p><h2><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image11-ll2xbcmtra.jpg\" /></h2><h2>Motorola remote control</h2><p>Nowadays we can control our TV viewing with our voices, smart assistants and more. Technology has come a long way. In the 1960s things were a lot different. There weren't many TV channels for a start. It was in&nbsp;1956 that&nbsp;Motorola first introduced its&nbsp;transistorised remote control for television.</p><p>Motorola wasn't the first company to release a remote control - that was&nbsp;Zenith Radio Corporation in 1950 - but it certainly made a push towards convenience in the years that followed. This advert was one of many from that time that pushed the ease of use. No more hassle of getting up to change the channel.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image12-y2jqlo5vnk.jpg\" /></p><h2>Quake II contestants in Lan Party mode</h2><p>Before superfast broadband, PC gamers got together with their hefty machines and large CRT monitors to play. These LAN parties were serious business and certainly a mark on history that a lot of us won't forget.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image13-yrkt0mxvom.jpg\" /></p><h2>Masks for plague prevention</h2><p>This vision from 1912 shows uniformed workers with special gear to help them avoid catching the plague. These individuals were responsible for research into the plague that struck the Philippines at that time. A rare view of terrifying work and brave people carrying it out.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image14-h2ynsqdais.jpg\" /></p><h2>The first photograph of lightning</h2><p>In&nbsp;1882,&nbsp;William Jennings snapped the very first photo of lightning ever to be taken. Although not the most impressive image of the power of nature, it was certainly a historic moment for photography in general.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image15-bx9angsdcc.jpg\" /></p><h2>A selfie from Mars</h2><p>The human race might well be selfie-obsessed, but NASA would have us believe robots are too. This snap was taken by&nbsp;NASA's Curiosity rover on the surface of Mars. An amazing, if slightly dusty view of another planet and a brilliant historic photograph.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/gadgets/news/google/147416-a-visual-exploration-of-space-with-nasa-and-google\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">An amazing glimpse of decades of space exploration with NASA</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image16-kojajqcqzx.jpg\" /></p><h2>The first rocket from Cape Canaveral</h2><p>This image from NASA shows <a href=\"https://www.nasa.gov/multimedia/imagegallery/image_feature_644.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">the first rocket</a> to be launched from Cape Canaveral in the 1950s. The rocket would reach new record heights for the time and higher than the current orbit of the&nbsp;International Space Station. Bumper II would be the first of many rockets to launch from this spot and this is a brilliant photo to signify its importance.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/gadgets/news/148002-best-spacecraft-of-all-time\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">The 15 best spacecraft of all time</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image17-9viz6knmhx.jpg\" /></p><h2>Niagara Falls frozen&nbsp;</h2><p>This photo from sometime in the early 1900s shows the Niagara Falls waterfall frozen over. Quite a spectacular sight, but something that actually <a href=\"https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/niagara-falls-frozen/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">happens quite regularly</a> it seems, though not many get to see it in this full glory.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image18-cx6cbp5y87.jpg\" /></p><h2>The first Disneyland ticket ever sold</h2><p>In 1955, Disneyland opened its gates for the first time. The first ever ticket was sold to Walt Disney's brother&nbsp;Roy O. Disney for $1. The first real customer though was&nbsp;a college student named David MacPherson. Mr&nbsp;MacPherson achieved the honour by getting up at 2 am in the morning to join 6,000 other people queuing to enter the park. He was the first proper guest to enter the park and was given a lifetime pass as a reward.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image19-exkvhsuxvn.jpg\">&nbsp;</img></p><h2>A bicycle for two&nbsp;</h2><p>In&nbsp;1886, this couple posed for a photo outside the White House in Washington D.C. on this two-seater bicycle. Tandem design has come a short distance since then as have the gear people wear when out and about on their bikes.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image20-j3xf0vcsdp.jpg\" /></p><h2>Galileo's drawings of the moon</h2><p>Galileo Galilei was an Italian astronomer who has been famously referred to as the father of several sciences including&nbsp;observational astronomy,&nbsp;modern physics,&nbsp;scientific method and modern science too.</p><p>In 1610 he famously published these images of the moon as he had observed it through a telescope. They were released in the&nbsp;<a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sidereus_Nuncius\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Sidereus Nuncius</a>, an astronomical&nbsp;pamphlet which showed detailed observations of the moon and constellations of the stars. Not quite as incredible as <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/147588-amazing-images-of-our-moon\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">the photos of the moon</a> we have seen today, but incredibly impressive for the time.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image21-4qab08nvds.jpg\" /></p><h2>Daredevil pilot</h2><p>This photo from the 1960s appears to show an insanely brave pilot manually restarting his propeller in mid-air. It was actually part of an airshow stunt.</p><p>The photographer explained:</p><p>\"I took this in November 1946 and it shows Merle Larson demonstrating a small air show stunt that he did. It appears that he is alone in the plane but there is another pilot (Gladys Davis) flying the plane from the back seat and he does have a rope tied around himself. Merle was a WWII B-24 pilot, flight instructor, inventor and builder of three unusual planes based at Buchanan Field, Concord, California.\"</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image22-2wuw4y0pmg.jpg\" /></p><h2>One man and his car</h2><p>This image shows a gentleman aged over 100 years old who has been driving the same car, a 1928&nbsp;Rolls-Royce Phantom for well over 80 years. They don't build them like they used to.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image23-fsuwvztie3.jpg\" /></p><h2>Harlem Hellfighters</h2><p>During both the Great War and World War II, African American men and black soldiers fought for the freedom of the world against enemy forces. These particular men were from the 369th Infantry Regiment, known as the Harlem Hellfighters. They won the Croix de Guerre for gallantry in action during their fight and can be seen here proudly displaying the medals. The original image was black and white but has been colourised so the men can be seen in their full glory here.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image24-zpmr4toqlf.jpg\" /></p><h2>Witches from 1875</h2><p>It is said that this photo shows some Victorian witches posing for a photo in 1875. We have some doubts about how legitimate the image is, but it is nice to imagine ladies of the coven brazenly posing at a time when they wouldn't be burnt at the stake for their craft.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image25-bpfch38rsy.jpg\" /></p><h2>The World Trade Center&nbsp;under construction</h2><p>The construction of the famous World Trade Center building began in 1966 and wasn't finished until 1973. In the meantime, this brilliant view of the towers was captured with sunlight shining through the middle. It's an awesome tribute to a place where many lost their lives tragically in 2001.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image26-9rtufy2kbd.jpg\" /></p><h2>A man buying cigarettes in hospital</h2><p>In the old days, cigarettes were unbelievably marketed as being good for you. As a testament to this daft time, this photo of a man buying cigarettes from his hospital bed was snapped in the 1950s. What a weird time to be alive.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image1-wrqsldcghz.jpg\" /></p><h2>Nikola Tesla, with his equipment</h2><p>This photo from 1899 is not only interesting because it shows the magnificent Nikola Tesla, but because it might also be one of the first doctored images of the time. The experiment that the viewer is witnessing appears to show Tesla sitting nearby while his magnifying transmitter sparks large bolts of electricity through the air.&nbsp;</p><p>However, the image is actually a double exposure, which the man himself admitted at a later dark. The sparks of electricity were snapped in a darkened room when Tesla wasn't there. That photo was exposed again with Tesla safely in the room and the machines off. Still looks impressive though.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image1-rj9wfjgp6k.jpg\" /></p><h2>A child labourer</h2><p>This striking photograph dates back to 1908 and shows a child labourer working in the mills of South Carolina. The photograph said the mill was full of children working like this but that the \"overseer\" of the mill claimed they'd \"just happened in\" to help.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image1-5lwxrbsidk.jpg\" /></p><h2>A&nbsp;Suffragette arrested</h2><p>This photo from 1914 shows the leader of the Women's&nbsp;Suffragette movement being arrested outside Buckingham Palace in 1914. Emmeline Pankhurst was the leader of the movement at the time and was attempting to get a petition to King George V at the time.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p><a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Women%27s_suffrage_in_the_United_Kingdom\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">The Suffragette movement</a> was later successful in getting women the vote in 1918. But this image is a fitting tribute to the hardships women of the time endured while fighting for their rights.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image1-j5at9xdke3.jpg\" /></p><h2>Remains of the World Trade Center</h2><p>This image was taken in late September 2001 from 1,000 meters above the streets of New York City by a Cessna jet. It shows the aftermath of the attacks of the 11 September and the devastation to the World Trade Center building that's clearly visible in the middle of the photo.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image1-thvcmwrysu.jpg\">&nbsp;</img></p><h2>A&nbsp;self-immolation during the&nbsp;Buddhist crisis</h2><p>This photo dates back to 1963 and is perhaps one of the most instantly recognisable images on our list. It shows&nbsp;Thích Quảng Đức, a&nbsp;Vietnamese Mahayana Buddhist monk who set fire to himself as a protest against the&nbsp;persecution of Buddhists by the South Vietnamese government at the time.&nbsp;</p><p>The image was one of many historical <a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buddhist_crisis\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">events from the crisis</a>, but by no means the most shocking thing to happen at the time.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image1-yrboxsgfml.jpg\" /></p><h2>Crash landing Hellcat</h2><p>This image might be one of the most iconic photos from WW2 and shows a Hellcat that has crash-landed on the desk of the USS Enterprise. The pilot incredibly surprised the burning aircraft without significant injury despite the burning fuel tank seen at the bottom of the plane.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image1-sbe0uczrvp.jpg\" /></p><h2>Exercise Field Artillery Corps&nbsp;</h2><p><a href=\"https://www.flickr.com/photos/nimhimages/16026531357/in/photostream/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">These old photos</a> show a magnificent band of troops on exercise. Cheerful chaps in some impressive uniforms. We'd recommend checking out the whole collection as they're very special.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/148556-cameras-feature-some-of-the-most-interesting-events-in-history-in-photographs-image1-5o28h46lzi.jpg\" /></p><h2>M3 Lee Tank during training</h2><p>This image from 1942 shows an American M3 Lee on training exercises in Kentucky. It's interesting because M3 Lee was one of those tanks that were almost obsolete before it even started being useful. A small main cannon, high visibility, weak armour and more made it ineffective against enemy tanks.&nbsp;</p><p>Tank technology progressed swiftly during the war years and it was far too easy for even rel=\"nofollow\">Best Watch deals</a></li> \n </ul><p>You can ask an Alexa-enabled device, such as an Amazon Echo or Amazon Dot,&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/deals/amazon/138192-best-amazon-prime-day-deals\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">\"Alexa, what are your deals?\"</a>, and you'll get a heads up on many Amazon deals; she's always got deals on the go.&nbsp;</p><h2>When is Amazon Prime Day 2020?</h2><p>We don't know any official dates from Amazon yet. We previously predicted that Amazon Prime Day would take place on 13-14 July 2020 but this was delayed due to the global situation.&nbsp;</p><p>We now believe it will take place in September, although the <a href=\"https://ir.aboutamazon.com/quarterly-results/default.aspx\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">July 2020 Amazon earnings call</a> revealed Prime Day would be in the fourth quarter of the financial year, Q4. That would put it in early October at the earliest but it seems a little late to us and too close to Black Friday.&nbsp;</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.fool.com/earnings/call-transcripts/2020/07/31/amazon-amzn-q2-2020-earnings-call-transcript.aspx\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">actual quote</a> during the call was: \"we plan to host Prime Day in Q4 this year rather than Q3, as it has been in prior years. The one exception is Amazon India, which will host Prime Day on August 6 and August 7.\"</p><p>The Wall Street Journal reports the move is because of distancing measures in warehouses and also to de-prioritise non-essential goods.</p><p>In an official press statement Amazon said that: \"Over the last five years, Prime Day has become a special celebration and time for Prime members to shop incredible deals for themselves and for friends and family – and it’s something we look forward to every year.</p><p>\"This year we’ll be holding Prime Day later than usual... members all around the world will experience Prime Day later this year. We look forward to sharing more details soon.\"</p><p>In 2019, Amazon Prime Day took place over&nbsp;48 hours from 15-16 July and that seemed about right; Amazon was able to sustain a good number of deals for the two days and it was successful from Amazon UK's point of view. So we're expecting the same duration again.&nbsp;</p><p>Prime Day, as the name suggests, was previously centred around a 24-hour period, but 2019 was the first 48-hour Prime Day. In 2018 Amazon Prime Day deals took place for 36 hours across 16-17 July. In July 2017 it was 10-11 July.&nbsp;</p><h2>Do I need to be a Prime member to get Amazon Prime Day deals?</h2><p>Yes - to get Amazon Prime deals you&nbsp;need to be a Prime member. If you're not, it's high time you signed up for Prime membership.It usually costs £79 a year&nbsp;but it is currently £20 off - so £59.99.</p> \n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/prime/pipeline/landing?ie=UTF8&amp;tag=reviewspocket-21\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Sign up for Amazon Prime on Amazon UK</a></li> \n </ul><p>Some of the very best deals are always on Amazon devices, but there are stacks across all product categories such as TV, laptops, smart home, fitness, cameras, gaming and more.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/138192-apps-buyer-s-guide-amazon-prime-day---stock-images-image2-8mpr7oaxbv.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1067\" /></p><h2>Can you get Amazon Prime Now on Amazon Prime Day?&nbsp;</h2><p>Yes you can on selected items. Prime Now is Amazon's free two-hour delivery service available to customers in select postcodes in&nbsp;London, Birmingham, Hertfordshire, Sheffield, Surrey, Newcastle, Manchester, Leeds, Liverpool, Portsmouth and Glasgow. You order something from the dedicated smartphone application or in-browser at&nbsp;<a href=\"https://primenow.amazon.co.uk/?tag=pocketlintc07-21\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">primenow.amazon.co.uk</a>&nbsp;and it will be with you, with free delivery, within two hours.</p> \n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/amazon/137306-can-i-get-amazon-prime-now-one-hour-deliveries-in-my-area\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Can I get Amazon Prime Now one-hour deliveries in my area?</a>&nbsp;</li> \n </ul><p>Previous Amazon Prime Now deals in the past have included:</p> \n <ul> \n  <li>30&nbsp;per cent&nbsp;off select Walkers&nbsp;crisps</li> \n  <li>40&nbsp;per cent&nbsp;off select Nescafe coffee</li> \n  <li>30&nbsp;per cent&nbsp;off select Coca-Cola bottles and cans</li> \n  <li>25&nbsp;per cent&nbsp;off select wine when you buy 6 bottles</li> \n  <li>20&nbsp;per cent&nbsp;off select items from Dettol, Vanish and Finish</li> \n </ul><h2 id=\"16\">Amazon Prime Day 2020 tips and tricks</h2><h4><strong>Don't miss an Amazon Prime Day deal</strong></h4><p>Get the dedicated <a href=\"https://www.amazon.co.uk/b?node=12021217031&amp;ref=m1m0mAAU\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Amazon shopping app</a>&nbsp;on your mobile and turn on notifications. &nbsp;Within the notifications settings you can turn on \"Watched\" and \"Waitlisted Deals\" so you don't miss it.</p><h4><strong>Save even more money on your Amazon Prime Day deal</strong></h4><p>Get £1 back by opting for No-Rush Delivery if you don't need your new bargain straight away.</p><h4><strong>Make a list to get the best deals</strong></h4><p>Rather than going in with a scattergun approach, make a list before you go onto Amazon and be targeted about the products you want. It might be in July, but <a href=\"http://www.amazon.co.uk/b/?_encoding=UTF8&amp;camp=1634&amp;creative=6738&amp;linkCode=ur2&amp;node=6505293031&amp;tag=pocketlintc07-21\" rel=\"nofollow\">Amazon Prime Day</a> is a perfect chance to do your Christmas shopping on the cheap.</p><p>It's a big day for deals on any Amazon Prime Day. Hitwise data reveals that&nbsp;the volume of Prime Day web searches in 2018 were&nbsp;up&nbsp;57% compared to the previous year and on the day of Prime Day's official announcement, searches unsurprisingly increased 162%</p><p>Amazon's own devices are the most popular products on Prime Day. In 2018, Echo Dot&nbsp;and&nbsp;Kindle&nbsp;were the most viewed product pages in the days leading up to the announcement of the sale.&nbsp;</p><p>Check out <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/148506-secret-amazon-tips-and-tricks-every-shopper-should-know\" rel=\"follow\">more great Amazon Prime Day tips</a></p><h3>Amazon Alexa</h3><p>If you ask an Alexa-enabled device, such as an Echo or Echo Dot, \"Alexa, what are your deals?\", you get access to Prime Day deals hours earlier as well as access to exclusive bargains.&nbsp;</p><p>To order something, say, \"Alexa, what are your deals\" followed by \"Alexa, add [the item] to my cart. \" Alexa will confirm this, but if you want, you can set up a 4-digit voice shopping pin with the Alexa app to prevent unintended purchases.</p> \n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/b/ref=s9_acss_bw_cg_VANS_2c1_w?node=16924225011&amp;pf_rd_m=ATVPDKIKX0DER&amp;pf_rd_s=merchandised-search-2&amp;pf_rd_r=0NBXMCHK3SC14ZMNAG8C&amp;pf_rd_t=101&amp;pf_rd_p=0e12d452-364b-4887-98aa-9f9a8fa737d0&amp;pf_rd_i=16924218011&amp;tag=pocketprimeday-20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Go here to learn more about voice-shopping with Alexa</a></li> \n </ul><h3>Watch out for Lightning deals</h3><p>Lightning Deals&nbsp;are limited in duration and sometimes end in minutes. To stay on top of everything, use Amazon's app, where you can view many deals 24 hours in advance and sign up for alerts.</p><p>Check out the links below for Lightning deals in key areas on deals, sorry</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 12 Aug 2020 07:43:55 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/138192-apps-buyer-s-guide-amazon-prime-day-2017-image1-h4frinqnps.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"1bf37cc9cb2f3d3d7c2174fb8db68785","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn72@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-36-50-689_2c9bf8ed20a49bb3.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":499,"sourceBytes":77673,"destBytes":34916,"author":"Dan Grabham","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/138192-apps-buyer-s-guide-amazon-prime-day-2017-image1-h4frinqnps.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn72@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-36-50-689_2c9bf8ed20a49bb3.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/138192-apps-buyer-s-guide-amazon-prime-day---stock-images-image2-8mpr7oaxbv.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn98@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-37-07-868_50b4faa87d7a298e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209024},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"Sony ZV-1 is an all-new breed of vlogging camera","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/sony/152266-sony-zv-1-vlogging-camera-release-price-specs","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"498\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152266-cameras-news-sony-zv-1-is-an-all-new-breed-of-vlogging-camera-image1-xb6qaoglpi.jpg?v1\"> <p>Sony has designed an all-new camera from the ground up to be the last word in the world of enthusiast/professional vlogging cameras. It's called the ZV-1 and it's compact, lightweight, but features a tonne of features vloggers and video makers will find really useful.&nbsp;</p><p>The design of the camera is all focused around making it easy to hold and easy to film yourself. The small grip on the front has enough of a gap between itself and the lens, that you can place your thumb there in order to hold it while pointing it at your face. It also has a bright red LED on the front that flashes while recording.&nbsp;</p><p>Unlike some of Sony's <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/sony\" rel=\"follow\">other camera offerings</a>, the movie/video recording button is prominently placed on the top, right near the camera shutter button.&nbsp;</p><p>For those who have complained in the past about Sony's lack of a proper flip-out screen, it even has one of those.</p><p>The display can be flipped out to the side so you can see yourself on screen when filming, but likewise, it rotates, and can be held at various angles when viewed from the back or up top. You can even flip it over to have the screen facing the camera's body when shut, to protect it.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152266-cameras-news-sony-zv-1-is-an-all-new-breed-of-vlogging-camera-image2-1vel4wrdnf.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"498\" /></p><p>The top of the camera features a three-capsule mic setup which Sony says can give you clear, good quality audio whether you want to set it for wider ambient capture, or a focus on your voice. It even comes with a custom-made deadcat to kill wind noise that fixes into the shoe mount.</p><p>Of course, some vloggers and video makers will want to use their own dedicated microphones, and so there's also a 3.5mm mic input, but also the capability to plug in an XLR mic via a hot shoe adapter if you need that.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>It's arguably the video processing that makes this ideal for vloggers, combined with the auto focussing and tracking capabilities that Sony is renowned for.&nbsp;</p><p>Like a lot of its recent high end cameras it has real-time eye and face tracking, as well as fast autofocus based on phase and contrast detection. However, it's programmed to base its frame exposure on the person's face that's in the shot.&nbsp;</p><p>What that means is that you can be talking to camera, walking under bridges, into darker or brighter settings and it'll continuously adjust the exposure to ensure your face stays looking well exposed and natural. And that's not dependent on ethnicity either, it can detect and adjust for different skin colours and shades.&nbsp;</p><p>If you're a vlogger that needs to bring products to the frame - like makeup tutorials or consumer electronics hands-on videos - you can switch the camera to Product Showcase mode, and it'll automatically pick up the product in the shot and focus quickly on that, and then focus back on your face when you remove it from the frame.&nbsp;</p><p>For <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/149869-best-tiktok-tips-and-tricks\" rel=\"follow\">TikTok</a> and <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/instagram/138416-what-is-instagram-stories-and-how-does-it-work\" rel=\"follow\">Instagram Stories</a> users, the camera automatically detects when it's shooting video vertically, and will transfer that video in portrait mode to your phone, without auto-rotating to landscape.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152266-cameras-news-sony-zv-1-is-an-all-new-breed-of-vlogging-camera-image3-xsmn1efm9j.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"748\" height=\"498\" /></p><p>It shoots 4K video at 30 frames per second, or 1080p up 60fps, but also features a super slow motion capability and can shoot at 240, 480 and 960 frames per second. You can even shoot in different Log settings, for those who want to colour grade later on in the edit, and it supports proxies.&nbsp;</p><p>Inside, Sony's equipped the camera with a 1-inch 20-megapixel 4:3 CMOS sensor. 4K videos oversample a 16:9 14MP frame down to 8-megapixel, without cropping it and it's equipped with EIS and OIS for stability during shooting too.&nbsp;</p><p>It has 315 autofocus points, and can shoot still bursts up to 24fps, and then displays those bursts in clusters within the gallery on the camera.&nbsp;</p><p>The battery is good for 45 minutes of video recording time, or 260 still photo captures, and can be charged by plugging the camera into a microUSB cable. That - of course means - if you're going out for an extended period, you can take a battery pack with you and plug it in to keep it topped up between shooting.&nbsp;</p><p>The Sony ZV-1 will be available to buy in June 2020 for £700 in the UK.</p><p></p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 26 May 2020 14:42:46 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152266-cameras-news-sony-zv-1-is-an-all-new-breed-of-vlogging-camera-image1-xb6qaoglpi.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"9120fa84795175990f8142ce96f065d2","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn95@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-36-50-657_e59ce3058625ab7f.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":498,"sourceBytes":55683,"destBytes":44020,"author":"Cam Bunton","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152266-cameras-news-sony-zv-1-is-an-all-new-breed-of-vlogging-camera-image1-xb6qaoglpi.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn95@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-36-50-657_e59ce3058625ab7f.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152266-cameras-news-sony-zv-1-is-an-all-new-breed-of-vlogging-camera-image2-1vel4wrdnf.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn48@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-36-55-548_6665c7e3ac70c159.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152266-cameras-news-sony-zv-1-is-an-all-new-breed-of-vlogging-camera-image3-xsmn1efm9j.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn16@2020_2/2020/08/24/23-36-55-704_da61213311c1c7dd.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209017},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"These superb pictures of retro tech will show you how far we've come","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/152281-retro-tech-pictures-gallery","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"751\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152281-cameras-news-these-pictures-of-retro-tech-will-show-you-how-far-weve-come-image1-pxrgzwlni6.png?v1\"> <p>There's nothing like an advert for a spurious technological product in black and white to make you realise just how much progress we've made as a tech society. Whether it's bizarre contraptions for making phone calls or lighting products that barely look safe, it's fair to say that we've all got a heck of a lot more access to reliable tech now.</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/adobe/140252-30-famous-photoshopped-and-doctored-images-from-across-the-ages\" rel=\"follow\">Famous Photoshopped images from across the ages</a></li> \n </ul><p>Still, there's a lot of fun and interest to be found in surveying images of old tech and reminding ourselves of how things used to be. That's where <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/concepttalk/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Concept Talk's Instagram feed</a> comes in - it's full of amazing photos from days gone by. We've combed through it to find some amazing photographs for your browsing pleasure.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152281-cameras-news-these-pictures-of-retro-tech-will-show-you-how-far-weve-come-image1-uzm4cjjdtu.png\" /></p><h2>Future aesthetics</h2><p>Cars reflect our times more than we sometimes realise - their designs and looks are generally tied to the sort of tech that we as a society are purchasing and hankering for. No wonder, then, that this Ford model looks so funky - it's from the 70s and we just can't get enough of that colourful stripe.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/151220-brilliantly-bizarre-paintings-of-an-alternate-1920s-with-mecha-robots\" rel=\"follow\">15 brilliantly bizarre paintings of an alternate 1920s with mechs, bears and wolves</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152281-cameras-news-these-pictures-of-retro-tech-will-show-you-how-far-weve-come-image2-sqdpttvxfg.png\" /></p><h2>Pimp my ride</h2><p>Bikes, compared to cars at least, haven't changed nearly so much - after all, the core technology can only come on so far. That said, it's been a while since we saw a lighting option for a bicycle quite like this one, which straps a frankly astonishing number of bulbs to your bike. If people were concerned about being seen when it was dark, this certainly would have solved the problem.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152281-cameras-news-these-pictures-of-retro-tech-will-show-you-how-far-weve-come-image3-thrdyhlle7.png\" /></p><h2>Social isolation</h2><p>People's imagined versions of the future always make for fascinating comparisons after the fact, and this painting from Italy is a perfect example. Its vision of isolated individuals zipping around in personal vehicles that seal them off from the rest of society is, on the one hand, far-fetched, but also bears at least a passing resemblance to some aspects of how we live now.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cars/news/151360-batmobiles-batman-car-best-ever-gallery\" rel=\"follow\">Batmobiles down the ages - check out Batman's best-ever vehicles</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152281-cameras-news-these-pictures-of-retro-tech-will-show-you-how-far-weve-come-image4-acqxzihl8c.png\" /></p><h2>Green skies</h2><p>People also liked to imagine what our cities would look like decades into the future, and these predictions seem, for whatever reason, to often skew towards the optimistic. Hence you get ideas like this one, which posited that the skyscrapers shooting up in cities around the globe would all be topped by gardens to lessen their environmental and visual impact. Sadly, this hasn't really proven true.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152281-cameras-news-these-pictures-of-retro-tech-will-show-you-how-far-weve-come-image5-dszs4kybhw.png\" /></p><h2>Neon demon</h2><p>Going all the way back to 1930, this neon salesman's case is a great example of how futuristic some real retro technology can be - the way these tubes are powered is so low-fi that most of us would struggle to comprehend it. What's obvious, though, is that it has a gorgeous look and feel to it, sure to be a collector's item nowadays.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/141224-the-most-famous-ghost-photographs-ever-taken\" rel=\"follow\">The most famous ghost photographs ever taken</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152281-cameras-news-these-pictures-of-retro-tech-will-show-you-how-far-weve-come-image6-fi48hcs2v0.png\" /></p><h2>Gaming rig</h2><p>Fast-forwarding rapidly into this century, we love this image, because of how well we know that it was, in its day, the height of sophistication. This is someone's amazing rig to play flight simulators on, even if a modern PC gamer would snort at the idea. Compare those chunky monitors to modern ultra-wide options and you'll see the definition of progress.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152281-cameras-news-these-pictures-of-retro-tech-will-show-you-how-far-weve-come-image7-lgxeyplr7w.png\" /></p><h2>Operator, please</h2><p>This is a photo so farfetched as to look amusing, but this idea of how people might look if fashion changed drastically, while telecommunications technology stayed bafflingly static, makes for an amusing collage of concepts.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/phones/news/120303-mobile-phone-40-year-anniversary\" rel=\"follow\">The most iconic mobile phones in history</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152281-cameras-news-these-pictures-of-retro-tech-will-show-you-how-far-weve-come-image8-26dm9rz8bw.png\" /></p><h2>Space commander</h2><p>Similarly, this isn't an actual design or prototype of a spacesuit, as we'd hope would be obvious, but even as an exploration of what suits could one day look like, it's amusing how far off-base it is.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152281-cameras-news-these-pictures-of-retro-tech-will-show-you-how-far-weve-come-image9-etidma2cko.png\" /></p><h2>Nap pods</h2><p>Meanwhile, this concept for a nap pod now looks mighty prescient. It might not be right in design terms, with the bulbous looks no longer in vogue at all, but ever since Google famously added napping stations to its huge campus in Silicon Valley, nap pods have become, if not popular, at least accepted.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/smart-home/news/151608-these-interior-decor-disasters-will-leave-you-cringing\" rel=\"follow\">These crazy interior decor disasters will leave you cringing</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152281-cameras-news-these-pictures-of-retro-tech-will-show-you-how-far-weve-come-image100-xetlfhteoz.png\" /></p><h2>Sleek</h2><p>Setting aside Elon Musk's folly in the form of the Cybertruck, we think it's fair to say that car design has got a heck of a lot less interesting over the last few decades, as this gorgeous model demonstrates. While it might not have been a bestseller, we can't see such a radical design getting made now.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152281-cameras-news-these-pictures-of-retro-tech-will-show-you-how-far-weve-come-image111-4exxotlayq.png\" /></p><h2>Quite a den</h2><p>This artist's idea of what an ideal den would look like, meanwhile, has us drooling in envy. If you mentally upgrade its pinball table to a games console, this really isn't that far off what people aspire to nowadays, as much as its aesthetics are wild. Who wouldn't want a pool-room?!</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/gadgets/news/151755-richest-people-in-tech-silicon-billions\" rel=\"follow\">15 richest people in tech: Who's sitting pretty on their silicon billions?</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152281-cameras-news-these-pictures-of-retro-tech-will-show-you-how-far-weve-come-image122-ojs0auyedt.png\" /></p><h2>Flowery</h2><p>By contrast, this simple image of a phone from the 70s is a useful reminder that actual, physical tech from decades gone by can often be underwhelming or even openly a bit ugly. We're not saying that floral prints and patterns are always grim, but we're also not sure we'd want this telephone in our house.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152281-cameras-news-these-pictures-of-retro-tech-will-show-you-how-far-weve-come-image133-5qnsaods2b.png\" /></p><h2>Clash of cultures</h2><p>We like this image for how dated different elements of it are - in particular, the contrast between the futuristic TV set (for the time) and the dolls sat on the shelves to its right - showcasing how quickly tech marched on in the 20th Century.</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/apps/news/140473-best-internet-optical-illusions-you-won-t-believe-your-eyes\" rel=\"follow\">The very best internet optical illusions around: You won't believe your eyes</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152281-cameras-news-these-pictures-of-retro-tech-will-show-you-how-far-weve-come-image144-3e4hairjk6.png\" /></p><h2>Communal listening</h2><p>We'd like to say that easy headphone splitting has become way easier since this image, but it amusingly hasn't really, at least not if you still want eight kids to listen to the same source of audio. Still, whatever solution exist are probably a damn sight smaller, at least.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152281-cameras-news-these-pictures-of-retro-tech-will-show-you-how-far-weve-come-image155-7njflwxtcu.png\" /></p><h2>Spin the decks</h2><p>Speaking of record players, this might be the most ostentatious one we've ever seen - a set of decks embedded in what can only be described as a giant marble egg, it's just about one of the ugliest bits of interior decor on record, we think.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/gadgets/news/140183-retro-gadgets-you-can-buy-that-will-remind-you-of-the-glory-days\" rel=\"follow\">Amazing retro gadgets you can buy that will remind you of the glory days</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152281-cameras-news-these-pictures-of-retro-tech-will-show-you-how-far-weve-come-image166-qhdpc8zki4.png\" /></p><h2>Floral again</h2><p>This phone is a good contrast to the floral print option we featured earlier - it might be using daisies to advertise itself, but the actual design of the telephone is, dare we say it, really nice. It's elegant and timeless, and we'd happily use it now.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152281-cameras-news-these-pictures-of-retro-tech-will-show-you-how-far-weve-come-image177-ygtiv2qjpv.png\" /></p><h2>Food magic</h2><p>The cover of this book is a great reminder of how microwaves changed the game when they first became widely available and affordable - speeding up some types of food preparation to the point where young people might genuinely need reminders that the technology isn't just magic.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/gadgets/news/148387-the-best-tanks-and-armoured-fighting-vehicles-of-all-time\" rel=\"follow\">Some of the best tanks and armoured vehicles of all time</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152281-cameras-news-these-pictures-of-retro-tech-will-show-you-how-far-weve-come-image188-og3yarkdnq.png\" /></p><h2>Videospheres</h2><p>Spherical televisions are a law unto themselves. We know they don't make sense ergonomically or for viewing angles, yet we can't help ourselves when we say that they just look ace. Would we watch a movie on one now? Of course not. Would we have one as an interesting bit of art? Quite possibly.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152281-cameras-news-these-superb-pictures-of-retro-tech-will-show-you-how-far-weve-come-image1-wmjifxpp3h.png\" /></p><h2>Interesting marketing</h2><p>The audio mixer itself might be front and centre, but that doesn't stop us from thinking that we can't see any modern companies marketing their product with an image of someone enjoying a joint in the background - maybe that's just us!</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152281-cameras-news-these-superb-pictures-of-retro-tech-will-show-you-how-far-weve-come-image1-ezs1waunc3.png\" /></p><h2>Loud enough?</h2><p>This photo from the Mitsubishi archive is a fun look at how big a speaker can get if you're pushing the boundaries of the sensible - we're not sure what it would sound like turned on, but we can imagine the pain of any sort of interference feeding into it.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152281-cameras-news-these-superb-pictures-of-retro-tech-will-show-you-how-far-weve-come-image1-gdmnvhw9ax.png\" /></p><h2>Razzle-dazzle</h2><p>What better way to market your hi-fi like Philips has done here, with a ruddy great lightning bolt. Marketing copy? No thanks - just give us a stormy sky and huge pink glints on the speakers to show that this thing is built for rock and roll.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152281-cameras-news-these-superb-pictures-of-retro-tech-will-show-you-how-far-weve-come-image1-lwfzixyzop.png\" /></p><h2>Rolling out</h2><p>This might just be the coolest vehicle of any type that we've seen in quite some time, but the fact that it was built in the 1930s makes it almost jaw-dropping. We can see the reasons why this didn't spread to become a normal sort of thing to own, but that's still a crying shame.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152281-cameras-news-these-superb-pictures-of-retro-tech-will-show-you-how-far-weve-come-image1-nwgvphscx5.png\" /></p><h2>Why not?</h2><p>A burger-shaped phone would later be made iconic by the film Juno, but why not have a portable games console in the same shape? This concept piece is hilarious to look at, and you don't the sense that its two buttons and a D-pad would be much fun to play, but it's certainly memorable.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152281-cameras-news-these-pictures-of-retro-tech-will-show-you-how-far-weve-come-image199-dsdy8t29vu.png\" /></p><h2>Chunky chic</h2><p>Our final picture is a final phone, too, and we're honestly torn on it. Is it a great bit of knowingly kitsch design with huge buttons that are unique and fun, or an ugly monstrosity with buttons that should never be replicated anywhere, ever. At the end of the day, we might just have to leave that to you.</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/141628-48-insanely-neat-photos-of-cables-that-belong-in-a-modern-art-gallery\" rel=\"follow\">58 insanely neat photos of cables that belong in a modern art gallery</a></li> \n </ul> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 21 May 2020 13:23:00 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"Canon EOS R5 brings 45MP sensor and 8K video to full-frame mirrorless series","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/canon/152765-canon-eos-r5-45mp-8k-video-mirrorless","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"499\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152765-cameras-news-canon-eos-r5-brings-45mp-sensor-and-8k-video-image1-ttx2zqfnhc.jpg?v1\"> <p>Canon hasn't been quiet about the announcement of its EOS R5 camera, <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/canon/151073-canon-eos-r5-8k-ibis-release\" rel=\"\">teasing a pre-release way back in February</a> about some of the goodies you could expect from it.</p><p>Now the full information has come to the fore: the EOS R5 is the top-tier camera in the company's RF lens-mount mirrorless system, bringing a 45-megapixel full-frame sensor that's even capable of 8K video capture.</p><p>Yes indeed, the EOS R5 is a beast when it comes to potential. Here are some other specification highlights, as there are so many potential places to start.</p>\n <ul> \n  <li>In-body stabilisation system, works with lens IS for up to 8-stops of stabilisation</li> \n  <li>12 frames per second mechanical shutter (20fps electronic shutter)</li> \n  <li>Dual Pixel CMOS AF II autofocus system introduced (0.05s)</li> \n  <li>Enhances face/eye detection, adds animal detection</li> \n  <li>ISO 100-51,200 sensitivity (102,400 expanded)</li> \n  <li>Weather-sealed magnesium alloy body</li> \n  <li>5.76m-dot electronic viewfinder</li> \n  <li>3-inch 2.1m-dot vari-angle LCD</li> \n  <li>Dual card slot (1x SD, 1x CFE)</li> \n </ul><p>There are some big take aways there, in particular that this full-frame sensor is a massive 45-megapixels when it comes to resolution. That's not quite the highest Canon has ever produced (<a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/canon/135439-canon-eos-5ds-review-resolution-revelation\" rel=\"\">there's the 5DS</a>), but the company is claiming - due in part to the RF lens system, but also the low-pass filter design here - that it will deliver the best fidelity of any of its cameras. Like, ever.</p><p>It's also the first camera to introduce the second-generation focus system, called Dual Pixel CMOS AF II, which not only claims the world's fastest speeds (at just 0.05 seconds if the right lens is attached), but adds in animal detection - it's able to lock onto the eyes of various species, including dogs, cats, and birds (including birds in flight).</p><p>Then there's the image stabilisation system, which is a first for Canon. There's a gyro in the body, which works in tandem with the lens-based stabilisation (IS) to function as a two-part system, which Canon claims can stabilise for up to 8 stops. That's a rather immense claim.</p><p>Elsewhere the R5 has an ultra-resolution electronic viewfinder, plus a 3-inch vari-angle LCD touchscreen.</p><p>Two card slots feature: an SD (UHS-II) and CompactFlash Express slot. The latter is an essential for one of the R5's other major abilities: shooting 8K video. Yes, this camera can capture the 33-megapixel format at 30 frames per second. Or you can 'downgrade' to 4K and shott at 120fps, making for ultra high-definition slow-motion capture. Looks as though Canon is finally opening the gateway to its high-end video capabilities.</p><p>So how much do you need to buy such a system? It doesn't come cheap, at £4,199.99 for the body only. The RF lenses are various prices and levels, including a batch of new optics also announced to show the company's dedication to getting the R system well and truly off the ground.</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 09 Jul 2020 12:00:00 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152765-cameras-news-canon-eos-r5-brings-45mp-sensor-and-8k-video-image1-ttx2zqfnhc.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"df98999c9a8d5cde383356c9807a5fb5","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn100@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-36-50-716_86548745be28a406.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":499,"sourceBytes":42558,"destBytes":24124,"author":"Mike Lowe","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152765-cameras-news-canon-eos-r5-brings-45mp-sensor-and-8k-video-image1-ttx2zqfnhc.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn100@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-36-50-716_86548745be28a406.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209016},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"The winners of Apple's iPhone night mode challenge offer some stunning images","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/phones/news/apple/151293-the-winners-of-apple-s-iphone-night-mode-challenge-are-stunning","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"499\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/151293-phones-news-the-winners-of-apples-iphone-night-mode-challenge-are-stunning-image1-af9z6njqzx.jpg?v1\"> <p>It's been hard to ignore the growth of night mode photography in the last couple of years. When Google first debuted the software through its Pixel phones it felt futuristic, but more and more phones now have systems to get jaw-dropping results in low light.</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/phones/reviews/apple/149323-iphone-11-pro-review\" rel=\"follow\">Apple iPhone 11 Pro review: It's all about those cameras</a></li> \n </ul><p>Apple's is right up with the very best, though, with its top iPhones able to get simply amazing results, and to that end it's just announced the winners of its iPhone night mode challenge. These six images are really quite incredible, and do an amazing job of showing just what you can do with an iPhone camera nowadays.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151293-phones-news-the-winners-of-apples-iphone-night-mode-challenge-are-stunning-image1-ex29awrvk1.jpg\" /></p><h2>Rubén P. Bescós (Pamplona, Navarra, Spain), iPhone 11 Pro Max</h2><p>This shot from Spain is so evocative, with Night Mode bringing out the detail in the hill close to us, while silhouetting the walkers on the verge at sunset. Those scaffolded frames in the background are mysterious and draw the eye, but the collection of animals in the centre are also beautifully captured, almost looking like drawings of themselves. Meanwhile, the overall palette is obviously dominated by that impressive, warm orange in a way that makes the whole tableau feel welcoming.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151293-phones-news-the-winners-of-apples-iphone-night-mode-challenge-are-stunning-image2-rn156r9okx.jpg\" /></p><h2>Rustam Shagimordanov (Moscow, Russia), iPhone 11</h2><p>This shot looks fit for any tourism brochure, so idyllic does it make this riverside set of dwellings look. The light of the buildings, and their beautiful red colouring, makes for an interesting contrast between what looks like a lovely place to live and what is plainly a freezing, harsh environment in many ways. Meanwhile, in the background, that looming rock places the village in the context of an awesome demonstration of nature's true scale.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151293-phones-news-the-winners-of-apples-iphone-night-mode-challenge-are-stunning-image3-8ofcu3w9t0.jpg\" /></p><h2>Andrei Manuilov (Moscow, Russia), iPhone 11 Pro Max</h2><p>Taking us from the natural world to the urban environment, there's something very deliberate about this shot of the internal courtyard of a building block. It's got that slightly otherworldly light that is characteristic of software-assisted night shots, but in a way that serves its aesthetic. You can almost lose track of which way is up as the parallel lines of the walkways extending away from the lens draw you into the photograph. The night sky at the top of the frame, meanwhile, is pitch black.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151293-phones-news-the-winners-of-apples-iphone-night-mode-challenge-are-stunning-image4-xi9io07vqe.jpg\" /></p><h2>Konstantin Chalabov (Moscow, Russia), iPhone 11 Pro</h2><p>Another photograph contrasting warm colours with the coldest imaginable, with the head and taillights of this truck lighting up the middle of the frame while the cold expanse extends in front of and behind it. Meanwhile, once again a huge hunk of rock stands by nearby to illustrate the harshness of the environment, as do the frigid trees visible in the background. The blue of the sky and snow is almost cold enough to feel through the screen.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151293-phones-news-the-winners-of-apples-iphone-night-mode-challenge-are-stunning-image5-dtbmszjdzy.jpg\" /></p><h2>Yu “Eric” Zhang (Beijing, China), iPhone 11 Pro Max</h2><p>Back to the city we go, with this picture managing to capture the eclectic hustle of a side street in Beijing. There's a lot going on but the small details are what win out, whether it's the neon trainer at the bottom of the frame, the posters barely legible to the far right, or the different coloured ingredients on that trader's table in the centre, its steam wafting up into the sky. The skyscrapers looming in the background are the perfect reminder that this isn't some rural scene.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/151293-phones-news-the-winners-of-apples-iphone-night-mode-challenge-are-stunning-image6-i0sh1ohefl.jpg\" /></p><h2>Mitsun Soni (Mumbai, Maharashtra, India), iPhone 11 Pro</h2><p>This image is simply awash in red, obvious though that may seem. We can assume all we like about where the deep red light is actually emanating from, but it gives this picture the feeling of almost being from Mars. The tree's branches are still detailed and intricate, though, while the stars picked out in the darkening sky at the top of the frame make a perfect contrast to the monolith in the centre of the
