smartphone cameras - the&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/phones/news/149390-iphone11-vs-pixel-vs-p30pro-night-mode-camera-comparison\" rel=\"follow\">camera performance</a>&nbsp;that you can expect from your phone has skyrocketed over the last couple of years, with some delivering truly excellent results.</p>\n <ul>\n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/phones/buyers-guides/120309-best-smartphones-and-flagship-mobile-phones-to-buy\" rel=\"follow\">Best smartphones: The top mobile phones available to buy today</a></li>\n </ul><p>That said, there are plenty of ways to improve a phone's camera capabilities a little more, with a whole world of smartphone camera accessories out there, from lenses to tripods. We have rounded up some of the best camera accessories we've come across, to help you get the most out of your smartphone's camera.</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 19 Aug 2020 15:58:00 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/131514-phones-buyer-s-guide-best-smartphone-camera-accessories-2019-image1-subvmrw0xz.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"e76fcde04ef1e1c7bf4f61a4ca2169ab","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn23@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-36-50-718_0bc35184c91f851b.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":499,"sourceBytes":42899,"destBytes":22616,"author":"Britta O'Boyle","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/131514-phones-buyer-s-guide-best-smartphone-camera-accessories-2019-image1-subvmrw0xz.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn23@2020_3/2020/08/24/23-36-50-718_0bc35184c91f851b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209023},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"How to be an Instagram travel sensation without leaving the house","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/instagram/144672-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"549\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/144672-cameras-feature-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house-image1-l9shpckyqe.jpg?v1\"> <p>We're living in strange old times at the moment and Instagram is feeling it too. In the past, the social network was full of photos of&nbsp;Instagram travellers showing off the wonderful sights from all around the world. Now, everyone's stuck at home, there's less and less of these about.&nbsp;</p><p>There is a solution though, as you can still travel the world by using Google Maps for a virtual tour instead of a real one.&nbsp;</p><p>That's what one Instagram user started to do when issues with&nbsp;agoraphobia led her to have a crippling&nbsp;fear of the outside world. Unable to leave her London Flat,&nbsp;Jacqui Kenny instead took to Google Maps to travel to faraway lands.&nbsp;</p><p>When she struck upon the idea of uploading the images to Instagram, she soon became an Instagram sensation and is now over 126,000 followers. Maybe if you're looking for something to do to alleviate the boredom you could use her idea as inspiration for some digital travels.&nbsp;</p><p>We've been through the <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/streetview.portraits/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Agoraphobic Traveller's Instagram</a> account to show you some of the best destinations she's travelled to, all from the comfort of her own home.&nbsp;</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/instagram/149858-this-incredible-photographer-creates-new-worlds-with-arts-and-crafts\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">This incredible photographer creates new worlds with arts and crafts</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/instagram/148290-fantastic-street-artist-transforms-the-world-with-pixel-art\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Fantastic street artist transforms the world with incredible pixel art</a></li> \n </ul><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/144672-cameras-feature-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house-image4-q5vksncp2c.jpg\" /></p><h2>A tree that casts a large shadow</h2><p>Using Google Maps to travel to Sun City, Arizona, the&nbsp;Agoraphobic Traveller discovered this impressive street side view of a magnificent tree casting a large shadow over its sunbaked surroundings.&nbsp;</p><p>This is just one of many desert&nbsp;locales this Instagrammer has travelled to thanks to the power of Google Street View - probably a welcome change to the rain-soaked views of London visible through her flat window.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/144672-cameras-feature-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house-image5-gruv0lx3ni.jpg\" /></p><h2>Boys and girls at football practice</h2><p>In the foothills of Bolivia, a mixed-sex football team takes some instruction from their coach and prepares for practice in the sweet warmth of the summer sun.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/144672-cameras-feature-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house-image25-piwsy6vr9q.jpg\" /></p><h2>Paddling pool in the street</h2><p>Summertime in&nbsp;Callao District, Callao Region, Peru must get a bit toasty. This view shows kids splashing about in a large paddling pool in the street. A refreshing dip in the sweltering sun. A brilliant view from another part of the world enjoyed from a computer screen.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/144672-cameras-feature-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house-image6-39ggkbmj1c.jpg\" /></p><h2>Staten Island after the hurricane</h2><p>This image was captured in 2013 and shows the aftermath of&nbsp;Hurricane Sandy, one of the most deadly and destructive hurricanes of the time. Here we see the damage the hurricane did in Staten Island, but that same hurricane also did damage elsewhere. Winds whipped up to&nbsp;115 mph, causing 233 people to lose their lives and damage totalling over $68 million.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/144672-cameras-feature-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house-image7-d6ru8xlqrc.jpg\" /></p><h2>A home in the sun</h2><p>In&nbsp;Western Cape, South Africa, a man stands in the doorway to his home watching the Google Street View car passing by. A simple view of life miles from home.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/144672-cameras-feature-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house-image8-urc3bowsyj.jpg\" /></p><h2>The boy with the blue balloon</h2><p>On a quiet street corner in the&nbsp;Western Cape, South Africa, a small boy can be seen blowing up a blue balloon. Small blue shacks can be seen behind him and the vast blue cloudless skies above.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/144672-cameras-feature-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house-image9-ric0mvy9ag.jpg\" /></p><h2>Workers in Bolivia</h2><p>Another shot from the foothills of Bolivia shows some workers at the side of a dirt track watching as the Google car passes them by. Dust roads and green hills can be admired in this area, without all the hassle of actually walking.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/144672-cameras-feature-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house-image10-pw81ytgcla.jpg\" /></p><h2>A lone horse is watching you</h2><p>At the edge of the road, a lone horse looks befuddled by the car as it passes by disturbing his peaceful grazing. Not the usual Instagram snap of&nbsp;Rio De Janerio, Brazil you'd expect to see - no beaches or cocktails anywhere in sight.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/144672-cameras-feature-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house-image11-ajp5m0lwbh.jpg\" /></p><h2>A long worn mountain road</h2><p>This view shows the worn out roads of Mongolia, stretching off into the distant hills. This rural view would certainly require a long trip in order to see normally. Google Maps gives easy access to far-off lands with just a few clicks.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/144672-cameras-feature-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house-image12-rfdxygl60e.jpg\" /></p><h2>A herd at the petrol station</h2><p>Nature meets man. This image shows a petrol station in&nbsp;Kyrgyzstan, Central Asia as a shepherd and his flock pass by the pumps on their onward journey.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/144672-cameras-feature-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house-image13-n8bf7upga4.jpg\" /></p><h2>A well-used pitch</h2><p>At the edge of the road in&nbsp;Peru, South America sits a well-worn sports pitch. Not many sports fields have a view like this, with mountain ranges stretching off into the distance. Another hidden manmade beauty spot captured by Google for all to see.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/144672-cameras-feature-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house-image14-i9kszbsopi.jpg\" /></p><h2>Cows disturbed by Google</h2><p>Some cows check out the Google car as it drives by. These bovine beauties were snapped in&nbsp;Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia and show a standard roadside view not many of us would see on a daily basis. Though it would certainly make for a more interesting commute to work.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/144672-cameras-feature-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house-image15-nhpsbwlugz.jpg\" /></p><h2>A family cooling in the pool</h2><p>Another snap captures a family cooling off in a paddling pool at the edge of the street in Callao, Peru. No doubt a refreshing treat from the heat of the baking sun.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/144672-cameras-feature-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house-image16-olrb2yebzz.jpg\" /></p><h2>Workers in Russia</h2><p>Kemerovo Oblast, Russia, some workers are seen digging outside a housing complex. An urban view from the depths of Russia you're not likely to see elsewhere.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/144672-cameras-feature-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house-image17-qydebma6lv.jpg\" /></p><h2>A woman walking with her cat</h2><p>A woman can apparently be seen seemingly walking her black cat along the streets of Bulgaria. Snow-clad roadsides and rolling hills tell a chilly story for her and her feline friend.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/144672-cameras-feature-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house-image18-kuo2dnljui.jpg\" /></p><h2>A security guard taking some shade</h2><p>A much warmer view shows a security guard attempting to cool off in the shade of a tree. Small and quirky domiciles can be seen behind him, a regular view on the streets of&nbsp;Celaya, Mexico?</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/144672-cameras-feature-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house-image19-aw3jlwkofm.jpg\" /></p><h2>A man and his birds</h2><p>A much more rural scene from&nbsp;Belgorod, Russia shows some feathered creatures waddling down to the waters. A lone man seems distracted by something in the distance and completely oblivious to the passing Google car.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/144672-cameras-feature-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house-image20-gtisjo7vzb.jpg\" /></p><h2>Cactus by the road</h2><p>Where your average road might have a few flowers at its edge, the streets of Peru&nbsp;are a little bit different. These neatly placed Cactii seem to be waving at the cars passing by. Cloud covered mountains can be seen in the distance too. Quite a peaceful view.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/144672-cameras-feature-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house-image21-mkt4px9krm.jpg\" /></p><h2>Beautiful Saguaros cactus</h2><p>Another cactus with a view - this time from the sun-baked desert of&nbsp;Florence, Arizona. This majestic cactus certainly makes for a smashing focal point of the barren surroundings.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/144672-cameras-feature-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house-image22-wocnxvvrka.jpg\" /></p><h2>Colourful car camouflage</h2><p>This image is so brilliant it almost looks staged. A colourful car is parked at the edge of this road in&nbsp;Mexico and almost matches the houses behind it.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/144672-cameras-feature-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house-image23-vec4kg2sjx.jpg\" /></p><h2>Just a man walking a cow</h2><p>A snap of&nbsp;Kyrgyzstan shows a man walking with a cow following close behind. One of the&nbsp;Agoraphobic Traveller's first photos. The caption reads:</p><p>\"This is one of the first images I ever captured that got me excited about exploring the weird and wonderful world of Street View. It's not my usual style but I really love the painterly feel of it. This was taken in the beautiful country of Kyrgyzstan.\"</p><p>We hope you've enjoyed this selection of images. Be sure to check out&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/streetview.portraits/\" rel=\"follow\">the&nbsp;Agoraphobic Traveller's Instagram account</a> to see even more.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/144672-cameras-feature-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house-image24-mj7z9et4og.jpg\" /></p><h2>A colourful view</h2><p>In an otherwise harsh surrounding, a lone bush hangs over a wall, adding beautiful colour to the area. The&nbsp;Agoraphobic Traveller has an eye for finding beauty in the most unusual of spots. All from the comfort of home.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/144672-cameras-feature-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house-image3-rwqm5iawyp.jpg\" /></p><h2>Camels prancing in the desert</h2><p>This wonderful view of nature captured by the Agrophobic Traveller while investigating the deserts of&nbsp;Sharjah in the United Arab Emirates. This view appears to show camels prancing in the sand, but they're likely spooked by the maps car. Hopefully, no animals were harmed during the making of this image.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/144672-cameras-feature-how-to-become-an-instagram-sensation-without-ever-leaving-the-house-image2-gjoz6cyj1p.jpg\" /></p><h2>The abandoned playground</h2><p>While virtually travelling around&nbsp;Baganuur, Mongolia, the Agrophobic Traveller found this large playground area, eerily abandoned like a small playful ghost town. src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/146898-phones-feature-the-best-apple-iphone-photos-ever-taken-image1-ydter7skel.jpg?v1\"> <p><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/phones/reviews/apple\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Apple's iPhone</a> has long been known for offering a&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/buyers-guides/120768-best-point-and-shoot-compact-cameras-to-buy-today\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">great camera</a>. These flagship smartphones are capable of some incredible photography, so much so that many modern photographers often ditch their <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/buyers-guides/122777-best-dslr-cameras-full-frame-and-interchangeable-lens-cameras-to-buy\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">DSLR cameras</a> in favour of the ultra-portable iPhone.&nbsp;</p><p>The results are often spectacular too. To honour the efforts,&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.ippawards.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">the iPhone Photography Awards</a> were born in 2007 and have been choosing award-winning photos every year since.&nbsp;Apple also encouraged iPhone photographers to share their best works for the&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2019/01/share-your-best-photos-shot-on-iphone/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Shot on iPhone Challenge</a>.</p><p>As you can imagine, the images submitted to both these competitions are nothing short of fantastic.&nbsp;We've combed through them to bring you a collection of our favourite photos taken over the last few years. Incredible images you won't believe were shot on a smartphone.</p><p>If you feel like you've got what it takes, you too could submit your photos to the iPhone Photography Awards to see if you can win an award in one of the 16 categories. The registration page of the IPPA 2021 is already&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.ippawards.com/2021-entries-form/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">open</a>&nbsp;and the deadline is 31 March anytime","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/smart-home/buyers-guides/141537-best-outdoor-security-cameras-top-rated-smart-home-security-cameras-to-buy","description":"<img width=\"748\" <p>When it comes to choosing a camera to watch over your home remotely, you're spoilt for choice nowadays. In fact, there are increasingly two big categories to choose between - after all, many home security cameras are naturally&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/smart-home/buyers-guides/131155-best-indoor-smart-home-cameras-see-inside-your-home-anytime\" rel=\"follow\">indoor cameras.</a>&nbsp;If you're looking for an outdoors camera, though, with the hardiness to stand up to adverse weather, there are numerous options too.</p><p>If you're wanting to keep an eye on the area in front of your home, perhaps to check up on an alleyway or similar, or have a camera focusing on your garden and your back door, you're in luck. Here's our guide to the best outdoor cameras around.&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/smart-home/reviews/logitech/141803-logitech-circle-2-review-the-best-home-security-camera\" rel=\"follow\"></a></p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 10 Jul 2020 10:07:00 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/141537-smart-home-buyer-s-guide-best-outdoor-smart-home-cameras-2019-see-outside-your-home-anytime-image1-9roxd8yfts.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"a0dfd8f123e557a24340efaa02002055","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn3@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-36-50-680_385e3c5c2eb9c123.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":499,"sourceBytes":77425,"destBytes":32708,"author":"Britta O'Boyle","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/141537-smart-home-buyer-s-guide-best-outdoor-smart-home-cameras-2019-see-outside-your-home-anytime-image1-9roxd8yfts.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn3@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-36-50-680_385e3c5c2eb9c123.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209016},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"This incredible photographer creates new worlds with arts and crafts","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/instagram/149858-this-incredible-photographer-creates-new-worlds-with-arts-and-crafts","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"498\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/149858-cameras-feature-this-incredible-photographer-creates-new-worlds-with-arts-and-crafts-image1-axebmkvjzi.jpg?v1\"> <p><a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/hernandez_dreamphography/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Felix Hernandez</a> is undeniably talented. This artist uses a mix of photography skills and minute arts and crafts talents to create visions of new worlds and amazing visions for you to enjoy.</p><p>The following is a gallery of behind the scenes images to show his various projects and the magic of his creations. We're sure you'll agree they are impressive. A little lighting here, some clever perspective there, a dash of modelling and you've got a whole new world before your eyes.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/149858-cameras-feature-this-incredible-photographer-creates-new-worlds-with-arts-and-crafts-image2-ad8tymdtep.jpg\" /></p><h2>Love Bug Story</h2><p>Just a few images hardly show <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=07tyFtA5_KQ\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">all the effort</a> that Felix Hernandez puts into his works. This one was part of a project for Volkswagen and showed a tiny VW Beetle model that the artist lovingly constructed, along with a brilliant backdrop to give the illusion of a real road and landscape. Perspective plays a big part in these works and the results are magnificent.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/149858-cameras-feature-this-incredible-photographer-creates-new-worlds-with-arts-and-crafts-image4-fkrzkm2sjo.jpg\" /></p><h2>Abducted</h2><p>Another vision of a VW vehicle in tiny form. This painstakingly created work includes a camper van in a small frozen landscape seemingly being abducted by an alien spacecraft. We love the framing of this artist's work, along with the lighting and smoke that's added for atmosphere.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/149858-cameras-feature-this-incredible-photographer-creates-new-worlds-with-arts-and-crafts-image1-jciqa0bfsm.jpg\" /></p><h2>The boy and the dove</h2><p>Felix's work appears to use a healthy mix of perspective, attention to detail and Photoshop wizardry. In this image, a small boy is made even tinier and cast off into some imaginary waters.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/149858-cameras-feature-this-incredible-photographer-creates-new-worlds-with-arts-and-crafts-image1-qh8wc2xk60.jpg\" /></p><h2>Star Wars Tamashii Nations</h2><p>Handcrafted&nbsp;dioramas, a small smoke machine and some clever camera placement lead to some fantastic and interesting results. This is just one of several Star Wars themed images Felix has created.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/149858-cameras-feature-this-incredible-photographer-creates-new-worlds-with-arts-and-crafts-image1-ypbrudxx81.jpg\" /></p><h2>Shelby GT40</h2><p>We see this as a brilliant way to enjoy a car you might not otherwise be able to afford. A spray of moisture, some clever lighting, the right angle and you can make a small toy car look like a dream machine.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/149858-cameras-feature-this-incredible-photographer-creates-new-worlds-with-arts-and-crafts-image12-p0nonfmudo.jpg\" /></p><h2>A rusty Nova</h2><p>Felix is not just a dab hand at crafting and building models, it turns out he also has a talent for painting them in such a way that they appear worn out and broken too. Here he's made a toy car look like a well-worn automobile that's rusty and run-down but still has plenty of character.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/149858-cameras-feature-this-incredible-photographer-creates-new-worlds-with-arts-and-crafts-image1-nyelmu85vx.jpg\" /></p><h2>Myth mountains</h2><p>Some clever photography can even transform a day at the beach into a foreboding landscape of a distant planet. A lone stormtrooper can now be seen staring off thoughtfully into the distance, wondering what went wrong with his life.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/149858-cameras-feature-this-incredible-photographer-creates-new-worlds-with-arts-and-crafts-image16-jvty9cluj3.jpg\" /></p><h2>Love Car</h2><p>The Love Car came about as a <a href=\"https://youtu.be/ZpkKPvwZ-VI\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">project over several years</a>. Another small model car turned into something much bigger. There's <a href=\"https://retouchingacademy.com/the-love-car-2018-by-felix-hernandez/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">a great story behind this project</a> too, as Felix&nbsp;Hernandez set out to create something special without spending a fortune.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/149858-cameras-feature-this-incredible-photographer-creates-new-worlds-with-arts-and-crafts-image18-1vjsziwodl.jpg\" /></p><h2>Heartbreak</h2><p>This intricate work of art was the result of a single word. The idea of heartbreak becoming something visual with a carefully constructed cliff face falling apart as two elephants reach out for one another. We love seeing <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/BxsWMbKlH8J/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">the various small steps</a> that go into creating a masterpiece like this.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/149858-cameras-feature-this-incredible-photographer-creates-new-worlds-with-arts-and-crafts-image20-daolvnfebf.jpg\" /></p><h2>Fix it</h2><p>Some of these works are a mix of reality and cleverly crafted&nbsp;dioramas. For this one, Felix used a tiny scale model of an East German&nbsp;Trabant backdropped with an image of the Los Andes mountains snapped on a trip to Peru.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/149858-cameras-feature-this-incredible-photographer-creates-new-worlds-with-arts-and-crafts-image22-3dejiyziho.jpg\" /></p><h2>Future Car</h2><p>From broken old cars on desolate landscapes, to something much more futuristic. Felix once again uses his skills, attention to detail and infinite patience to create a magnificent scene using another model car, some clever lighting and fake fog to transform an old-looking car into futuristic flying one.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/149858-cameras-feature-this-incredible-photographer-creates-new-worlds-with-arts-and-crafts-image1-fxhjcgevnw.jpg\" /></p><h2>Echo 1</h2><p>Back in 2017, Felix worked on creating a awesome vision of the iconic vehicle from Ghost Busters as part of a project called Famous Cars. Lighting and smoke effects were used to give the toy model a new lease of life and resulted in this awesome vision along with <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/BREIoPWjHL3/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">other cool visuals</a> that included seeing the car doing a wheelie through the smog.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/149858-cameras-feature-this-incredible-photographer-creates-new-worlds-with-arts-and-crafts-image26-itvgnwuy15.jpg\" /></p><h2>Dukes of Hazard</h2><p>This brilliant shoot and <a href=\"https://www.behance.net/gallery/47111045/The-Dukes\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">several others like it</a> were inspired by the Dukes of Hazard for a famous movie cars project. We enjoy seeing how much effort Felix puts into these projects with brilliant behind the scenes photographs and there's even a video of this one too.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/149858-cameras-feature-this-incredible-photographer-creates-new-worlds-with-arts-and-crafts-image28-2t5i40fulz.jpg\" /></p><h2>Action!</h2><p>We can only imagine how much effort goes into these images where two cars look like they're actually moving. Jumping over one another through a cloud of smoke.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/149858-cameras-feature-this-incredible-photographer-creates-new-worlds-with-arts-and-crafts-image30-tx1da8aowz.jpg\" /></p><h2>Back to the Future</h2><p>Where we're going, we don't need roads. But we do need a lot of photography magic. We're finishing off with one of our favourites, but we'd recommend checking out this <a href=\"https://www.hernandezdreamphography.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">incredible artist's website</a> and <a href=\"http://instagram.com/hernandez_dreamphography\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">following him on Instagram</a> to see more.&nbsp;</p> 0@2020_1/2020/08/24/23-37-10-701_2f241811ab9c0b71.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/149858-cameras-feature-this-incredible-photographer-creates-new-worlds-with-arts-and-crafts-image30-tx1da8aowz.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn57@2020_6/2020/08/24/23-37-01-718_f320c137ed3acb71.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209017},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"Sony A7S III unveiled: 4K up to 120p, all new sensor and a proper flip-out touchscreen","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/news/sony/153116-sony-a7s-iii-price-specs-details-release-date","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"499\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/153116-cameras-news-sony-a7s-iii-unveiled-4k-up-to-120p-all-new-sensor-and-a-proper-flip-out-touchscreen-image2-1wijllx6ow.jpg?v1\"> <p>Sony has finally delivered the answer to so many video-makers' prayers. Five years after it launched the last A7S full frame camera, the A7S III has been unveiled and it looks like an absolute beast.&nbsp;</p><p>When briefed about the new camera, <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/sony\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Sony</a> told us it has built everything from the ground up. When it comes to internals, hardware and performance, it's virtually all been upgraded to create what - on paper - looks to be one of the best run-and-gun cameras made so far.&nbsp;</p><p>It starts with the sensor, and in order to give us quality video capture, Sony opted for a 12.1-megapixel sensor. That ensures there are enough pixels for 4K video, but also means that those pixels are quite large and enable better light and colour capture than a higher resolution sensor might, and there's no pixel binning involved.</p>\n <ul>\n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/sony/150424-sony-a7r-iv-review-mk4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Sony A7R IV review: Here's to new resolutions</a></li>\n </ul><p>Sony says it's its best full frame sensor yet for signal to noise ratio, and that also means cleaner images in low light situations even with the ISO cranked up. The sensor itself is an updated Exmor sensor, called the Exmor R, and is backside-illuminated for faster readout speeds and combined with a new Bionz XR processing engine for faster overall processing performance.&nbsp;</p><p>Spec-wise, the A7S III in video mode has an ISO range of 40-409600 and is capable of 15 stops of dynamic range when shooting in the lower sensitivity settings.&nbsp;</p><p>The company also says it has improved rolling shutter performance as well, with as much as 3x improvement over the last A7S camera. That much much smoother panning, and fewer jitters when you're moving the camera.&nbsp;</p><p>As for recording quality, that's been upped too. 4K is the top resolution here, but you can shoot in frame rates all the way up to 120 frames per second at max resolution. For full HD that frame rate tops out at 240p.&nbsp;There is a slight 1.1 crop at the top 4K/120p end, however.&nbsp;</p><p>It has a plethora of resolution/bitrate/frame-rate options, but you'll be able to shoot them all internally on an SDXC V90 memory card on either or both of the SD card slots. The camera also supports a new kind of CFExpress card, which will launch alongside the camera.&nbsp;</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/153116-cameras-news-sony-a7s-iii-unveiled-4k-up-to-120p-all-new-sensor-and-a-proper-flip-out-touchscreen-image3-dirvop4hca.jpg\" width=\"1600\" height=\"1067\" alt=\"\" /></p><p>The only recording mode that requires this CFExpress card is the highest quality slow-motion setting, but otherwise, everything can be shot on a V90 SD card.&nbsp;</p><p>As with most of <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/cameras/reviews/sony/152309-sony-zv-1-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Sony's recent cameras</a>, it has market-leading autofocusing and tracking features. It has 759 phase-detection autofocus points, taking up nearly all of the sensor's available surface area, with an additional 425 contrast-detection autofocus points.&nbsp;</p><p>You can use the built-in, flippy-out touchscreen (yes it has one now), to enable real-time tracking on any object, but you can also switch it to track human or animal eyes.&nbsp;</p><p>When you do touch to focus, you can set the speed at seven different settings which means you can either program it to switch focus immediately or create a slow pull focus effect.&nbsp;</p><p>Other features worth noting include the redesigned buttons, which make the movie mode button more prominent on the top. There's also 5-axis IBIS to keep footage nice and smooth. There's even an electronic stabilisation algorithm that can save any movement/shake data captured by the internal gyroscope, allowing to more accurately stabilise footage in post.&nbsp;</p><p>For those worried about thermal performance, Sony has redesigned the heat dissipation system so that if you are shooting at 4K/60, you can get an hour's worth of filming done before it needs to take a break and cool down. In less intense modes, it can go up to 95 minutes.</p><p>For professionals who want to shoot HDR, it has 10 bit HLG shooting capability and supports HDMI 2.1 out, so you can hookup an external recorder like the Atomos Ninja V and shoot up to 4K/60 using that method.&nbsp;</p><p>The Sony A7S III will be available to purchase at some point in September this year, with prices likely to be around the £3,800/€4,200 mark for the body only.&nbsp;</p><p>squirrel_widget_307806</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 28 Jul 2020 14:00:00 +0000","feedId":7639,"bgimg":"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/153116-cameras-news-sony-a7s-iii-unveiled-4k-up-to-120p-all-new-sensor-and-a-proper-flip-out-touchscreen-image2-1wijllx6ow.jpg?v1","linkMd5":"7a737bcec5b9cde32f66ddb7916895bb","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn32@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-36-52-043_2805b950c1f2a6cc.webp","destWidth":748,"destHeight":499,"sourceBytes":47914,"destBytes":30306,"author":"Cam Bunton","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/153116-cameras-news-sony-a7s-iii-unveiled-4k-up-to-120p-all-new-sensor-and-a-proper-flip-out-touchscreen-image2-1wijllx6ow.jpg?v1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn32@2020_4/2020/08/24/23-36-52-043_2805b950c1f2a6cc.webp","https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/153116-cameras-news-sony-a7s-iii-unveiled-4k-up-to-120p-all-new-sensor-and-a-proper-flip-out-touchscreen-image3-dirvop4hca.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn71@2020_5/2020/08/24/23-37-17-404_444168a6ffc3094e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598312209023},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 07:36:49","title":"Huawei P50 could be first to have an innovative liquid lens camera","link":"https://www.pocket-lint.com/phones/news/huawei/152284-huawei-p50-could-be-first-to-have-an-innovative-liquid-lens-camera","description":"<img width=\"748\" height=\"499\" src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/748x/assets/images/152284-phones-news-huawei-p50-could-be-first-to-have-an-innovative-liquid-lens-camera-image1-zri6lhfkiw.jpg?v1\"> <p>A patent filed with the&nbsp;China National Intellectual Property Administration (CNIPA) could result in <a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/phones/news/huawei\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Huawei</a> being the first to market with a phone sporting a \"liquid lens\" camera.</p><p>Indeed, we might even see the technology debut on the Huawei P50 next year.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152284-phones-news-huawei-p50-could-be-first-to-have-an-innovative-liquid-lens-camera-image3-vsebya6yum.jpg\" /></p><p>Liquid lens technology uses optical grade liquid inside a cell structure rather than optical glass. This is more fluid, so when adjusted mechanically or electronically, it can completely change its shape, and therefore alter focal distance more effectively and speedily.</p>\n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://www.pocket-lint.com/phones/buyers-guides/huawei/152170-huawei-p30-pro-new-edition-whats-new-difference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Huawei P30 Pro New Edition vs P30 Pro (2019): What's the difference?</a></li> \n </ul><p>Modules that use liquid lens tech can therefore greatly shorten the response time when focusing, when compared to those using conventional lenses. It is also a more effective technology for optical image stabilisation.</p><p>It's not a new technology, having been used in manufacturing machinery, microscopes and even the camera systems on professional-grade drones before, but its not yet appeared in a phone camera.</p><p><img src=\"https://cdn.pocket-lint.com/r/s/660x/assets/images/152284-phones-news-huawei-p50-could-be-first-to-have-an-innovative-liquid-lens-camera-image2-ymtwinvvqf.jpg\" /></p><p>Huawei's <a href=\"http://egaz.sipo.gov.cn/FileWeb/pfs?path=r13zea0XTQIpgr3zcPYfMamhhvf9JdEwEgcjVXM2tFqdMr7Ux20yIGUuG8t2QsaVyZIVgQVIYYSGcUFY4UKt7wU3_L5li6yjR8n9Ga9fT-k\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">patent</a> shows a camera module made up of several parts, including a liquid lens. It states that the adoption of the tech will indeed improve the camera's autofocus and image stabilisation properties.</p><p>It is also more stable: \"This structure [is] used to move the liquid lens to achieve autofocus and optical image stabilization. Moreover, the solution also improves the stability and reliability of the motor under conditions such as impact or drop,\" it says in the patent document, as reposted by <a href=\"https://www.huaweicentral.com/liquid-lens-next-big-camera-tech-to-come-with-p50-series/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"follow noopener\">Huawei Central</a>.</p><p>The patent was initially filed on Christmas Day 2019, and approved on 7 April 2020.</p><p>Hopefully that means we'll see the tech used in a product in the next year.</p> </img>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 21 May 2020 11:17:23
